text: Alex at El Azteca hooked us up with a secret desert that may soon come to the menu!!! This is a cheesecake desert thatâ€™s nothing shy of AMAZING!! If you love Mexican food and deserts this is definitely a place to stop by. Very polite staff and gets food out quickly!!! With a reasonable pricing why not stop here!!!! Great place!!! A++++

text: I am appalled at the quality of service and food at this place. While a family of Mexicans sitting next to us got served like royalty we were put on the back burner the waitress came over a total of three times while we were there. She also loved to flirt with her boss the whole time while ignoring us! We ran out of chips and salsa asked for more and didn't get any until after we got our food. When I got my plate. The portion was so small ! I had maybe 10 tiny pieces of meat and 4 pieces of shrimp on my dish which was the muscle maker . The lettuce was all brown and nasty. The avocado looked rotten. And not just a normal oxidation brown but it looked like it had been sitting and got rotten and they didn't care. Also only got like three slices of avocado. The dish looked nothing like the picture on the menu. I would have sent it back immediately but the waitress ran off and never even came back until it was to bring  the check. I didn't eat a bite of it and they tried to charge me for it until we talked to the manager! His excuse was they were training them. Yeah whatever. Never coming back here again. Waste of money and time.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

title: Fazoli's

text: Very economical. This sampler I got had 4 different things on it using a big plate. For $3 more, you get a salad and drink. All said and done, about $12 for everything, and it was a ton of food. Service was great. Food was prepared quickly, very friendly people, and attentive to check up on you. Bread sticks (when dining in) are unlimited, and they come hot and fresh, buttered and seasoned with garlic. They are super soft and fluffy. Honestly, I rate their breadsticks above Olive Gardens. They are wonderful. Reasons why Iâ€™m not going with 5 stars, is nothing that this location has control over. Itâ€™s not a complaint of the individual location itself. First issue is, I felt the Alfredo sauce was very bland. Iâ€™ve had stuff out of a jar at home that beats it. Secondly, the amount of sauce (all 3 pastas had the same issue) they put on is very little compared to the noodles you get. My feeling is, I can buy a pound of uncooked noodles for $1 at the store. After they absorb the water, youâ€™ve got 2lbs of noodles for $1. Commercially, they buy them much cheaper than that even. Noodles are incredibly cheap. Yet, youâ€™re not really given enough sauce for them. Since pasta is so cheap, youâ€™d think they could afford another 50 cents of sauce. The picture makes it look ok because itâ€™s all on the top. It certainly looks like a decent amount of sauce. But you canâ€™t see the noodle to sauce ratio. Also, I assume they have a pre-specified ladle size they are told to use. However, mix things up (or eat the top portion), and youâ€™ll quickly find yourself eating plain noodles. Again, Iâ€™m sure this is a corporate thing, and not location specific, but youâ€™re reading my review because you want an honest review, right? So, Iâ€™m going to tell my experience as it was. Over all, Iâ€™m giving it 4 stars still, as service is good, breadsticks are wonderful, and food was pretty good, aside from the lack of sauce. Go in there prepared with this info, and see what you think. And remember, those wonderful breadsticks... they are unlimited. They will keep bringing more if you want. And, youâ€™ll likely want them to.
title: Fazoli's

text: We have to agree with everyone else, their breadsticks are pretty good.

text:
If you have a healthy appetite you gotta check out BullDawg's Burgers....and ask for Mike....who happens to be the Owner.

Mike is very personable and friendly he greeted me as soon as I walked in the door.....in other words he made me feel welcomed immediately and things only got better from there!

The food...all I can say is....OH MY GOODNESS!!!!! I ordered a chocolate shake (no whipped cream  HUMONGOUS BURGER and loaded fries and I was in delicious food heaven!!!

If you are located in Pittsburgh or ever find yourself visiting Pittsburgh make a bee line to BullDawg's Burgers and ask for Mike.......tell him The Disabled Vet sent ya'!!!!!!!

100% guarantee you won't leave hungry!
title: BullDawg's Burgers

text:
Pretty decent little sandwich shop. They have hoagies, cheesesteaks, burgers, wings, and almost any other American type food. Tonight, I saw they had a great deal on Uber Eats offering buy 1 get one 1 free on select items. I decided to try the classic Philly cheesesteak, which also came with their hand cut fries (you also have the option of substituting chicken for steak).

The cheesesteak was about $12.50 each, which I think is an okay price. Portion size is decent too, not too big nor too small. I will say that there was quite a lot of bread in comparison to the meat, cheese, and vegetables. I believe the bun was too thick. The steak itself was pretty flavorful and had a good texture. They use an adequate amount of cheese. Good amount of mushrooms, and each mushroom is quite big, but they do have a slight canned flavor.

The fries were just okay. Quality probably declined due to them being in the car for delivery. Still, they were not bad, and definitely nice to get fries for free. As usual, I would have wanted a bit more salt or pepper, and they were a bit limp.

All in all, not a bad spot for a sandwich, wings, or other classic American fare. The cheesesteak was still enjoyable, just nothing special. I do appreciate the deal they had going on with Uber Eats, though.
title: BullDawg's Burgers

text: So here's the deal.  The first time I ate at this spot was last month I got the steak hoagie and my bf got the BBQ chicken hoagie.  Both were amazing.  Tonight, we both decided to try the burgers.  I'm only going to give the burgers a 2 out of 5.  The bun was double the size of the burger. The burger was dry, and the bottom of the burger was hard as if it was precooked and sitting. They didn't even ask or include any veggies for the burger.  No lettuce. No tomatoes.  No onions, and I paid 13 bux for this burger. Next, you definitely have to work on a different way of delivering the fries.  They get soggie in plastic containers.  Some places use paper bags.  Just a thought.
title: BullDawg's Burgers

PS. Try the spring rolls, I got a surprise one with my salad and I liked it so much I ordered a whole side.

text:
SUPERB AUTHENTIC THAI in the Pittsburgh area, a short 15 min drive from downtown.  Cozy restaurant with no-touch menu, short and sweet. It looks a popular spot to locals of many persuasions. Takeout or sit in (I have done both), itâ€™s simply excellent food. A FOODIEâ€™S GEM.

Start with Fresh Rolls and Fried Eggplant, contrasting but complementary textures and sweet tangy sauces that wake up the palate (very much unlike the cliche peanut sauce in the run of mill Thai-style places.

Any of the curry entrees are very good, smooth well-balanced sauces; none of that pungent sugar-loaded curry so common in so-called Thai restaurants in this town.

My recommendation: Duck Curry, very crispy well seasoned perfectly cooked duck atop the smooth Red curry with bell peppers and cherry tomatoes, carefully balanced with two halves of lychee just enough to brighten the palate: Simply Wow!

Pair the curry with any of the Thai stir fry veggies.  Iâ€™m partial to the Hot Basil fry, extra veggies (natural sweetness of the fresh vegetables complemented with their brown sauce).

By the way, enjoy Thai food with a spoon rather than fork/knife. Spoon the curry or veggies on rice, mix, then enjoy. Spoon allows one to taste every drop of the sauce.

Great service!
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Such a lovely, warm setting.   Excellent customer service.  They went above and beyond for the child in our party.  We really enjoyed the food.  Parking out front, comfy seating.  Reasonable prices and good portions.   New favorite restaurant.
title: Thai Tamarind

text:
Well, it wasn't anywhere NEAR as good as a few years back but the presentation was decent. Of course the prices went up, lol. An almost 3 star. Almost. Sadly I can NOT recommend  Thai Tamarind any longer since the flavors were incredibly weak and/or bland; so much tasted like it came from a jar and the top of the line "thai spicy" was a powder they sprinkled on top of every dish when presenting your level of spicy. Some of the powder hadn't fully dissolved during your meal so you would gets little clumps of it in your mouth. The "so-called" Thai Iced Tea I had tasted as if it were a syrup from a bottle. Yech!

Pictured you have the Tom Yum soup, Volcano Chicken and the Thai Style Chicken Noodle. All bland and weak. Not pictured but as an appetizer we had the chicken satay, another huge let down since when eaten with a homemade peanut sauce or cucumber sauce, it is DELICIOUS! The peanut sauce seems to have some type of dairy added to it. Gross.

Seated WAY in the back corner in the last pic you'll see your "typical American Ken", who did nothing but complain from he moment he sat down. Entitled as "F".
DONT EAT HERE IF YOU DISAPPROVE of the restaurant or its style a**hole!
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Overall a decent experience.  The food was high quality.  The staff was not as attentive as they could have been, but it was not the end of the world.  Having gone a few times, the spice level (1-5) is not super consistent.

text: We ordered take out, and it was delicious. The trio curry was our favorite, and it includes a lot more than you can find at other restaurants. I found the food to be the perfect amount of spice at level 3 (has a kick but you can still taste all the flavors). Both portions were large which makes up for the mid-range price. I would 100% recommend ordering the curry from here.

text:
I live directly up the street from this place on Washington Ave and I have got to say that I am absolutely disappointed with their quality of food.  Today, I just recently ordered their Pad Kee Mao and it looked like someone chewed up the meal and spit it right back out into the carry out tray.  The noodles were overly soggy and mushed up like mashed potatoes.  The salad that comes with the Lunch looks as if someone cut out a large chunk from a piece of lettuce, threw it into the tray, and then decided to splash a little sauce on top of it.

I don't normally complain about food and most times I simply ignore the mistakes but I've been living in Bellevue for 3 years now and this incident has happened more than once.  A customer can only be patient so many times and then there comes a point where a enough is enough.  This restaurant will never receive my services ever again.  I don't know if it's the cook or the management but the quality of food is poor.  Years ago the food was much better. I'm not sure what happened between then and now.

If you want a quality restaurant for Thai food, go to Niky's Thai Kitchen.  I promise you, Niky's Thai Kitchen is the better choice.  Their food quality is suburb compared to Thai Tamarind, especially for the price you'll pay for it.

Please observe the images attached for evidence.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: I've eaten there, and now I work there. So I get to see the food "behind the scenes". Most, if not all, is homemade in the sense that whoever the cook is, they will cook it their own way with their own ingredients like they would in their own home. So you get to try the same food about 4 to 5 different ways which I think is pretty awesome. The cooks take allergy warnings very seriously. The owners come in pretty much every day to make sure we dont stray off of the path that they made to build this restaurant and its food upon. We have SO many return customers that when they're off work they will hang out with us from open to close. We strive to be extra friendly and helpful! And our MANY return customers can verify.  We have 2 flat screens to watch your sports on or for your child to watch cartoons so you can eat with some peace (lol). Our food is great tasting. Certain waitresses will buy 4 to 5 bowls of homemade cream of crab soup to take home for the night. As an example. So if we trust the food enough to eat it AND buy it in bulk, I'm sure you will love your dinner! Since I started working 1 month ago, I have yet to hear not even one complaint. If I work somewhere that's not all that good, I'm not afraid to say so. So I promise I'm not on here because anyone told me to, or to try to gain more customers etc. I simply rated it because my phone noticed how often I come here and asked me to review it LOL. Dont be afraid to give it a try. The portions range from "good size for the money" to "Massive"! We are located inside the Laurel De Truck Stop/gas station with the Hardees hooked to it. Come say hello if you've seen this review and I happen to be worki g when you come in! My name is Alyssa & I cant wait to meet yall!
title: Chesapeake Country Kitchen

text: My Family & I Visited "RED LOBSTER" on McKnight Road for the 1st Time yesterday (6-10-18). We took My Wife there for Her BIRTHDAY & We TOTALLY Enjoyed Our lunch. It was a Very DELICIOUS & DOWNRIGHT Enjoyable Experience. Our Grown Children & their Spouses & Our 4 Grandkids really ENJOYED what they ordered & even sampled other Family Members dishes. Our Server was a VERY NICE & HELPFUL Gentleman by the Name of DONALD. He took a few minutes to show us the MENU & He even made a suggestion or two in case We couldn't decide what We wanted. The Menu choices were MASSIVE & looked very TASTY in the pictures, Which made My choice on what to choose to EAT more EXHAUSTING. My Wife's & My 1st Visit to "RED LOBSTER" Won't be Our last bc We were BOTH very IMPRESSED w/ Our Server DONALD & Our LUNCH was so "DAMNED DELICIOUS" & the INSIDE DECOR was Very Impressive & Warm. Menu Prices are VERY COMPARABLE & REASONABLE too. I CAN'T tell You what We ALL ordered for lunch, but I CAN tell You that EVERYONE left w/ a HAPPY & FULL Stomach.

text:
I went to an event that offering a free meal by a mattress salesman.
I personally wanted one of the lobster dinners they were advertising so I ordered it after the event was over.
It looked like the lobsters were old, sat out all day then microwaved. A $50/$60 tasteless plate. I sent it back and kept the free meal. That free meal was also tasteless. No seasoning on Anything.
That was an event offered there for several days.
That salesman had to have spent thousands!
My suggestion to him, find another restaurant if he ever came back to Pittsburgh. The best thing offered at Red Lobster that day was the bed because I bought one!!

text:
This is arguably the best sushi in Easton (maybe even the shore)! I've tried all the others and I keep coming back. The staff is friendly and always asks about my family when I come in alone. The wait for food is never long, even if the place is full. You can dine in at lunch and get back to work quick. The menu items consistently taste amazing and are prepared the same way everytime... there are no surprises, if you order an Olympic roll it's going to be amazing Every Single Time, and that surely can not be said for the other places in town. Some of my favorites are "Amazing Tuna" "Jingle Bell" "Olympic" "Incredible" and "spicey crab" but all of them are good. If you go between 12 and 4 the special is "get 1 special roll and get a second at half off". Oh, and their unsweetened tea is the best in town, I know that's a small thing but it matters to me since I've given up soda.

If you're looking for a great place to have Sushi in Easton look no farther than usushi!
title: U Sushi

Update on 08/14/19

I had Tina's Gai Boun - Chicken, Curry and Coconut at a "10!" Dave had Tina's General Chicken at a "3!" For our "warm up," we had "3" beef egg rolls and a bowl of Tina's Egg Drop Soup at a "10!" Everything was ABSOLUTELY EXQUISITE!!!!! It was sooooooo good to see Tina and her crew! It's been waaaaay tooooo long! However, with the endorphins released tonight, I believe that I will be able to go on!!! Thank you, Tina!!!!! You came into my life when I needed you most! You do my heart good!!!!!!! Update: I have seen rude comments from people about the delay in getting food. Iam not surprised since was told they make it from scratch and it definitely tasted super fresh. text:
Enjoyed a nice breakfast today at Gaia. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. Our party of six was seated immediate on a Saturday morning.

Unpretentious, casual, warm interior. Small menu, but nice to have so many vegetarian and vegan options. Good to have the opportunity to try something different, outside the normal brunch fare.

I stuck with what I normally like - eggs & potatoes plus tried a fruit cup. It was a filling portion and cooked well. The potatoes were well seasoned and crispy. I also enjoyed the sourdough bread that came with my meal. The fruit was fresh and seasonal. Coffee was self-service and offered three options, with creamer available at request. I tried the Swiss chocolate brew and liked it a lot. My friendâ€™s specialty French toasted looked amazing. It has tender sweet sautÃ©ed apples, cherry sauce, and almonds. Everyone had to try an apple slice - they were really good!

Worth your time and taste buds! Thanks for a good experience!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
1st time trying today.
vegan burrito and vegan breakfast plate. very reasonably priced with large portions. self-serve water and coffee station. there was a jar for vegan cookies at main counter, but was empty. love the vegan options for breakfast/brunch/lunch. cute calm dining.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Gaia is one of my favorite local restaurants. The food is so good, and it is the same every time I order it! Pictured is the veggie stash with potatoâ€™s and rice. The spice combination is just the right combo of flavors. If you need a place with comforting food, that wonâ€™t leave you feeling heavy, this is the spot. The food! The food! The cookies! I so remembered the cookies! I had the Veggie Stash and my husband had the Green Burrito!ðŸ¥¬ðŸŒ±

text: Nice spot for breakfast. Nice variety on the menu. Breakfast burrito was a little heavy on the beans, but otherwise tasty.  Cute lounge area towards the back serving drinks only. Did not see any of the  cleanliness concerns mentioned in another review.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
Unfortunately I donâ€™t have anything good to say about Gaia house . When we were sat down there was paint bubbling near us, probably due to moisture trapped behind the paint. And then a leak above. Itâ€™s not really an appetizing sight.

We were told that we wouldnâ€™t be able to have espresso or lattes because the espresso machine was down. Thatâ€™s fine. What I did take issue with was the self serve coffee station. For one, the way the glasses were stored was gross. The shelves were not clean. The cups were freshly washed. I could tell because they were wet, placed rim down. So that the dust and debris on the shelving was collected on the wet rims of the cups. And whenever you picked up a cup you could see the wet rim marked it left. These cups should be dry if youâ€™re going to store them rim down. Drying them rim down traps the moisture inside (causing an unpleasant odor and taste), and damages the shelves, and is altogether unsanitary if the shelves arenâ€™t even clean. Storing them rim side up would be a better option in this case . They are used often enough for collecting dust to be an argument for storing them rim side down. Sanitary conditions aside, for a vegan/vegetarian place for the only milk option to be whole milk was disappointing. Consider offering milk alternatives.

The food was even more disappointing . My guest ate his omelet , but I good not stomach my food. The cornbread French toast was incredibly dry, even soaking it in the butter and syrup didnâ€™t revive it. The potatoes tasted fine but they were stale. Since it was the only semi edible thing available to me I picked at that instead of what I ordered. I only managed to eat half of one slice of French toast and didnâ€™t want to take it home. We came out of our way to go here after seeing it on Instagram. So it was that much more disappointing.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
Gaia House Cafe was very nice. The decor is slightly bohemian and very cozy with mismatched chairs and tables.We went on a Tuesday at lunch and got the Gaia Tempeh Ruben and the Banh Mi sandwiches.The coffee was excellent. The staff was very pleasant and the food arrived in good time. The price seemed a little steep for sandwiches but when you get homemade pickles and kraut it makes up for it. I couldn't tell where a good place to park would be, so we parked in the Irish pub reserved area with a risk of towing.

Some things to consider: add a bit more spread on the Banh Mi as it was a little dry; add a few completely vegan options to the menu as many of the entrees are so close but then have cheese; swap out those potato chips for a cup of soup. We'll be back! Keep those homemade fermentations coming!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Love the cute atmosphere and the juice is awesome.  I think there may be off-street parking but we didn't know where it was.  We were happy to see fans of the old restaurant come in and were pleased that the menu was exactly the same.  Even though it's a vegetarian restaurant they can make most foods vegan. I hope they will come out with some more vegan dishes as I heard they have a new vegan chef hired on.

text: I loved this re-discovery recently! I vowed that if I ever noticed that Gaia Cafe was back  in any way I would maintain patronage as I used to frequent the Cafe when I was a student at Aquinas with friends and family as I maintained a vegetarian diet the majority of my time in attendance there. Thank you for coming back, I love the changes and the maintenance of staple favorites like B.Y.O.B. and Mean Green Burrito. I personally chose the Veggie Stash as recommended by my wonderful hostess (I selected the vegan options for cream cheese and cheese toppings as in recent years I have had to cut dairy out of my diet more fully). I had a lovely experience with the self service water and coffee, enjoying the flow of the community coming in and out of the Cafe as I spent a few hours there working on a few personal and professional goals and trying a new, but also nostalgic, meal. Thank you for being back in the Grand Rapids area!!! ðŸ™

text: First timer- after waiting so long to try- and I loved so much! I wanted to try the stuffed tortilla but weirdly the price on the online menu is $4 cheaper than when you go to actually order it online- a lot of menu items were the same way and I wonder if it's on purpose or if the online menu just needs to be updated? Instead, I got the mean green burrito and I loved how fresh it was- I love love love greens and veggies in a burrito and the tomatillo on top was superb. Howeverrr I really really wished the rice and beans had some more flavor! The whole concept of this burrito is amazing but I was left wanting more when the bulk of the burrito was kind of bland. I would love to try the food again- this time eating in as the space inside was so lovely.

text: Walking in, first impression of Gaia House was: so cute! Welcoming seating for intimate convos, color scheme,  draping plants and modern lighting made it a sweet environment. I started with house made chai in a big ceramic mug, some of THE BEST chai I've had in my life, sweet but spicy. I had the Pesto Omelet which was full of flavor and made with cashews and yummy cheese. The side of salsa made for a great balance of flavors, I enjoyed every bite! Very filing and lovely vegetarian cafÃ©.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: This cafeâ€™ is mind blowing! I eat meat regularly and it can take a seat for once. The Coffee is self-serve and the food is served with a smile. Add it to one of GRâ€™s hidden gems. So glad itâ€™s back!!!!

text: Gaia's open for in house dining and if you use to frequent the old Gaia in East Town you will be familiar with the menu. No meat is served but don't let that stop you.  We had the Paul Collins Cuban and the Jim White.  I also had a freshly, not frozen or sweetened, fruit cup. For some reason I have not been able to get a good fresh fruit cup anywhere I have been for breakfast lately.   All three, excellent, fresh and delicious. Staff was friendly and happy to serve you.  Although the interior doesn't have the same vibe as the old Gaia it has it's own charm and coolness.  Just like any diverse hip cafe people talk to each other, exchange ideas and genuinely are happy to do so while eating exceptionally good food, and for me drinking good coffee.  We had this experience on our first time there. It will be our go to breakfast place.

No mk or chocolate fountain. Only 2 pie selections. As I said the quality used to be better. All of these are things noticed by my child it's her favorite restaurant. My waitress was awesome ty Brittany. Over all the food was def not fresh all but the steak the options were slim and not very tasty. Many tables were not wiped down without asking after awaiting a significant time. Unused tables stacked with piles of dishes. This st 4pm so not a full dinner rush.   I'd hate to see it during rush time.

The buffet had many empty pans due to non attention.

I've been  to several Golden Corral in many other major city centres. And this so far by far has been the worst!
Find another location or establishment for a better dining experience

text:
Today my family and I arrived at Golden Corral in Sterling Heights Michigan and were extremely disgusted with what we saw.

After paying (over $60) we finally found a table that was clean. When we went to the bar, we saw nothing but food thrown all over the floor, the bar was disgustingly dirty, and completely empty. Servers and the manager were just walking through the food all over the floor, never cleaning anything at all. It was so bad, I decided to take photos as well for you.

After sitting down, it took us 15 minutes to get silverware, and over 25 min to get drinks. Our server never cleared the plates from our table when needed either.

As for at the bar; the woman doing the steaks was more interested in flirting and trying to get a date with a customer than actually helping customers, cleaning anything, or even putting steaks on the grill. The salad bar was basically full of rotting fruit and slimy lettuce.

At the desert bar, there was chicken on the floor, food everywhere. My biggest concern was the fact that there were peanuts all over the bar, mixed into other toppings, on the cookies, on the brownies, etc. As someone with an extreme nut allergy, this type of cross contamination is deadly, let alone disgusting.

For $60 my family and I ate one plate of food that was cold by the time we got our silverware because the bar was empty and never refilled. I understand that places may be short staffed but that is not an excuse for any of this. If the health department would have walked in, the place would have been closed immediatelyâ€¦.and honestly should have. When the manager, the staff, the servers, and guests are having to walk through food on the floor and nothing is being cleaned or refilled, thatâ€™s awful. We have been here several times and this is the most disgusting restaurant I have ever seen.

The photos shown below are just some of the photos I took. The entire restaurant was like this.
title: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill

text: I love the Peppermill. They have great food with surprising variety at low prices. I had the inside out grilled cheese. It has baby Swiss, cheddar, tomato, red onion, and avocado on parmesan crusted bread. It was amazing. The onion was flavorful and the creamy avocado made the two melted cheeses even better. The parmesan added another layer of crispness to each bite. I upgraded to tater tots instead of chips, and I was surprised at the large portion. My daughter had a pancake and tots. text:
You can consider LA CREME your go-to spot for small batch, organic artisan crepes. The Canela and Citron crepes are our favorites. Make sure to order them with strawberries.

The difference, as with most great restaurants, starts with using excellent ingredients. When we spoke to Kim, the owner of LA CREME, she explained that their toppings are either made in-house or sourced from high quality bakers and such is the whipped cream â€” a delicious level of thickness with the right amount of sweet.

You can feel the attention to details in the decor. Itâ€™s down to earth with an elegant use of black and white with splashes of rose gold among the perfectly socially-distanced tables.

The staff is young, precise, and welcoming.

Overall a great experience that can rival those in Napa, where weâ€™ve been going for years.

One small change I would suggest is upgrading the coffee creamer. Pleased do away with the plastic containers. They just donâ€™t fit within the ambiance LA CREME has created.
title: LA CREME

text: La Creme is a perfect place for crepes and coffee lovers!!! The personal was polite and very friendly. The food was AMAZING. Highly recommended!! We drove one hour for this place and was totally worth it. Definitely will visit again!!! Thank you guys, keep the great work up!!!

While their main focus is crepes, La Creme also offers everything from yogurt bowls to smoothies to coffee to boba to macaroons to pastries and EVEN MORE!!

text: This was our anniversary and we wanted to celebrate with fine tasting Italian food. This was it! Outside on their patio, sipping a tasty, tart cocktail and a nice Barbera red. The Filetto Di Maiale(pork tenderloin) was perfectly cooked and the flavor was mouth watering, even as I ate it! We wrapped it up with their lemon cake. Oh, man, so light and lemony. We took smaller and smaller bites so it would last longer. Give them a go, weâ€™ll certainly be back!

text:
Came here originally on my birthday last year . The food is just amazing. The chef / owner is from Italy and knows how to cook. The homemade pastas were amazing , the staff knew what kind of wine my wife needed , as their wine menu was very overwhelming. Huge wine menu lol .

My wife wanted come back on Valentineâ€™s Day weekend on a Saturday , and it was such a lovey experience ..... we started with the fried calamari. It was crunchy and tender. Got a nice $30 of Cabernet and it was smooth. I donâ€™t really drink wine but I was able to drink a whole bottle with wifey . Next we got a shrimp / crab dish and 4 cheese ravioli. Outstanding entrees. Didnâ€™t look like much but we were very stuffed . Last was our lime something cake ....

We did come at 8pm so the crowd died down so our service was pretty spot on .

Love love love this place !

***updates*** 12/21/2020

Just came here on a Monday for my bday and it was perfect ! When we got there at 6pm there was only us and another table. We practically had the restaurant for a good 30 minutes to ourselves . Usually this place is packed but probably due to covid it has slowed down. They closed their larger dining area. We had a bottle of wine , few appetizers , and two main courses ! Our food was awesome ! And service was great ! Wish it was busier so the restaurant stays in business.

Apps
Caprese
Carpaccio
Meatballs

Main dish
Fettuccini w mushrooms / shrimp /scallops
Piccata chicken w spaghetti?
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text:
Cute restaurant! We got our own little corner behind curtain, it was quite perfect for a group of loud kids and adults.

Meatballs and the sauces were very good!!! The other entrees portions are all too big. Seafood risotto was not bad, I would prefer the seafood not cooked so much that they were a bit chewy.

We all laughed over the one giant piece of ravioli, that was not expected. It smelled really good and was told that it tasted very good too.

They have a large menu of wine by glass and by bottle. Cocktail menu was pretty standard.

I would prefer here than any other chain restaurant, but there are also much better Italian out there.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Honestly, this restaurant is incredible.  The food is amazing, the staff pleasantly is at your beck and call. What else can I say other than book a reservation at Nicola as soon as possible.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Excellent food and service highlight this wonderful restaurant on the north side of Columbus!  I was recently visiting family and we decided to go to Nicola for a nice quiet dinner.  It was later on a Saturday night and after we had placed our orders we were pleasantly surprised when our server not only brought some bread, but a nice bruschetta appetizer, as well, and he explained it was on the house since they were low on bread.  I went with the lasagna, as I also do, on my first visit to an Italian restaurant and it did not disappoint.  We had also ordered a beef carpaccio appetizer for the table that was quite excellent.  We capped off the meal with an exquisite rendition of tiramisu, that proved to be a delicious finale to our dining experience.  I highly recommend this restaurant and am definitely looking forward to my next visit!
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: I was in Columbus for 4 weeks for work and of course I find this restaurant on my last night in town!  If I wouldâ€™ve known about this place my first week I wouldâ€™ve eaten here once a week. Service was good. I got the chicken Marsala and substituted Alfredo sauce with pasta instead of the spaghetti and sauce. It was so good along with the bread and oil!  I want to go back here if I ever get back to Columbus!
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Meatballs were why I came in for dinner but the lasagna will bring me back time after time.  Lasagna is fabulous.  Great wine list with wide selection.   Staff is courteous and professional
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: One of the best Italian restaurants Iâ€™ve ever been too! The atmosphere was so cozy and nice. Our server, Igor, was very attentive and did an excellent job of explaining everything that was on the menu. I got the Tuscan Nido, and it was the best pasta dish I have ever had. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in the Columbus area looking for a nice dinner.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text:
Wonderful food, beautiful garden setting,  knowledgeable staff.   Chef Nicola and wife Esperanza greet you. The patio makes you think you're in Italy. The homemade creamy limoncello is a must and you have to save room for the limoncello cake!!
Can't reccomend it enough.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Last Wednesday dinner at Nicolaâ€™s. A taste of Heaven with scallops Zafferano appetizer and melt-in-your-mouth veal Osso bucoâ€¦to die for! Makes wanna be Carly Simon and sing â€œNobody does it betterâ€¦ðŸŽ¶â€
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Excellent service, friendly staff, huge wine list and tasty food. We had a great bottle of Chianti. Then we split the calamari and caprese. The calamari was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all. I saw the guy in the kitchen breading it. The caprese was honestly one of the best I've had. Being winter, the tomato wasn't the best but the mozzarella was perfect. It was topped with a delicious pesto. And the plate was drizzled with the thickest balsamic glaze I've ever had. It was almost like caramel. The balsamic glaze was extremely flavorful. For our main courses, we had the Tuscan Nido and the wild mushroom Tagliatelle. The Tuscan Nido was basically a giant ravioli. The filling had great flavor. I loved the pops of whole peppercorn and the fried sage leaves. The pasta was clearly homemade and perfect. The wild mushroom Tagliatelle was even better. The mushroom flavor was amazing and the smell was just divine. Normally, I would have liked to see the addition of truffle to a dish like this but honestly, I think it was near perfect without. The mushrooms just had such good flavor. To top off our meal, the lady who seated us came around to see how our meal was. Based on our conversation, I assume she was the owner. She was incredibly sweet. We will be back.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Excellent experience! Excellent food prepared by Chef ! Host was excited to welcome us, Beth our waitstaff was excellent!
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Great service, atmosphere, cocktails, wine list. I have only visited once and have only tried their rissotto, which was better than any I've had here in Columbus although no where near as good as what I've had back in Tuscany. Overall, recommend.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: I donâ€™t like to go back to this place because when I tried to make order the manager says sorry we canâ€™t do this order because we are busy and sheâ€™s left me and got outside!
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Wonderful food and atmosphere.  One of our favorite spots for fine Italian food
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Amazing value for an incredible meal. We dine with 4 guest total, all ordered something different. Each dish was delicious, there was nothing we didnâ€™t like dish to the bread and salted butter. Service was on point and the view was great. 10/10 would recommend
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Our family was there on Easter Sunday. The three course meal was absolutely fabulous. Even though the Bistro was busy, we never felt rushed, and we truly enjoyed our meal. Laura our server was professional and very attentive. Sam was so sweet and made our dining experience very special. This was our sonâ€™s familyâ€™s first outing with their six month old son. It couldnâ€™t have been a more positive. Thank You so much! We will be back for dinner!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Myself and 5 friends went tonight to celebrate our good friend's engagement and wedding coming up next month with something a little different! We had an amazing time, the food was totally different than what we normally would find but so good, we had a ton of fun picking out our meals, trying all the different things, and just enjoying the experience. The wait staff was phenomenal, I honestly think Allison was a highlight of our evening. She was very personable, made us feel entirely comfortable, and had great tips and information on the menu.

We were gifted with extras at dessert, champagne for those of us that partook in cocktails and N/A sparkling juice for those that didn't and it was SO good! Super refreshing! We also (seriously, they were so amazing) were gifted a bite of something delicious - I apologize for not remembering what it was by the pastry chef this evening - but it had almonds, was a dessert bar of some sort and it was really good - not super sweet, honestly would have gone great with coffee if any of us had room for it - which we most certainly did not.

The atmosphere was wonderful, even being in proximity to other tables it still felt intimate enough that we couldn't hear other parties' conversations, nor could they hear ours, and I feel like we were a little rambunctious at times. Also, my friends that had cocktails said nothing but high praise for them - my coke with lime was also top notch * in case anyone cared ;)

Food. That's why you're reading this, yeah?
It was good. Like, really great. It also felt like a performance at times. Lots of fun pouring, super attentive taking items away, never once had to ask for anything, be it water, napkin, silverware, etc etc. Maybe we're cheap dates but I'm fairly certain everyone went above and beyond, exceeding our expectations. Thanks for a great experience!

In case my photo captions don't save:
1. Scallops
2. Surprise Carrot & Cardamom Soup option (big fan of this, you don't know unless you KNOW)
3. Beef Medallion Filet - my favorite of the 3 savory dishes
4. The best dang dessert option there is - even though the mousse looked and sounded amazing - I will DIE on this chocolatey-citrus hill any day. Any. Day. This chocolate cake (better than the chocolate cake in your head, bet) and orange sorbet - beyond. Be.yond.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Absolutely stunning dishes & drinks, paired with amazing service. Hakim, our server, was excellent and made the birthday dinner with my girlfriend a much more special and memorable experience. The food is elegant and delicious. Everything was cooked to perfection. The cocktails were fantastic and the bartender was great! Would highly recommend going here for an intimate dinner with a beautiful lake view or to get together with old friends.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Had the pleasure of dining here during my trip to Milwaukee. I definitely enjoyed my experience. Everything was cooked to perfection. I started with the Moules MariniÃ¨re. The mussels were cooked to perfection and sauce was very light and fragrant. Then I tried the Fondue de GruyÃ¨re Aux Asperges which was very flavorful. For my main plate, I had the FricassÃ© de Homard and the lobster was cooked so delicately that it nearly melted in my mouth. And lastly for dessert I had the delicious Mousse au Chocolat "Yves Camdeborde." Wish I hadn't came so late so I could check out the view everyone spoke about but I still loved every minute of my meal.

text:
Such a wonderful spot, Lake Park Bistro brings a medley of foods and flavors that elevate the dining scene in Milwaukee.

Each course was prepared and plated to perfection, but the best part was the incredibly extensive list of French wines offered by the bottle. Anything weâ€™ve gotten from Burgandy has been exceptional!

text: Wonderfully classic French restaurant. Price fixe 4 course menu provides plenty of options. View is gorgeous also.

Wine is pricey though. Had mussels, sole, salmon, duck breast, chocolate mousse and creme brulee. Also a small fried rice ball with a curry aioli as amuse bouche very arancini like.

text: Made my birthday experience perfect! I felt so taken care of from the bar, to the Lake room. Amazing staff and the food was incredible. Shoutout Hakim, he was an excellent waiter.

text: Absolutely amazing! Great food and staff along with an amazing desert, highly recommend!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Really enjoyed our visit here. We came here for the annual fall mushroom dinner and got to taste a great spread of delicacies and unique mushrooms. We enjoyed about 18 different mushrooms blended into our 6 course meals paired with wine! Everything was delicious.

This was our first time here and glad we decided to be here to enjoy the special evening. We got seated right away and the staff were so polite. We also had some food restrictions and our server attended to us right away addressing that. He just made us feel very comfortable and ensured us that the request has been taken care off.

We visited here for dinner but I would love to visit here again during the day because based on the location, it overlooks the beautiful Lake Michigan and I can only imagine how gorgeous the view would be from the hill top! It's an upscale restaurant and is great for special occasions! They offer a lot of speciality themed dinners (just like the mushroom one) so I would really recommend joining in for one of those if you get a chance! It's awesome :)
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Went for my birthday and it was a perfect meal. The fois gras was superior to the ones I had in France. The squab was a first and well worth every bite. The scallops with shaved truffles were seared to perfection. Plus, they had a wonderful birthday card!

Can't wait to go back in the summer and enjoy the view of the lake!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Always good and  no surprise! food was very good. We had set brunch menu with 3 courses and they were delicious. Server was on top of all and food came pretty quickly and good. Steak and eggs was good also portion was filling. My wife's crab benedict was very good and eggs was perfect on top.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
I can't believe I've lived in Milwaukee for 30 years, and have never visited this restaurant.
We both had the most amazing French onion soup ever. I had hanger steak which was tasty, and my hubby had quail and skate (which is stingray) which he didn't care for.

The service was excellent and I got chocolate cake for my birthday. The decor is beautiful and the location is on Lake Michigan.

We will be back for the soup for sure.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Our wedding at Lake Park Bistro was absolutely perfect. We had a tented reception with cocktail hour on the gorgeous East Balcony with stunning views of Lake Michigan. The restaurant's white pillars were a perfect location for photos and the surrounding park offered more beautiful options all with in a walking distance. The staff was fantastic and our guests were thrilled with their prompt and friendly service. We also received many, many compliments on the food from our family and friends; even those â€˜hard to impressâ€™ said their meal at Lake Park Bistro was the best theyâ€™d ever had at a wedding. However, the best thing about Lake Park Bistro was working with Dan. He made us feel comfortable and welcome every step of the way and provided us with excellent advice to make our day fun and stress-free. Dan was clear in all of our communications and went above and beyond to host a meeting for myself and my other vendors. His honest feedback and recommendations helped make our day personal, special, and truly, the best day of our lives. We truly can not say enough about our wonderful experience at Lake Park Bistro, thank you Dan and team!!

(Photos from Dawn Silva Photography)
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Gourmet food, great service, nice views of Lake Michigan, and classic restaurant ambiance. Menu is diverse enough to have something for everyone. Prices are high, but fair considering the quality of cuisine. Ample parking.

text: Always a favorite destination, Bartolottas Lake Park Bistro is nestled in lake Park with a great view of the lake.  We like to start with an old fashioned at the bar and then try to get a window view.  I enjoyed the best medium rare ribeye with brussel sprouts.  My wife went for the filet mignon and scallops.  As always, we grabbed a few desserts to share.  The chocolate mousse with praline crust was my fave!

text:
I thought my mom and I would have really enjoyed this restaurant, but we were a bit underwhelmed and feel that Le Reve in Tosa and Pastiche in downtown are better options in Milwaukee for French cuisine.

Things we liked:
â€”the view of Lake Michigan
â€”free parking!
â€”the butter (kinda random, but it was really good!)
â€”the wine pairings for the Menu de Chef
â€”the service from our waiterâ€™s assistant (I think her name was Michelle)
â€”my dessert, which was an Earl Grey pot de creme with honey brittle and lavender chantilly creme. The bright, lemony Riesling was a perfect pair.

Things we didnâ€™t care for:
â€”our waiter made the same spiel for the specials at every table and became a broken record.
â€”the soup lâ€™oignon was so-so, a little too sweet
â€”the entrees could have used more vegetables to brighten up the plate
â€”my filet was well-done when I ordered it rare, but they were quick to fix that
â€”noisy in our room and was difficult to maintain conversation
â€”we got a bit of a pretentious air to the place

Overall, this place was nice, but didnâ€™t knock our socks off. However, I would go there again for drinks and dessert.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: The atmosphere is beautiful, the service is wonderful, and the food is amazing. I had the veal and one of their salads. Their fresh warm bread and butter is served to you as needed by the servers. They really take care of you here and the view overlooking Lake Michigan doesn't hurt either!

text: This is a fancy place for big occasions. Try this out for birthdays or anniversaries and you will like it. Lakefront view is good when there is sunlight. text: Excellent food with a nice view of the lake. The servers walk around with a basket of French baguette pieces that are offered throughout the meal. It was played beautifully and the flavors were amazing together.

text: LPB has been our favorite for a long time and we we're thrilled to learn they re-opened. The service was stellar and VERY safe however we were not quite thrilled with our  food. It was almost as if the kitchen has an entirely new staff.. perhaps new suppliers/wholesalers??  My Oeuf Mollet avec Champignons des Bois was prepared differently, the mussels were definitely different. And my favorite fois gras dish has a new bland fruit or vegetable to accompany it vs the old one which was a sweet fruit that was such a great compliment to such a savory protein. Lastly,  I had a lobster entree that was prepared in a "beef stock" like base... Almost like it should have accompanied beef vs. fresh lobster. I hate to sound harsh but I am just being honest.  And FYI the menu is now a set 3 or 4 course menu. We will certainly come back however having eaten here so many times for so many special occasions.. we were a bit disappointed compared to any previous visit.  One last note.. just a thought... Why is it I cannot find a desert chef in Milwaukee who makes Panna Cotta? The last time we found it was at Chistopher's (now closed/new owner perhaps) in Sister Bay. That was approximately 10 years ago..I will finish by staring the lemon desert we had was excellent!!

text: The food here was absolutely terrific! Some places offer homestyle dishes like your mom used to make. This place offers homestyle dishes like someone else's mom made, and they're all delicious. My favorite was the shepherds pie, but everything they served was great. Wednesday nights are "buffeteria" style. They serve you like a cafeteria but you keep going back until you're finished. Non-members price was $16.95 which I felt was fair for the quality of food and service provided. If you want to try something a little out of the ordinary I highly recommend a Edelweiss! I'll certainly be back when I cost the area again. Call ahead reservations are recommended.

text: Amazing service and amazing food. Our family randomly decided to give this place a try to satisfy our want for authentic German food. title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text:
This is truly a hidden gem!

They have a dance group anyone can join; it's been very fun! Wednesdays at 7PM, except for the 2nd Wednesday each month.  I have literally no dance background, but this is folk dancing, so that's fine ðŸ˜

Edelweiss is located in German Park at the end of the drive.  The park itself isn't anything major, but the scenery is very nice.
Once at the parking lot, you can go in the main entrance and down the stairs to the restaurant or follow the sidewalk north of the building where it slopes down and around the building to their outdoor seating. You can see a gnome garden along the way!
I've seen comments saying this place isn't handicap accessible, but this sidewalk is the entrance to take if you have a wheelchair or stroller.  Understandably, this will be inconvenient if it is raining.
The outdoor seating is the beer garden area and the doors lead into the restaurant.

On Wednesdays there is a buffet.  I'm writing this review after a stop at their buffet and I'm impressed.
On Fridays they have live music; simply amazing fun!

They have several events through the year and I definitely recommend checking them out! FrÃ¼hlingsfest, JÃ¤gerfest, Octoberfest and more!

Through the year, they have several German events, including an Octoberfest.  From what I hear, it's a blast!

Additionally, a local Duolingo group has started holding language events here and, separately, there is a lady who gives basic German lessons in the fall.
*Note* September 2022 - I'm not certain if these have started up again yet.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: 1st 2 items I ordered,  they came back and told me they were out of them. The weiner schnitzel however,  was very good and the waitress was nice.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Really nice restaurant with attentive staff.  The food is delicious and the grounds are beautiful.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text:
This place is amazing.  Talk about taking yourself back in time for a minute you feel like you are in Germany.  They open at 5pm for dinner only.  You drive down this  dark road, and you would never know there was a parking lot and a restaurant from the top of the road.
You go inside from the parking lot on a top level,  down a flight of  stairs is the restaurant.  They do have an elevator for handicap.
Once below it's amazing.  It's small probably about 30 tables, wooden walls, and all decorated with Germany memorabilia.
I was so excited to try this place the last time I had German food was in Germany 20 plus years ago.  I still remember what that tasted like.
There was 2 waitress serving and taking orders. Lisa was our waitress.  She is such a nice lady,  and definitely knows her menu,  and has worked their for a long time.  I ordered the German beer on tap it was very light, clear, and refreshing. My other half Bayrischer Schweinebraten it was a tender slow roasted pork shoulder.  I tasted the dish and it was amazing.  Very tender and with lots of flavor.  It was not sliced it was more like chunk pork. His side was the sliced apples.  I have never tried apples sliced fresh, in a cinnamon sauce.  I wish you could order this by the pint or quart to take home.  Amazing!
I ordered JÃ¤gerschnitzel which was delicious with the cream white wine sauce, and mushroom.  The sauce was so good I asked for a little more sauce. The pork meat was tender, and a nice slice. My sides was potato pancakes oh my goodness hold the fork these were not greasy at all.  I put the sour cream and applesauce on the potato cakes. My other side I was wanting to try was the German potato salad.  It was good, completely traditional,  but not my favorite for my taste buds. Before dinner you have a choice of soup or salad.  I definitely tried the soup which was really good the traditional red cabbage soup.
I can't wait to come back to try more dishes.
For dessert if you have room definitely order the bread pudding with the warm whiskey sauce.  You will want to make room for this dessert.
We were getting ready to leave, they were closing, and they were so nice they make everything fresh daily, and had extra apple and cherry turnovers. I had taken home 1 of each. The next day with a cup of coffee, warmed up,  very good.
I can't wait to come back!
Thank you ladies for such a great experience.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Great selection of German biers (see how I did that?) Not a huge fan of German food, so not a fair judge of that.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Great food and service the place is in the basement will be returning for sure to try what i didn't this time !!!!

text:
Delicious!
Do yourself a favor and order a big bowl of the haus soup!
The cabbage is fantastic. The pork chops were huge and perfectly done.
Portions are enormous

text:
You get what you pay for. Fine dining at its finest. Tim, our waiter, was absolutely outstanding. A Beautiful  calming atmosphere enhanced a pleasant dining experience. Food quality and presentation were exceptional.
We were just passing through on a Sunday, and hit a home run.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: I went here for my first time with my girlfriend from Germany. We were both impressed with the food and atmosphere! Iâ€™ve always heard of Shulerâ€™s and the legend it is. My great grandparents use to eat here all the time. I look forward to making it a traditional every year. The service was excellent! Our waitress, Roxie, was super awesome and explained the entire menu. The classic cheese ball, crab cakes, and lamb chops were all perfect!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: My husband and I came in for our anniversary. From the hostess to the waitress to everything in between, everything was wonderful. The pictures on the walls were beautiful. The stuffed mushrooms were great! Fresh cut fries were awesome. We decided on sandwiches and got the French dip and the brisket sandwich. Both were great. The staff really set the visit apart though. Our waitress was just so sweet. They even gave us a sweet gift for our anniversary. Now everytime we drink out of our glasses we will remember our trip.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: What a magical little place in Marshall. The throwback interior sets the mood for the good food you receive. The wait staff was attentive and nice. So, why not five stars? The food was really good, but not 5 star. Also, they have a lot of areas they are serving. So the service was a little slower than usual. Not a huge wait, but wanted to note it. Overall, I will always visit this restaurant every time I visit in Marshall. You should, too.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Haven't been to Win Schuler's in over 25 years... Was so glad I decided to stop again! I ordered my favorite, "French Dip" sandwich. Great portion size and loved the sweet potato fries too! It won't be so long before I stop again. It was everything I remember, and even more! The baked goods I bought were also amazing!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Lovely historic restaurant and pub in what was once a hotel. The decor and ambiance is classic and refined. The service is prompt, friendly and professional. A bit pricey but the experience was worth the $90 (tip included) for two entrees and an appetizer. The crispy brussel sprouts were deliciously sweet with just the right amount of heat. The wife enjoyed the pecan-crusted chicken. I ordered the braised pot-roast which i literally cut with my fork.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text:
Fantastic quality meals from high end Prime Rib, to 'Pub Style' options; you'll never miss hitting a top shelf experience no matter your choice. With great house wines, and sweet treats to end the night, this place has (and will continue to) received plenty of my patronage.
If I need a place to take my family which I can rely to provide a memorable and enjoyable experience: It's Schuler's.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Wonderful food and good service! My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and because of that we got a complimentary dessert! A little pricey but well worth it.

text: We were greeting upon entering, quickly served, and enjoyed the grand historical environment. Our server, Holly, was very friendly, prompt, and attentive. text: Not for me but others really enjoy this restaurant. To me the food is only okay compared to the high price. My parents however come here for the nostalgia and environment. The cheese is definitely the best part of this place however my one complaint is that it come out in plastic salad dressing containers. Iâ€™m a stickler for plating and with the price of this place itâ€™d be nice if they could scoop it out and put it in a serving dish. The service was excellent.

text: Walk into a place that looks kinda like a Frankenmuth restaurant. Dark but absolutely beautiful inside. They have an amazing wine and spirits menu. Drinks were very good and hit the spot. (Not a super fan of sweet pickles, but on this sandwich is was very tasty with a sweet and spicy taste. French fries were beer battered and hot. Very tasty food and drinks. text:
My fiancÃ© and I came in for a couple Manhattanâ€™s at this beautiful, spectacular, historic destination in Marshall Michigan.

We were terribly disappointed to receive in our Manhattanâ€™s, a red, dyed, bleached, maraschino cherry, (just like our local VFW). We recommend management considers a tiny investment in providing Luxardo cherries for its bourbon aficionados. Other than that, we absolutely love this destination and are happy to drive 60 miles each way to enjoy all that Schulers has to offer.  Love this place!

text: The husband and I have decided to set off and try a new place where we have never ate before every Friday for date night, with that being said we found ourselves here. My first impression wasn't bad at first. It was very beautiful when we walked in. A little confusing because you choose if you'd like to eat in the Diner or Pub and each menu was a tad different (as they did show us) but I was still confused so I just said Diner so we could get to eating. After about a 20 minute wait we was finally placed into a corner but at this point I didn't care, I was just ready to eat. We ordered our drinks and appetizers, those took about 15 minutes to receive. I immediately noticed that the glass was dirty, still at this point I'm trying to stay positive. I calmly wait as we wait for our waiter to come back so I can express my concerns to him unfortunately he took about 20 minutes before he came back in that 20 minutes we watched others get drinks numerous times and their food as we still set there waiting to just get one more drink, at this point I'm getting annoyed. Right about then a manager walk by and I expressed my concerns to her and she immediately address the issue. We finally receive our food from our original waiter and to be honest the burger was okay it didn't have much flavor at all but at this point I'm still trying to stay positive and look at the positive like at least the fries are good right? Just overall not a good experience I don't think I would ever go back there again the manager however did come up to us and offer us a free dessert to take home and we kindly took it home with us to enjoy later. Not the best experience for me the food was very pricey and definitely not worth the money.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text:
Had a great dining experience here. Stopped by after a long day in Battle Creek to find this classic dining location in Marshal. Old world style with rough finished beams that have great quotes painted on them.
Our server did not hurry us, but set us up with drinks and their house made flat bread and cheese spread. The cheese spread was a great throw back to my childhood! Next was the roasted brussel sprouts.  Followed by their prime rib, Turkey (!) shepard's pie, and burger. Very pleasantly surprised by the Turkey shepard's pie - a nice twist on a classic. The prime rib was perfect and classic. Give them a try!

text:
We had an amazing time and we enjoyed the food and appreciated the whole experience.
Our dinner started with complementary bread and butter. After that, we had a salad with a delicious dressing.
Our main course was a dish of quail in special wild mushrooms sauce, a dish of a rack of lamb which I highly recommended, a dish of snapper with homemade cajun spice, and the venison on the cherry port sauce.
For dessert, we had this delicious tiramisu.
Magdy the owner is a very skilled chef and a friendly welcoming person.
This place is one of the best places for me.
Highly recommended and itâ€™s better to call before you go.

text: Do NOT judge from the outside, although I can see why you might. We took a chance and we were blown away. It was a very quaint and nicely decorated restaurant.  It had white linen tablecloths and napkins, nice music and everything was very clean. They had a nice wine list and we ordered some chardonnay as an appetizer....and then an actual appetizer. For the main fare we ordered beef wellington and chicken caprese. The food was absolutely delicious! Chef Magdy came out and spoke with us. He was absolutely charming!! He comped us free desserts, which were also delicious, and made us feel like we were eating with an old friend. We dressed for the occasion, but it is not necessary at all. It's a very comfortable, fine dining experience. Give it a try.
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: Elm was lovely! All the staff was so warm, friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was so unique for Bloomington. I felt transported to a metropolitan areaâ€¦in all the best ways! Itâ€™s upscale, but yet cozy and modern. The mezzanine had a different vibe than the downstairs, but both were lovely! They also have a separate room upstairs for a small event or work meeting/lunch. There is a bar both upstairs and downstairs which is neat! Beyond the atmosphere, the food was good and the presentation was great. I had the beet salad which was small but very tasty! The homemade gnocchi with pesto sauce and toasted pine nuts was also delicious! I canâ€™t wait for my next visit!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: I want to begin by saying I really love the atmosphere. The tables are spaced out enough that there is not much noise and itâ€™s easy to talk to your table. The interior decoration is also very beautiful. There is not much parking but I live close so I walked. The food was delicious but there were just enough weird things that made me give 4 instead of 5 stars. The bread and butter (which is its own appetizer) is OK but definitely not anything to write home about, the butter pat was cold so not easily spreadable. I ordered the cauliflower main dish with sauce and golden raisins knowing it would be lighter than a meat main. However, with the price of the dish, I was expecting a bit more than 1/4 of a cauliflower head for my main meal. I know inflation and prices are high but cauliflower? Seems they couldâ€™ve spared a bit more. Additionally the olive oil cake with rhubarb and strawberry ice cream was good but the ice cream stole the show! The cake itself was just ok and the rhubarb had not been sweetened enough to make it palatable, I ended up taking it off. The service was good but not great, we had a new server and she made a few missteps that ultimately would have cost our party money if we hadnâ€™t spoken up (as opposed to slow service, etc). Overall, I definitely want to go back to the elm, i will just choose my dishes more carefully.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Fantastic experience. We felt comfortable  the moment we got there. Our cocktails were very good and the food was delicious. For just getting started they are already at or above most places in town. The team in the kitchen is made up of local celebrity chefs. Itâ€™s great to see so much talent under one roof. Canâ€™t wait to see what they put out once they truly hit their stride.

text: We stumbled to this restaurant by accident when we were looking for a place for dinner after 8 pm. Their host was kind to find us a table right away and our table services were remarkable. We loved each dishes they introduced us to and were surprised by some innovations of the chef. Each dishes looked well presented, not too crafty, but once you taste them, you will keep on eating until you finished all of them. text:
The Elm is beautiful, gorgeous even, and the staff were friendly, attentive and good at their jobs. The menu is big enough that there are enough choices but it's not overwhelming. The cocktail menu is inventive.
I mention all of this because the bar, from the moment you walk in the door, is set very very high. And the food is great. It's just not quite as beautiful as the decor or as perfect as the menu describes.
The tostones are plentiful and the brussel sprouts are crispy. But the sauces leave something to be desired.
The steak and lamb were excellently cooked but greens and asparagus needed a little more flavor.
But hot damn the olive oil cake was good. The seasonal rhubarb, strawberry and pistachio pairing was divine. Textures and flavors, yum!
I'll be back for espresso and dessert ASAP!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: You can easily spend $50-100 or more per person here. You might leave hungry without an appetizer or desert. We were very pleased with our drinks and entrees. Beautiful space, modern and refined. Lovely patio. Romantic.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
Fantastic interior layout, private dining area from the bar. My brother and I came here for dinner he was in town and I haven't been here yet so we decided to try it. Food was interesting to say the least, we got the CALABRIAN CHILI CUCUMBERS for an app and it was more tangy like pickled cucumbers. Still very refreshing. I got the SWEET CORN AGNOLOTTI  , charred corn very sweet with shredded crab mix, pretty good however needed a little salt added.
My brother got BRAISED PORK BELLY, cooked an amazin crispy skin , however, this one was overly salted. Not bad but our palette was interesting.
Then we ended with dessert CHOCOLATE MOUSSE CAKE and Seasonal Truffles (3)
By far my favorite I've tried, subtle , flavor isn't overpowering (I don't have that much of a sweet tooth) would definitely get the dessert again! The truffles was alright, dark chocolate and white chocolate. Tasted really nice.
Great experience, menu is seasonal so it's nice to see different options.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
Went for an early Saturday dinner. The place was nicely spaced, the staff was all very professional and friendly, the food was tasty, the pricing was reasonable, and it was upscale (for Bloomington) without being snooty/uncomfortable.

Let's hope it sticks around, cuz I'm planning on becoming a regular.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: I couldn't have asked for a nicer birthday dinner. The staff were lovely (thanks, Tam), the interior has a beautiful modern, earthy vibe, and the food was great. I especially liked the matcha creme brulee, baby beet salad, harissa cauliflower, and salted pistachio latte. We're so excited something is finally in this space again.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Outstanding local restaurant.  Unusual menu that changes regularly.  Great open atmosphere.  Make a reservation as they are usually full. The only drawback is that parking can be difficult in the neighborhood.  They have a small parking lot in front and alongside the building. You can park in any space that says "customer parking only".
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Very pricey with small portions. The vegan charcuterie had some new flavors to me. The beet salad and duck were good. My partnerâ€™s pasta was bland.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: This experience exceeded my expectations. Highlights included the gnocchi which was prefectly light and flavorful and the Ube cheesecake which with sorbet on top was a novel and delicious take on a classic. I highly recommend the Elm.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: I'm sure this is something many reviews will say, but it's such a cool atmosphere, especially for Bloomington. We had the ribeye and the chicken sandwich, both were great, especially the ribeye. We also had a wonderful spicy jalapeÃ±o/Cherry margarita and a quality Manhattan. We had made reservations online beforehand, and were seated right away. The service was perfecto and I'm sure we'll be back again in a month or two since there's seasonal menu items. If you need a place for a nice date night, or celebrating a special occasion, tis a perfect spot.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Superb food, great presentation, good service, great location, and a nice ambiance.  One of the top two in Bloomington.  The vegan charcuterie was really good and inventive.  The duck breast was just right and a colorful presentation.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Finally there is a fine dining restaurant in B-town. Seasonal menu with creative ideas, healthy & tasty food, and cool vibe, love it.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Wow! Excellent,  fresh and lovely prepared seasonal food. We are so happy to have this little gem in our neighborhood. If you haven't stopped in yet put it on your to do list!!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Absolutely smashing food and amazing drinks. Bailey, our bartender, was the absolute best. Do check this place out! This place is definitely one of Bloomington's best!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
My wife and I originally booked a reservation for 8pm on a Friday night but decided to come an hour early to see if we could sit at the bar for a couple of drinks first.

We ended up staying at the lower bar and eating a wonderful dinner. Mostly because of our bartenderâ€™s kindness, professionalism and the great ambiance.

Mushroom kushiyaki and charred avocado for a starter. Then, egg yolk raviolo and chicken roulade for our main course. Delicious on all counts.

Itâ€™s set up as a cafe, as well. We didnâ€™t experience this side of it. But, highly recommend if youâ€™re looking for a nice dinner in Bloomington.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: It's hard to believe a place like this exists in Bloomington. It's like walking into a trendy bar / restaurant in a major city. The cocktails are original and interesting. I ordered the Choconut Negroni and it was unlike anything and I have drunk before. And interesting blend of Jen, cocoa nib infused sweet remove, and coconut fat washed campari, It is entirely original and fun to drink. Next I tried the espresso martini. I've had plenty of those in my lifetime and this one was a new twist. Two different kinds of Espresso and tiramisu liqueur woke me up and provided just the right amount of decadence. I didn't try the menu but it looks excellent. This would be a great place to come with friends or on a date night.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Excellent service and drinks! The decor is beautiful and the food is wonderful. Photos of the pork belly and duck entrees.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: It is a hit or a miss when I go to the Elm, but the drinks and the desserts are always good!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Finally had an overpriced and meh dinner at the restaurant. Halibut was overcooked and mushy. Nope. Flavors were good, but its trying too hard at this point. They cant make a good Manhattan and do not care. Its fine for the midwest... meh.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Excellent menu choices, service is great, and the dessert is delicious. Reservations recommended.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Absolutely stunning! Incredible interior, great staff, and most importantly: the food is delicious! Apparently a lot of it is locally sourced and made in house. Very reasonable prices for all of this.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Great service, and the chicken sandwich and freshly baked bread was delicious.  We also enjoyed the drink selection.  Glad that there is excellent bike parking at the restaurant, which we appreciated
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Tasty meals in small quantities! Good ambiance too!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Fantastic Mexican. Come here once a week. Great proportions, never have to wait long. Love all the sides that the platters come with. Super fresh tasting food every time. The workers are so so nice too.
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Went there a couple days ago with some friends and had a great time! The food there was great and the blonde waitress was very nice and sweet. 10/10 would eat again
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Was delicious & clean ...excellent service...definitely going back... Went back today May 8 2022.. We all had the taco salad and it was delicious...Our waiter was awesome took very good care of us... They also did some updates place really looks nice..
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Good friendly service exellent food and fair prices love going to this place
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Always a great place to eat for a large party!
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Great food.  Chili with rice, and a bean burrito. A little spicier than we have expected, but good. We will return.
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: First time eating here and the food is great, I had the mixed fajitas and the steak and chicken was so tender and flavorful, the frozen margaritas are delicious, the kids tenders were fresh and tasted great, I'll definitely be back here to dine or just for drinks, atmosphere is cool as well, very clean and spacious restaurant.
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: I always like to come here when I visit family. The atmosphere is very family friendly. The food is good.
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text:
This is THE BEST Mexican restaurant my husband and I have ever had !
The staff is very friendly and the food is amazing, and the prices are very reasonable we highly recommend this place. For sure a well deserved 5 star *****
Update- still the best !
They go by the COVID rules.....  , mask, distancing, I feel safe there !
