title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Food was great, wait wasn't long, great service!
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text: Great food at reasonable prices.
title: La Fiesta Mexican

text:
This restaurant is the BEST find in over a year!!! How could we not know about this little dream stop?
It is a friendly and fabulous-tasting food experience! I highly recommend you stop by and choose a favorite! As for me and mine... the pancakes are puffs of heaven AND, they serve peanut butter upon request!
Will be back ... OFTEN!!
title: The Grill Inc

text:
Awesome home cooked meals and rock-bottom prices!!! Highly recommended that you visit here.
Waitresses are very polite and if you visit regularly they will begin to remember what you order. Great benefit!
P.S. For coffee drinkers, the coffee severed here is excellent!
title: The Grill Inc

text: This place has been family owned for 40 years.  The food is so fresh and the service is amazing. Its so worth the trip.
title: The Grill Inc

text: Excellent food ...a true hidden gem had the Rideye steak it was perfect salad was fresh & delicious .. Highly recommended 7/16/22 Don't buy the tenderloin was dry & horrible.. bigger doesn't mean better .. the waitress took it off the bill and I didn't even ask.. she was really nice..
title: The Grill Inc

text: Good food, good prices. But cash only.
title: The Grill Inc

text: I normally don't leave reviews but one of the best dining experiences I've had in a good while and I felt compelled. All I can say is that the food was excellent and while the prices were up there, the quality food and preparation was exactly what you would expect for a premium dining experience and are on par with their prices. Here's a picture of the Sea Bass. Perfectly cooked with an amazing presentation. Skin was crispy with the fish itself, succulent and juicy. Kudos to the Chef. Please continue to do what you are doing, I will definitely be back.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
The newest Chesterfield staple!! Great vibe from the moment you walk in. We sat at the bar, had some delicious craft drinks and lunch! Bartender couldn't have been sweeter and food was nothing short of delicious! Familiar with Chef Matt's work and he's really brought his best stuff to the menu here. 10/10

pictured: duck fat truffle fries (omg!!), french dip, + smash burger
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
Everything from start to finish was fantastic! The onion soup was flavorful and did not need the GruyÃ¨re cheese, but the cheese made it better. Perfect for a cold winter night! The steak tartare was also flavored well with peppers and the perfect ratio to the sauce. The chips made it even better. The duck breast matched well with the parsnip purÃ©e and was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The flavor profile had a gamier edge. The portion sizes were generous, and there were extra duck pieces mixed in with the vegetables. The cocktails were a delight: my old fashioned had a clear, custom cut ice cube that added to the aesthetic charm. The drink tasted better over time as the ice melted.

One of the owners, John, was so friendly; he came to check on our table to see how we were doing. I had a wonderful experience and will definitely come back!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: This place is super cute. Drinks were great and dessert was amazing. Marietta was the best bartender!! Awesome drinks and margaritas. We will be back!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Went to Westchester for lunch today.  I had the best french dip sandwich of my life.  The beef was a brisket that was absolutely stunning in terms of flavor and tenderness.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: We had a wonderful experience at Westchester for lunch! The decor is beautiful and the â€œvibeâ€ inside is welcoming and cozy but also hip. I ordered the grilled chicken mezze salad and it was beautiful, but also delicious. The duck fat truffle fries were also phenomenal. We brought our kids (7 and 4) so Chef Matt made them a grilled cheese (he also added delicious crispy fries) and amazing buttered noodles. He even sent our server, Olivia, out to double check that multi grain bread was ok for the grilled cheese. Olivia was a wonderful server as well and knew everything about the menu, and the owner was there at the host stand greeting people as they came in. There was a big table of women having a fun lunch and the bar was full of groups of men hanging out as well. I am born and raised in Chesterfield and itâ€™s totally unique and awesome for the area. I highly recommend it and we will be back very soon! Probably for dinnerâ€¦without the kids ðŸ˜‚ â¤ï¸
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
I am torn.. . The food and drinks were 5 star. Service was slow, not just for us but noticeably for everyone around us. Maybe it is because they recently opened but the service didn't seem to have a solid flow.

I want to say the bar needs an additional person but with so few tables two should suffice. It is a shame they dont knock the wall down and expand the kitchen and dining room.

A few labeling mistakes on the menu. Orin swift hasnt made saldo in over a decade but the 2020 orin swift saldo is on the menu.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Iâ€™ll get right to it, order a bottle of wine when you go to Westchester, most wines by the glass starts at 20.00. My husband had the Wagyu steak and I ordered the salmon my whole dish was too salty, the wagyu was tough, 79.00 tough. Vegetable overcooked. Just because you slap high prices on a menu does not make it affluent or good. The server checked on us 11 times, she was such a sweet and pretty young lady, however,  needs to learn the art of being a server. #dissapointed Oh! The ice cream from Clementines was a delight! For those prices you should offer a Sommelier and better wine selection. The whole production of fine dining is to educate the diner and their experience should make them feel welcomed at your establishment. The hostess was not friendly at all. The decor dark and dreary. Those days of dark and dreary restaurants are outdated.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Five Star fine dining. Exceptional service. Expensive but worth the Date night ambience.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Great place. Food was amazing.  Atmosphere was great.  Staff and owners were very welcoming and made it a great night out.  Highly recommended.   We really needed a place like this in the valley.   We will be back.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Lobster and smoked shrimp appetizer! It made my palate so happy!! Amazing!! Drinks superb and service fantastic!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Great atmosphere, excellent customer service and amazing foodâ€¦from the salads to the sandwiches, burgers & fries you canâ€™t go wrong! Canâ€™t sit to come back for dinner and drinks!

text: Great meal at busy place.  The halibut is outstanding and was the star.  Smoked shrimp, steak tartar, mussels, and duck fat fries were very good.  Expect a very loud dining experience with excellent service and food
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Delicious! Sit at the bar, you won't be disappointed.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
My husband and I ate here on a weekend for dinner. You definitely need to make a reservation. Even during the week they are busy. If you are lucky you can try to get a seat at the bar.

Their cocktail list is excellent! Their drinks are priced similarly to Ruth Chris's $15+. The use quality fresh ingredients. I enjoyed their French 75.

I ordered the Waygu burger cooked medium rare with truffle fries which are fantastic. They sell it during their happy hour as well. We will be returning! Loved it!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
Good food at a good priceðŸ‘ðŸ»
We were coming from the Loess Bluffs Wildlife Refuge.
We did come in the late afternoon, so the location was not busy.
The staff that we encountered was efficient, but not cheerful, but not rude either.
The atmosphere was not overly welcoming and dim lighting. It was a cloudy day, so maybe they rely on sunshine to help out?
The location was clean and restrooms were clean, with no baby changing station in the women's room.

text: For Falls City Nebraska This place is good.  The prices are trainable.  The helpings were large. People very friendly. I would return here.

text: Great experience, fast service and great pizza. The server needs to learn to be more personable but overall a good experience.

text: Good food. Service is friendly but can be slow during busy times.

text: I wouldâ€™ve given this place a two star review, however, I brought it down to one star because of the waitress who served us. First and foremost, they do have really good wings. Letâ€™s start off with the good. The not so good, was the service and the burgers. I did not enjoy my burger whatsoever. It was greasy and absolutely disgusting. The waitress clearly saw that I only took one small bite of my burger and never even questioned whether I liked it or not or if they could remake it. Still charged me full price & that was truly disappointing. Basic customer service adequate, would be to ask the customer if they enjoyed their food or how things were? But she clearly she did not. Overall, I would not return to this copperhead. Iâ€™ve had much better experiences at the copperhead in Allentown.
title: Copperhead Grille

text: From the outside this restaurant looks more fine dining. We were a bit surprised to see the inside resembling more of a chain bar/restaurant. They had several TVs with sports playing. The food wasn't worth the price. Granted we came an hour or so before kitchen closed, however the food items that we ordered weren't as good as they looked. The server seemed a little swamped with tables, possible the restaurant needs more staff.

text: Great food off a huge menu. Tons of parking and not a bad seat in the house with TVs on every wall. Vegetarian options are good. Good portion. We had great service. Not too loud for being a sports bar.

text: Nice outdoor seating with a bar. We loved the seared tuna quac and the coconut shrimp. Both tasted amazing and had fresh seafood. I would probably come back and order the same.

text: Good drinks, nice space with lots of TVâ€™s and some really good cocktails. The food was OK, not bad and not great. Service was good and our meal was delivered quickly.

text: Review is for take out: Mozz sticks are ginormous! And the marinara sauce for dipping is awesome ðŸ‘ very yummy mozzarella sticks. Triple play is gr8! Love the kielbasa â¤ Ribs and pulled pork were awesome too! Mac n cheese was very good (we got the yellow, had white last time and it was too mild for our tastes). And I love the veggie soup â¤â¤â¤ this is our go-to for higher end take out ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

text: After passing this restaurant numerous times my hubby and I   decided it was finally time to give it a try.  Well...we were not disappointed! We began our meal with the fried mozzarella which was highly recommended by both the hostess and our server.  Excellent and not your typical...these were huge and there were five of them..more like logs as they're referred to by staff! And marinara dipping sauce was really good...just a slight kick to it.  Hubby then had  a crabcake and shrimp and chicken fajitas (he couldn't decide between the two as entrÃ©es so getting the crabcake as an add on worked out great!)...and I had the yummy strawberry apple walnut salad with chicken. The entire meal...and a few adult beverages...were perfect! And our server, Sammie (sp?) was so helpful, friendly and sweet... made our dining experience even more enjoyable. A great experience all the way around and look forward to returning again soon!
title: Copperhead Grille

text: We enjoy this restaurant and it's good and beverage choices.  We just got a puppy and I called to find out if they allow pets in their patio.  I was told "of course". So the puppy and I picked up our special lady for a surprise birthday dinner.  Not only did they welcome our puppy but they brought her out a bowl of water and many of the staff came over to show her some love.  The staff was very friendly and the food is always delicious.  Now I've added them to my pet friendly restaurants.  Thank you copperhead grille!!
title: Copperhead Grille

text:
I typically enjoy eating here. I ordered some takeout steak salads and I requested 2 modifications. One was to remove the fries from it, and the other was to add a hard boiled egg, I hadnâ€™t realized that it would cost an extra $3 for the egg. I get inflation is a mess, but that seems a bit ridiculous for 1 egg, which Iâ€™m sure is bought in bulk from a restaurant supplier.

Iâ€™m just a tad annoyed with the restaurant and to top it off, they didnâ€™t give me any dressing. So all around a disappointment for a nearly $30 salad.
title: Copperhead Grille

text:
Great selection on draft! I ordered the blackened fished tacos and really enjoyed them.
Reasonable prices for good food and beer, very pleased!
title: Copperhead Grille

text: Great food.  Friendly service.
title: Copperhead Grille

text: The place is a nice sports bar and  they're adding on to it to make an outdoor patio. The staff is very friendly and the wings were very  good.
title: Copperhead Grille

text:
My wife and I stopped here for lunch following a trip to Chriskindlemart.

We were quickly greeted by the hostess and or waitress Kim came over to us to take our order relatively quickly. She greeted us with a smile in a very friendly manner.

We both ordered the strawberry lemonade which is a great thirst quencher. For appetizers,  we shared the crab dip and brown butter buffalo wings which were delicious.

For meals, my wife had the crab cakes with brussel sprouts and the bacon twice baked potato. She said the crab cakes were very good but said the brussel sprouts,  although extremely tasty and flavorful,  were not fully cooked and were somewhat hard. She also said the twice baked potato filling was very good, but the skin of the potato was very hard and overcooked.

I had the butter garlic strip steak medium well with the broccoli, potato wedges and the stuffed potato.

The steak was served already sliced, and although not a huge problem, not something that I prefer. It was slightly over cooked. To me, medium well it's slightly pink in the center (serving temp around 160*) but it was cooked well done. Also, the menu says roasted garlic and herb butter. I didn't sense any butter on it and it came with quartered garlic on top. The wedges were very tasty and seasoned nicely as was the stuffed potato.

For dessert we had the funnel cake fried Oreo's which was delicious!

The presentation of all the food was exceptional. The cleanliness of the restaurant was superb. There wasn't a time when we didn't see someone cleaning.

Lastly, the food was not very expensive for the portions.

Service - 10
Cleanliness - 10
Speed - 9
Quality - 8
Value - 10

Overall dining experience - 9.4
title: Copperhead Grille

text: 5 stars for overall experience throughout the years. Tonight was a little delayed with the server getting to the table, but the crab dip was delicious and the steaks were cooled to perfection
title: Copperhead Grille

text: Wonderful food. Really nailed it. Everything is delicious. Try their Venom sauce on your wings. You won't be disappointed

text: Fun place to go for happy hour and dinner. It can get loud on friday nights because of the live music band. Fortunately, the servers and food quality are pretty good and worth the wait. It is a pretty popular local restaurant and bar.

text: Copperhead is a pretty solid place most of the time. I really like their salads.  Folks love their wings (I really dislike their wings). Beer list is respectable and always rotating. text: I am giving it 4 stars just because personally the hamburger was very  greased. I also know that for most customers that grease is their taste or is the one that gives the final touch to the hamburgers but honestly, I do not like to eat a hamburger where the bread is greasy... that is terrible and not healthy, one must take care of the cholesterolðŸ˜‰ although I could not eat it, it tasted good and the potatoes are excellent, which in the end is the important thing.  The entrance was phenomenal !!!  and excellent customer service and atmosphere. text: EXCELLENT FOOD AND SERVICE! The staff here are so humble and personable. Celebrated my sister's birthday here and was not disappointed. They honored every request I had and the food was so good. Thanks Copperhead! I highly recommend to anyone thinking about going.

text: Good zoo. I really enjoyed how it's set up. We went during a cold day so there was some things we didn't get to see but it was nice having the dinosaur's out around the zoo. Good variety of animals. Also my kids got to ride on a camel which was pretty fun for them. A bit pricey but they enjoyed it so I'm a happy parent.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I really enjoyed visiting this zoo. There are so many uniquely different animals. The  animal exhibits were well taken care. The animals were very active. There were many different activities for children.  Patrons could feed various animals for a fee.  The parking lot is smaller and finding a parking spot can be difficult.  Overall, I would highly suggest taking your family.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I really enjoyed my time at this zoo.  I would say itâ€™s a medium size zoo with lots of engaging exhibits.  I saw so many animals out.  I loved all the fish in water exhibits, which was throughout the zoo.  Pretty impressive bird collection.  So many kid friendly areas and lots of restrooms peppered throughout.  Iâ€™ve been to lots of zoos throughout the US and this has to be in my top 3!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Came on this vacation to check out local animal sanctuaries and get a few experiences in with wild animals. The San Antonio Zoo shows a lot of love with its exhibit design. The terrariums are well-designed and the animals seem pretty content where they are. The animals have places where they can hide if they're stressed, which may irritate some zoo-goers, but I'm glad that the Zoo gave them that. Some of the birds are also just hanging around freely within the park! The cool zones were all really neat, and a nice way to get out of the heat.

I went through the entire zoo twice in about 3 or 4 hours, which I feel is a nice size for a zoo. If I didn't see an animal in the first walk through, I saw them in the second. I also fed the birds! It was an absolute joy!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Zoo Lights is a great Christmas event for children. I took my grandson and he loved it. The weather was so nice 72 degrees and almost all animals were out for viewing. We rode the train and then later walked the Park to view all of the lights. They even had snow machines. Bring your wallet as everything is a bit pricey.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great local zoo.  Not huge in size, but lots of personality and they work the exhibits into the landscape.  Animals are well taken care of.  Pro tip, come right when the zoo opens - got here at open and had over an hour with almost no one else in the park!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
I really like this zoo. I enjoyed it so much that I bought an annual pass for my family. There are a lot of different animals to see and appreciate. Fun areas for the kids and lots of "cool zone" areas to cool off in the Texas heat.

I wish that the membership plan was a bit more all inclusive. The lowest tier membership that I have doesn't allow you to ride rides or feed some of the animals without paying an additional fee.

Other than that, though, it's a fun place to spend an hour or two on a weekend.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
The San Antonio zoo has come so far in the ten years I've been here! I especially appreciate the upgrades to the rhino exhibit. Most of the exhibits are middle of the road as far as quality and some are better than others.

The staff is very friendly and will chat with the kids if they have questions. The prices are good and there are a lot of experiences here you can pay just a little extra for that are worth doing, in my opinion.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
I love the zoo. However this year's zoo lights was very disappointing. Not many kiosks were open.  Lights were okay. Worse, Cocoa was $12 each and Santa pictures were $36 or $42...  previous years you could take your own picture with Santa and the experience was much more fun with Santa and his elves.  Providing more engagement and even jokes. I felt more like a customer at Walmart than a visitor of a venue.

I will say the 4d polar Express experience was fun and worth the $6 price! As was the $18 fresh popped large bag ( filled to the brim ) of warm kettle corn! Warm and  delicious on a cold night.

Not sure we'll come back next year, though.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Hands down a one of a kind zoo! I was trying to make it early in order to beat the heat but it was still scorching down on us but itâ€™s understandable itâ€™s late August.
There is SO much to see and there are some animals that you wonâ€™t see very often - at least not in Dallas or Houston Zoos- they have hippos, a hyena, the cutest bush dogs, and stunning crowned cranes.
There is room for improvement for sure- some exhibits have overgrown weeds and the restrooms could use some TLC but all in all I would definitely recommend families to come check this out!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We've been season pass holders for many years, and I just want to say that I appreciate that the zoo tries really hard to have engaging events each month. There are some sections with minimal shade,  so in Texas,  that means it can get REALLY HOT. I wish there were misting fans or little shaded canopies, especially in places where there are tables... but the employees are helpful, the newly refurbished kids area (as of 3/25 it still has some construction in that area) is fun. I just wish there were more seating places for parents. My daughter is going on 8, and has been going since she was just a baby... overall,  it's a great place for families, especially seeing and knowing our zoo is one of the leading zoos for endangered birds. Just bring lots of water, hats, parasols, and go early or late- just avoid the heat of the day.  (Pics taken from recent butterfly and pollinators event 3/25/23)
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: A really beautiful Zoo! They have taken advantage of San Antonio's rocky terrain to create some very well landscaped animal enclosures for all of the animals as well as having trees, flowers, cactuses, and ponds laid out throughout the zoo. It was kind of a cold and rainy day the day we went and a lot of the animals were not having any part of it electing to sleep out of the weather in their enclosures, but we still enjoyed it very much! They have a nice reptile house with lots of snakes, lizards, and turtles. They also have a sea life house that has both fresh water and salt water fish and turtles! There are plenty of refreshment stands spaced out around the grounds as well as restrooms and hand wash stations. There are areas under construction and we went in through the Blue entrance, I believe the regular entrance might be the orange entrance, but it was closed. They also have a train station that has a scaled down train to take you on a nice ride around the zoo and Breckenridge Park!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We were lucky to witness a lot of the animals enjoying their lunch on Valentine's day! Many had stuffed animals in their areas (cute..  but the monkeys looked confused). lol

The day and the weather were perfect! Some areas were closed off in preparation for their Valentine's dinner event, totally understandable. Truly makes us feel like we need to go back soon to see everything we missed!

We noticed a lot of areas that seemed upgraded. But don't worry, they still have the create-your-own wax Zoo animal figurine!

P.S. They have kiosks on-site for ticket purchases. I was able to get my Veteran discount!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My family had the best day ever. Even with quite a bit of people the day went well. The only exhibit that was full was the hippos. We got to see all the animals they were all out. It was just like when my kids were little. My kids are older but it was still a great place to spend the day with the family and still enjoy it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great place for kids and adults. They have plenty of extra features you wouldn't find in most zoo's. You get to feed birds that land on you as they eat. You can pet kangaroo's and even feed a giraffe. They do offer military discounts. Would highly recommend to anyone.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I Love the Zoo and the Staff are Very Friendly. Animals enclosures are kinda small but they working hard to renovate and expand many of the habitats and you can tell that the Staff cares for the animals. Prices on things are a little high but it is for a good cause so no complaints as it does cost a lot to care for animals. I am excited for the new gorilla exhibit.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It is a very good place to take your kids and have a good time. The zoo is not that big but it does have many animals. I would only suggest for them to be more careful about the maintenance of the place. But overall I really liked it and we had a good time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Good exhibits, animals are easy to see, kid friendly (as exhibits are all close together so you are constantly engaged in looking at things). Went on a hot weekend and it was busy but not as bad as I expected. Free carousel rides with membership. Free parking. Enough air conditioned areas spread throughout the park that we had enough chances to cool down! (Check out where the hippos are, the beastro restaurant has lots of extra seats inside, and the aquarium.) There was much more action (the kids zone had music and dancers) and shops and food open now in July than when we visited in February.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Loved our visit! (3) 11-12yr old girls in tow, and they enjoyed seeing and learning about the animals here. Good variety of birds, fish, & reptiles, too. We'll definitely make the 1.5+ hour trip back to San Antonio when we want to get out of Austin,  but not so far. Nice set up for littles too.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We went for a school field trip. All of the children had so much fun. We only had 3 hours, so we didn't get to go through everything slowly. If you take your time and really look, play, feed animals, shop, and interact, you could easily spend 4 to 5 hours or more here. It is luckily very spaced out, so dress comfortable. We've been coming to the SA Zoo for years and will continue to go.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a great time! We went on a beautiful day, at around noon, so it was incredibly crowded and the parking was busy, even in January. The entry line was very long, but the zoo was worth it! There were some great exhibits, and we enjoyed the train, as well!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fun to see all the animals! Definitely wish we would have gone in a cooler month but as long as you go early the heat isn't too bad. You can take pics with some of the animals as well. Didn't try the food but it and drinks seemed pricey just as any amusement is. Overall, fun!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Animals were kind of shy I guess. Some we weren't able to see at all. There is a digital map but its not very good.  Enjoyed the lory landing, feeding the birds was great.  They landed right on you. The train needed to announce that you can get off at the stops.  Loved feeding the giraffe.   Only one restaurant was open, so not a lot of choices but food was good but pricey. Drinks are crazy expensive, $5 for a 16 oz water or soda.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Such a clean place! The employees have great hospitality with the customers. The food/drinks were way over priced. Some of the popular animals weren't out for some odd reason. The ticket prices are decent. Overall. I rate the zoo experience 8.5 out of 10.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Our kids enjoyed themselves so much. So many animals to see. The weather was perfect. We went on the weekend and there was no wait to go in. Fun music everywhere!  We enjoyed riding the carousel!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had such a great day today at the zoo. The animals were mostly visible. It is a pretty big zoo with lots to see. The food is expensive as you would expect but I have to say it was well worth the cost. It was delicious!! We will definitely be going back.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very good Zoo to keep kids amused... The Zoo opens at 12pm to 9pm. The holiday lights are really cool after dark time. The kiddie park is right next to main Zoo which has many kids rides, it's a lot fun for kids. The 15 min train ride is fun as well. The train is running for every 20 mins. The parking is away from main Zoo entrance which is mis leading. Plan for a whole day since the Zoo is big and needs lot of walking. Please bring your kids stroller so you don't end up carry your kids.. there is much restaurants inside, not sure if put side food is allowed or not. Every food store has a long line, so anticipate that. I recommend to buy tickets online since the entrance was very busy, also online has good deals which I loved it. Go for a fun filled day activity with your kids, you won't be disappointed.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Family loved the zoo experience here! Arrived at opening and easily used our scanner online tickets. Amazing enclosures with up close looks at some of the animals! Great "cool zones" for these 100Â°+ days. Easy to step inside for a cool off and all restrooms were clean. The "beastro" is way over priced even for a place like this. The snack stations are a bit high too but when it was 105Â° today we gladly paid $5.99 for a small Powerade! The 4D movie is a great deal! $24 for 4 and was worth every penny! Stop in for a great show and a good way to beat the heat!  Bring quarts of you want to feed the fish or similar animals since there are pellet vending machines near the water ways. Most of the little vending machines take cards which was convenient for us. The staff were so friendly and didn't hesitate to answer questions!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great zoo to visit! Large variety of animals, birds, and fish to see. Lots of places to sit and or eat if you get tired. Lots of restrooms as well. Wear comfortable shoes as the zoo is large. If your toddler gets tired and they will, you can rent strollers if you don't have your own. Giant carousel!  Lots of souvenir shops. Courteous and helpful staff. Open Sundays too!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo train does NOT take you through the zoo so be aware of that prior to ticket purchase. Also the train seating is very cramped. Otherwise a fun place. The zoo parking garage is a significant walk from the entrance. Highly recommend parking across the street in the train depot area. There is a Starbucks and bathrooms in the depot area. They have scooters available for rental but get there early!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I love the zoo and hadn't been in quite a while. Tonight we enjoyed Zoo Lights. Most of the animal exhibits were closed but the park is beautifully lit and we're planning a daytime visit so we can see the new enclosures and animals.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great zoo. Lot of variety of animals and saw at least 80 percent (not hiding). Hippo exhibit is awesome. Took us about 4 hours to walk and stop and see everything. Alot of fun. Kudos to the zoo. Very clean.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo is great, employees are friendly and helpful. The property is very clean and the food at the bistro was great! Looking forward to when they bring back elephants and butterflies!! Reptile building was fascinating. Loved seeing the Bald Eagles too!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fantastic zoo! I think they have every animal here. It was so many from all over the world, some I never heard of. There are also interactive experiences such as feeding the giraffes and petting kangaroos. You will have to pay for these things, which turned me off a bit since I think the zoo makes money from so many other things. There is also a kiddie amusement park right next to the zoos if parents want to find other ways to amuse their kids. I highly suggest you buy a Groupon or find some other site that would allow you to get a discount. I didnâ€™t and paid the full price of $31.00 and I wasnâ€™t pleased. With that said I still would recommend going here if you are in San Antonio.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very good zoo.  I wouldn't put in the same class as the San Diego Zoo, but,  well worth the visit!   The Rhino and Giraffe are the highlights.  They have a wonderful variety of birds and reptiles.   All the staff were outstanding ðŸ‘ and friendly.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: First time in this zoo and it is awesome!! We had a blast. Animals are healthy and look well,people were nice and friendly. The price per entrance is also good and fair. Highly recommend the zoo for the whole family. Be prepared to walk alot though, stay hydrated peeps.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I had went to the SA Zoo last month for my youngest sons 1st Birthday. He had such a blast! We got to see all sorts of animals we've never seen before. He even powered through being tired to see it to the end. Definitely worth going with kids. Or even yourself ðŸ˜‰
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a great day here! I was really impressed with all the enrichment the animals were provided that kept them active and in view of visitors. My kids were more than happy all day and loved everything.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
This zoo was awesome!
1st great experience, there's a Starbucks on the corner of the parking lot! All the animals were awesome! The only part I didn't understand was the multiple flamingo exhibits throughout the park. Otherwise, everything was perfect!
Definitely got Starbucks walking back to the car!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Honestly the best zoo I have ever visited. The enclosures are designed to make for easy viewing of the animals and many are very close. Be sure to do the encounters. They are absolutely worth it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo was awesome today!! Only because we went 2 weeks ago with the whole family (9 total) to see the zoo lights and missed out on all the attractions. We went at 4:25 to feed the girraffes and they ran out of food. So I took my sister back today, she's visiting for her birthday and went straight to the giraffes. She had so much fun feeding them!  ($5.00 for lettuce)  Feeding is between (2-4:30) then we stopped to feed the birds ($3.00 only til 4:30) So much laughs with the birds on our heads and arms. Then straight to ride the camel. Its on my sisters bucket list. She rode Coco so sweet ($10.00 rides until closing) We also found out once a month residents are only $8.00 so that's great to know in the future! We had a blast . We also ate at the Bistro restaurant, hot dog and fries($8.00) it was way better than the food booth and I think the same price.  Tickets to feed the giraffes, ride the camel and feed the birds are all purchased at the site not when you purchase the main ticket to the zoo. Have fun! AlohaðŸŒº
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: An absolutely incredible place! Drove 17 hours straight from Florida just to be able to meet Uma and Timothy the hippos! We were lucky enough to secure a spot to feed them, and it was hands down one of the best experiences ever!!! The staff are friendly and accommodating, the animals are adorable, fun and obviously well cared for. Should you spend the money to go here? ABSOLUTELY!!!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We decided to go before the rain hit and we had so much fun. Many of the animals were much more active with the inclement weather and cooler temps, so that was a nice bonus. Always a great time at the zoo, even when we have to mad dash out in the pouring rain!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Itâ€™s our fault for going during spring break so it was extremely crowded but even if it wasnâ€™t crowded itâ€™s not a very accessible zoo if you bring a stroller or wagon or if you have a wheel chair. It was hard to navigate through especially not knowing some areas are basically only one way. The biggest problem I had was the ticket prices being extremely different than on the website, 21.95 for adult vs 35$ at the zoo and 17$ for kids vs 25$ at zoo, maybe I missed something on the website about the prices being different but that is so much different I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s right at all.  We were extremely disappointed that we spent $120 to have trouble navigating and even seeing the animals and most animals are in very small enclosures. There are more snack stands and lounging areas than there is space to actually see animals and they are kept up nicer than the animalâ€™s enclosures, seems more like a money making set up than a place to be educated on the amazing animals of the world.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo was way bigger than when I last visited. There were so many different species ranging from small to large. Staff are all friendly and it wasnt too crowded. The food they had to offer was all great but a tab expensive, everything was fun and got to see animals I didnt know existed! Great experience all around.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It's a good bit of walking so wear comfortable shoes haha. This place is awesome, worth the money. Probably the best zoo I've ever been to. Great place for kids, plan to spend most of the day here. Their is a lot to see.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I do not recommend going in the summer, especially on a weekend. The animals are well looked after,  seem as happy as a zoo animal can possibly be, but they're mostly hidden in the scorching Texas summer heat. Tickets for 2 adults  cost us over $62 (kids under 3 go for free), which seems very overpriced. Extremely overcrowded.  They do have a great selection of species,  zoo is very clean and we will come back in the winter.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Fantastic small zoo, well thought out and made to seem big.
Did the Hippo experience and loved it... Up close feeding and explanations, but too bad couldn't touch one.
Prices at the cafe are not too bad for a zoo and the BLT grilled cheese was really good.
Beautiful park area outside zoo and easy access.
We will come back.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The Zoo is located inside Breckenridge park. It is a great size to explore. It has Komodo dragons, the big cats, a hippo enclosure, a feed the giraffe experience that is an extra fee. Buying tickets in advance makes entry quicker. There are free and reduced entry days that are periodic. We find our season passes well worth having as we drop by whenever we want to get out and enjoy the animals. They are very handicapped friendly and accessible and my daughter with mobility issues navigates the zoo easily. The only help she needs is the stairs into and out of the reptile house. Otherwise it is a great adventure.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Our family loves the San Antonio. The staff is always nice and friendly and zoo always has very nice events (Zoo Boo and Zoo Lights). The animals always look very well taken care of and in good spirits. We have been season ticket holders for many years now and we will continue to support our San Antonio Zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
If you love birds check out the Hixon Bird house, they have the biggest collection of birds Iâ€™ve ever seen before! Theyâ€™re beautiful!!
Two other animals you donâ€™t always get to see were the Rhinos and kangaroos. Loved it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We bought a membership online earlier this year and received our digital tickets by email. When we arrived, the people at the entrance had trouble scanning our digital tickets, but eventually found our info and let us in. Sections of the park are beautifully decorated with different themes. We even got to see the rhinos, zebra, ostriches and flamingos out and about around 8pm. We stuck around for the light show. I hope you like Christmas meets dub step!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Itâ€™s improving so much! I really liked going today, more color, more visual, more activities and so many updates and renovations. Donâ€™t have many photos because I was really enjoying it. I love the work theyâ€™re doing; got a membership, $48 for the whole year-not bad at all!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Zoo is clearly dated with old, cage style enclosures in most places. Lots of bird exhibits with the flamingos being especially good. Some feeding experiences available for an additional fee. Great for families and kids.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We absolutely love this zoo! Itâ€™s beautiful and relaxing. There are many places to sit, relax and enjoy the wildlife. Highlights are the many species of birds ( the flamingos were our favorite so beautiful and vibrant) and the Pantera Walk where the Jaguar can walk a bridge over the crosswalk. My only complaint would be the restrooms were not so hotâ€¦ they could have better cared for the day we went. Here are some random wildlife pics.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
They have 2 hippos, what else does one need to see?â€¦.
On a real note, this place was great. Itâ€™s not a large zoo (donâ€™t even try to compare to San Diego zoo) but it had so much to offer. Hippos, elephants, rhino, lions, reptiles, snakes, birds, and lots more. We bought the fun day passes which included day passes to the park, train tickets, feeding a lory tickets, and the carousel tickets. The train is a miniature version the takes a stroll through the nearby nature park. Feeding the lorys is pretty cool, they give you a cup with nectar and the birds land on your arms, shoulders, head, pretty much everywhere. Then once the nectar runs out they start licking you. The carousel is a carousel with animals you ride, itâ€™s is made for kids but that didnâ€™t stop me.

Overall this park was small enough to see just about everything in about 1/2 of a day. It does have inclines and declines but a nice easy hike around the park. The drinks and food is expensive so I would save up if you plan on eating in the park, but I imagine most of that cost goes back into operating the park.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Loved it, perfect family trip with kids. Plenty of tables throughout so you can stop for a picnic by your favorite animal exhibit. We saved big with a pogo pass through groupon, paid a fraction of regular admission price
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We absolutely loved this zoo! We just moved to San Antonio and finally got to take the kids and we had so much fun!! Itâ€™s not too expensive and both my 7 year old and my almost 3 year old had a blast!

Animals look great! And everyone working at the zoo was really nice and helpful â¤ï¸

I hope they get more elephants, the elephant did seem a little lonely, also heard they are making room for gorilas ðŸ¦
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
A trip to the SA Zoo is a special Christmas trip.  To see some of the animals with all the Christmas lights around has become a yearly trip for me  if you are slow to get into the Christmas spirit then a trip to ZOO LIGHTS will get you there very quick.
The Zoo staff does a wonderful job of creating a magical time for everyone.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My husband and I had such a great time. I have all kind of interactive exhibits such as feeding the giraffes. There really is a little something for everybody. You can tell the animals are well taken care of and all the staff was super polite and helpful.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo was clean and tastefully decorated. The area was easy to navigate. A decent variety of animals. We enjoyed being able to feed the giraffes. Will make it a point to come back soon to see the new renovations.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: One of the best zoos Iâ€™ve visited (compared to the Houston, Seattle, and Denver zoos). They make a great use of the space. The reptile house is phenomenal and sold my husband and I on the place. The fish ponds are beautiful and we circled back several times to watch the carp. The only thing missing is a bug house!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Visited with our homeschool group, and really enjoyed the presentation.  The zoo itself is very nice.  Well laid out and lots to see.

Always disappointed by all of the "extras" that aren't included in the price of admission.  We did, however, pay to ride the carousel and the employee running it was funny and kind.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Awesome place to go with the family. So many animals to see and opportunities to come close to them. you do have to pay extra for the meet an greets but they a reasonably priced and something that you will remember forever. You can ride the train right outside of the park and feed birds and ride the carousel for just a bit more. Well worth it if you have a child under 3 because they are free and get to experience it all.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a great time! I really enjoyed taking my daughter as a rite of passage to a place my parents took me as a child. I've seen the ups and downs over the years here and I can tell you they have really cleaned up and done a lot of upgrades. There is so much to do and see that it can't all be done in one visit. I also love the area this is in next to Brackenridge Park. The scenery is beautiful.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Big awesome and fun. We couldn't see all the animals as some were inside. But it was still an awesome experience. TIP, you can take your own water bottles.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Was nice to visit. Definitely a little frustrating with all the construction and whith which lines were digital tickets or if you needed to buy them. Zoo has definitely changed a bit and was neat to see all the changes. Seems like it's also getting a new entrance.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My wife and I drove up from Houston and really enjoyed the San Antonio zoo. No wait time, ample parking, very clean and the layout was great. Will definitely recommend you visit if you have not already.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Wow! This is a beautifully laid out zoo with thoughtful nooks and crannies to explore throughout. The landscape is meticulously groomed and worth the admission alone as a botanical garden. This is not a place you want to rush, but take your time and savor each exhibit marveling at the design and attention to detail. My 3 and 12-year-old loved it.

Our family loved the fact that the zoo really caters to young kids. All the exhibits seemed to keep the youngsters in mind while providing special covered play areas to chill, play in a stream, and eat lunch. This is what we did since our lunch was included in the price.

Our ravenous family of four was able to get admission tickets, lunch (very good chicken strips), drinks, and a refill souvenir cup for 100 bucks. Add another 50 bucks for miscellaneous stuff for the kids and you have a great experience.  I highly recommend if you are considering a trip to San Antonio to put this spot on your must-see list.  What a fantastic zoo and value for the price.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Hot! Learned that many animals kind of hide in the heat. But still, its a zoo. Cant go wrong for a family day. There is a spot where you can feed the giraffes, pretty cool. And if you are into birds, this zoo has you covered, inside and outside.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We finally ended up getting the zoo membership because we love the SA zoo! The staff is amazing and love sharing information on the animals and the zoo is kept clean and well maintained. Africa was closed the last time we went, but it just gives us another reason to visit again!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I gave this 2 stars only because it seems like it's a great zoo, and one day hope to update this. I took my toddler and nieces and nephew here for the Zoo Lights and was highly disappointed. I visited from out of town and the advertising for Zoo Lights seems like it's spectacular and something worthy of seeing.ðŸ˜‘ It is not... Do not come here for the Zoo Lights and waste your money. I am really upset with how much the Zoo charges for this. Tickets after 5p should be deeply discounted as you do not see any animals just trees here and there wrapped in lights. The "light show" is 1. ONE. 32 foot tree that was synchronized to music for about 3-5 minutes? I would only come during the day to see the animals itself. Otherwise go to Lightscape down the street or something.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Awesome zoo! Maybe Iâ€™m just an easy to please person, but I have nothing but good things to say about this place. It was clean, plenty of places to sit, trash cans were plentiful. Animals were mostly visible, maybe a few we couldnâ€™t spot but more than enough to have the kids jumping for joy. We did lorys landing which was cool, pet the kangaroos, and rode the train. I set aside almost 4 hrs and we are quick movers, didnâ€™t make it to the kiddie park or the regular farm animal area so if you really want to get the most out of it 6hrs is a reasonable expectation. Great zoo and looking forward to our next visit.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I absolutely love animals and if you havenâ€™t been to the San Antonio Zoo lately, in particular, you definitely need to take a trip as they have done a ton of renovations in the last 3-4 years. Now the have a bird house exhibit, Bald Eagles, a Bat ðŸ¦‡ exhibit, and even the legendary Chupacabra exhibit to make things fun! This time of year holiday lights are up to prepare for Zoo lights at night. They also have a Tiny Tot Nature Spot and theyâ€™ve also moved the Kiddy Park immediately next door to the entrance of the Zoo so that you canâ€™t miss it. Such a fun experience!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This is a great zoo for the family. It's best to go early when they first open during a week day to avoid any crowds. Bring plenty of water to drink as some drink items are pricey in the stores there.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Nice place to get away while your down town. Not very far from the riverwalk. Kid's had a blast coming here. Very hot outside right now. They do have area's to cool down. A must when I visit this great city.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
This is the best zoo in the state of Texas, so much to see, kids activities, nice shady spots.
Animals are in good spirits, we got to feed Giraffes! Was a perfect day, Have been to Austin's Zoo and Dallas Zoo. The San Antonio zoo is way better! (Dallas is a close second). Try and get there early as well!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Really Nice Zoo with beautiful and healthy animals! I only wish there were more information sessions or shows during this particular season. However, I'm sure that improves in the summer. I enjoyed being able to interact with birds and kangaroos!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo has very crowded parking. The key is to get there early and park in the parking garage. This zoo has a ton of birds to look at. The rhinos were awesome and the Kangaroo exhibit were amazing.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We took our baby daughter out for the first time, and she loved it! The zoo does have construction going on, so it is not all open.  The worst part was the price, it has gone up a lot!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I spent a Thursday afternoon exploring the many exhibits of the San Antonio Zoo. What really sets SAZ apart from other zoos is the use of the various vertical height of exhibits which allows the visitor unique perspectives into exhibits that would be impossible in other zoos. I had a great 4 hours in the park! I did pay the $3 for the lorikeet feeding and loved it!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo was a nice size. Some of the animals were either sleep or they weren't in their enclosures.  It was a little crowded, but it is Spring Break, so I don't know if it's like this all the time.

text: It was an elementary school field trip and I was a chaperon of a group of kids. We were able to have a great time following the map to all the various animals. It is worth the visit when you have little ones who love to learn and explore.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very clean Zoo with many things to see and do! Love how the animals have plenty of space and aren't cramped like some other Zoos. They always have some sort of festival or activity for the family all year round!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I can't believe for as many times as I have been to the zoo I have never left a review! The zoo is great my kids love it no matter how many times we come. They are constantly doing improvements and adding new animals I learned the night before this most recent visit that they will be adding Gorrillas and a safari! I can't wait for that exhibit. We always bring our family to the zoo boo and zoo lights, which are fantastic! We finally got to ride the train this on this most recent visit which my son loved! The staff is always extremely friendly, approachable, and informative! We will continue to bring our family to the San Antonio Zoo for years to come! Its tradition!

text: The San Antonio Zoo is a family affair for certain. The first zoo I ever went as a child was here. I brought my kids here when they were little and now their little ones have visited. Overall, the zoo is in many ways the same as it always been. Tucked just outside of the downtown area adjacent to Breckenridge Park the zoo is a nice little visit and worth going to. The price of the zoo admission does not include all exhibits, so be prepared in the event that you think otherwise. To me, this is the only reason I wouldnâ€™t give it 5 stars. I certainly donâ€™t recall this being the case years ago, but perhaps this is to help keep the cost of the base admission to a more reasonable cost. Even with this in mind, donâ€™t hesitate to go. You will have a good time and build memories for certain.

text: Was there for 5 hours. It was great seeing all the animals. 2 hippos were splashing around in the water and they drew a large crowd to watch them. The merry go round was fun. They have a snow globe you can go in and have your Pic taken. My grandson got to ride on a camel and feed a giraffe.

text: I've been to zoos all over the country: San Diego, L.A. and Washington D.C. this may be my favorite of all of them. Tons of animals and all very close together. Great exhibits. My favorites were the komodo dragons and jaguar.

text: My family visited here in Nov 2021. Veterans receive a free admission and up to 4 family members receive 50%. We saw alot of new encounters that I've never seen before. They had the park displayed with Christmas lights and smores stations. Great family time and educational for my 5 yr old. Definitely visit again soon.

text: Nice area for the zoo. Well geared to children.  Entrance price is high, and extra price for special rides or experiences.  Several animals not in designated pens and  no notice why. title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
It has been a few years since qe have been to San Antonio zoo...specifically zoo lights. We oved it! Some differences I noticed was kiddie park moved to right by the zoo and the train made no other stops other than the main station. It didn't seem to be a big deal to buy tix in advance. There should be aine for people who have their hand stamped for re entry. A few times we were stuck behind very large groups of people waiting to check in for the day. We had a digital code that was scanned from my phone for initial entry. Purchsed online beforehand. People who paid at the kiosk had a digital code as well. Members seemed to ha r thw most trouble entering. I have no idea why.
Another thing that kind of stunk was my inlaws needed to rent scooters which was right before the scanned entry....after my barcode wad scanned, we were given our fun pass cards to ride the train, feed the Lorries and ride the carosel...sooooo we had to loop around the first part of the zoo...get out hands stamped...ask if they scooter people could watch our scooters while we exited to go ride the train...if you need a rent a scooter  a stroller just save yourself the trouble and ride the train first if you were there for zoo lights. The train stopped running at 5 pm..probably everyday however the nighttime experience made it tricky.
We loved the carosel!! The light ahow amd musoc wasn't as awesome as two years ago. The music was quieter unless you were right near the speakers. The camel ride was so short. 2 years ago we paid like 25 and the kids got to around a huge area like 3 times. So 10 bucks and shorter ride time makes up for it I guess. We probably won't do that again however we will go again. Zoolights is my fave!
The kangaroo petting experience was the best addition ever!!! It was not an option 2 years ago so maybe it began last year. I will do that every time! Loved the new giraffe and rhino areas! And Pantera's walk was spectacular. There seemed to be a lot more Christmasy things for kids this year!
So reminder this review is mostly about zoolights. Come well before dark to get better parking.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The marketing department took over common sense!  We went to the zoo at night.  I would like to have seen ANIMALS at the zoo, but since it was night, there was only a snake and komodo dragon  visible.  I will return to the zoo in the future, but during the day.  Kind of a wasted trip.

text: We love coming here. We got to try our first butter beer at the dragon forest. Though the forest itself wasnâ€™t worth the extra $$. text: We LOVE going to zoos and had a great time at the San Antonio zoo today! My teenage daughter is a huge bird enthusiast and this zoo did not disappoint. There is even a bird feeding area where you can feed nectar to small parrots @$3/person. The zoo layout is good and there are many specious exhibits for the animals as well as a few new/improved exhibits going up. There is a WONDERFUL kids area with a stage, wading beach, places to play, etc. Lots of air conditioned indoor exhibits help to break up the day nicely. The Beastro has good food too which isn't always the case at zoos. There is also a FABULOUS 100yr old carousel with animals from hummingbirds to elephants to ride. Good job S.A.!

title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Iâ€™ve lived in San Antonio since 2006 and have only visited the zoo once previously with my familyâ€¦ I had fond memories of that trip.

Upon returning from five years being stationed overseas, I was shocked that the admission was now up to $30 per personâ€¦

As others have mentioned, the first impression is that most of the animals are inside their enclosures /  out of sight of the publicâ€¦ starting with the bears at the very front of the zoo. Ditto on most of the public displays. Other large sections of the zoo were under construction. Public areas generally seemed clean and kept up.

Some of the exotic birds in the birdhouse looked stressed and were in much too small of an enclosure, the birds in outdoor enclosures seemed to fare better.

I ended up only staying about an hour due to the heat of the day and the fact it was so crowded (I was wearing my mask but saw few others wearing any).

I donâ€™t mind paying to support the zoo/city but at least try to provide alternate exhibits if none of the advertised animals are present.

The dinosaur exhibit looked like a really neat draw but I saw more dinosaurs than zoo animals todayâ€¦
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:

text: This is a wonderful zoo. The kids really enjoyed hiking to each exhibit and gettin to see all of the animals. title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
By far one of the best zoos I've been too. It's expensive, but it's so big and there's ton of interaction between and during the exhibits. The have a vast variety of animals. Fun kid play area too, tons of birds, feed the giraffes and hippos!

Wish they had a gorilla or two, but they have a ton of other little monkeys.

Also, pictures while feeding the giraffes is a rip off. They print the pictures out and show them to you, tell you it's $45 and if you say no, throw them in the garbage. Waste. Should be like $5 since you're already printing them, spent hundreds (depending on party size) to get into the zoo, and it's just a waste if you don't sell em.

Otherwise, it's a blast.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great zoo! I recommend going early or late. Too hot in the middle of the day and animals aren't doing much. Looked like they'll be adding more by the end of this year (2021).
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I'm used to the Abilrne Zoo and I love them but the San Antonio Zoo is so much bigger and has more to offer and it was just an amazing experience. I also got to live a long dream of mine and interact with the kangaroos. Pet them and sit with them while they ate and fed. It was an amazing and awesome moment for me and I spent it with my two children and I loved it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This review is mainly about the new dragon forest! And oh man what an awesome edition to our local zoo! This place has grown so much and with all the new attractions itâ€™s made it so much more dynamic. Almost all of the dragons moved and I from of each one they had displays saying what part of the world the dragon was from. My only complaint is that sometimes the special events and tickets or info can be hard to get a hold of. The dragon forest is located directly behind the new parking garage but for the life of me I could not find anywhere online where I should park. I ended up parking right by the zoo and to make the hike up hill to the back of the parking lot. My son and I attended the event for â€œdragon alleyâ€ which is supposed to be a play on words for the infamous â€œdiagon alleyâ€ in Harry Potter. Iâ€™m sure the zoo knew all the Harry Potter fans would come out, and we did. They advertised there would be butter beer but they only had one stand. The line was so long! Like over and hour in the heat. We ended up just grabbing iced coffee from Starbucks and taking the train ride around the zoo. It was still fun but if they had more booths open Iâ€™m sure ppl would have bought more.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Awesome zoo. So we got there at 10am on a Monday, there was plenty of good parking. We took about 2hrs with a toddler on a stroller.  I loved that they had several animals that you don't see at Gladys Porter zoo, if you've ever been there. I didn't like that you have to pay to go in the butterfly exhibit. They have snack stands and gifts shops throughout the zoo. This place is pretty stroller friendly to get around. Oh and if you have a membership with another zoo in TX, you might be able to get a discount.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Friendly service. Beautiful animals. Clean areas for the animals. Only problem was that didn't tell us that we needed to download the map of the zoo so we were looking around blind. And there were a lot of hills to walk through.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very nice experience but I didn't like how there was a lot of construction going on. Plus I wanted some kettle corn and snack and the snack bar were closed. Only one snack bar was open all the way to the end.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It is lovely to see animals but the same time seeing them caged wasn't nice
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Itâ€™s a fun ride for kids and it takes you for a 20 minutes ride. Good one for fun.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I went yesterday with my son on his school field trip, we really had a good time. Food, drinks, and souvenirs were a little pricey but the staff was great and ill definitely come back.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I enjoy our day at the zoo. Would highly recommend feeding the flamingos. We did a family package on line that came with lunch that was ok and got a cool cup as well. Felt like the extra cost was a little much. But had a wonderful experience anyway.

text: My first time visiting The San Antonio Zoo. I didn't get to see the black bear and some other animals but overall it was definitely a good experience for me.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: San Antonio Zoo is the best! The girl that did their face paint was awesome..only took like 15 minutes to do all 3 of their faces!! My kids absolutely loved it!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We went for Night out at the Zoo for pride week and let me tell you. Their first pride event was a success. We loved it. Can't wait for next year. Our 2nd time was great. We love the events at the zoo!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Wild kingdom & explorer delight! 1p to 4p are feeding times for up close pics!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Super fun experience for our grandsons. Longer ride than expected. Tour audio needs improvement â€” train audio speakers sounded like a bad Taco Bell experience. Lines for the ride get much longer later in the day.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The cat caverns were definitely a highlight for me, but overall all of the exhibits were very nice, I loved the multiple aviaries they had around the zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Stopped by the zoo while we were on this side of town.  The great thing about season passes is that we can just show up and go for a walk whenever we want.  The zoo is currently doing a dinosaur exhibit.  Some of the dinosaurs are animated which was really neat.

During the week the zoo is usually pretty empty which is always nice.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This place is AWESOME! Go see the butterfly garden, hippos play fighting, or visit the Kangaroo encounter! If you are lucky, you'll see the bears walking around their habitat and take a rest break while watching how the popcorn vendor makes their kettle corn. They have mechanical dinosaurs for the kids and a limited edition Dragon Forest complete with animatronic dragons and live falcon/wild bird shows 3x a day which was definitely a crowd favorite. The Dragon Forest runs through October 2021.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We come to the SA Zoo at least 3 times per year from Houston. We really enjoy the upgrades we have seen since last year. We are particularly fond of the animal interactions. We always visit the kangaroo petting area, the Australian bird enclosure to feed the Lorikeets, and feed the giraffes. The zoo layout is great and has plenty of shade. I actually think this zoo is better than the Houston Zoo. They even had a camel rides last winter during the holidays.

We loved it so much we bought a zoo membership.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: There was this new dragon place that they had, and a dinosaur place. After that, we saw a lot of cool animals, and I even fed a bird. They also had a stage, and a band that was playing some country music. I definitely recommend coming here, Just know that food and stuff can get expensive here, so bring some cash. I had a great time!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Omg I love this zoo more than any other I've been to in the country.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: A great zoo! We went during this past winter and just a few weeks ago and if you can manage go during the winter! As the weather gets warmer and schools let out it gets more and more packed. They have giraffe feedings and mole close up encounters that you can pay extra for. They even have a food truck there for lunch. They have just about every animal and a huge bird community. I would recommend wearing your walking shoes and hitting up the botanical gardens nearby. This is an AZA zoo too so we like going to these zoos that have higher standards for their animal care.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We came late on Thursday afternoon, during Spring break.  The weather was perfect along with the timing of the day that we arrived.  I really love the fact that the San Antonio police are throughout this facility,  if your child gets lost they're in safe hands with the San Antonio Zoo employees, Police and on site security all there helping your child if the situation should arise.

The views of all the animals is great.  The walk all the way around is worth your time.  I haven't been here since I was a kid and it was still enjoyable, the fact that they still have the machines throughout that make the plastic molds of various animals was fun. We of course took two home with us, along with the penny press.  There's a carousel that's fun for the kids,  but not worth the $3.00 per person price for an actual one minute ride ðŸ¤¬. Oh well,  at least my girls enjoyed riding the sea horse and Polar bear, the smiles on their faces made it worth it, I guess.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Visited on a Friday, got there early. No lines no waiting and Not crowed at all. Everyone had a great time. We purchased a package deal which included lunch, it was worth it!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: So fun. A friend and I went for the day we had a blast. Purchased the fun day pass for about $27 which included admission, train ride, carousel ride, and butterfly exhibit. If you want only admission to zoo it is $20. Parking is free. Butterfly exhibit was too small and kinf of empty of butterflies. There were over 500 per the attendant but only saw about 50. She said summertime would be more. Our 40 year old selves had a blast doing all the activities.  So many unique birds, bears, and other animals I haven't seen before. Different animals than Austin, Houston, Fort Worth,  or Dallas Zoos. Took us about 4 hours to do it all, no breaks or lunch. Came out with over 10,000 steps.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fun zoo! They have so many birds. We've only spent 3 hours to see everything. They'll have the jaguar(s) in autumn.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Always a great place to visit. Their conservation efforts are fabulous and we really enjoy the up close animal encounters and knowledgeable staff.

text: I purchased my tickets online the fun pass which is super worth. The fun pass has everything you can possibly do there at the san Antonio zoo. text:
Today was my first time going to the San Antonio Zoo. It was a wonderful day with more than I thought would be there. Tickets, attractions and even the food/drinks were very affordable. The only downside was that they were unable to run at full capability due to Covid. I definitely plan on going back someday.

text: We got there a little later in the day but they had the Whataburger Zoo Lights celebration going. In the beginning of the zoo the majority of thr enclosures are empty until you get to the butterfly/monkey section. As it got darker, they light up the way with Christmas lights and decorations. They have enclosures but you can't see anything in them as they are all dark. I figured if you're going to have people walking around at night, at least light up the areas to see some animals. The tickets were not cheap, so we were bummed that we couldn't see the majority of the animals once the sun went down. Will definitely have to go back during the day one of these days. Overall we had a great time and the light shows they had were cool for the kids.

text:
Came here with my Girlfriend on a weekday, was not busy at all!

Overall though there was plenty to see and do! Spent a good hour or 2 there and had a great time! It was nice to see the elephants and giraffes up close, reminded me of LA :)

Definitely a great place to just walk around and have a nice time, saw plenty of familes there as well! A lot of the food places are closed but some are scattered around here and there.

Give it a try! Won't be disappointed!

text:
Fun drive through zoo!

title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
In the past the Zoo was not the best (see my review from years past) the San Antonio Zoo has put a great effort into making the zoo the best that it can be and is doing a great job in the past few years. I highly recommend this zoo at this time.

I visited many zoos in my past. I grew up in N. E. Ohio and went to the Cleveland Zoo many times every year from birth till 18yrs and then I visited every couple of years, I've visited the Pittsburgh Zoo multiple times in my life, I've visited the Asheboro NC Zoo multiple times, I've visited the Virginia zoo, I've visited the Washington D. C. zoo, I've visited Disney Animal Kingdom and I've been to many super small side of the road places that call themselves zoos or Aligator /Reptile farms. I've seen a lot and have much to compare. The San Antonio Zoo needs some help. The animal habitats for many of the larger animals are not large enough and many of the outdoor habitats are somewhat overgrown and look like the animal couldn't be living in there but they are. The small animals are living pretty well and the zoo is clean and you can tell that it's a fight for the zoo staff to stay up on the upkeep. It's time to update or down size and give a few animals the space and care they deserve. Look to the Virginia Zoo. The Virginia Zoo is about this size but has put a lot of effort into the beauty of the park and great habitats for the small amount of animals that they have. Please do better San Antonio Zoo
title: San Antonio Zoo
