text: This was an awesome place lots of stuff for the kids to do events other than the  Animals I took my granddaughter she just love the whole thing she is 5 could not get enough of it
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My daughter has always loved the zoo! And my son is finally old enough to enjoy it too! Just realized there is a tiny tot area that has a little river for children to swim and play in the sand! As always the zoo doesn't disappoint, but like usual, the concession stands are a bit pricey. Even with a membership and getting 10% off. But overall love the animals and newly found tiny tot area!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Really enjoyed this zoo, was able to see all the animals we wanted, it was a great day, and looking forward to coming back again soon to support animal conservation!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: One of our favorite places to spend the day. Membership only covers getting in the gate, everything fun to do there for the kids is extra. Still, the membership is worth it after just a couple visits. Itâ€™s easy to walk the entire zoo in a few hours even with littles in tow and see everything they have to offer. If youâ€™re a bird watcher this is definitely the zoo for you.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Weather was nice so you saw more animals and the park was not over crowded. The restrooms could use some attention. Some of the exhibits looked run down so might be time for the zoo to invest some of the funds to renovations. Overall educational experience.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We always enjoy coming here! Great adventures for you family!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Went to go see the lights at the zoo.
Kids had a good time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Affordable and full of entertainment for the family. One of the better zoos in the state and the nation, no joke. The facility is airways working to stay modern, fun and educational which is no easy feat. The combo tickets for carousel ride and two feedings are well worth the price editorial if you have children or are looking to surprise your date. If you haven't been here you're really missing out!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Need to plan on spending the whole day. The zoo is surprisingly large and sprawling. The ticketing system is very slow and confusing (you scan your tickets after walking a little bit from the ticket purchase area). Prices were reasonable compared to other zoos we've visited and you get a lot more variety and diversity at this zoo than others. The dinosaur displays are a lot of of fun! Suggest doing a good "map recon" before venturing out because there is a lot to see and if you have little kids or older adults they will get worn out. So see what you want to see by checking the map first. Feed the Giraffes! It's a blast! I've gone to a lot of zoos and there were creatures here I had never heard of or seen before. Definite "must see" while in San Antonio.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Disclaimer: Don't expect to driver here when it is busy. It is near impossible. We ended up having to park several miles away to get there.

We had so much fun here, but it was a bit stressful with how crowded it was. I would recommend coming when it wasn't busy.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Great fun for the family. Went during the afternoon and waited for the Zoo Lights Christmas display. It was good, but a little crowded which can be tense during this pandemic. Masks are required in any indoor setting, but when outside they are not required.

The Zoo has spent some time clearing out sight lines and making it better for the children which is important to me with a child with serious vision impairment.

The downside was buying a food package in combination with our tickets for hotdogs or burgers and they ran out of burgers when we got to the restaurant and the zoo was still open another 2 hours.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great zoo, especially the herpetarium. One of the most impressive viper collections I've ever seen. Signs are down in some areas like Africa due to COVID so it may be difficult to identify some of the animals in there. Only downside I'd say is that there is lots of circling around, exhibits could be better organized. Aquarium is small but very well kept. Extremely large bird collection with several aviaries and exhibits throughout the zoo. Nice crocodilian collection with Gharials and Tomistoma outdoors. There's also an area where you can interact with Kangaroos in the Australia section for $8. Plenty of activities for children, several places to eat, including a unique area where you can eat overlooking the rhinos, giraffe feedings, bug room, good mammal collection (no apes though) and overall a very well kept and clean zoo. Loved this zoo, cannot recommend the herp enough especially.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We went for the zoo lights, which they do in the evening. Most of the animals were out, which was nice. The only thing that we didn't get to see were the elephants. I'm not sure where they were. The zoo light show was awesome and they had snow machines, which our 1 year old loved. She didn't like Santa lol, but we did get some good pictures.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This place was great except the security guard which I caught a photo of was being weird he kept following us and asking staff if tgey were okay. And if they felt like there was danger. Our family has mask on like evetyone else. My husband is Puerto Rican and dark complected. He walked in to where the diffrently birds were kept and the security guard only walked up to him and asked that we take the stroller outside which carried my grandbabies. And we has absolutely no problem even though there were four other strollers and people with no mask. The security guard only told us not to mention there were no sign saying no strollers allowed like all the other places. Well this guard followed us thru most of the zoo. We still had a wonderful time I just wish we didnt have to experience that with the security guard. I didnt know who to speak with I was alil afraid being that I had the whole family there so we left early. But we still had a wonderful time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We enjoyed our 3 hours at the park. Some of the  exhibits were closed but was still fun overall. The bird feeding was fun and the kods had a blast. Definitely recommend people to check it out. We live visiting as many zoos as we can when we visit a big city.

For anyone looking for discount admission, visit the zoo's website and purchase the tickets online. You can then have them scanned directly from your phone.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
The San Antonio Zoo was so much fun! It is massive and there are a plethora of animals from multiple large cats, to endless amounts of reptiles to look at and learn about! The entirety of the trip was very insightful and educational.

My fiancÃ©e and I visited in the morning when it was humid and rainy, so sadly a lot of the animals (big cats, especially) were asleep. Of course thatâ€™s not the zooâ€™s fault, but it may be a good idea to keep in mind when you plan out a time to visit. We spent a total of four hours there, but it is definitely possible to spend even longer.

The gift shop carries a large variety of souvenirs, and there is also a restaurant in the zoo grounds. Sadly we didnâ€™t go there as we were meeting friends elsewhere for lunch, but the next time we get the chance we would definitely check it out. The zoo also offers green screen photos, which is a fun and cute idea that kids will love, and will serve as a great family memory.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The San Antonio Zoo is very nice. They have a huge selection of birds that I really enjoyed. The layout of the zoo gives you the opportunity to get in your cardio. I was very surprised to see a large percentage of the vendors open. I must do if you are in San Antonio.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My kids enjoyed the zoo today, especially the dinosaur roar! ðŸ˜†.  Its was our first time here very nice clean zoo a lots of animals, but the box of popcorn is a bit overpriced.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very clean and beautiful. The Christmas lights are stunning. I love that they don't force you to have your mask on outside like other tourist spots in San Antonio. Just highly suggested. Its outside after all
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It was nice.... they are under construction and it's going to look amazing just by what I saw today. Had fun feeding the giraffe's. Although it is way cheaper to buy the all pass at the entrance it will save you $9. And a headache from not waiting in the lines! Overall it was a great Sunday funday!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
I have always loved zoos and the San Antonio one I really enjoy. For my birthday one year, my husband and I did the beastly breakfast (additional cost to the regular admission fee). There was an all you can eat breakfast spread to enjoy. Then we each were given 3 leaves of lettuce to feed the giraffe. Love feeding them and getting photos taken.

For my birthday last year, my generous neighbor gifted my husband and I annual passes! We had gone during Zoo Lights which was fun and rode the camel for an extra fee.

For Memorial Day, I was looking forward to seeing the koalas visiting from San Diego Zoo. Before we saw them, I really enjoyed the different cats of the world. We also saw the visiting kangaroos in the petting area. For $8 per person, you can go and play with them. We saw the hippos for the first time. They were both sleeping soundly in the water against the glass. We've seen the flamingos many times before but this time there was one area where they were very close that I could touch them!

Really enjoyed the sunny day and seeing many of the animals out!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We came for the Beastly Breakfast with the giraffe feeding. Thought the food was amazing! Buffet style (although the staff plates the food for you with the COVID precautions) with options for seconds. (And the giraffes seemed to like their breakfast too).
Mimosas were pricy at $7 each for a small glass.
We enjoyed the rest of the zoo, especially the dinosaur exhibits, but it started getting pretty busy by 10-11 AM, glad we were among the first ones in there.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo is doing a good job at expanding their exhibits and giving people great experiences like giraffe feedings. I'd like to see more animals in the exhibits even I'd they are as simple as white tail deer, armadillos, and other Texas native wildlife, keep some from getting run over. They have a good deal going on for annual passes. The hubby and I will put up a video soon on our YouTube channel Geek Out SA.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The enclosures are not well kept. Grass overgrown. Several areas are under renovation. I feel like some of the animal exhibits had fake animals because they never moved. There weren't any hippos that we ever found. Only a couple of tigers. Never saw a lion. Some enclosures were empty.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fun Experience while in social distancing time period. The Legos addition adds a bit of pop, color and entertainment for everyone. We only got to see probably half if not more of the zoo animals but this is a good Learning experience for the whole Family. I recommend it at this time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It was great to see the number of animals although I think there are some renovations going on. One thing that stood out to me was how clean the bathrooms were. I never think about it until I have to use it. But I have to say it was very clean. One exhibit I really liked was the reptiles. Hard to believe that those are some of the most dangerous animals on the planet.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My girlfriend and I bought the yearly membership package as we both love going to places like this. We took her son and his girlfriend with us. I had not been to a Zoo before (gasp). I lived being able to see animals that I would not have had a chance to see in my lifetime. The butterfly enclosure was awesome. While we were there they had robotic dinosaurs throughout the Zoo. It was a lot of fun.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very nice zoo.  Exciting place to take the kids and adults alike. Plenty of animals to see and  activities to do.  Right now they have a dinosaur exhibit.  The children have a wet area to play in, so bring the swim suit, towel and change of clothes.  There is really no full order restaurants,  just short order foods (burger's, etc.), water,  Gatorade and soda. Get there early and take your time; do not rush. Depending on the time of the year it can be very warm, so drink plenty of water. There is plenty of shade on the paths.  The park allows you to bring in water and basic foods if you want to. If you are visiting from out of town, check out the hotel advertisement stand for the 15%off coupon. They also have military discounts. For a small zoo they do a great job!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Wow.  What can be said about this incredible attraction?  Much!  This is one of the best family activities I have seen in a long time.  This zoo is so well done and beautiful that photos can hardly capture it.  The number of things to see is way more than anyone would expect.  There is also a little train ride just outside the Zoo that takes people on a little tour of that local area.  Like many other attractions, things like admission and food are a little spendy. But then think what it takes to maintain such incredible facilities for the massive amount of displays, animals, reptiles, birds & fish and it's totally understandable and appreciated.  This is an attraction that a person can not get tired of and will want to return to!  Thanks for an amazing day!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This is a nice zoo. It's a bit small and is surprisingly not very stroller friendly. We got there right when they opened on a Sunday. We found an excellent parking space and the zoo wasn't crowded at all. Best part is, all the animals were out! Price was good and they offer a military discount. No map when we came in and I didn't see where you could get one, so we didn't know where we were going or anything. When we walked in we were bombarded with people asking to take our photo (the ones you buy at the gift shop at the end) and we were asked multiple times within the park... it was a little much. The zoo has an AMAZING children's area. Very fun for the kiddos. By the time we left, about 3 hours later, it was starting to get busy, we didn't see many animals on the way out, and the parking was full.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: There is always a Groupon for the zoo so don't forget to check that out! The zoo has some maintaining that they need to catch up on but as far as the exhibits, they are all very interesting and fun to look at! There is plenty to see and you can easily spend a half day here. The plus side is you can take your own food and water so you can save money there but they do have some available throughout the grounds. The line can get long on peak days but you still get it rather quickly. The light show during the holidays was really impressive so do not miss that opportunity!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Very beautiful and well organized and taken care of. We spent a lovely day and everyone enjoyed the experience. Alkost every animal you can think of you will see. The map is very helpful in addition to Zoo staff and worker as well and they are always ready to help if you need or require any assistance. The train experience was great too and we have enjoyed the ride with the kids.

We were visiting San Antonio and I highly recommend to have it in your plans if you are visiting the city.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Loved it!! Had a wonderful time. Everyone for the majority was wearing a mask. This is an all time family favorite. Been coming here since I was a lil girl. My parents and siblings were coming here way before I was born...
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Very very expensive!
They charged us $100.00 to get in, $40.00 for a picture and $35.00 for 4 small drinks and 1 Hotdog.
The rides inside the Zoo were extra and so was the Butterfly exhibit.
We saw only a few animals that did not look healthy at all (poor babies)
1 Lion-1 Tiger-1 small Monkey-1 Bear-1 Hippo and a few more here and there.
Not what it used to be.
Very disappointed and will never return.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Have been coming to the SA Zoo since I was a kid. They are constantly improving... the hippos are a favorite for me and my children.

While a bit expensive, feeding the giraffes is a fantastic experience for the kids.

Lots of beautiful foliage and landscaping. My kids love the childrenâ€™s area with the new mud kitchens and the small beach area. They can play for hours in the childrenâ€™s center. They have different animals you can get up close to and pet in the kids area at 11:00, 1:00 and 3:00 everyday.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a great time at the Zoo. We got the upgraded tickets to ride the train, carousel and feed the lorikeets! Definitely worth it. My kids enjoyed everything and the park is perfect to see everything in a few hours. The lions were the most entertaining. The train ride was longer than I was expecting, but a nice relaxing ride after walking the Zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo is nice, kinda chaotic if your not following the map. Parking was less than desirable, having to walk with all the kids across a busy street. The prices to enter is not bad, they push hard for season pass holders for a reason, I paid $20 for 5 bottles of water on an extremely hot day. Food prices were out of this word!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo is just awesome! Huge but basically every animal you would want to see. Admission price is pretty dang reasonable as well!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We opted for the fun day pass and the visit was good. Fun day pass includes lory cart feed, train ride and one carousel ride. The place is clean and you can enjoy with kids. It is a fun place for couples as well. It took us around 3 hours to cover the zoo but if you want to roam at your pace do plan for this place as a whole day trip.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Not the best zoo I've been to (that honor currently rests with the Detroit Zoo), but still definitely worth seeing. It's somewhat small, but there's a wide variety of animals and my kids always love coming here.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo is really pretty, animals are always interesting.  When we went there, it was super crowded, but the lines went quickly.  The only thing I didn't like was the 2 zoo workers standing just inside the entrance holding big snakes.  I have to say, a panic attack ensued much to my teenagers embarrassment.  I don't like snakes at all.  I think they should have been holding puppies!  Lol.  But it is the zoo, so snakes it is.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo isn't huge but the layout is well done and the exhibits/enclosures are nice.  I was impressed with just how active the animals were.  The Beastro Restaurant had a nice selection of food and drinks. (To include a decent selection of beers as well.). Overall, my wife, daughter, and I had a really enjoyable time at the zoo!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Really enjoyed exploring the zoo with my grandkids. Lots to see! Wear comfortable walking shoes & bring drinks! Took approx 5 hours to walk through - saw almost everything. Highlights include the hippos, rhinos, giraffes & tiger. So much more to see! Highly recommend it!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo is by far my favorite with the animals having free range of there cages. It's open so it's like there habits more in the wild. The only thing I would say is that if it's hot a lot of the animal go inside that's a downfall but it was still fun for all ages.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo blew my expectations out-of-the-park. I went in thinking that it was "medium sized" with not much to see. By the end of the visit I was tired of walking there was just so much to see and enjoy. The animals seem to be well taken care of and the zookeepers are all very friendly. The only bad part was that some of the "bigger" animals like rhinos and giraffes were not on display but besides that everything else was great. Great place with many different adventures to try out with friends and family.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great place. When we went all the animals were out and about. Lorey landing is totally worth the cost. Lots to see.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We hadn't been to the zoo in several years and I'm so amazed at the improvements they have made. We bought season passes, which I highly recommend. They pay for themselves in 2 visits. There are new interactive exhibits, including feeding the giraffes, and a really cool area for younger kids. If you're a native San Antonian do yourself a favor and rediscover the zoo!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: What a fantastic little zoo! Was a great little day trip on my work trip to San Antonio. Being able to walk into little sections where the birds were flying around and the butterflies... Hope to come back after the Leopard skywalk has been completed! Lots of children there but nothing seemed over crowded thankfully. Went a little later in the day when some of the animals were receiving food so that was a blast. Very friendly staff and super helpful about directions and questions
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This is exceeded my expectations  which where  not low. This is one of the best zoos I've ever been to. To have a good ride around I'm as I haven't seen another places. I recommend going during a cooler time of the year than summer. It's and the February and it was beautiful weather.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We didn't get to see much because we came to close to closing time. I am giving 4 stars because the zoo itself is SO confusing. They don't give out maps and so we wasted 20 minutes trying to find a bathroom. We didn't even know that you could download an app until we were leaving. If we ever go back I would go earlier and download their app. Learn from my mistakes. ðŸ™‚
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Interesting and quiet private event for Oh Snap. Great seeing the animals in a calm environment. Very cool lego exhibit too.  I wanna go back and ride the carousel!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo has a lot of shade trees. Definitely bring water if it's hot out. This was my first time and I really enjoyed it. I enjoyed feeding the giraffes and taking the train as well as all the other animals.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My granddaughter was disappointed after being told there would be no costume contest.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I heard they had a Hippo named Timothy. So I had to venture down from MN to see him. I got away from the winter storm also.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Love our San Antonio zoo!! So many fun animals, and things to see. They do a great job of providing information and facts along the way. Fun for every age!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We went to the San Antonio Zoo on Friday we had such a great day it was really nice the kids enjoyed it I enjoyed it my daughter enjoyed it and we will look forward to doing it again
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Very well done zoo for being on the smaller side (compared to Houston Zoo). Love the "secret" passage to the elephant exhibit from Africa Live exhibit. Well shaded. Great Live Oak exhibits.

Update after second visit: Fantastic zoo! Amazing activities for children. Huge outdoor play area that is well shaded. Education center staff are very good with kids and enthusiastic about the animals. Staff introduced us to a ball python which my son excitedly touched and let him help prep a snack for the squirrel monkeys and watch them eat it.

Six stars.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My daughter and wife really enjoyed the visit we lost track of time and almost spent 4h there. It was fun even if it was drizzling the day we went.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My kids always have fun when we go to the zoo. My oldest is 12 going on 13 and always enjoys himself. The Africa Live exhibit is always a treat. We were there for nearly 3 hours and still didn't see everything.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Nice zoo with a great variety of animals to see. They are committed to modernizing exhibits and are pretty regularly updating one exhibit or another. Feeding the Lori's for $2 is a lot of fun with the birds landing on you and flying all over. There is also a classic carousel and face painting for the kids in addition to a hands on kids area.

They are consistently doing special events throughout the year that bring in things like animatronic dinosaurs, a winter wonderland, and all sorts of other things.

It's not the biggest or best zoo in the country but is excellent for what it is. For comparison St Louis and San Diego are the gold standard for zoos in my opinion. San Antonio does a great job of putting together a great experience though and I'm excited for what's to come as they work through adding more and better exhibits.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It was fun,it was a lot cooler them normal as there was a overcast,it was just really humid. Most of the animals where out, few were moving about, most were laying about trying to beat the heat. If you went into a area where the was AC it felt really good on you as your covered in sweat by the time you got there. I'm going to miss this Zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo was great.  Better than most other zoos I have visited.  The animals were easy to see and the exhibits were interactive and informational.  They playground area for the kids was amazing.  Close to animals and fun.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Omg I have to give this Zoo a 10

I've been to alot of zoo's, but this one is great!!
Well maintenance healthy animals, just wonderful!!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: There were a few exhibits that were closed which I can understand. However, that limited our viewing of the animals. Hoping to return again soon when my kids are older so they can understand the animals. I love how the zookeepers were very friendly and always smiled, especially the friendly animals.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We absolutely love coming to the San Antonio Zoo. The annual pass is a no brainer for us, it's worth every penny. It's not a very big zoo compared to Omaha or the San Diego Zoo, but it's definitely got it's own charm! They are always improving the exhibits every time we go. One tip is, go as early as possible and try to avoid the really hot TX days(hard to do, but try!). You'll be glad you did, because that's when it seems the animals are most active. Our daughter loves ending the day on the carousel and getting her face painted.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Nice zoo. We enjoyed how close we were able to get to the animals and how well we could see them. There were quite a few that weren't outside or in view; it was pretty hot. We didnt mind, we liked that the animals could decide to be in or out and could hide if they wanted too.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Our family went to see the Zoo lights. We parked by the train. We had a great time. There are a ton of Christmas lights. They had adult hot Coco. My favorite lol. They also had the regular items to eat and a camel ride. Tonight the Elephant's were close to the fence. I also heard them hum or growl. It was only two seconds. That was awesome! There's also a bubble machine and it produces snow flake bubbles. Not all the animals were out. We walked in the bird section. They were in the tree huddle together staying warm ready for bed. It's worth see the lights. It feels magical.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Great zoo! Our first visit we bought membership passes after spending the day here.  Excellent for several points:
1) quality of habitats and exhibits.  It's always great to see spacious, well thought-out enclosures that recreate animals natural habitat instead of smaller cages.
2) diversity of species.  They have exhibits with animals we haven't seen at other zoo like the tree kangaroo and the okapi.  A real treat.
3) the kangaroo petting was an absolute favorite!  We hope that is stays. Seeing baby joeys was awesome.
4) a lot of engaged zoo staff to teach the kids and interact with guests made for a pleasant visit.

The few points which it didn't get 5 stars from us is that the water fountains throughout the park were all turned off which is crazy considering temperatures are in the 90's.  There are also no misting stations throughout the park.  Many of the animals are free to go inside out of the heat ( which is great) but means you may not see some of the favorites if you don't go early.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fun place to visit but prices are high. We been to other zoos that offer more. The ladies in the kid area are great with kids. We were locked in recently due to a storm and they kept my kids and the other kids busy and their minds off the lighting and thunder. The train ride is fun.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: There are more birds at this zoo than I think I've seen at any other zoo I've been to in the States. Zoo seems well maintained and the animals were quite active (we went between 10 and 1roughly) there are no cup lids and straws offered for smaller cups so if you want something lidded you will need to buy the souvenir cup or bring one in.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Good zoo with some big animals and lots of canopy birds. The trees in this zoo are amazing. Be sure to go up to the giraffe feeding station. Even if you don't feed them, it is amazing how close you can get to these huge animals.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great zoo really 5 stars. ABQ zoo is better but not by much. Very few Exhibits where closed and almost all of the animal's where out of there pins. Of course food is expensive but you are allowed to take water inside. If you wanna take A camel back I'm sure you can as they didn't search are bags when we went in. Be warmed in the summer months you'll roast alive so take lots of breaks and drink plenty of fluid.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: All in all a good day to go in Dec. not crowded until the zoo lights came on for the holiday in the park. Good display of festive lights. I think light show would have been more enjoyable to Christmas music. Exhibits seemed to be under some construction a bit more than expected. Lots of bird exhibits. Pricey to eat or drink inside. Entry was about what I would expect for a zoo. Enjoyable visit. Friendly enough and helpful staff.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Itâ€™s been a long time since I have been to the SA Zoo! I like the lay out of the zoo and how they use some of the natural habitat for the enclosures. My 2yr old loved the hippo exhibit and couldnâ€™t get enough of it. We all liked the butterfly room! My only complaint is that a lot of the glass in the enclosures seemed dirty. Make sure you give yourself enough time to see the entire zoo...we got there late on Sunday and missed some.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The San Antonio Zoo is an affordable, educational and fun place to spend an afternoon. The wildlife variety is somewhat limited these days but the place is well kept and lively. The five of us (4 adults and one kiddo) had a good time. The camel ride was a hoot.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This Zoo was Amazing!! Lots of Animals and sights to see. The staff were friendly and answered questions regarding animals and their care. Very clean park. Would highly recommend.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
San Antonio Zoo has upgraded from when I was there over twenty years ago.
It is wonderfully set up, clean, and lively. The animals all look happy.
We got to go inside a butterfly sanctuary, and have butterflies flying all around us.
We got to see mommy and teen hippo, underwater through glass, swimming together and playing with each other.
And, in top of a lot of other attractions, we got to feed the Giraffes.
It was a total blast all day with my children and their significant others. A PERFECT TIME, even on a really hot day!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Parking. Saw alot of people walking towards the zoo. Just keep driving, there was some parking close to the zoo. Place was really packed but even like that the flow was easy and not frustrating. Alot of the animals were not visible, they might of had been sleeping inside their dent. Staff is really friendly and helpful at any moment. Feeding the giraffe has times so plan in advance if you are planning to do so.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Fun place to visit.  Enjoy your walkabout.  Too bad the big cats ðŸ¦ðŸ…were not visible.
There is a train that runs every 20 minutes for a 20 minutes ride.  But it was down for maintenance.  It reminded me of the one years ago at JOYLAND amusement park
In Wichita Kansas.ðŸ˜ƒ
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We have upgraded to yearly membership as its really worth it. Love the zoo, specially the Rhinos as they are only 2 left in wild. Love zooâ€™s conservation program. Beautiful animals , birds, reptiles, and fishes.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: A really surprising experience. Good selection of animals. Exhibits were clean. Staff was friendly. They have an awesome attraction that let's you feed the giraffes! Take your kids here, they will love it!!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It's fantastic! I took pictures. I want to thank Mr. Strickland for having such beautiful flowers for me to take pictures of.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This is a really fabulous zoo, and they are doing great work. Many of the exhibits are gorgeous. Most of the staff we talked to were friendly. The Beastro Cafe was tasty and clean. I'm docking one star only because several of the cat exhibits really did seem much too small for the species and had no noticeable enrichment (though we might have been on an off day).
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Overall an enjoyable experience. The food was lukewarm and not very flavorful but it was cheap. One of the exhibits had rats running around with the lemurs, eating their food. The baby Komodo dragons were absolutely adorable. They also have kangaroos, which I don't frequently see at other zoos. Our visit was a good value.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Not the biggest zoo but has a great variety of animals to get to learn about. The butterfly attraction was a favorite for the family because the big butterflies would land on you for a perfect photo opportunity. They also have the option to purchase a ticket to get lettuce for hand feeding 3 male giraffes. Get up close with these guys for another photo opportunity. They had a combo ticket for the zoo, butterfly attraction and the train which is outside the park. Wear sunscreen and good walking shoes.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Took the drive thru tour of the zoo. Its better if you have an SUV. Many animals are hiding and difficult to spot from the car.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: San Antonio zoo was fun,,however alot of the exhibits were closed which made it less entertaining. Then we bought souvenirs and told no plastic bags. Had to either carry our merchandise or buy a bag,,which we found very bad business for the zoo. All about the money
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
I felt the need to update my review since a LOT has happened for me at this place. This zoo will always have a deep and beloved place in my heart.
I was married here in January 2021 inside the hippo cave! The staff and event coordinator are the most on point professionals I have ever had the pleasure of working with. They had everything I might need anticipated before I could even get it out of my mouth. We were treated so grandly and the food they served was flawless.
They are currently rebuilding endangered species and came out of the pandemic and winter storm without a single animal or staff member lost. If you ever want a place to visit or donate to, please make it them.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Honestly the times I've been there most of the animals were not available for viewing or asleep. It was disappointing. Overall, the zoo is very family oriented and kid friendly. The staff is very friendly and very well prepared for any questions.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Took an unplanned trip to the San Antonio Zoo. The weather was beautiful! Had not been there in years, and it has changed so much! The entire place has a very different look. Games, the carousel is inside the park now. The restaurant seems bigger and there are so many more dinning areas than there were before. Very nice! Great place for early morning or late evening visit.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Wonderful place. Employees really know the animals. Clean an friendly. Price is very reasonable. Lots of kids that the staff really takes time to educate. Love all the different types of animals. Really a great experience. Only took about 2 hours to see everything but of course you can walk through as much as you like.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo and it's new additions make going both exciting and relaxing. I now see the benefit of membership. The Christmas lights and displays are divine and children are sure to be pleased.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I have yet to finish this zoo because there's always so much to do! Plus, I never really give myself enough time to see everything, but I always enjoy myself. I got a fun pass that allows you to have one carousel ride, feed flamingos, and feed lorikeets. They had a special or something online so I paid maybe 40$ to do all this extra stuff and it's a great experience for adults and kids.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Lots of hills, not really handicap friendly.  It took two of us holding on to the wheelchair so she didn't end up flying down hill. Pushing her up the hills wasn't much fun either! I did not really like that you had to play an extra $2 to see the butterflies,  but that is why I really wanted to go. Over all a good zoo, but it was so hot outside!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
The entrance to the zoo had us pay electronically and get a texted or emailed receipt. I would have preferred a friendly zoo employee.

When we entered the zoo, my family and I saw two young ladies almost directly in front of us offering to take pictures. I asked the rate and then turned them down. She said, "You can still take a picture in front of the lions." So, my husband, grown son, and I went and posed in front of the lions to take our own selfie. I noticed one of the young ladies had her camera aimed at us. I told her we didn't want her pictures. She replied, "Our policy is we have to take a picture if anyone takes a picture." So my family and I walked away.

The zoo has beautiful landscaping. The Lego block displays I didn't see at first. I passed signs that said how many blocks and how many hours, but I was at the back of the zoo before I clearly saw a mallard duck and his offspring. I got so excited. That's when it dawned on me that's what the signs had meant, and I had missed the others. After that, I looked more closely to see the displays.

The zoo is beautiful, and the animals look healthy. I like the variety that you have and that you didn't have to build fake accommodations; instead you seem to have animals that can be comfortable in the heat of Texas.

The signs could be better at showing direction, because sometimes the path to follow isn't very clear. I am amazed and pleased you have helped with the protection and propagation of the Whooping Crane. We heard two of them making a beautiful sound together, but we couldn't video it quickly enough. The Flamingos were fabulous, too.

This was a pleasant experience, and I wish you the best on your newest venture.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This is an incredible zoo. The animals are lively especially on overcast days. The enclosures and foliage make you forget where you are and seem to provide ample space to keep the animals content. My children enjoyed feeding the Lorikeets at Lory landing and riding the carousel.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We went there this time. It was clean and nice and with many staff. All of the animals have their â€œtagâ€ assigns to them but not all windows have the animal. It was understandable that the animals may have to go some way on the period but can you please put some note up there? This can be done, right :-) I went there at 40 degree C the animals were opened their mouths! Anyway that was difficult for most of the animals and staff :-)

Very nice Zoo - keep it up!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Always a good day when you are able to go to the zoo. My son myself and my family luv and enjoy it so much. The only thing is prices are getting ridiculously high, even to enter. But I always enjoy..
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Took the family to San Antonio for spring break.  Couldn't pass on taking the kids to the zoo.  It was a wonderful experience. There is a large range of animals, and all are easy to view.  The park itself is clean and easy to navigate.  Also, the employees are very helpful.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fun and inexpensive. My daughter loves coming here. Last year we took her to the Zoo Lights and it was terrific. The new updates to the zoo have really improved customer experience. We can't wait for the new parking garage
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a good time on our visit. The weather was perfect in the lower 70s which allowed more animals to come out and amaze us.  The hippo and butterfly exhibit are my fave.  We also enjoyed the train ride, although it broke down halfway, the mechanics were able to get it back on track, overall it was a great experience
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This was a pleasant surprise!!  It was not very busy so we had easy viewing access to all the animals and exhibits. It's a good sized zoo with lots of animals, reptiles, etc that I haven't seen at other zoos. The zoo lights were fun too
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This place is fun for the whole family, it's very informational, and the staff is very friendly. My favorite part about my visit was when I got to feed the Giraffes at one of the exhibits. I also liked the variety in animals and the species of animals they had here. The only complaint I have is the water prices, 3USD for a bottle of water. Other than that, please visit this place when passing through or staying in San Antonio.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We went to an after-hours event and the facilities are very nice. They offer nice options and a very comfortable area for meetings. The giraffe feeding is a great idea to add to the experience. We had a nice dinner and got to see a few animals in their after hours mode. Thanks to the very helpful staff.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: What a wonderful experience this was. We have been to zoos all across the country and would rate this among the top. Clean facilities, friendly staff, and awesome learning opportunities for my children. Really enjoyed all of the hands-on stuff too. Great animal displays as well as snake collection.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
The San Antonio Zoo. Not too much differs here from any other zoo, however it is a great place to walk around and take in the scenery regardless. Little kids will enjoy just as much as the adults.

The exhibits are spaced rather close together and allow anyone to see at least 2-3 animals, at one time, within the same 10 meter radius.

During the holidays, however, this place lights up in color and events, I recommend stopping by for the animals, but staying around during the holidays for the fun and festivities.

The zoo food is also good. It is a step above normal. I've been to many zoos and I would have to say this zoo's food ranks at number 4 out of 30. I recommend the burger in the "BEAST"tro as they call it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Large, sprawling zoo with a wide variety of animals. Was disappointed that the lions weren't there and half of the food and drink carts were closed. It's very expensive to get in and on hot days it's extremely uncomfortable, as most all of the wind is blocked here and the sun just beams down. It's a lot of ground to cover on foot so be sure to wear good walking shoes!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This zoo has amazing well thought out habitats that provide an amazing environment for the animals but also positions them so you can see.  You are on the level of the giraffes as you walk past the observation tower.  You are at water level with the alligators. My son loves it and we visit frequently!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It has been awhile since I last been to to the zoo I have to say that I was shocked on how this zoo is looking now its is a fun a great place to take the family hands down one of the best zoo in the states. Beautiful,Clean, and well maintained
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: They have a great selection of animals. Fun for the whole family. Not wheel chair accessible in some parts. Alot of parking spots. Parking lot was dirty though. Dirty diapers laying around. I had a great time with my boyfriend!!! I got a souvenir. We spent 3.5 hours there
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
I was told it is one of finest Zoos in USA. Well I will debate on that.

Firstly the animal collection is decent but not great. They cover almost all sections of animals like birds, cats, pachyderms, apes etc.,

I believe the areas provided for animals are smaller with respect to their sizes. Apes have the smallest cages I have seen. They have impressive bird collection. They serve food at certain points of the zoo.

Staff are courteous and professional. Visit this place in the early hours where sun is not high point to see some animal activity.

Beware if you are visiting on weekend there gonna be a tussle for parking.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Itâ€™s been about 10 years since I have visited the zoo and although the admission price is more than I recall, they have definitely made a LOT of improvements. I didnâ€™t even recognize the place!

The giraffe exhibit is really cool because you can now walk onto a deck that is as tall as the giraffes and you can actually feed them.  Even if you donâ€™t pay extra to feed them, you are able to walk on the deck and see them face to face â€“ it was AWESOME!

The Lory exhibit is also pretty cool.  You walk into this aviary and if you pay a couple of bucks, you can feed the birds â€“ they will actually land on your shoulders and arms to eat.  One in our group didnâ€™t have any food but 3 or 4 of the birds landed on him as soon as he walked in the gate for some reason.

Parking is the same as it always has been â€“ kind of tough to park in the lot in Brack Park, but donâ€™t forget there is parking under the highway on the opposite side of the zoo.

Signage could be improved â€“ itâ€™s hard to find your way to the exit when you are leaving.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: LOVE IT...my daughter loves it...we all love it.  Of course, ridiculous concession prices BUT it's a steal if you have the membership and go as often as we do.  They do SO MUCH during the holidays:  Christmas lights and being open until 9pm are just naming a couple things I love about the place.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Loved it. Not overtly commercial.  Friendly staff. Loved train ride at the zoo. Food is on expensive side though and fried pickles are not good. But overall great experience. Very hot to visit in summer though.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I took the day off to visit the zoo to check out the rhino exhibit I keep hearing about. I was completely disappointed. The zoo is overrun by vultures in every single corner. Poor animals are sharing their tiny little space with these animals by the dozens and waiting to grab their food. I only took a few pics because I didn't think I'd be writing a review but once I left, 24hours later it still bothered me. I will never return to the San Antonio zoo or any other zoo because when I was little, I didn't know any better as to how confined and stressed these animals look. Many zoo animals experience continuous strange behaviors because they have been kept in captivity for so long or live their entire lives alone. Many parents will continue to bring their families and keep this pattern going. There are animal shelters that provide ample space for wild animals but the zoo captivity isn't one of them. I love my city but I however do not support what I witnessed.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Super interactive zoo, we love this place!  Feeding the flamingo's was one of the coolest experiences I have ever had!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The train was a hit with our toddler. We really enjoyed this experience as a family.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My first time visiting the San Antonio zoo and I went with a large group for a private event. The holiday lights were nice! The food provided by the zoo for the event was subpar. The biggest downfall during my experience. There was an open bar, which others seemed to enjoy. Following dinner was our party where we had a great time in the reptile exhibit, dancing, drinking and enjoying the hippos and other animals. Iâ€™ll have to visit again during the day to experience the entire zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Pretty good size zoo. Decent amount of different kinds of animals, however when I went there were only one of each of certain kinds like the tiger, jaguar, and cheetah. Didn't have to pay for parking. If you plan on drinking anything, plan to spend alot. Spent 4.40 on a 12 oz cup with no lid or refills. I also spent $4 on fried Oreos, and had to wait 10 minutes when I was the only one at the food stand.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a very enjoyable morning at the Zoo.  We had an 20 month old with us and he thoroughly enjoyed seeing the animals!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Zoo Lights at San Antonio Zoo.. very beautiful.. enjoyed looking at everything decorated and lit up, also the light show, had smores and hot chocolate while we walked around. ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My husband and I drove down to visit during the Christmas lights and that was pretty cool, although,  you don't see many of the animals, we enjoyed it. Recently, We decided to go back during the day, we were not impressed.  There are a ton of birds and we didn't get to see many of the other animals. The hippos, Pumba :-), & giraffes were awesome but unfortunately,  not my favorite zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The whataburger Christmas lights are so beautiful and you're still able to see some animals at night. They have a pick a present for $5 which is so exciting. Definitely recommend before the holidays are over.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My father passed away recently and to honor his memory we had a family outing to the San Antonio Zoo. My dad loved zoos and he always wanted to see the one here in San Antonio; unfortunately, things didn't work out that way. He would have loved this zoo!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Pens clean, animals taken care of, water in pools. Most were doing a great job keeping busy.
Very humid and hot. Attendant at carousel ticket booth very nice.
Grandson 3 years old and hot, crying. Some of the workers making rude comments....not appreciated. He is very active and loves to run, loves color and wants to touch everything.
Second....
Holding my daughters hand walking down the path to see Giraffes...two employees leaning up a building called us dykes. This was our only family day together during military month and we were shocked by the rude comments of a few interns/employees. No time to waste on immature kids as we were making sure GUNNER had a super awesome time at the zoo.
We will be back and next time management will be notified.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Felt that some of the habitats or enclosures could have been better then to place them on concrete where they should all be in there own environment.  Anything that was stuck on concrete should had better layout of what they could have done.  Like for example the kangaroos where on concrete/ light sand and brush where they could have done better upon grass or something from there natural lands.  Just think things could been planned better.  All around it was fun and I enjoyed our time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: A very nice zoo for a city this size. Good organization of exhibits, and well maintained.  There's never any way to predict what animals will be lively or sedate, so be prepared that some of your favorites will be sleeping in a hidden corner, and not visible. All in all, well worth it!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Definitely a family friendly place, thereâ€™s never a bad time to go, although usually about 10% of the animals are put away so itâ€™s hit and miss to what youâ€™re gonna see but thereâ€™s still a lot to see. Take a hat and water because it is hot and the food and drink prices are expensive unless you purchase a â€œzoo cupâ€ with which you get $1 refills and if you go often itâ€™s very much worth it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Best Zoo I've ever seen. Beautiful nature and beautiful animals. Great experience. Affordable and unforgettable. Me and my family had a great time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Y'all we live in Texas. Those animals are hot as hell. They don't even move cause of the heat.. I think they need better water sources and think about us humans to! I thought I was gonna die from a heat stroke in Africa y'all need to make more shaded and fanned areas. With all the tourist there's not enough benches in that area either.

text: The San Antonio zoo is one of my favorite places ever. It's fairly priced, large, and very interactive. Anyone from children to older adults can enjoy it. There's a lot of places for food and rest and there's a lot of exhibits where you can interact with animals, such as the bird enclosure, feeding giraffes, and others. It's a fantastic place and the animals seem very well cared for and happy.

text: Huge zoo with multiple Komodo Dragons and a HUGE rhino. The Behind the Scenes Hippo experience is AWESOME!! Drink lots of water, and start early if you want to see it all!

text: Beautiful zoo that kids of all ages will enjoy. Our favorites are the butterfly enclosure and the hippo exhibit. My kids loved the train ride to top off the day at the zoo.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My family and I love the zoo. The park is kept clean for the most part, parking is easy accessible to the front gate and the animals seem to be treated kindly.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Had so much fun. Really well organized. Toilets located inside was really nice, and it's clean. Beastro restaurant  got variety of foods to choose from before you start your adventure of after you get tired of walking  ðŸ˜‚ staff we're really nice also. Too bad the butterfly garden was close during winter time, I still had fun! Great great! ðŸ˜‰
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We enjoyed our time at the zoo. The animals seems well taking care of and where very active. My family enjoyed very much. The prices are a little high but we did had a good time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The staff were pretty friendly and the animals themselves (what was there) were pretty nice. I recommend going on a day that's a lot cooler than when we went, it probably would have been a better experience.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo was a very nice place, so many animals to see. It took us most of the day and I think we still missed some. The reason it is getting 3 stars is because most of the food places were closed and the lines were so long for the ones that were open. So we ended up in a gift shop and ended up paying almost $60.00 for 6 20oz sodas and 6 little bags of snacks, that is what you call ridiculous. On top of that they don't let you take your own food in so you are at their mercy. Just visiting but don't think we will do it again.

text: Absolutely loved it but about 40% of animals didn't show up. I suppose, because of very low temperature outside, wind and a bit of rain. So consider visiting it on warm conditions. Anyway, I enjoyed everything I managed to see=) they have cool kids' playground also!

text: Awesome place for the kids!!!! Came with our Hernandez elementary field trip!!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: All the animals were well cared for. Staff was polite. I especially liked the use of the natural terrain in the layout. The seasonal lighting was very well planned and totally worth going to see even if all the animals were asleep.

text: Always fun to be had at the zoo! We came with the school field trip and did a scavenger hunt. The only thing we could not find was an animal from the polar region. title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo has been a ton of great improvements over the last few years. The exhibits are very educational and the flow and lay out of the is top notch compared to others.

text:
Great on a cool day. Go on a cool day if you can. The animals were incredibly lively and it was super walkable. The hippos are definitely my favorite part of this zoo, especially when they're swimming around. I really wish I had taken a picture of the hippos.

5 stars only on days below 75 degrees.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Try and visit when it's under 80 degrees! I came home feeling faint from how hot it was when we went. Other than that the zoo has had many new upgrades. They have a feeding area where you get to feed the giraffes. My son loved it. Of course they'll take pictures of it for you and sell them to you for a lot but you don't get to feed giraffes daily so it's well worth it. The giraffes tongue touched my sons hand. text:
I love the remodeling that they have done, it really is how the zoo should look. If you Purchase the membership pass, please pleaseee make sure you bring your ID as well. Sometimes they will let you im without it but it is very rare.Beside that
I think the zoo is perfect. However I think they should remodel the animals habitats, they could use alot of work, ALOT OF WORK.
But overall it really is a great place for kids, they got all the exhibits to visit,a carousel,petting zoo, and many more. They recently added a area to where you can feed giraffes! But if you are not very fond off that, you can also check out the lory area where you can feed nectar to those birds.
Great place to take photos of these beautiful animals up close.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: One of the best zoos i have been too,, very nice nature walk. Wish they would enforce mask issue.

text: This is a really nice zoo, except for all the vultures. I thought at first they should kill them but now I know they let the animals kill them. Other than that they have a large variety of animals such as giraffes lions tigers cheetahs rhinos bears monkeys hippos a large aviary a butterfly exhibit and a reptile house. You can get a good view of the lions.

text: Super fun!!!! A little price but worth it. Very clean. We fed a giraffe ðŸ¦’. I would recommend everyone to go at least once.

text: Haven't been there in yyrs they had added some things & took away but I 100% loved it. Oh they have a carasle cost $3.00, butterfly $1.50.. Here are pics I took not whole zoo..
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great way to spend a few hours in San Antonio, at any age. Great for kids. We got the souvenir drink cups as it does get pretty hot, and there's lots of walking, so we were able to refill every so often easily. If you need a break from the crowd and/or the heat, find the amphibian house. Cool, dim, and there was absolutely no one in there. We loved the okapi the best!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I got the Rihno pass, worth the experiance in one visit. Important to educate kids about animals of the world in this way and get them off their phones. Most animals have more space and care near down town then most tourists. A treasure spot in San Antonio and Texas and well worth the admission and donations it takes to keep this going.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
A small but delightful zoo. They have a great holiday light display, and I love that there are a few artists who have been allowed to set up tables and offer up some prints for sale.

Plus, you can feed a giraffe!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very beautiful lights, food, snacks and beer (other adult drinks) available.  Despite most of the animals not in view there were still a suprising amount of other animals and pens available.  Plenty for the kids and adults...fairly reasonably priced...
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We visit zoo's everywhere we travel and this is one of our favorites. We will be excited to return once the renovations are complete. Went with my husband and 2yo, everyone had a good time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: San Antonio zoo will always be my favorite spot. The place is perfect for family fun. The scenery is amazing.  The zoo is not too big and not too small therefore you won't be tired from walking thru the zoo. Student discounts are not available though.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I used to love this zoo when I was a kid! As an adult, it was not worth the money to see empty exhibits and a ridiculous amount of vultures hanging around. Some cages were still being cleaned two hours after opening (understandable) but most were just sitting empty. We visit the zoo in SA every time we travel from Florida to visit family and this last trip was definitely the worst experience we've had at this zoo. Maybe they were having an off day but unfortunately this past trip was so full of disappointment that we've decided to stick to places like the Witte and the Doseum from now on. On a positive note, the "newer" sections of the zoo (Savannah/Africa Live exhibits and Tot Spot) are nice and I do always enjoy sitting in the bird house. Parking is plentiful, I've never had to wait too long in the ticket line, and the train is nice and has drop offs at the Witte Museum and the Japanese Tea Garden.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It was pretty awesome. There are a lot of different animals to see and a good number of "events" that are fun to partake in. Sadly, we did not get to see the elephants, nor was there any notice why (out for the season, or hours of viewing). But it was still a great experience.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: This Zoo is pretty cool, visiting from Germany i suggest this is a go to for sure, i love how they have staff all over you can ask and i love that they have certain themes additional to the zoo attraction. Very nice clean place, luved it :-) plenty animals, plenty to do, old an young enjoyed the visit.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I recently visited this Zoo (it's been years since) and I mute say they've add a lot of new attractions from the greenery to the layout and obviously the animals themselves. I enjoy walking the map from start to end, and there seems to be something along the way for everyone to enjoy!.. the reptile area and the large cats are some of my favorites.. you can't skip nor ignore the aquatic animals and the birds which are all beautiful and one can appreciate the view and interaction (even if minimal) with all stops. They offer camel rides, party reservations, gift shops and plenty more.. if you're in the area and want to escape the city view and noise, look no further.. you won't be disappointed. I will be returning later on when they update and finish the new additions!.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: San Antonio Zoo is amazing. Great place for family & adults. Excellent exhibits & selection of animals. Always enjoy spending time with my kids there making memories.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
This is the most robust collection of cats I've seen at a zoo.  Jaguar, fishing cat, clouded leopard, tiger, lion and more including the Caracal pictured here.

I thought the staff was friendly, the zoo was clean, and the gift shops were well priced.  The zoo is divided up by geographic theme - Australia, Africa etc.  I liked this.  There was lots of information about how native populations viewed particular animals.

The zoo was medium sized, so it's possible to walk its entirety in 2-4 miles.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo is nice and was well kept. Went during the week day so it was not so busy and many of the animals were awake and active. I also love the location of this zoo because it is apart of Brackenridge Park which has trails and a river. It is also close to other great attractions and food.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I had not been to the zoo in years. They have made major improvements and they actually have animals now. The reptile house and aquatic house are still the same that needs improvement and maybe add an area for pequins.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My daughter loved it! Lots to see!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I was ok but we went after 6 pm and most of the animals were inside their houses or something because we couldn't see them, we don't the see the giraffe, tiger, rhino, elephant, and many others that was not ok
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: In my opinion i like this zoo better than dallas or fort worth. It might be a lil smaller and even though the cats weren't out i still had fun. Just make sure you bring drinks and good walking shoes. Also dont forget to bring some quarters to get some fish food, fun for the kids.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Great place to visit , .nice to see the improvements. A bit pricey though for not that big of a Zoo.
Feeding the Giraffes was a real treat though.
More interaction with the animals would be awesome.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The best zoo in all of the world! Haha I grew up visiting this place as an SA native and it had only improved with time. Animals are happy, healthy, and enriched. Ample shade and seating for tired feet. Lovely signage and visitor engagement. Amazingly fun to find a chupacabra specimen!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Always a great time. But this was the first time in a couple years we got to see many more animals.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Loved this place!! A definite must do if your in the area. The staff are friendly the animals are not shy at all. We donated to the butterfly conservation and got to go in the butterfly house and got up close and personal with these beautiful butterflies, the whole family enjoyed it. We got to see the hippopotamus which is a first for me and I made eye contact with one of them it was an awesome experience. Couple of suggestions if this is your first time, if you have kids bring swimming clothes they have a wonderful kids area with water and a bunch of kids activities. Second they have souvenir cups that are pricey but by the rhino area they had one for $10 and it cost just a dollar and some change to refill a definite must we refilled minimum 15 times it was extremely hot when we went. Third do as much as possible outside before the peek hours of the day then move to the air controlled areas during the hottest part of the day really helps if you have kids. I've waited a long time to visit this place and enjoyed every single part of it.

text:
My family and I purchased tickets for the drive thru Zoo experience. The tickets cost $60.00 for entrance of one vehicle. The occupants included me, my two kids (1.5 YO and 4 YO) and my wife. We went on a weekday (Thursday) at around 12:00pm. The wait time to enter the zoo was 1 hour and 43 minutes. The tour of the zoo was approximately 47 minutes long. The actual experience was well thought out on part of the Zoo and their friendly staff. Restroom, snacks and gifts were available during the wait to get in, and throughout the Zoo tour. The confinement of the vehicle took away from the actual experience of being at the zoo, but still provided an excellent alternative to escape the confines of the house during trying times of the epidemic. We were able to see many animals including jaguars, alligators, flamingos, monkeys and assorted birds. We were sad to not be able to see the giraffes, elephants and the hippos as the tour did not pass their particular enclosures. However, the enclosures we did pass by, most of the animals were out and about including some bears and lions.
The overall experience was fun and memorable and the kids seemed to enjoy themselves however became restless due to the longer than expected wait time. We allowed our children to occupy the front seats with us as many other families did and the zoo staff did not seem to care as everybody I observed doing this appeared to be acting responsible. I would ultimately recommend doing this given everything thatâ€™s going on in the world, only to those however, that show patience especially given the wait time and If you have small children in the car that become restless as I do.
- Safe travels, be kind
title: San Antonio Zoo

itâ€™s always a great walk. they have new exhibits often. itâ€™s clean, it hardly smells, the animals look like animals, and thereâ€™s always an air of excitement. the current attraction is really neat btw. great for selfies and groupies. btw, elephants do a sway when anticipating something. if you look it up and see some dumb idiotâ€™s FB post about it being a symptom of elephant psychosis, ask yourself, â€œshould I believe what some dumb idiot posts on FB?â€ if the answer is â€œyes,â€ then donâ€™t. please. stop. if the answer is â€œno,â€ then, good job. in any case, the animals are happy, well fed, and the zoo keepers are freakinâ€™ awesome.

text: This was not a fun experience. The smell was bad. I know it is a zoo but wow. I mean it was smelly everywhere you went. Plus there were buzzards everywhere. I mean the eagle exhibit had one lone eagle in the middle of a group of buzzards. This many buzzards gathered in one place is unhealthy for the patrons and the animals. I kept looking for a buzzard mascot to show up at any second.  We also repeatedly seen the same animal in multiple enclosures like they didnt have anything to show so they filled extra pens with repeats. When we went to the restaurant to eat our order came back wrong.  The person that took our order told his manager we didnt ask for half the stuff we ordered. I repeated the order placed. When my wife walked over I had her repeat the order.  We left the restaurant and continued walking.  After passing multiple enclosures with nothing in them we decided we had had enough and left. Also the waterways were dirty and water in the pens was green and nasty

text:
As you can see they think Spectacled Bears are black vultures. I jest but lots of the animals aren't even out. A good portion is under construction as I can only assume/hope, they near the end of their "2020 Master Plan."

Their "Zoorassic Park" is a lame attempt at keeping people interested or trying to distract you from all the construction/missing animals.

In my opinion Dallas, Ft Worth, Houston, and Brownsville all have better zoos. Even the small Abilene Zoo gives you more bang for your buck.

Speaking of bucks, be prepared to spend a RIDICULOUS amount. It cost approximately $35 for me and my 5 year old. But who can argue when they provide such state of the art exhibits like the gated off (and old as dirt) Wetlands that they pretend look really natural, when in reality, they just have no idea what they are doing with that area and won't cut the grass.

Btw, I love how once you buy your ticket, you then have to AGAIN show your tickets when already in the park. Yeah you read that right, once you've bought tickets, you can go to the gift shop, look at the black vultures who have squatted on the Spectacled bear's exhibits but then still have to show your ticket to get to the rest of the zoo. (Queue crappy reason from SA Zoo or Zoo member here.)

To top it all off, they've already deepsixed their Tot area for a different one. Can't have a Master Plan without revisions I guess.

TL;DR Zoo still in "Master Plan" construction, black vultures have taken over, lots of animals not out, admission is too high.

Do yourself a favor, go to Fiesta Texas instead. If you really want to pay a ton amd see animals just use that money and go to Sea World. At least they have a water park. I
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The Zoo will always be one of the attra tions in San Antonio that the kids will enjoy but parents will dred. For starters if you are going to get food at the Zoo prepare for an hour long wait just to order your food. The main restaurant is terribly slow but the food is worth the wait. Unlike most other attractions tions they don't have same day refills, their refills are a dollar each stop. The Zoo itself is always very enjoyable even on the worst of days. The heat is even more so multiplied by the big areas of the zoo that block any wind from getting in to cool you down. Your only saving grace will be the reptile houses or other indoor attractions that will allow a quick cool down experience. Hydrate! Hydrate! Hydrate! We saw more then a few people who looked close to passing out. You will also want to call ahead and see what is closed and what is opened. Prepare a game plan for how you want to enjoy the Zoo of not and you try to plan in the heat you will wind up missing areas you would have otherwise wanted to have seen.

title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
We purchased tickets online so we were able to skip the long lines. Also free parking is available if you don't mind walking about five minutes. They had a Dino exhibit and had several presentations throughout to educate you on the dinosaurs. The giraffe exhibit was the most interesting. They were so active & friendly. Very graceful & majestic creatures. Many of the "regular" exhibits were empty or being cleaned while we were there (on a Saturday mid-day).
We liked the refillable cups that double as collectables. We did find it hard to locate maps throughout the park. Bring a hat & bottle of water to help combat the heat.
The petting zoo portion of the zoo was pretty fun for the kids. They also offer a sand & water play area for the kids so make sure you bring water shoes, towels,  and a change of clothes so your little one can participate.

text: My child school came for a visit to the zoo. There is little to no animals available for children to view. Which is sad because this is the first time some of the children have come. The animal we encountered looked depressed and malnourished. The areas or spaces that the animals live in have not been updated nor cleaned period. Most spaces have no animal available to view but plenty of vultures. The zoo employees threw away their lunches and the children waited for an hour to be served. The worse experience I have ever had at this zoo. Then they served the kids peanut butter and jelly sandwichs and a bag of chips no drinks. Making the animals and children happy is a priority and should be one for this zoo.

text:
Lots of fun, I've been to many Zoo's and I really enjoy myself here.  It's on the smaller side, but I like it cause I can I am not spent after walking for a few hours. Easy park layout and park has always been clean.

FYI, if your getting a drink though, they do not provide lids or straws. So, idk maybe bring and empty cup of your own and transfer your drink after purchase.  I was bummed, I wanted to get a slurpee, but it was hot and I didnt want fight off the flies while pushing the stroller.

Overall, great experience, easy and not so taxing, family friendly stop. See my family enjoying many days here.

text: It's a really nicely sized zoo. However, if you have little ones and you plan to come in the summer, make sure you take your time and have proper sun protection. My boyfriend and I were only here for about an hour and already started to overheat. Granted, they do have some air conditioned exhibits, but those get crowded because it is so hot outside. I saw lots of children throw tantrums over the heat, only satiated with ice cream. They do have dippin dots though, which was nice to me. With animals concerned, this one had a larger variety of birds than I have ever seen, with some free roaming, and some in exhibits. With the larger animals, it was so hot that some of them were either brought inside, or were sitting in the shade napping/not doing much. Can't really blame the animals for that, but I can imagine that would disappoint someone else. But what can you do, it was hot! The things moving around most were the birds and this squirrel that I swore was following us.

text: The improvements made over the past 5-10 years at the zoo have made a huge impact for me and my reasons on attending this zoo. The employees have always been courteous, the grounds are always so clean, and the tickets stay at a reasonable price. I love that the animals have activities and sensory objects, I love the availability of the encounters for guests to interact with the animals, and I love the events. Zoo Boo & Zoo lights are my favorite. I have been able to feed giraffes, ride a camel, and even feed Timothy and Uma with the Hippo Encounter. Hippos are my favorite animals so this activity even being possible is amazing and a dream come true! My husband and I recently became annual pass holders for these reasons and we continue to support the SA Zoo whenever possible.

text:
I've been a member for 3 years. Its small size makes it an easy walk.

With San Francisco being a top third, and DC a middle third, this is a bottom third zoo. You will find smaller enclosures than what is typically seen. There are virtually no healthy food options, and bathrooms are such that you'd better hope you don't have to #2. Zoos in general are excused by the fact that they are supposed to teach us about nature and habitats. Yet the massive amount of plastic at the concession stands run counter to this. I'd give a pass to the plastic popcorn tub we've been using for 2 years, but plastic souvenircups, plastic souvenir straws, plastic Ziploc bags for your pickle. The latest are giant 3D plastic printers that print plastic souvenirs, at least 4 of them.

The zoo lights are quite a sight during the Christmas season. During summer, they have some excellent zoo camps for kids that my 5 and 8 yr olds really enjoyed. When they have dinosaurs there the kids love it.

The membership process is also annoying. You pay for membership, then have to return at a later date to a two person office, to print out your card which is not a quick process with 5 kids in tow. These are cheap movie ticket quality paper cards that they will charge you $5 each for if you lose them, and they will not accept photos of them from your phone or provide any digital version. The first year we were members they mailed it, and it would be nice to have the option to pay for a stamp. They have also made their entry process longer and longer each year. Non members wait in line to buy a ticket..then wait in line again (with members) to have the ticket they just bought verified?

text:
This review is for the Zoo lights and visiting the Zoo in the evening.
I think the Zoo lights were a ploy to get people to come to the zoo in the night because, you can see absolutely no animals in the dark - there are no lights and the zoo itself loses it's value prop. The kids were very disappointed as they couldnt see anything.
The zoo lights themselves were underwhelming and haphazard. In many places the lights were so distracting we couldnt see the animal enclosures because of them. the entire zoo in the evening felt lika a maze where we didnt know where to go, didn't have anything to see, except for the ugly zoo lights everywhere.
Maybe a daytime experience could be different
title: San Antonio Zoo
