text:
Today was our first time visiting Sea Life Aquarium! We decided to make a day trip out to Great Lakes Crossing Mall and do Legoland followed by Sea Life Aquarium. We had researched beforehand and knew the Legoland visit would eat up about 3-4 hours or more and the aquarium visit would eat up about 90 minutes or so. We bought a combo ticket through Legoland that included a visit to Legoland that day and a visit to Sea Life Aquarium either the same day or up to 30 days after the date of purchase. I have seen some reviews talk about the price of Sea Life being rather expensive. I would have to agree. It definitely didn't end up being a cheap day for us.

I've also seen reviews about the age of kids making a difference. I would totally agree with this. My mother and I enjoyed ourselves as adults visiting the aquarium and we brought my 6 year old son and 3 year old daughter, who both had a ton of fun. However, if we had brought my 11, 12, or 15 year olds with us, I'm not sure they would've had nearly as much fun. There are a few kids activities throughout the aquarium, which includes coloring with crayons, coloring and naming a virtual fish, which then starts swimming around in a virtual fish tank, and an activity book ($5 extra per book) where kids can perform tasks and add embossed stamps at the different stamp stations throughout the aquarium.

Overall it was fun and enjoyable. I'm not sure I'd ever go back just for Sea Life Aquarium. We'd definitely do the combo tickets again.
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text:
Overall, this is a really nice aquarium. The primary wow factor is realizing it's virtually all contained in one large atrium with a spiral walkway up the center and an open-air penguin exhibit across the entire bottom of the room. I love penguins, so being able to see them up close and from slightly above with no glass between us was really fascinating. I also loved the seal and sea lion exhibits being outside (yet covered). It adds a more natural feel to the area, which I'm sure the animals enjoy.

I think my only complaint would be that it seems a little small for the ticket price, especially compared to other aquariums across the country. If you purchase a combo pass with other attractions, I'm sure it's a better value. However, all that being said, I was impressed with the number of displays they were able to fit into the space. They made good use of the building's height. I could have probably spent hours watching the center tank - especially the giant sea turtle!
title: New England Aquarium

text: A fantastic aquarium and easily walkable from our hotel.  We came here in the afternoon after doing a Duck Tour in the morning.  We have been several times and my husband and I agree that the penguin exhibit at the entrance is the most memorable aquarium entrance we both remember.  It is worth walking the four floors up and then following the huge tank down the ramp in the middle of the museum.  We also enjoyed the sea lion area outdoors.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Three stars as I went with great expectations. I expected the aquarium to be big, have shows and more exhibits. After been to sea world, I was expecting to see more interactive programs that educate about marine life, how it's in danger and more variety of the marine life. It's good but not great. Approx. 2-3 hours are sufficient to cover entire aquarium with a break for snacks at a very relaxed pace.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
The New England Aquarium was amazing! From how clean it was, to how orderly it was organized! The staff was fun, inactive and knowledgeable! The bathrooms were spotless. Gift shop prices were reasonable with some proceeds going back into conservation and rehabilitation of sea life! 10/10 would recommend to anyone, especially with kids. Plenty of room to move around with a stroller, elevator access to all floors.
Seriously considering becoming a member here!
title: New England Aquarium

text: My family and I had a fantastic time here! The tickets are a little pricey but it was definitely worth it. The aquariums were lovely with diverse options. There was also a sting ray tank that allowed people to touch the sting rays which was wonderful. The bathrooms are clean and well-kept. There are rental lockers for coats and other accessories for only 5-7 dollars. 10/10 would recommend, especially for families with smaller children!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Such a great time. Tickets were so simple to buy online, parking was simple and convenient and only a quick 2 minute walk from the aquarium. Staff was very professional, polite, and filled with information on the exhibits. And the exhibits in marine life were awesome and fun to watch and learn about. I believe it's children three and under are free. In my one-year-old daughter had a blast
title: New England Aquarium

text: We went on a Wednesday and it was pretty busy but, decent room to move around. The concept of the enormous single tank with a wrap around spiral is pretty cool. As you walk up each level has additional tanks and exhibits around. Nice to see a giant octopus on exhibit, definitely my favorite. Some cool infographics around, geared more towards conservation rather than just stats. Nice to see the creatures with large areas of space to live. The penguins have a lot of space and the open air exhibit is unique at least in the aquariums I've visited. Definitely recommend a visit if you're in the area and enjoy sea life.
title: New England Aquarium

text: As a fan of the film Next Stop Wonderland, the New England Aquarium was a must-see during my visit to Boston, and it did not disappoint!  The aquarium offers a AAA discount and a university discount. Upon entering, I turned to the left to the sting ray petting experience and shark exhibit.  This was the first of multiple stops where aquarium staff were on hand to share information and answer questions, which was great! I appreciated the washing station, too. The shark exhibit was interactive and engaging.  I could go on about the multiple exhibits and aquariums in the main building, but the jewel of this Aquarium is the enormous, multi-story tank featuring sea turtles, schools of fish, and the scuba divers feeding them.  I suggest calling ahead to find out when the feeding time will be so that you donâ€™t miss it! See if you can find the small Puffer fish in that large tank; itâ€™s not easy, but worth seeing that friendly little face! ðŸ˜Š if you turn to the right as you enter the main space, you will find a flashlight attached to the railing that allows you to play with the penguins! They enjoy swimming after that light (which is in a fish shape) just like a cat chases a laser!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Really enjoyed this aquarium! I've been to many different aquariums; New England stood out because they created many different environments that were truly natural to the species they were trying to preserve. The penguins were extremely entertaining; there were 3 different species that each had their own environment which allowed them to behave naturally. Would highly recommend a visit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: This place is fantastic, my niece and nephew loved it. They loved seeing the penguins and how they interact with each other. The sea lions were very cool to look at. The central tank is amazing with many different types of fish and large turtles, it is like a mini reef. I also liked seeing the bioluminescent jellyfish and fish.  The fish and other animals were very easy to spot within the exhibit. The information next to the exhibit was good to read. I hope this place continues to flourish for many years to come.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Cute aquarium. Iâ€™ll lay out the pros and cons to help anyone visiting Boston for a few days decide whether coming here is worth it or not.

Cons:
I wasnâ€™t a fan of layout of the building itself and the flow between exhibits was kind of awkward. Also, the touch tanks (ie where the sharks and rays are) are right at the entrance and easy to pass by when you enter. If you go into the gift shop before seeing that area you wonâ€™t be able to come back in without showing your ticket again which is kind of annoying.

The ticket price was also kind of expensive for the size of the aquarium ($34) considering there isnâ€™t that much to see and youâ€™ll probably spend 1.5-2h there at most. The gift shop has only a few items with the cute logo on it and the rest have tacky clip art on them that you wouldnâ€™t even be able to tell came from this specific aquarium. They should at least put Boston on there or something.

Pros:
Some of the habitats are so creatively curated, from the shape of the glass to the way they planted the vegetation, itâ€™s all very pleasing to the eye. If you go in the morning you can see the animals being fed which is extra entertaining. They all seem happy especially the turtles who you can see love to be handled by the marine biologists. All staff is friendly and open to answering questions. If you have small kids and came with a stroller they have elevators and a ramp that goes all the way around the building so you can walk around easily without missing anything.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Took the kids on a day they had off school expecting it to be VERY crowded, but it wasn't. This was most likely due to COVID capacity restrictions, but it was a pleasant surprise nonetheless. We were able to stroll through easily and there was almost no wait to look at all the things we wanted. More places to sit down on the upper floors would be helpful; little feet get tired quickly. The gift shop and food court were reasonable.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Awesome views and structural setup at this aquarium. Loved how we walked one direction and down a different scenery to leave.

My husband and I went on a Sunday shortly after they opened (after our Duck Tour), and it was pretty crowded. We then wondered if it would've been better to go on a weekday.

I loved Murtle the Turtle ðŸ¤© She's probably 90 years old and gave us a little swimming show.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very fun aquarium, I really enjoyed watching the penguins without a glass. The giant tank in the middle is quite impressive, they managed to make good use of the space. The sea lion exhibit was interesting, but I kind of wished we could see them being fed, as they are very cheeky and fun when they are. The ray and shark touch tank was a lot of fun! Overall a really nice if a little small aquarium.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A super cool aquarium! The layout of the building is very fun with the giant spiral center. I love the amount of penguins and sea lions and seals that you can see way up close! The touch tank is a little underwhelming, but it's a nice place to chill by. Also, the sea dragons there are the coolest! I've never seen them anywhere else before.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I enjoyed my time here but just didnâ€™t think this aquarium was worth the money. I was hoping there would be more exhibits and diversity of wildlife. Maybe itâ€™s different in the summer but I wouldâ€™ve loved to see a dolphin, sea lion or otter show. We went on a super busy day which also made the experience less enjoyable, it was difficult to even get a good view of some of the exhibits. I think they cap off the amount of people in at a time but I still think there was way too many especially since everyone moves in the same path up the atrium. It was alright for a cloudy afternoon but Iâ€™ve definitely been to much nicer aquariums.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We had an amazing time at the New England Aquarium. As we slowly walked up the spiral staircase we enjoyed observing the fish in their natural habitat. When we reached another floor we also took the time to view the other displays that provided further insight to sea creatures and wildlife from around the world. A very fascinating experience. Later we went to the theater to see the various films about animal odysseys. That was fascinating as well.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Cute for kids or just a date. Itâ€™s the perfect size for them and easy to navigate since itâ€™s just a big circle. It seems that they really care for their animals which is so important. Cleaning and feedings constantly. The fish and penguins and everything is incredible. A little pricey for the space but if it goes to the animals Iâ€™ll take it. That center tank is the main attraction of course absolutely beautiful.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I had such an incredible experience. I am so happy that I decided to come to the aquarium. Itâ€™s the perfect size, not too big or small, and there are plenty of different species of animals. The staff was really nice and my favorite part was touching the sting rays.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had a great time. Took us about 1.5 hours leisurely strolling to get through the whole thing. Lots if great information with the displays. Not too crowded. Love how you can see the penguins from lots of different angles and viewpoints.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My husband & I chose to visit the aquarium this morning to stay out of the rainy weather. Although the aquarium was crowded, we enjoyed our time there. The aquarium has a very unique layout. There are lots of animals to see & learn about. The penguins were most definitely my favorite! The ticket prices seemed reasonable for the experience. We parked in the parking garage near the aquarium & it is definitely over priced. Overall, we had a great time!
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's a bit pricey and it's difficult to find parking in the heart of the city. That being said, they have a very cool cylindrical tank going up all the way to the ceiling. It was cool to see all the different animal feeding times and at one point you could see two workers in scuba gear in the large tank. The sting ray touch tank was a big highlight.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Not as good as some of the other big cities. Still fun, but missing some of the more regular main attractions you would be used to seeing at a bigger city Aquarium (sharks, eels, dolphins, whales, larger sea life). The biggest thing they have is a large sea turtle. Beautiful, but just not a huge band for your very expensive buck. Biggest draw is the four floor tall aquarium tank in the center.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wonderful aquarium! The animals are treated well and are all healthy and safe. Staff are knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. Reasonably priced, a cute gift shop and a cafe with a view over the harbor. Great place for families and tourists. Say hi to the penguins for me!
title: New England Aquarium

text: This aquarium reminded us a lot of the National Aquarium in Baltimore, just on a slightly smaller scale. The location is terrific. It was most interesting to watch the staff interacting with and caring for the animals. It would have been nice to have more signs and more staff or volunteers posted on different levels to answer questions. We enjoyed our the theater film on turtles too.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was very easy to get tickets online, no waiting at the entrance, although it was quite crowded inside. Penguins were adorable, as well as seals and the big aquarium in the center is quite nice too. I really liked the information boards and possibility to watch feeding of the rays.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Highly recommend buying tickets online and getting there right when they open. Within half an hour it was very crowded, but totally worth it. So many things to see and learn here. The penguins and sea lions were delightful and I especially loved learning about the different environments certain fish live and thrive in. Really liked the sea horses and jelly fish exhibits.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Immediately fell in love with the penguins. And the animals seemed healthy and well cared for. Environments were very clean. Signs throughout were very informative/educational. There was sufficient space (at least on a Thursday in summer) for people to enjoy the aquarium without feeling like they were right on top of each other. We got in late and were actually hoping to grab a snack, but the cafe closed rather early, which was a disappointment. Both beverage machines were out of order, which didn't help matters on a hot day when we needed refreshment. I also thought the price of entry was steep, though we took advantage of the GoCity Boston pass and that helped.
All-in-all I'd recommend.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
4/5 stars because I wasn't super impressed with the overall offerings of live species.
I do love the design of the aquarium and the overall feel when you walk in to the penguin exhibit.

I've been to some great aquariums and I missed the sharks and the sea otters and in Oregon they even had an orca-which happened to be in the movie, Free Willy. Although that was years ago they still have a fantastic exhibit with many more species.

I don't want to be too harsh of a critic, but I was a bit underwhelmed.

I did enjoy the penguin exhibit, the seals and the big sea turtles.

The feel tank had stingrays alone. It was fine, but many feel tanks usually have starfish and other sea urchins. As well as someone commentating.

It was pretty busy and hard to get good pictures, since everybody else is trying to do the same thing.

Aquarium only:

Adults $34
Children over 3. $25
Seniors $32
title: New England Aquarium

text: There are sea dragons and beautiful jellyfish. The center tank is amazing. The seals are cute. The penguins are friendly and you can pet the stingrays. This place won't hurt your feet, it's not huge like SeaWorld. It's stroller friendly and senior friendly. Great for a date or to take your family.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
A must-visit on any trip to Boston. The Aquarium is beautiful and wonderful and all superlatives rolled into one, when it comes to an educational venue.

Turtles, sharks, penguins, seals, eels, jellyfish, rays you can pet...this place never loses its appeal for me. It's mesmerizing and calming and breathtaking in the diversity of natural beauty. A fascinating treasure of New England.

Expect to spend about 1.5-2 hours here if you really want to take it in and learn about the sea life and ecology; 1 hour even if you visit it like an art museum and let the beauty and color wash over your vision.

Tickets were $32 for adults. Gift shop is not big, but the gifts weren't stupidly expensive either.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Was a bit crowded there, which is understandable since it's summer so alot of kids are out, but besides that this place is pretty amazing! I've gone here ever since I was a little kid and even now I still love this place! Only thing mom family requested was possibly expanding the place and adding even more interesting water animals that aren't just from our oceans here in the Atlantic. They do have a few newer exhibits, but nothing a little more could hurt.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Loved the layout and our son enjoyed the aquarium.  Wish they had a full live shark exhibit like other aquariums we've visited.

I would recommend eating before going.  The cafe left a lot to be desired.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wish it was bigger. No sharks or any larger animals. Just a big circular tank in the middle with penguins at the base and other smaller tanks around the outside. While it was nice and the fish were awesome we found it lack luster. Finished the whole aquarium in like an hour. Was expecting more.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Caution - very crowded during peak season and when hot. Recommend go early. Parking can be around $40, but reduced with validation inside. Enter into penguins. Great variety! See the 500 pound sea turtle. Great learning areas.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
A little on the small side but the aquarium was a good time. There's a lot of cool fish and we got lucky enough to spot a diver in the big tank!

We went on a Saturday and it was a little crowded, so go during the week if you want to avoid people. I did feel at ease knowing that everyone was vaccinated though and am over zealous that they checked my vaccine card at the door.
title: New England Aquarium

text: such a fantastic place to visit, exhibits were well put together, very informative and the central tank is amazing. plenty to do with kids or adults. you can easily spend 2-6 hours perusing the different tanks. tickets prices are about normal for the area but you can find discounted tickets through your local libraries
title: New England Aquarium

text: We enjoyed it a lot. I wouldn't say this is the best aquarium. However, if you have not visited any aquarium in any other places like Atlanta, Virginia Beach, Cleveland, Niagara falls etc., this is a best visiting place for the people in and around Boston. If you have been to Atlanta Aquarium this is just one place. Little penguins and center tower three stories water tanks are the best attractions. It's fun for kids for sure.
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of the best aquariums I've ever been too. So much too look at. The giant coral reef with the spiral walkway all the way around it was so cool . Has so many things to look at one every floor. Giant turtle was the best!
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's overpriced but still a good option to visit with kids. Easy access from the subway but it can get pretty crowded. The collection is extensive and the main tank with the reef ecosystem in the middle provides some great views. The penguins and seals habitats were great but likely the best part of the visit was to "pet" the many rays in their shallow tank. I would come back here for sure despite the high price.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A wholesome experience, got to witness a beautiful and vibrant underwater world. Entry and exit was smooth, I loved the unique experience of touching electric rays. The gift shop was another beauty, perfect for kids. I wish they had more animals and some educational sessions going on.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great place for all ages! The penguins were so fun to watch! Bioluminescent jellies, giant sea turtles, sea horses, and so much more!! You can touch the sting rays and watch the sea lions. Even with timed ticket entry it was very crowded. Take your time and enjoy these magnificent creatures!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Great small aquarium.
It took around 1.5 hours to see everything (we didnâ€™t read every description)
We bought ticket for the movie but there was technical issue so they refund us :(
Love all the stuffs work there. Very welcoming and smiley!

One thing they could improve is the gift shop. There are not many cute things to buy.. a little bit disappointed that we couldnâ€™t buy something cute home.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Very nice aquarium and worth a visit while in Boston. Penguins are a highlight to see and there are plenty over viewing areas to sit and watch them.

All other wildlife is really interesting and the central circle exhibit has so much variety of animals it is hard to even spot them all!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great aquarium. Def worth a stop. Leave yourself some time for this one. My only complaint is there weren't sharks... They had lil ones but .... Not the same. Can't give it five stars cause it seemed a bit smaller than i expected but still cool.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
This aquarium is very unique in that there is a penguin exhibit along the entire first floor, then a spiral walk way up with a viewing tank in the center, with each floor having its own tanks as well. The top floor looks down on the center tank, with great views of the turtles.

Outside, the seals were LOVING the attention from passersby, and this visit the touch tank was open. We were able to touch sharks and stingrays, after being able to find a place to stand. It is difficult to walk around here and take your time, just because of the amount of people.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Visited Black Friday with family! Kids loved it! The new Sting Ray tank was amazing and the young ladies who interacted with us were very informative. We always love the penguins and sea lions were adorable, nice to see them swimming in their huge pool!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great experience for the whole family. Quite a few species and well maintained. Visit can easily last a couple hours if you don't speed through it and read a bit. Kids were fascinated.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Took the kids here for a nice activity during our vacation. It is pretty pricey but a nice experience. If you are driving pay for parking in advance there is no parking at the aquarium but there are lots of parking lots with in walking distance.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had a great time with my family although we arrived almost at closing time. The staff was nice and referred us to the exhibits that were closing first. The big tank was really cool. Start from the top floor if you can and walk your way down. Lots to see. Make sure to pat a stingray!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I would give more stars if I could. The price was definitely worth it at $34 apiece. We got to touch stingrays and see an octopus and tons of fish, as well as a seal show. So fun and absolutely great for kids.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's an OK experience.  Can walk through it in maybe 30m. Good for kids. The exhibits are small and in opp sides of the buildings. The center piece is a huge tank surrounded by a spiral walk way
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Iâ€™ve heard itâ€™s smaller than other big city aquariums but the center fish tank, penguin and sea lion exhibits make it all worth it. Iâ€™ve gone probably about 4x and love it each time. Itâ€™s good to go with young kids and theyâ€™ll love the shark/manta ray touch tank.
Food court on the second floor is convenient but the parking garage nearby is expensive and they donâ€™t validate. But worth it purely for the conveniency and bc street parking isnâ€™t an option in the nearby vicinity.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Amazing place for the family and another idea to spend quality time. Get there on time, 15 min grace period. If the Cafe inside is closed...they allow you to exit and grab a bite to eat and return to finish  the tour at your leisure. Great place for kids of course.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Lovely aquarium. I spent only 2hrs here & I believe I saw all the exhibits.Beside the sea lion show it was too cold. I spent about $150 at the gift shop and you had to pay for a bag. I believe at that point it should be free. Beside that the exhibits are worth every penny.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great aquarium!! Loads of fish in fun variations with nice tanks. I highly recommend touching the sting rays. They may have done our not Steve Irwin wrong, but these pancakes are completely harmless and slimey in the nicest way
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Should you travel to Boston stop at the Aquarium. The staff were friendly and informative.
During the Covid pandemic theyâ€™ve utilized social distancing and hand sanitizer stations as well as a mandatory mask requirement for adults and children (not toddlers) for â€œsafetyâ€.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Our family regrettably must award this aquarium one star. After visiting aquariums throughout the south east and west of the United States, this aquarium would be the smallest and least impressive. Our family saw everything in less than thirty minutes. We expected much more for a price of $30 and up.

In addition, our wheelchair-bound son required assistance with all but one door. Some of the doors have non-functional push buttons. While other doors required both doors to be open for his chair to go through.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was interesting. I saw penguins for the first time. There were so many type of fishes- I even got to see a small shark looking fish eat another fish ( not sure that was suppose to happen). I saw an anaconda. And of course all sections are labeled with information on each animal. I did not love the smell though.

text: I loved the layout of this aquarium. The spiral staircase was something Iâ€™ve never seen before and Iâ€™d like to say Iâ€™ve been to a lot of aquariums. Great place for kids and even if you wanna go on a date that doesnâ€™t require eating.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium was pretty cool, my stepdaughter really enjoyed it! I would highly recommend you purchase tickets online ahead of time because of how busy it gets and expect to spend some time looking for a parking spot in a parking garage, which there are several nearby, all not cheap.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very good aquarium besides the fact that there were no sharks or very big animalsâ€¦ besides seals and penguins. Interesting to learn about all of the fish and other aquatic life though! Alsoâ€¦ for kids they can pet stingrays which was pretty unique
title: New England Aquarium

text: Went there yesterday. Although, the website mentioned that they are allowing only 50% of the capacity but still it was too crowded. But at least most of them were in mask. So many verities of aquatic animals are there. Kids enjoyed their visit. The food options (small pizza, French fries, bars and drinks) are there but expensive. It is good to visit once.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Extraordinary place with an extraordinary mission. Not only does this place allows you to see a larger picture of what we are all part of. It also helps preserve and save endangered species.
The penguins are so gorgeous and adorable. Definitely going back.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Best Aquarium Ever! The location is awesome, the exhibits are fantastic, and the staff are incredible! This is a great place to take families and visitors to Boston. Before or after your visit to the Aquarium you can walk to all kinds of restaurants, shops and other attractions. We added a Harbor Cruise (right next to Aquarium), then walked to Faneuil Hall and North End. Great day!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had a great time at the New England aquarium. Seems to be if you go first thing in the morning thatâ€™s when the least amount of people will be there in my experience. Lots of cool tanks and an amazing sting ray/shark touch tanks.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The Aquarium has lost its mystic and The closure of the tidal pool tanks where you could pick up the starfish, crabs and stingrays.There really isn't much to see or do except the penguins. Especially for 35 something bucks for one adults admission. Thanks to a wonderful organization the tickets we received were gratefully donated to my child and I .
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Wow this place was so much more than I expected. It's huge and laid out very well. Everything was clean and well kept. The animals were awesome. Staff was great.
Excellent experience and I very highly recommend it.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice aquarium. Lots for kids to see. Small outside area with seals. Able to pet stingrays and sharks. Large center aquarium with ability to see turtles and many different fish.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A little small for the price, wish the touch tank was a little bigger for the kiddos, and they really would've loved to see a bigger shark. Even more skeletons of animals would've been cool! Overall a fun trip with the kiddos
title: New England Aquarium

text: I was very disappointed about the price of this place for how small it was. I have yet to find an aquarium that outshines Newport aquarium on the Ohio/Kentucky border. My kids were able to get through the aquarium in less than an hour. We loved the giant tank in the center of the aquarium though. The turtle seemed very curious about the visitors when they came up to the window.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Super cool and fun place to go! We just walked thru and looked at the animals- if you want to read everything there then I would budget 3-4 hours. The main attraction is their huge tank in the middle with a spiral walkway going around it- that was really cool and I could stand there for hours just looking at it. The penguins were awesome too- when we went they were being fed so they were swimming around.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I had so much fun here! So many exotic species to see from penguins and tropical fish to frogs and various turtle species, even an anaconda! A really fun and beautiful adventure for animal lovers everywhere!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
The size of this Aquarium is perfect for kids and toddlers (and of course adults too!). I say that because it's smaller than expected for perhaps an adult, yet it's small enough for your family to "see everything" in one visit without burning out or being overwhelmed.

It's fun, in a great part of town, and we love taking our kids here.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was a beautiful aquarium and I love how there is 4 floors to look at all the different fishies. It was very educational in each section with details on the region the fish is found in. My favorite were the penguins and big tortoise!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great penguin exhibit and I like the tall tank that you observe gradually going up in a spiral. They had a cabinet of marine life curiosities in the manta ray petting room that was fascinating
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Great aquarium. Our kids loved it. What sucked was the amount of people, crammed in, pushing you out of the way and tripping over strollers that are slammed into your legs. They said tickets were timed and entry was limited, due to covid19 and to avoid overcrowding, but it was definitely over-crowded.

The parents allowing their children to beat on the glass (and acting like it was cute behavior) was ridiculous. I know the aquarium cannot control how people behave, but there were no staff in the areas to correct that behavior (even though it is the parents job!!)

The seal tank out front of the aquarium entrance was a great idea! It made our kids even more excited to see the inside.

The stingray touch tank was so much fun! My youngest was nervous at first but was so glad he finally touched one. They had so much personality too!

It's definitely worth the price of admission! There is so much to see and explore.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Overall this is a really good experience. They've got a lot of really nice well-kept displays. It feels a lot like a lot of other aquariums though, and I won't say that it blew me away but it was very good. It was very crowded when we went but it was a holiday weekend. If it was less crowded I could have spent a lot longer in there for sure.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Amazing! Love the aquarium! We went out for the whale watch cruise today too and we saw more than a dozen humpback whales and dolphins too! It was amazing! Parking garage next door. Accessible. Knowledgeable staff. Gorgeous marine life. Pricing very reasonable.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium was ok. Not the best. Aquarium has whale watching cruise. It was really good. Aquarium has one big tank. And they have small tanks around. Big tank is the main icon. If you go to the aquarium take the whale watching tour too. You have to pay sperate for that. But it is very fun. We saw whales. And they explain every thing about whales.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We went here for a few hours and had a really good time. Itâ€™s easy to walk to and thereâ€™s parking nearby. We bought tickets ahead of time so we were able to walk right in and start seeing the place. Itâ€™s a well designed place making it easy to see the animals and exhibits. It never really felt crowded because people were pretty much exploring in different directions. Thereâ€™s a good assortment of sea-life covering different parts of the world. We also watched 2 of the IMAX movies that were being shown. The theater is on-site but in a different building right next door. The aquarium was clean and easy to get around. Itâ€™s right on the harbor so itâ€™s a nice area to walk around.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great small aquarium. Located right on the bay,  great views all in walking distance of downtown. We loved the penguins. The big tank is breathtaking. Well worth the visit. Very well designed. Definitely a must if you come to Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text: An aquarium visit is a great way to spend time in Boston. The facility is well-run and well-kept. Lots of space appears to be available for the animals to roam around in. The penguins are my favorite part! There's a lot of space for them and they're so cute. I like to play I-spy and find the turtles in the big tank (they usually are near the top). The afternoon was enjoyable overall. Visit is definitely worth the price, even if it is a bit expensive
title: New England Aquarium

text: Interesting exhibits with a clean, well-respected feel to it. You can't possibly go here and miss how close it is to all of Boston's major attractions. Definitely a good stop for the family or as part of an evening out in Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text: 4 stars for great customer service and reception. Parking was easily accessible. As an adult it was a bit underwhelming for me. I expected a lot more than what I experienced but i must say the kids had a great time. Will definitely still recommend as  this is still a great place for family fun activity.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Really cool aquarium! Itâ€™s kept very clean and has a neat layout. The tanks were big enough for the fish and animals inside, and had some cool interactive portions. One of the big perks was the sensory bags that you can borrow that come with noise cancelling headphones, a few stim toys, and communication cards. It made my visit way less stressful so I can enjoy the aquarium :)
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was cool seeing the harbor seals outside of the aquarium as we were getting our tickets. Nice African penguin reef. And a 4 story tank that had a fossilized turtle it looked like when we got to the top of the tank. There's a picture of it. He'd been there a long time it looked like. The other sea turtle was swimming and showing off for my camera. The jellyfish were pretty cool too. It was an ok aquarium but when you've been to the Atlanta aquarium nothing else can compare to the biggest aquarium in the USA. Like I said it was an ok place.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very good place for fun with family & kids. You can see lots of sea animals. Nice place. Have enough parking but pay parking. Good place for time spend.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Overall the aquarium is really nice, has a really cool concept of walking around the main tank. However, was a little disappointed with how small the aquarium is for a major city. We currently live in Connecticut and visited the Mystic Aquarium and that was our measuring stick. There isn't a ton of space, if you go on a busy day it can feel a bit cramped.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is a small to medium sized aquarium. It has lots of ascending and descending involved to see the animals in it, something to keep in mind if you easily get tired. There arenâ€™t a lot of animals to see here, so can get tad bit boring.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful aquarium. There are a large variety of fish and other aquatic animals to view. They also have an interactive attraction with stingrays.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A wonderful experience - I love how the aspect of conservation and rescue is present within the whole aquarium, which is one of the main reasons I visited in the first place. Touching rays was also amazing, and the staff was very clear and professional as well as super helpful !
title: New England Aquarium

text: Such a special place. The seals and penguins were my favorite. Overpriced gift shop but the experience the aquarium provided was 5 stars. I had an up close visit from a seal who smiled for me. Loved it!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Lots of colorful fishes. Has seals, penguins, all different size fishesn an orange lobster, live coral, jellyfishes, sea dragon, dwarf shrimp, Octopi & cuttlefish, etc. Huge fish tank. title: New England Aquarium

text: Brought my son for his first visit, and my first visit since I was a kid myself. We loved it!! So much! All the exhibits were beautiful and interesting, the great ocean tank we spent so much time at because it was so amazing. Gift shop has no prices labeled except the plushes so be careful there or you'll end up with with a $14 magnet. Lol. Looking forward to coming back soon!
