text: 5.19.2022 visited NEA. A spiral center aquarium with lots to learn & see. Kids would love this. Bring along your kids and spend a good 2-3 hours exploring this aquarium and learning about sea creatures.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I loved it, it's not as big as I thought but the fishes look great they have variety and a lot on information. They only have one kind of penguins wich makes it more alike to the real habitat. The temperature is cool so that's one of the reasons they don't have antartic penguins but African Penguins, those require lower temperatures.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Im really not to impressed with my experience here. They have very limited exhibits and this museum is not really that big at all. I went this last weekend and I felt that it was way to over crowded, especially during a pandemic. They had some nice salt water fish to obseve. Very limited freshwater exibits. Wish there was a bigger observation with sharks, would have loved to have learned more. On the bright side I enjoyed watching the penguins.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Lots of things to see and read. The six story salt water display was over the top. The octopus and seals display were very good. It has a good size gift shop.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Didnâ€™t realize how old the ship was until got on board. The seats were a bit dirty, ceiling leaking, maintenance needed. Very friendly staff, very helpful and informative broadcast. They knew of almost all of the whales in that area. You can tell these staff/researchers definitely got a lot of enthusiasm/love for them whales. Over all positive experience.
title: New England Aquarium

text: There was a public parking lot nearby but we spent $42 just for visiting the aquarium. We saw many cute animals including Seahorses, Penguins, and Jellyfish. You can even touch the shark (Batoids, a kind of squashed shark).
title: New England Aquarium

text: We had a great day here. Touching the rays was really neat. The exhibits we're vibrant and the space is laid out well, never too crowded.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Love this aquarium. Lots of sea creatures to see. The highlight and the stars were when the penguins turned their backs on their feeder because they didn't like the fish he was feeding them that day.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great aquarium, penguins are very engaging right when you enter the aquarium, feeding time is always fun to see. I appreciate the balance of educational material available on climate change, endangered species and the animals themselves. They have a touch tank where the employees are very conscious to educate kids on how to not scare the animals. The main part of the aquarium has a large tank that spans all the floors, with a walkway going around it that takes you up. There are giant eels, turtles, schools of fish, and tons of other animals. Overall, the aquarium isn't huge, though. It is definitely a great visit, but could be completely explored in an hour even if you spend some time at all the exhibits. If you only have a couple days to visit Boston, I would say this isn't a must see as it is similar to most other aquariums- but if you're already near the harbor and have some extra cash it is a wonderful and engaging time for kids!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful aquarium!  Excellent staff!  Easy to walk all floors.  Animals look healthy and well cared after!  Thank you!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very pretty! All kinds of fish I just feel like itâ€™s missing something! The large tank that goes all the way to the top is very cool! Just really stinks that thereâ€™s no parking for the price already being expensive!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Good place to spend time with your kids. Might not be that much amusing to adults. Underwater tunnel is a big attraction to me which is missing here. It's not that big. One to two hours is enough for covering all sections. Boston Harbor cruise boarding point is just nearby. It's a good idea to plan these together. Entry fee seemed a bit costly. But there are some packages for multiple places visit which reduces the overall cost.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I expected it to be bigger, but it was still awesome to see. The structure inside of the building is definitely one of a kind. Would love to see it again but the cost for parking there is ridiculous. I don't recommend parking there for 80 min it's almost like $40ish dollars.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fun experience.  Lots of interesting animals, and even a 90 year old turtle.  There are just too many common fish to make it a five star visit.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We brought my daughter here for her 5th birthday, it was her 2nd time going but she was too young to remember the 1st time. She loved it. Great for kids and their touch pool is awesome!! You get to pet stingrays!! Fun for kids and adults of all ages, Soooo many diff things to see! My favorite exhibit is the lion's mane jellyfish!! They are huge!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Kids loved the central tank! My younger one was so happy to see Nemo and the huge turtle.. Kids were excited to see penguins jumping and swimming ..
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Great getaway for the weekend!
The tix is $32 for adults, $30 for college students only.
The interactive shark tank was one of the best features of this aquarium, you get to touch the sharks softly while they swim by.
The seals were also very eye catching and you will be able to watch them interact and play with the trainers
There are also two different kinds of penguins at the entrance of the aquarium

The aquarium isnâ€™t too big, but you can spend around 2 hours in there. Expect to see so many different marine species youâ€™ve never seen before!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
The grandkids saw some sea lions swimming in a tank before we even went in and it got them excited and interested but thatâ€™s the only free thing youâ€™ll get all day. Letâ€™s start with parking in the garage next door they own. $46 to park for 3 hours. Ticket prices are outrageous especially for kids. And Senior discount, what a joke; $2 off per ticket. That wonâ€™t even by me a half gallon kg gas. There are some nice features to the facility. The central attraction is a large tank in the middle with penguins on the lower level and then all the fish and turtles in the tank. Tip: take the elevator to the top floor (4th) and walk â€œdownâ€ the spiral walkway that wraps around the tank. Itâ€™s less crowded and easier than walking up the ramp especially with old ones and the little ones. Another great area is the Stingray tank. You can put your hands in the water and stroke the rays as they glide by under water. The little ones loved this. There is a shark exhibit on the floor below this area but real sharks are limited to some small species and baby sharks. My 5 year old granddaughter began singing; you guessed it: â€œ Baby Shark do do da do, baby shark____â€
Besides the cost of parking and entrance fees there are other costs that are high. Just like Disney World you canâ€™t exit unless you go through the Gift Shop. The first items thrust into your face are the overpriced stuffed fish, sharks, etc. While my grandkids are very good about excepting No for an answer I fully understand that for some children itâ€™s hard and I find this set up very unfair to families. The cafeteria is pretty small and is very limited. It is self serve, precooked burgers, hot dogs, fries, etc. No GF options in real food, just a GF cookie. Prices are what you would expect for a facility that has you trapped.
Another criticism of the entire facility is a lack of continuity and sine age and directions. Because everyone is afraid to hand out printed brochures anymore ( sustainably) you have no idea what is available in the aquarium and how to find it. Employees are limited so there are no guides or personnel stationed strategically throughout to assist you. Overall it was an ok experience but a tough nut to swallow if youâ€™re on a tight budget. If you find yourself in the mid Cape area with little ones, do yourself a favor and take them to Cape Cod Museum of Natural History (Brewster). While itâ€™s not an Aquarium itâ€™s similar in being a museum for natural wonders. Itâ€™s way more hands on, interesting and informative. There are plenty of employees to help you, you get a map with a scavenger hunt on it for the little ones. The price of admission is reasonable and there is free parking.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Grandson, nearly 3 years old, and 4 adults in the group, loved the visit. The skate pool and the penguins were a hit with him, but the big center tank and other individual displays, including the weed sea dragon, were all exciting.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The kids had a great time at the aquarium on their field trip. The staff was very informative and helpful. The aquarium is very clean and has lots to see.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Amazing stop.lots of things for kids and adults to see. Lots of beautiful aquarium displays with fish from around the world. Every corner has something new to look at. Interesting interactive displays and tidbits of knowledge all over.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
This is a really small aquarium centered around a cylinder tank and is mainly a verticle aquarium with penguins

I think its overpriced for what it offers. I think it might be good for a short 2 hour visit for kids but adults will find this place underwhelming
title: New England Aquarium

text: The New England Aquarium was a decent experience, but it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The tanks and exhibits were well maintained, and although it has a decent selection of sea creatures the crowds can make the experience overwhelming. The exhibits can become congested and it can be difficult to get a good look at the animals. Overall, the Aquarium is a decent option if you're looking for a quick and easy attraction to check out, but there are better options out there for those who are looking for a more memorable afternoon.
title: New England Aquarium

text: You must pet the Sea Rays!!! Still had a great time as an adult with no kids! Didn't take too long to go through for us.  Loved the giant fish tank in the middle that you get to walk around and see the different levels.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
That is amazing place . My kids enjoy 7 years & 3 years old.
Price is good , staff is good , very clean place . A lot of animals ,georges :) . If somebody going to Boston ,that place is important to check.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Was my first time going love how they have the seals outside kids loved watching them play and swim around keep them entertained while we waited to get inside i think there was too many ppl not enough space to see all the animals but it was nice seen alot of penguins did not see any sharks wish we could have seen more
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium is ok. You can walk the whole thing in an hour. I was hoping for more interactive entertainment like another show or seals but we got to see the penguins feeding and the seals playing in their tanks. My kids got bored afte4 we walk the whole thing.  The gift shop has nice things some were kind of pricey.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had sooo much fun!!! The kids loved it!! The sharks are no longer there. They died. So we were a little disappointed. But over all it was fun.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fun but CROWDED- plan accordingly.  You will be fighting your way through screaming toddlers, parents pushing strollers and teenagers not paying attention to anything going on around them- timed entry is still a thing so maybe try for a less crowded late afternoon or early morning entry.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful aquarium! Lots to see. I have been there years ago. Looking for the pictures. Unfortunately canâ€™t find them. Recommend strongly everyone who enjoys aquarium time is a great place to spend with family.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We reserved the 11:40 time slot for Saturday thinking they were limiting entry. Boy were we wrong. It was an absolute zoo. You couldn't walk or turn around without running into people. The aquarium itself is nice. We enjoyed the layout with the central tank and the spiral walkway around it. It was just a little difficult to enjoy with so many people. Had to wait in line to get up to any of the tanks.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very nice aquarium by the water. Felt a little  bit  crowded on Memorial Day  weekend. Many people were  not wearing masks indoors as it  was  not required. Collection of sea creatures were decent.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Would I come back?No.
The penguins caught my families eyes. It took us maybe 45min to walk through. I wish there was more sea creatures. The gift shop I also thought could have sold more stuff. We waited to pet the sting rays at the end and that was also a great experience.
The facility is also clean. The staff were very knowledgeable and friendly.  My children really enjoyed themselves. I also really appreciated seeing everyone wear their mask.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I enjoyed the aquarium but expected more.  I was able to tour the whole aquarium in less than 2 hours. I tried to find Myrtle the Turtle but somehow she evaded me that day.
title: New England Aquarium

text: There's really nothing quite like it. Plenty of nice aquariums out there, but this is the place!! Aside from navigating Boston, it's pretty easy on and off. Parking was fine. Nice gift shop and cafe. Everything was excellent.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Hadn't been here in years. I love this kind of experience. They had people talking about the animals and the workings of the aquarium. Afyer we ealked over to Faneuil Hall Market and has some clam chowder.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Exciting space, the way the exhibits are designed is very linear and intuitive, you get to see everything at once but also are able to delve deeply into the specifics! Beautiful creatures and plenty of awesome animals all over. A must visit if you love sea creatures and penguins!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I really love the Boston Aquarium.  They have the most beautiful exhibits.  My only comment is that if you require people to buy timed entry tickets then it shouldn't be so darn crowded.  It was so busy that we had trouble seeing some of the exhibits, and that was during the week.  We couldn't get anywhere near the touch tanks.  So I left a little disappointed.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wonderful place, amazing view and boat ride. I roam around the place including north end where there are many Italian restaurants, financial hub, downtown, Hay Market and street performance.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great aquarium with a huge central tank.  You can watch divers go into the tank and feed the fish twice a day and do maintenance twice a day while someone is at the top commenting and answering questions.  You can see inside the tank walking around 3 levels.  There is also a great viewing area at the seal tank and a really good penguin exhibition etc.  There are some very interesting fish species that I had never seen before and a tank with ray that you can put your hand in and let the rays brush up against you.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great as a one time visit. I personally don't think the ticket price equates to the experience. I expected there to be a lot more animals and hands on activity here.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Very nice place. You can bring in water but no food.
The prices in the food court and store were very expensive. Got to pat the sting rays. They have many mini tanks along the wall
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Went here with friends and it was absolutely so much fun! Volunteers were cleaning the penguin exhibit and there was an employee also holding a penguin to apply some medication to its feet and waiting for it to dry. I asked her a ton of questions and learned so much from her! I loved learning about the penguins - how their identify male from female, territory, how they are raised, etc.

Highly recommend visiting. Great place for kids and for cute dates!
title: New England Aquarium

text: $34 dollars a person to basically walk up a 3 story sea spiral.. really underwhelming and disappointing. Takes about 35 minutes to walk throughâ€” Itâ€™s mobbed on the weekends and is claustrophobic being stuck in the spiral with 1,000 people. Lacking joy; really no spaces / exhibits for self exploration as you just follow the crowd up and then back down. If your aquarium is just going to be 12 penguins and 4 sea lions, it better be the the best conditions available for these critters to be highlighted and celebrated. They need to upgrade, modernize, and do better for the animals calling this place their home instead of sticking them in the middle of the room in a small enclosure. Shame on you New England Aquarium!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: This aquarium is very small and well kempt. They do have an interactive exhibit where you can touch rays and smaller sharks. Their penguin exhibit lies at the base of the central aquarium where over one hundred fish swim with turtles. It was fun but because of itâ€™s size, you wonâ€™t need much time there.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
An amazing experience with breathtaking sea life. The highlights for us was the ability to touch select sharks and rays in the touch tank and watching over 30 penguins chilling on the ground floor.

They also have a giant stairwell which wraps around a gigantic tank, which has thousands of fish, where you can see schools of fish, giant sea turtles and hundreds of kinds of fish.

Small sharks, seals, Sea horses, ancient fish,  poison dart frogs, puffer fish and rare coastal birds were also there.

The gift shop is also definitely worth visiting although things are a bit pricey.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Was a wonderful afternoon of delightful animals and incredible views. I have never been to an aquarium that was so well maintained that you couldnâ€™t smell the penguins 15 minutes before seeing them. The harbor seals were so much fun to watch as we waited for our appointment time that the kids didnâ€™t want to leave them. Inside was a little crowded but the aquarium tank went all the up the center of the building and gave such amazing views of the marine life that we didnâ€™t mind the crowd. The sea lions were adorable and personable and lead the girls arguing which was cuter between them and the harbor seals. We will definitely return and I am sure we will find new favorites every time
title: New England Aquarium

text:
As far as aquariums go, it gets the job done. However, all the signs made it seemed like there were more exhibits than there actually were. Disappointed at the small size, but the exhibits that were offered were well organized and had lots of great sea life to see. The highlight was seeing the rockhopper penguins â€” SO CUTE. There is also a touch-tank where you can touch sting rays and sharks (ones safe to touch, of course!) which was a great opportunity! Very educational, clean, and well kept. Great staff, too. They seemed very involved in the exhibits, passionate, and knowledgable, which is exactly what is needed when dealing with animals, especially many endangered species.

One thing I wished to see were axolotls! They were included on an information board, but then absent in the exhibits.

There was also quite a few creatures that can be seen in Animal Crossing, so it's great for ac fans!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Really cute vertical aquarium. There is a HUGE salt water tank in the center of the building. It is filked with hundreds of different species of aquatic life, including a 95 year old sea turtle named Myrtle. There are a lot if staff that work with a monitor the different fishâ€™s behavior, any abnormalities, and provide care if needed. Such a great place for kids and adults. Only heads up is they say they have sharks on exhibit, which technically is true, but they are baby sharks in different tanks. Still love the place. This is my third time going in the last 10 years.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Brought the family here during our day trip to Boston.  Lines were very short to get in, ticket scanning process was smooth, and liked they had hand sanitizer everywhere.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fun exhibits. Just the right amount of information and animals to see them all without cramming anything in. The Cafe prices were laughable for the quality and gift shop items way over priced.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fantastic aquarium, loved the penguin areas, nice and open for them. The center big tank was super cool going all the way to the top. The sea turtles circled on the top, which kinda made me sad..they deserve so much more space. Only other thing was how busy it was, thought the time slots would've mitigated larger crowd, but on a Saturday it didn't seem to matter.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Awesome place to take your kids and have a good time. Took my 10 year old son and he absolutely loves this place. It was obviously a bit crowded but we managed.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Loved the aquarium.  It very well maintained and there's a fair amount of exhibit to visit. I will suggest making reservations before going because it can get sold out pretty quickly on a nice sunny day.  There's a parking lot just across, if you're spending more than an hour and a half it will cost you $40 ( but that's the maximum, the highest listed fee for 80 minutes to 24 hours.  ) . There are probably cheaper options if you don't mind walking . After visiting you can also walk around the area to visit or relax, might as well enjoy that $40 parking. It was really nice.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My faves were the sea turtle, sea horses and of course the penguins.  However,  all the exhibits were great. From colorful coral to sassy seals. From slithering snakes to jolly jellyfish.  So much to look at and enjoy!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Aquariums generally don't excite me much. However, I thoroughly enjoyed the way this one is set up. The huge aquarium in the center allows you to see the creatures from all angles. The walkway spirals around the tank, starting from the bottom all the way to above the surface, allowing you to see the fish and creatures from many different depths.

The place is very clean, which was apparent when watching the penguins. We didn't experience that fishy smell that usually accompanies penguin exhibits. Also, the penguins have such a large place to hang out. They looked like they really were having fun!

If you enjoy visiting aquariums, I would recommend this one.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very clean and animals are obviously well cared for. Staff were very nice. Seeing Myrtle the turtle was such a treat! It was really crowded though with no traffic pattern. We were bummed about the touch tank being closed but we totally understand. Overall we had a good experience.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
You donâ€™t need a reservation to enter, so that was a major plus. The highlight was the tank at the top of the aquarium.
However the place was severely overpacked - to the point where you couldnâ€™t even see the marine life. So is it really worth the $34 ticket?
Another bad practice is the amount of camera flashes that disturb the creatures in the tank.
But this is a must if you visiting Boston. I am glad I went.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Visited on a weekday in August 2022. Nice aquarium but way too crowded to be enjoyable. Could hardly move inside without bumping into people. Canâ€™t recommend this, especially for the price. They limit tickets based on entry times, but it feels like they are letting too many in at once.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Amazing place to go with family and friends. Lots of things to see and touch tanks. Should space out 1-2 hours for the visit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Cool animals and exhibits, but the amount of people they let in till they're at max capacity is insane. Can't see much of anything unless you like waiting.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I loved what we saw & did enjoy our time here! The sting rays were our favorite. We were hoping for sharks so they do not have sharks here but they do have information and a center for sharks to visit still. I would of also loved hearing from staff to teach us. We didnâ€™t interacted with any staff here but the front gate. Small aquarium so it felt a bit over crowded for us even with reservations. I would plan 1.5-2 hours to visit here. The cafe was not open during this time.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Must visit!
One of the must see at Boston!
Located in the harbor and close to the center.
On the 2nd floor you can find a cafe with fast food.
The kid's ticket is 25$.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Always love coming here- so much so we became members and we always start showing off Boston with an aquarium visit. Staff is so knowledgeable, passionate, and skilled in exciting visitors.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Took our 19 month old grandson here with the family over Thanksgiving.  It was pricey, but for a good cause. Turns out that they help rehab sea creatures and turn them back out to the sea once they prove they can sustain themselves. If they don't reach that mark, the team keeps the animals in-house. I loved the sea horses and turtles.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is a smaller regional aquarium - itâ€™s worth a visit if you like fish, learning, or have never been to an aquarium before. Itâ€™s not like sea world or Monterey Bay and has no exhibits with otters, dolphins, whales, or sharks. The fish are beautiful and seem well kept and they also have some amphibians, sea lions, reptiles, and coral. The interior is dark, cramped, and could use an update. It looks like all the exhibits were built forty years ago and itâ€™s very crowded and noisy inside. It takes about an hour and a half to go through the whole thing. The location is in a fun part of Boston to explore.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love aquariums and  this wasnâ€™t the exception. Although many people wouldnâ€™t give five stars because is not that big I liked it! The part that I liked the most was touching the rays and the sharks. It was an amazing experience even if they were small. We also enjoyed watching the penguins and eels. I also got a little souvenir:)
title: New England Aquarium

text: The staff is very helpful and insightful regarding the exhibits. The animals look well taken care of and healthy
title: New England Aquarium

text: Spent a few hours here recently.  Jelly tank is so relaxing to look at.  Ray and shark touch tank is worth the trip alone! Not to mention getting to spend some time with the legend herself: myrtle the turtle. That is one beautiful old soul! â¤ï¸
title: New England Aquarium

text: Always a very fun experience, very interactive, and family-friendly! Ticket & parking prices have gone up (along with everything in this world..), but it's well worth the price!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful Aquarium! All of the animals were very active and healthy. The layout of the building was good for circulating around the exhibits. Staff were friendly. Watch your shins for runaway strollers on the winding ramp! What? No postcards? Get your printer up and running guys! If I lived here I'd have a membership!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Amazing experience. I went with 3 other adults and enjoyed this so much. Say hello to Myrtle the turtle for me, she is beautiful!
title: New England Aquarium

text: A great time with my 3 kiddos. Plenty of things to look at and interact with for several hours. The food court is rather pricy considering what it is. There is several options however. The good thing is you can bring your own lunch. There are lockers that you can rent as well. They are $5 for a small or $7 for a large. Was slightly disappointed that they didn't have schedule times to do the sea lion show any more, it's done randomly was what I was told when I asked the front desk. So we never got to see the show as we didn't know when it was going to happen. And we did sit there for 30mins waiting and hoping, but it didn't happen.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
I was a little disappointed... The aquarium came highly recommended to me, so I went there with very high expectations, just to find out that the octopus was not there yet and the shark exhibit didn't actually have any big live sharks, just tiny ones.
Pretty small aquarium, but ok if you want a little activity for the kids.

It was clean though, with sanitizing stations at the entrance,... interesting species of sea life, cute penguins and sea lions.

You can easily see everything in about 90 minutes.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium is fine, i have been to so many aquariums, this ranges more on the middle. I do not like the layout, because there is no flow and if itâ€™s busy you always walk in people or they walk into you.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful place... just overly crowded. It was way too crowded and it made it difficult to walk around, view everything  and enjoy. We actually left faster than what we would have liked, but it was just too crowded despite having time slots. The kids were over stimulated and the adults were drained from trying to navigate through the crowd with the littles.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Highly recommended for anyone of all ages. The sea lion feeding was neat. Touching the sharks and rays was my favorite.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Awesome visit to the New England Aquarium! The open viewing of the penguins and sting ray was great. Also an amazing experience to touch the sting ray!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Magical experience guaranteed for kids and adults alike. Beautifully designed aquarium full of so many unique species of fish that it is seem unreal. Please support the aquarium by visiting and learning more about our beautiful planet.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
I'm only sharing one photo, albeit a unique one for this review because I feel this an aquarium to be experienced. The only other aquarium I'm fairly familiar with is the Georgia State Aquarium which I've been to a few times.

What I like about the New England Aquarium is:
* No annoying "Brought to you by Home Depot!" signs every 15 feet
* The ability to be a little bit closer to some frens, like the Sea Lions and Penguins. You also get to see them get fed, which is pretty cool ðŸ˜®
* The neat, large, vertical tank in the center of the Aquarium -- this is pretty cool!
* Displays that are slightly more unique than other Aquariums
* Knowledgeable staff
* Being able to pet a sting-ray!!!!!!! ðŸ¤¯

The only thing that makes me sad is, it felt a little small with the amount of people. This may have been due to showing up on a Friday and going with a party of my peers. You learn some pretty cool facts about some of the frens they have and how old they are in the Aquarium. Very neat place :)
title: New England Aquarium

text: A tad smaller than I thought it would've been, however, nonetheless beautiful! I came here with my girlfriend and was thoroughly blown away! The penguins are adorable and the immediate whale skeleton was gigantic!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had a great time and felt like a kid again getting to pet the stingrays! The penguins are always adorable. My kids had a great time too.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Stunning.

Check in with your local library to see if they might offer discounts. The Lowell Public Library was able to give us 50% off of up to 4 adult tickets.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Public aquarium with a wide variety of exotic fish including piranhas and mantas, birds (penguins), reptiles (turtles, anacondas), mammals (seals), jelly fish, corals, etc. However there are no big or mid size sharks - nevertheless it's definitely worth seeing!
title: New England Aquarium

text: The last time I have been to the New England Aquarium was 8/8/2022 with my daughters, and it has completely evolved from having only New England aquatic animals to more wildlife from 3 additional habitats across the Americas. I never knew that I lived near the Gulf of Maine and a National Marine Sanctuary inside it is designated by NOAA. I always used NOAA religiously for the weather forecast.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
It was my first time visiting. I loved it. The penguins were fun but smelled of fish (ðŸ¥´) but don't let that deter youðŸ˜…
Hope you like the pics. Will take better ones on my next visitðŸ’ªðŸ¾
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had an awesome time checking out the penguins and all the different fish. Great time for kids, my son had a blast would definitely recommend.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We had a great time seeing all of the exhibits. Everything was clean and well-lit, and the staff was informative and patient with visitors.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium had a friendly and efficient ticketing agent and the phone representative was very helpful. Myself and a 12 year old had a great time. There are many fish displays, but the penguins seem to steal the show. Itâ€™s a unique aquarium that goes upstairs rather than being spread out. It is a smaller aquarium than many, but everything they have is well maintained.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wonderful experience. It's smaller than a lot of other ones, it can also be expensive so be ready for that. There are a number of parking lots around it as well as places to eat and visit within walking distance and some gifts shops. They have sharks, many fishes, 3 turtles, pet a string ray, sea lions shows.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Amazing aquarium, kids loved it and it's in a perfect area to walk around to really appreciate the city. Won't be the last time we go for sure. Definitely plan to get there early so you can fully enjoy the area, plenty of things to see and plenty of good food.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Too crowded for a weekday! And what's with the timed entry? Doesn't serve any purpose at all unless you live locally and get there first entry of the day, then it might be nice for 20mins or so. Also, the cafe was closed (and we didnt know until we arrived) and there were no other, reasonable, food options near by. It was far too smelly and hot inside for any extra stars. As a southerner visiting Boston (a city I LOVE). I would not recommend this place to anyone.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
We had a lot of fun!
I absolutely love aquariums! I love having fish around me and seeing different and unique sea creatures. When you enter the aquarium you have a giant pool with tons of penguins. Usually they put the penguins in the end of the aquarium but you actually go around it because the aquarium is a tall building and you go up and in circles. The large tank in the middle have lots of different species of fish and some sea turtles.
The gift shop at the end was a bit of disappointment. Most of the things was targeted for kids and the variety of items wasn't high. They had some Pampers diapers for some reason.
Overall we really enjoyed ourselves, we stayed there for about three hours!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Always a great time. Probably not a full day spent here, could see everything in about 2 hours but plenty of fun things nearby. And the penguins in the back are hilarious!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Overall, pretty interesting place with a lot of exhibits and information but the price tag is really high unless you are exceptionally interested in aquatic ocean life.
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of the best aquariums I ever visited. Perfect place, either for kids and for their parents. The life under water is so colorfull...
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Very beautiful place,  amazing Job done by management.
Really appreciate the hard work of whole team.
One of the best place to visit with children.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
We did the whale watching and aquarium ticket combo. It was well worth the cost. We saw over 7 different whales and didnâ€™t go more than 5 minutes without seeing a whale come up. We saw humpback whales, minke whales, and an ocean sunfish!!

The aquarium is also very cool. More unique than others Iâ€™ve been to with a huge circular tank in the middle that you go on a ramp around it to the different levels. The penguins were fun to watch and they also have fur sea lions too.
title: New England Aquarium

text: What a great place. Kids loved it and so much going on right outside. We walked there from the harbor near the USS Constitution and it was very manageable. Huge round 4 level tank goes all the way up the center of the building with a circular ramp going round all the way up. If in Boston with kids you should definitely make it a point to go. We read if you drive the parking was very expensive so we just walked. We tried for a water taxi bit it didn't work out. Only better aquarium we have been to is the one in Newport KY.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Great for a day trip! The penguins were awesome and there was a ton of informative signage!
If you want to avoid the crowds, go early on a weekend. The weekend gets a little crowded
title: New England Aquarium

text: Love the live coral reef display. Due to their difficulty and necessary upkeep, these displays are often left out or underwhelming in aquaria. Thanks for showing off these amazing and important ecosystems that are feeling the effects of human "progress". Pic of the African penguins.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Loved the big tank in the center, and the pigeons were awesome... Such a great afternoon adventure!
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was nice. But itâ€™s very small! Itâ€™s literally one buildingâ€¦it was a bit lack luster. But I enjoyed the touch tank.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
With many sea species, the place is incredibly special.
The place is very busy independent of the week so go easy and peaceful and enjoy space
The kids are gonna love it.
title: New England Aquarium

text: First time going to an aquarium and it was just absolutely incredible!!! I went earlier this year and had to go again this recent Summer!  TONS of animals/fish/sealife! Place was clean, covid guidelines were great, staff was excellent! Loved the penguins!!! Also loved that giant tank with tons of windows to see everything and you can walk up to the top! Lots of exhibits to see and lots to learn! Will defiantly keep coming back! Also nearby is boat tours of Boston! Itâ€™s just absolutely perfect!
title: New England Aquarium

text: It can be reeaaaal crowded depending on the time/date. Has a lot of fishies and penguins so I canâ€™t complain, but itâ€™s quite expensive for a ticket.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was amazing I went with 4 kids,me and my step dad.Food is like at a hospital so the food deserves 4 stars.But the Seal show is so cute
title: New England Aquarium

text: Absolutely beautiful and incredible experience!!! ðŸ¤¯ðŸ˜ I love how it is all handicap accessible, although I am not handicapped, my mother in law has a boot on her foot, so it was a great experience because of the accessibility. The penguin exhibit is absolutely amazing and just wonderful to sit and listen to the noise and when they would fight. I'm someone that is incredibly against any kind of zoo, or SeaWorld type of places but I did read up on this place and found that they do some sanctuary work and conservation as well so I agreed to go here and let me tell you ... When you walk up through the levels ... Such beauty such amazing fantastic views, the fish, the life that lives within this water was absolutely amazing and so very beautiful. Some things, fishes and other aquatic life that I have never seen and I loved it but my daughter just absolutely loved it and wanted a penguin. Also, the larger sea turtle in the giant cylinder aquarium, is 95 years old and when my mother in law was a child, that very same turtle was just a young little baby and than when my husband was a young child, this same turtle was mid aged and so big and beautiful. They have pictures from their times with this same turtle. Just a wonderful place, very informative, sea lions to watch them swim and play around outside as you waited was wonderful. Also, while we waited we got to walk around the giant walkway that surrounds the aquarium and also has the boats for people that want to go whale watching or just a boat ride. There's also the duck tour boats where they go from moving vehicle to a boat. It was fun to see the very old and antique ship too and to take pictures with my family on the ocean. Just beautiful and wonderful experience altogether. The gift shop has some pretty amazing items to buy! And although it can be a bit pricey, for the most part it's actually less pricey than others we've been to on this trip. Overall, a very enjoyable activity to do with family and kids.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I was expecting a lil more but that's on me. It was crowded so at times it was hard to get my grandson in position to see certain displays but there's nothing you can do about that. Plenty of exotic sea creatures to see. It took us about an hour or so to mover through everything and we weren't going fast at all so in that sense the cost was a lil frustrating. Overall it was a good experience.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love the aquarium so nice perfect for the whole family is a big place very fun!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Holy smokes what an aquarium! Very well set up. Unique views of Boston Harbor, and well thought out exhibits. Pro tip* be there in the first 2 hours of opening to catch feeding times!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Check your local public library for 50% ticket discount-I got it in Framingham public library. Other than that an amazing aquarium maintained very well with loads of species
title: New England Aquarium

text: My kids had a great time. In my opinion, 2 hours is enough to cover all the aquarium. *Important note:The aquarium does not have any sharks
title: New England Aquarium

text: My partner of 5 years proposed here yesterday (12/07/21) by the sea lions and seals and it couldn't have been better. I absolutely love the ocean and it's creatures and this facility is one of the better ones I've been to. The animals look happy and well cared for, and throughout our visit from 12-5 they were all checked on and fed their special  diets. Cleaners were consistently going from level to level cleaning and sanitizing, and all staff and guests were very diligent about staying masked up. Can't wait to come back! This is a very special place, now in more ways than one!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I must say that, for the price, this was a bit disappointing as we were hoping to see big sharks but they only have baby sharks, at least on July 5, 2022. But great for younger children as they do have the touch the stingray exhibit.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Enjoyed the aquarium but it was EXTREMELY crowded and there wasnâ€™t any attempt to social distance. The young man greeting folks outside was friendly and excited. We enjoyed the penguins but were very disappointed that the manta ray experience was not available. I also wanted to commend the employee doing the educational discussion about lobster traps and buoys. She was very informative and engaging. I do think this is a fun place and the fish are beautiful but if I had to compare it to New Orleans Aquarium  it falls a little short.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The giant fish tank in the middle of the building is fascinating, the ramp that wraps around it on 3 levels allows you to watch the various species move around, from deeper to shallower waters. We nearly missed the seals, the signage is a bit lacking, and could only watch them for a minute before it closed... Some displays are also a bit bright and reflects on the tanks which can be a bit distracting (and doesn't look good on the pictures...) Otherwise really enjoyed the visit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: This place is really nice. All the animals are so cute! Really loved seeing the seals and myrtle the turtle. Also loved seeing the penguins. There's a lot to do and the staff is more then willing to help. And they are very educated. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone visiting around Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Was super crowded nice but overwhelming at points great aquarium other wise buetifuel views of Boston harbor on the back side was still a enjoyable experience
title: New England Aquarium

text: Loved the aquarium. Well worth the time and money. Take the time to look at all the exhibits.  Starts with the penguins and then slowly make your way up to the top of the 200,000 gallon aquarium. Then go back down the sides and look at all the different smaller exhibits, oh and the seals near the back and touch pen and shark area. A ton to see. Give yourself well over an hour or two.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Highly recommend this aquarium. My kids loved it. In the basement there was a section that you can pet & touch Roy fish & sharks! Don't forget to do that.

Staff are beyond amazing.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Really nice aquarium. It seems a little busy for the size of the facility, but it's still fun.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Fun for the whole family! Pet some sting rays. Stare at some penguins starring back at you! The penguins are worth the cost of entry alone! Exhibits around every corner; a must see while in Boston.

Short walk from the subway and Quincy Market. A perfect day trip, but would be much better if you had the whole weekend there.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Lovely aquarium to visit if you have a couple hours to spare in Boston. We enjoyed the central tank that spanned all 4 floors of the aquarium, as well as the seals and sea lions.
title: New England Aquarium

text: An absolute treat to visit!! Second time visiting from NYC & just gets better each time! Place is pretty organized & staff is friendly and attentive! Covid safe with sani stations everywhere & not a lot of people! We loved how informative the Aquarium was and we loved even more how active all of our sea friends were the day we visited! Well worth the visit!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: The best experience  of our life... This is not the first time that we visit this place and its definitely  the last one. We moved out of Boston 2 years ago but we still come to the aquarium  once a year for vacations.. definitely  highly  recommend ðŸ‘Œ
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very busy, beautiful place.  I love that every part is centered on the large tank in the middle.

text: I was disappointed especially with the sharks and even my pre-K toddler lost interest.  If I didn't like the fact I supported marine life preservation efforts, I'd say the entrance price isn't worth it. This 500lb sea turtle presentation was the highlight our my visit.

text:

The penguin  and sea lions exhibit was great but by far was the central tank, the reef tank, the cold water reef tank.  Other notable aquariums were the weedy sea dragons, the electric eel and the Amazon river fish tank.

text: It's such beautiful place with so many different kind of sea creatures. It's a place you must visit when you are around this area.

text: Who doesn't love watching penguins while viewing everything else they have to offer at the aquarium. Vast collection of animals.

text: Not impressed at all. Over $30 dollars per ticket to walk around a circle. It was also way too crowded at 11 AM.  There is also no food inside. Save your money and time. Some of the fish were cool, but not worth over $100 for our family to visit. The aquarium is very close to the subway Blue line.
title: New England Aquarium

text: For the price of the tickets l say the aquarium is a little too small. The big tank in the middle was great but l would rather prefer the aquarium in Camden NJ or Baltimore.

text: We love the aquarium. I could watch the seals all day. We watched the sea turtle get fed, played a game with a penguin.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Letâ€™s start by saying the aquarium is small and get that out-of-the-way now. If youâ€™re expecting something grand and hours long then thatâ€™s not going happen but it fulfilled itâ€™s assignment as an aquarium. I loved that the tank is in the center of the aquarium and you walk up the ramp in a spiral exploring each angle and getting to see different exhibits or species highlighted along the way.

The aquarium is conveniently located near many other activities and was a quick and easy subway ride from where we stayed. People were required to wear a mask indoors and the aquarium was kept clean with hand sanitizing stations everywhere.

The sea lions were outside so people who werenâ€™t at the aquarium but in the area can see them too.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Lots to see and a fantastic place to bring kids. It was very busy when we visited at 13:00 on a Friday but that did not spoil our visit. I recommend booking a time slot in advance.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Our toddler had a wonderful time here for the first time! Stroller accessible and kid friendly.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The photos speaks for itself, loved the theatre absolutely. Make sure to get your student discount by talking over the ticket counter and have your student Id ready.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
We went to the aquarium yesterday.
We used our city pass, and I'm glad we didn't pay out of pocket because it wouldn't have been worth the money IMO.
The sea lions were really cool, the touch tank with the sting rays was also awesome, and we loved looking at the fish and penguins.
However, my kids and I got bored quickly. It was cramped and uncomfortable to get around.
We skipped a lot of the fish tanks along the walls because we could never actually get in and close enough to see anything because there were loads of people at each one. If you did so happen to get to one that wasn't loaded with people, you would quickly get cornered in. We were all so excited to go here, and it was really just a disappointment. We originally came here for the whale watch, but that got canceled unfortunately.
It was really cool seeing all the different animals up close, well the ones we could get close enough to, but if you're coming here expecting something amazing, I feel like you'd be let down. I hate that I'm giving this place a lower rating than I wanted to, but I feel I need to be honest. It wasn't horrible here, there just wasn't much to see or do. We got through in under an hour.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Aside from the crowd and torrential rain, it was a great visit.  Lucked out and got to watch Myrtle and her two buddies get fed at the top of the tank.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fun for adults too! Lots to look at and plenty to do. We also liked that the ticket was good for all day, and allowed for re-entry. We rented lockers and used this as base camp for the day.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Always a nice trip, was filled with families today and fun to see the sea life and the children excited to see and learn about them.  The staff are all so courteous and knowledgeable, such a great place to visit in Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful aquarium with great information. It only took two hours to see everything, but it is worth the cost.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Odorable place. I could spend all day looking at this fantastic world. Perfect place for children,  but interesting for people of any age.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
A lot of fish to see. I liked the way they've organized it. The center cylindric aquarium is a great idea! The turtles are really big. It's also cool to see how seals are fed.

Was only disappointed when didn't find a bicycle parking rack at the Aquarium.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I have so many great memories here as a kid so being able to take my son and daughter was very special. Going to the top of the big tank never gets old. This is a great place for families with beautiful views of the harbor!
title: New England Aquarium

text: We love going here however it was a little too busy so we left right after seeing the Jelly fish.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Not what I expected from a large aquarium located at the ports. They sure have done great publicity to make people come to see the aquarium. I have however seen much better and smaller aquariums with not even half this  publicity but much better content. There sure was a large exhibit of many varieties of fishes and an exhibit of penguins . The only part I really enjoyed was the sea lion feeding .
Most aquariums I have been to had sharks, pelicans, some sea birds, iguanas and much more. Maybe there are some restrictions to do that .

We had looked forward to the visit for awhile.  We enjoy aquariums and have been to several.  The building and center cylinder tank that went up through the center were nice.  They also had some beautiful tanks. But I was underwhelmed.   We had seen that it was rated number 1 aquarium  in the US.  My wife and I enjoy seeing jellyfish but the was just 1 tank we saw.  I enjoy sharks but only seen one in the touch tank.  Also, although there was a map you could put on your phone it was a bit tricky to figure out how to get around.
I am not saying it wasn't a nice aquarium, but it didn't seem to live up the a number 1 ranking.  The tickets were $37 per person which isn't bad knowing that it is going to help conservation but then you have to add $40 to park in Boston.
We are glad we went but probably will not go back.

title: New England Aquarium

text:
The New England Aquarium is located in Downtown Boston, Massachusetts right on the pier. They have seal, penguin, jellyfish, sea turtles, shark exhibits and more! This is a rather small aquarium compared to other aquariums we've been to but the size from the outside makes it look massive. We went online to book our tickets and they some available from 4-5PM. We booked the 4:20pm times as we weren't going to make it by 4. As we arrived we thought there was going to be on-site parking but instead parked at the garage right next to the aquarium thinking they owned it. The prices for this parking garage are absolutely outrageous. $20+ dollar for parking longer than 30 minutes and $40 for parking 80 minutes or longer. When we got to the ticket booth we asked if parking was included with our tickets and we were informed that the parking deck was a privately owned deck and they weren't able to validate it for us unless we were doing whale watching (which was an extra $50+ per person) or we were members. We are just traveling through so we were not members. Upon checking out the exhibits, we noticed that sting ray touching was off limits and interactive displays were closed and turned off. These are things that I pay for when we book a ticket here so the tickets should have been discounted or there should have been a notice on the website stating this before buying. We spent our time reading everything to be informed and learn about the aquarium and after reaching the second level we heard someone over the intercom say that the aquarium was closing in 30 minutes. We had only been there for a little over an hour and haven't even seen the rest of the 3 floors. We rushed to see everything we could and got to the fourth floor 3 minutes before we were told they were closing in 12 minutes and we had to go back to the main floor. The staff informed us we had to go back down and was following very close behind us as if they were security escorting us off the premises or something. It felt very uncomfortable. We made our way down to the gift shop and left 2 minutes before 6 when they closed.

I left 2 stars because I feel as though they shouldn't have had tickets to be sold past 4pm because if you really want to see and read everything and take it all in, it takes at least 2 hours or more to do so without feeling rushed. It was also sad to see the interactive parts of the aquarium blocked off even though hand sanitizer was everywhere and they don't enforce mask wearing for vaccinated people so I'm not really sure why it's still closed. And with our parking not being validated we eneded up paying $40 for 2 hours of parking because we didn't know otherwise, and $64 for an aquarium experience that had all their interactive experiences closed but still wanted full price admissions. For a total of $104 for a 2 hour experience that felt rushed and incomplete, this felt like a rip off and we felt totally sad after leaving.

I'm leaving this review so hopefully others can be informed and don't make the same mistakes we did. Would not recommend unless fully open to enjoy everything and come the latest by 3pm if you really want to get everything this aquarium has to offer.

text:
Very beautiful and well-maintained. Loved the penguin exhibits. A special treat for the eyes was the 538 pounds sea turtle, the green eel, moon jelly fish, the sea dragon, and the interaction with stingrays.

text: We got in at a lower.price with pass from the local library. My son loved the whole experience. Given that he is sensory driven, it was not overly loud or stimulating. He loved the touch tank with the Ray's the most! They have an awesome tank in the middle of the aquarium with many tropical fish and turtles.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The experience was awesome. They have a wide variety of sea animals. They have beautiful color fishes of every sizes as seen on TV shows. It was a great experience to see those marine animals in front of you. They have small tanks where in presence of authorities you can touch the sting rays, starfish and some variety of shark. The seals are a fun to see and they play amongst themselves. The penguins swim, play, chase each other and dive. Overall, it is a must watch attraction.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
For the last three years, I've been on the Whale Watchers boat ride, yet I've never actually been inside the Aquarium.

Luckily, this year, I decided to skip the 3 to 4 hour-long ride that was about $60 per person, and invested in an All-Inclusive Go City Boston pass.

The Aquarium was my first stop on my itinerary, and I was happy to have seen it. The entire Aquarium follows a spiral-like structure, which is lovely, as you literally cannot miss anything. Unfortunately, due to COVID, two of the exhibitions were closed: the sharks and the meant-for-kids section.

Greeted by penguins, then viewing animals from the Amazon, to creatures of the sea, every floor was wonderful. The area is wheelchair accessible for each floor, and the bathrooms are clean (there is only 1 on the first floor).

You will most likely take photos of the gigantic and old Myrtle the Turtle, which has somewhat become a Boston mascot :D.

And when you are about to exit, do not miss the seals, as the door is almost unnoticeable after viewing the loud Rockhopper penguins again.

Do note, once you enter the gift shop, you are unallowed to revisit the Aquarium again.

I would say that if you plan on coming here, do plan to stay for at most 2.5 hours. I highly recommend it, and if you are using a Go Boston pass, as you exit, you could go to your next attraction on a boat on the wharf.
title: New England Aquarium

text:

We purchased tickets online for 10am and we were done by noon. The aquarium wasn't overcrowd and it felt very clean and safe. There were plenty of staff on hand to answer questions and offer interesting facts.

text: Great place to go to.  People say it is expensive to go.  However if you actually think of the cost to feed just the centre aquarium which has about 925 living fish and sea life I feel that 30.00 is a great price.  We spent just over an hour here. text: It is a little small, but a very nice aquarium. The animals and tanks are well kept. They have a lot of demonstrations and educational sessions. I particularly liked watching feeding of the penguins. The training session with the seals was good also. There's a shark exhibit on the map, but it was not fully open when I went. title: New England Aquarium

text:
Strongly recommend getting here early as it gets busy very quickly & we visited late April.
Main aquarium tank is enormous and accessed via a circular ramp that ascends 4 floors. At the bottom of the tank was a penguin colony which was being cleaned out by staff when we arrived shortly after it had opened. Most of the cleaning was by hand so I guess to minimise any impact on the penguins.
As you ascend the ramp there is lots of information about marine life/environments etc with additional tanks on each floor to demonstrate these varying environments.
It was really fascinating. You really get different views of the tank as you ascend, all the different species they have at various levels within the tank. You may get to see divers in the tank feeding the fish, Iâ€™m assuming they do this for a couple of reasons 1) entertainment 2) ensures most fish get food at some point.
There is a separate tank area where there are Rays which you can stroke and was popular with smaller children. Also they had Sea Lions in a separate area and were used to perform a show at certain times, we didnâ€™t see this so canâ€™t comment on it.
I think my son & I were in there for about 4 hrs but could easily have spent more time in there but we were on a limited time frame.
Definitely worth visiting in my view.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had an excellent time! We went during a very busy weekend but still got to see most of the exhibits!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I haven't been here since I was my kids age and we took them just last month.  Amazing!! Mertle the turtle is still there!!!  The penguins and seals were my all time favorite:)

text: As Per my husband - "Its a great Water Kingdom"...By seeing the pictures I could literally assume how he would have enjoyed the chillness there. Hope to visit the place sooner

text:
Iâ€™m not quite sure why this aquarium is getting all of the 5 star ratings. I expected more. There arenâ€™t any knock your socks off exhibits. Theyâ€™re all pretty typical. I appreciate the conservation efforts.

text: Aquarium was awesome.  Been to a few in different major cities and even Canada. text: We bought our tickets with combo of whale watching, so we went as it opens. Very great place for family. Very organized system. text: My first ever visit to an aquarium was anything but disappointing. title: New England Aquarium

text: I love it here. Wish I was a mermaid so I could swim in tank with all the different fishes. Covid protocol and safety measures in place.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice day at the Aquarium.  We both loved watching the penguins. I love taking pictures and the way the penguins are set up allows for great opportunities to take pics.  We enjoyed seeing all of the marine life, especially the stingrays and sea turtles.  Today was a bit rainy, so the place was packed with children. As you can imagine,  with large groups of people in there at the same time, it got fairly loud. So if you can't tolerate crowds or noise, this is not the place for you.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
I've been coming to the New England Aquarium since I was a child. Either it has gotten smaller, or I've gotten bigger - when I was younger I used to think it was immense. But now it seems much smaller, especially to other aquariums I've visited. The main tank, which is still impressively massive, was refaced a few years ago and is now a 'Caribbean reef' instead of basically a shark and large creature tank. Personally I liked the old tank better. The coral in the tank is in poor condition - there just isn't enough light for the coral to thrive and a lot of the more colorful fish would be better presented in a smaller tank, I think.

I did like the new sea dragon, with leafy and weedy sea dragons, display, although we saw a similar display in Melbourne which was better (of course, Melbourne is a bit closer to where they actually live!)

I was also sad that the sea lions and dolphins that used to inhabit the Discovery barge are gone, along with the barge!

All in all, we went through the entire aquarium, including visiting the harbor seals and the cafeteria, at a very slow pace, in a little under two hours. At $50 for one adult and one child ticket, that seemed like a poor value to me. Also, we happened to visit on a day when there were several high school groups visiting so the aquarium was super super crowded. While I love aquatic life and aquariums, if you aren't a super fan, there are probably better museums to visit in Boston!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great educational place, lots to see, wonderful engaging exhibits. Four stars because of the adult admission price for a few hours for three people plus the additional $20 for parking. Not sure if itâ€™s worth it but others (Baltimore, Mystic) all charge about the same.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Such a wonderful place. So many fish, turtles, penguins, and other coastal and marine wildlife. Most of the exhibits are contained in one spiral tower so you can see everything as quick (about an hour and a half) or slow as you would like.

Worth it to go back and revisit as well. You might see the same things (one of the green sea turtles is 90 years old) or you might see and learn something new!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Went to this aquarium for a morning excursion while visiting family in Boston and was very impressed. It has a 5 floor massive tank that has a ton of fish. We even saw a huge sea turtle that was the size of me! The caretakers were very informative and answered all of our questions. They also have a ton of exhibits that will keep you there for hours. I would suggest getting there early though, by mid to late morning on the weekend, it was packed. A large gift shop too so plenty of options to remember the fun. Check it out.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is an incredible experience. Some of our favorite animals were the ball pythons, which they were feeding when we were there (awesome), the sea turtle, and all of the penguins. Kid friendly, and they have many restaurant options around to go grab a bite to eat, which are also posted on the website. For parking purposes, the parking garage is a steep $40+ dollars, and when you drive into the entrance of the parking garage there is not a way to really turn around if you do not want to go in, so park on the street if you want to save some cash. But the parking garage was convenient and is close to the entrance of the aquarium.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Some advice: buy your tickets online and get there early. The crowds here are crazy, however, you can't blame anyone. This place is awesome. It was cool when I was a kid, but know that I'm an adult and more aware of how vital conservation is, I'm floored by the work this place is involved in. Also penguin feeding time; a must see! The information given at the top of the tank is fascinating too. Everything in the aquarium is just so neat. And you can touch animals in certain exhibits.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Definitely a welcome change from the aquariums in CT. This place was very engaging and the kids as well as I had an amazing time! We will definitely be getting a membership!
title: New England Aquarium

text: A huge aquarium with so much to see, but as other reviewers have said, it's incredibly crowded. Despite that we had a good experience & enjoyed our time here. There are some interactive exhibits that I'm sure are especially exciting for children & a theatre showing nature/wildlife films, we watched one about blue whales & it was a nice break from walking before finishing up the tour. As you leave you pass through the obligatory gift shop & of course the point where the photos taken on the way in are for sale. We bought our photo package & of course it's extremely overpriced, but it was a memorable moment for a first date weekend so we bought them anyway.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Went on a Saturday after our whale watching trip.  It was crazy busy. Make sure to purchase tickets a head of time. You can walk right in. The line to purchase was long.  It was a lot of people inside but you could always get a view of the penguins and the big tank in the middle.  The tanks on the outer edges were hard to get to. Very nice aquarium
title: New England Aquarium

text: A really fun trip that kept my sister and I occupied for about 2 hours. We went later in the day before school let out and during the week to avoid the crowds. Parking in the lot across from the harbor is expensive (about $40) so if you can park outside of Boston and use the T-system to get around its a lot easier and cheaper (and easier to leave the area) but if you want to drive in it is the most convenient location to park in. I recommend going, the penguins are so cute and if you get in just after noon you can watch the divers feed the penguins and the tank (lots of colorful reef life and small sharks in it).
title: New England Aquarium

text:
This is up there with aquariums I've seen in other cities like Toledo.  It's smaller than the Shed aquarium in Chicago but they have a lot of nice exhibits and the staff seem passionate and knowledgeable.

I did think the admission price was sort of high for what you get (at the time of this writing it was $62 bucks for myself and my 13 year old son to get tickets).  I get that they have overhead to deal with though so what are you gonna do ya know?

They do have a pretty decent gift shop.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is a smaller aquarium than most people are probably use to. Their exhibits do not change that often but they charge a good amount to get in. We have gone to our local library to get discounted tickets as they prices are high. I remember going as a kid and basically seeing the same things then. But it is still a great place to go in the spring to fall as you get to really enjoy everything they have to offer then.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Excellent aquarium with three penguin habitats, two massive sea turtles in a 4 story ocean tank and other wonderful exhibits. Super crowded, but otherwise a great place to visit.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This will be the third time my wife and I have visited the aquarium and it still amazes us as it did when we were little! Love this place and everything that it's doing.

text: Pretty cool aquarium. Parking near the aquarium is expensive as are tickets in my opinion.  They have an awesome sea turtle,  lots of penguins, an octopus, a ray touch tank and one with sea stars and sea urchins as well.  The staff were friendly and informative.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I was not impressed.  Very small. They didn't have big sharks, octopuses or even jelly fish. After an hour I was bored. It's very expensive. I've been to better aquariums. My opinion don't bother. There are a lot of better attractions in Boston to see. Save your money.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love visiting this place, under the sea adventure. It's great to see all the different types of fish in the center tank.  Take the time to stop at each window as it will bring new surprises. My fav is the jelly fish, I could watch them all day. We used our ebt card for my daughter and I and admission was only $10 winning!! Or so I thought till I got back to the parking garage and spent $40 on parking, there went all my awesome savings for the day. So you have been warned. We were only there for less than 3 hours,  i was disappointed in that. Otherwise the animals provided a great morning adventure.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's an amazing experience especially if you never visited one aquarium! It's an obligatory stop if you're in Boston with or without kids. The penguins were espectacular and my favorite. The seals were also cute. Maybe they could have more jellyfishes. I particularly didn't like how the crabs were kept - in very small places, they couldn't move. I found it cruel.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Decent aquarium, but far from the best. This aquarium is okay. Essentially, the building is one large tank with a spiraling ramp going around it. It is also way to busy to be completely enjoyable. I would love to see the aquarium incorporate more of the natural environment like the Monterrey Bay Aquarium in California. I'd also recommend checking out the nearby Mystic Aquarium as an alternative. Regardless, it is still worth a trip. Many local libraries offer discounted or free passes to visit and they have good deals for community employees like teachers.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
If you are used to a better aquarium this one falls short. It is small an the day we went it was so crowded you could barely move.
Still they had some good exhibits the best one being the seal exhibit which you can spend most of your day watching a be content.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
I absolutely love the New England Aquarium! Fun way to spend an afternoon with family or friends. I see something new everytime I go. I love the photos I am able to get during my visit. They make it fun for the younger kids with interactive shows and presentations throughout the day. It's a fun place to spend a few hours in Boston! From the giant turtles, the adorable array of penguins to the abundance of fish and sharks in the giant tank located right in the center. There's also various sea creatures in tanks and such located all around the remainder of the building. And don't forget to check out the really nice (although a bit pricey) gift shop on your way out. What's a trip to the Aquarium without a souvenir! Hope you enjoy the photos.
*All photos belong solely to KLPhotography.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I almost gave this place 4 stars just because it wasn't as big as I expected but the sting ray and shark petting area gave it the extra star because the sting rays were so active and friendly and you actually get to pet them easily and frequently without waiting forever for them to come to you.  The sharks were a little more shy and less plentiful but we did eventually get to pet the little shark which made my 7 yr olds day.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Excellent place to being the kids, although not as big as other aquariums I've visited. Huge 4 story cylindrical tank in the middle of it all. IMAX theater available along with whale watch. Will definitely come back for whale watching once the kids get a bit older. Parking around the area can be tough if you plan to drive!

Until next time Boston!
title: New England Aquarium

text: So much fun, so many fish. You can get pretty up close and personal with the penguins, and you can touch a whole bunch of rays. If you stare too long into the tanks, youâ€™ll get a little dizzy. Great place to bring your kids and learn about the ocean and aquatic life. It gets pretty busy, so time your trip right so you donâ€™t get crowded out and miss out on seeing cool stuff like the giant turtle or giant octopus!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had a blast! Really enjoyed the penguins. Itâ€™s best to arrive early and avoid the big crush of families and school tours. Wish I had purchased the octopus hat from the gift shop. Great way to pass a morning.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
WARNING!!! DO NOT PARK IN THE PARKING  GARAGE NEXT TO THE AQUARIUM!!! We paid $40 for parking for 2 hourz. After asking around, apparently it is one of the only parking garages in the area that the aquarium CAN'T validate parking for.

Now back to the review:
I have some of the fondest childhood memories here. I live in Nebraska now and took my boyfriend home with me for the first time last week. This was literally our first stop off the plane. His first experience in New England was petting stingrays which was the greatest way to start a great trip home. All of the employees were very friendly and gave us so much information. We learned about social norms of stingrays, the life cycle of moon jellies, and so much more. There are floors upon floors of exciting exhibits!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Our two year old had a lot of fun. It wasn't as big as I was expecting. Cool and notable exhibits: anaconda, octopus, string ray touch tank, and three types of penguins. We spent two hours there. We spent hardly any time at each exhibit. If we had stopped to read about each exhibit we probably would have been there over three hours.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice aquarium with great exhibits - some interactive.  There will be something for the entire family here.  It can get a bit crowded with long ticket lines so try to buy them in advance or get a Go Boston pass
title: New England Aquarium

text: Pricy entrance fee. Buy your tickets online, otherwise you'll be on a long line to get in. Exhibits were very interesting and was really impressed with the building size aquatic tank that is in the middle. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.
