title: New England Aquarium

text: The layout of this aquarium is fantastic! It all centers around an awesome 4 story tank that is giant! The whole penguin habitat was also really fun. It made for a great afternoon outing.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
The perfect spot to learn about aquatic life and to see cute seals and neat fish! The sea turtles are HUGE!
Touch tanks are a lot of fun! The Ray's really loved being pet!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great place to visit...my 16yo son and I  spent 2+ hours there, and it seemed like 15 minutes.  We both took many pictures. Many souvenirs in the gift shop were overpriced (Ex:  They were selling a large jellyfish water lamp for $130, and I dound/purchased the exact same lamp at Amazon for $65.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The center tank is mesmerizing and can keep you amazed for at least 2 hours if you are kid-free. Obviously kids like to wander much more. We had a blast just the two of us!
title: New England Aquarium

text: The place has a great collection. The fur seals presentation is worth seeing. The great turtle, the stingrays, octopus and everything else. Well maintained and great learning experience. Children will love this place and learn a lot about the marine world. Make sure you have at least 3hours to spend when you go there. It truly is worth the experience
title: New England Aquarium

text: I've been visiting this aquarium my whole life.  I was disappointed that they no longer have the barge you can walk to from the dock for dolphin shows and other large marine mammal educated based shows, unlike SeaWorld . Dont get me wrong I live Sea World and the access it provide us humans to look these mystical creatures in the eye,  I just don't believe their honesty in their mission statement as a whole.  The Boston Aquarium is growing and expanding subways and brings to life real life threats such as bio-diversity and out coral Caribbean reefs in jeopardy of endangerment.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We love the NE Aquarium!  Myrtle the turtle is always amazing to see, and always fun to learn about the other species in the tanks.  The lack of bathrooms is a tad upsetting, but won't keep us away.  Everything was clean and the staff were very friendly!!  Do yourself a favor, buy tickets online ahead and you don't have to stand in line!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Daughter had a lot of fun reliving Finding Dory in here. I thought the exhibits were great, esp the penguins and the big "open ocean exhibit" tank in the center of the aquarium. I'd like to go back and really look at some of the displays again when I can go without a 21 month old with the attention span of an ant.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
It's very eductional beautiful and amazing sights the staffs are great. It's the best place to bring your family especially children to learn about the different creatures of the sea.
And a great movie theater for educational purposes . my family and I realy enjoyed the New England Aquarium. Thank you
title: New England Aquarium

text: This was an ok aquarium as Iâ€™ve been to many others. This aquarium seemed much smaller than most. Itâ€™s multiple levels but didnâ€™t really have many fun exhibits like other aquariums do. If you go here, Iâ€™d recommend getting the CITYPASS first as youâ€™d get to see this, a boat cruise, the science museum, and and observatory. text: The New England Aquarium is fun at any age. Love that you can touch the sting rays. There's this area where kids can touch starfish, sea urchins and, snails. Just beautiful sea creatures all over. They have harbor seal training shows. They feed the penguins as soon as the aquarium opens, they're cute to watch. Highly recommend.
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of my favorite places to visit when I go to Boston. They have a great deal of sea creatures at this aquarium. The gift shop is priced pretty decently compared to other aquariums or zoos. They have this beautiful tank that holds a turtle the water looks so clear. When you first enter you can see the sting ray and actually touch them. Also it's a few blocks from the market where you can grab food !
title: New England Aquarium

text:
The exhibits are impressive and the penguins are so fun to watch! I felt a little bad for the sea lions. Their pool could have been larger.
We went there on a Friday but it happed to be school vacation week so it was absolutely packed! May of the tanks were hard to get close enough to see. We will never go agin when school is out.  Luckily we bought tickets online so we were able to bypass the hugely long line and go right to the will call window.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful fish, penguins and sea turtles.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I have visited many other aquariums so if I compare this to others, this one was not so great. They have many varieties but stored in small fish tanks so you don't get the feel of aquariums. title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful aquarium that wraps around a large round tank in the middle with the larger fish, sharks, turtles, etc. the aquarium also has a dining hall type, with beautiful windows and lots of sun. There is also a great gift shop with all the animals!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Love the setup of the aquarium. Easy to navigate and keeps kids occupied. Not super cool in summer but quite a few areas with fans helps that. Several touch tanks, which are designed well. Don't miss the seal home/training area behind the aquarium.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great aquarium. Has a wide variety of animals from all regions of the oceans. Not a huge place, 2 hours would be plenty to see everything. Always enjoy coming to see the exhibits.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love aquariums, so this place enchanted me! They have a lot different species to show and it's always full of people. It's good for enjoy with your family!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Traveled to MA from CT to go here.  It was great! We really enjoyed our time here.  Here you can interact with some of the species here such as rays, starfish and so on.  Its a good place to bring your love ones.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Good aquarium...but not great.  High priced for what they offer.  Over $100 for family of three plus parking.  (Add IMAX movie, food, and a t-shirt  and you're easily over $200.)  You could tour the entire place in an hour.  Okay displays but no large fish.  No large or medium sized sharks, small whales either.   Interesting smaller fish displayed in tanks that are well lit and clean.   Seal and penguin exhibits are nice.  Crowded city traffic to and from the aquarium can be expected.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium is extremely educational for children and it's good to spend about 3 hours easily in this place. They have penguins, seals, rays, corals, some sharks and loads of fish. I could spend the whole day there! It does get super crowded during the weekends and holidays seasons. Best to avoid going that time as you would hate the experience.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My girlfriend and I had gone to Boston for the weekend and this was what we were actually most excited for. Right away you can see a ton of penguins and learn about how overfishing is affecting marine life. There's seals, sharks, turtles, eels, jellyfish, manta rays, piranhas, tropical fish, shrimp, anenome, beautiful coral, seahorses and so much more. There's a space to touch some of the aquatic life - like starfish - with staff supervision. Perfect for the kids. There's a bundle package you can buy where you can get an imax ticket with your admission to the aquarium. The theater is right next store and offers documentaries about different aquatic life... and Pandas? Hah- at least when I went. Luckily, the popcorn, candy and soft drinks are a lot cheaper than those sold in regular movie theaters. The gift shop is a delight too. They sell clothing, jewelery, toys and other souvenirs. I would definitely go back. I was there for hours and I had a great time.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wonderful place!  Delightful adventure in unraveling the ocean, with its multicolored fish and animals, corals, fossils, habitats, etc.  Various performances of seals in prime location.  Opportunity to touch various sea animals, children and adults alwgria.  Excellent service from staff.  Food court.  Discount on WIC card and Foods Stamps.  Super recommend
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very nice aquarium. All the pools and tanks got you up close with the animals. Lots of staff giving talks about the wildlife. Loved the fur seals and penquins and the huge sea turtles.  The penquins in the photo are having a shower in the sprinklers.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love the penguins. It was awesome getting to see them get fed. And the big tank was beautiful! The turtle is so very cool!  The touch tank was so much fun and the seals were adorable.  Definitely worth a trip! It's a small (ish) aquarium but there's plenty to see!

text: Whether you're solo, with a group, or just a few people, this aquarium is always a great place to visit! So many different fishes to see and lots of ocean life to celebrate and educate you. Great for long or quick visits.

text: Great time! The aquarium is very clean and full of attentive and enthusiastic staff. There is a lot to see and do. Myrtle the turtle is a beautiful animal... 500+ pounds and 90+ years old!
title: New England Aquarium

text: If you're visiting Boston , you must visit this place. If you have never seen sea lion , penguins this this is the place, you can also watch sea lion training session here. title: New England Aquarium

text:
It's an aquarium so the contents is always awesome!! This one has penguins as soon as you get inside. Wait, before we even get into the aquarium, this little girl has busted her head and the aquarium staff is outside working on her feverishly. I was impressed at how they handled the situation. The little girl's parents were calm, the staff was calm, the patrons in line watching the whole thing unfold were calm. I was impressed with their response to the situation.

Now, inside, penguins, sharks, giant groupers, octopuses, and a HUGE turtle are just a few of the creatures inside. The sea turtle was ultra impressive!!!

If you're in Boston, go for the city pass to get a good rate for the aquarium. The aquarium price of entry is a bit high otherwise.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fantastic experience for all ages! I especially loved the penguins, seahorses and sea dragons, and the private behind the scenes tour with the sea mammals. I appreciate the aquarium's commitment to sustainability, education and research. Don't miss this opportunity! Outstanding and I can't wait to go back!

text:
Tickets are slightly expensive, but if you love the blue planet, it's worth a visit. And if you don't have much idea about the world you live in, and share with others, it's all the more important to pay a visit to the New England Aquarium. You'll come back rich, with knowledge and compassion for the fellow living beings.

text: I always Loved the aquarium as a kid and now my kids can too. The remodel of it is stunning, love the new and improved exhibits. It lacks a ramp to the top floor which is wierd and makes having a stroller a bit annoying but atleast the elevator goes up to the last floor. The top is an amazing view, love being able to look down into the reef. The price is a bit steep but with a EBT or WIC card the price is discounted alot and makes the trip worth it. The only real complaint is it gets too crowded, they should put a cap on how many visitors are allowed in at a time. Overall great time.
title: New England Aquarium

text: You definitely must see the aquarium, when you visit Boston. The first thing you see when you get inside are penguins, and you just can't stand the cuteness! The whole 4 levels of the building are centered around the huge water tank with sharks, mantas, giant turtles and lots of fish of all kinds. You can pick your spot and watch them for hours! Other smaller tanks are on the outer walls, there you can see herring, water horses, golden eels, jellyfishes and other ocean creatures, also they have a contact tank for kids to explore crabs. Hint #1: buy tickets online - the price is the same as in their ticket office, but you don't have to wait a long line under the sun. Hint #2: if you have a small baby with you - take it in a ergo carrier; if your kid can walk - let him walk - leave a stroller on the first level. It gets crowded there and it takes time to squeeze with a stroller, kids get bored and anxious and you end up rolling the empty stroller after your running kid. Hint #3: make a lift to the 4th level at the beginning and go down to the 1st by foot - it's easier to go down, right? Enjoy your visit!
title: New England Aquarium

title: New England Aquarium

text:
I got to pet a shark... do I need to say more?

Ok, I'll tell you! First thing you see are harbor seals right out front in a big glass tank. Don't worry, they're really sealed in there. When you go in, you bang a left and they have sting rays and sharks that you can pet! Once you meet the rays, you have no choice but to forgive them for Steve Irwin. They're just so friendly!
Next there's a big penguin enclosure with a bunch of small dudes in tuxedos pointedly ignoring you. Uppity jerks. But then you start walking around the big tank, which is basically a national geographic special irl. All the awesome critters you used to see on discovery Channel are here! It's a stratified mockup of a coral reef, and you walk up the ramp, checking out all the tropical fish,  sharks, and even a trio of sea turtles! At first the turtles were hiding and refusing to hang out and be cool, but after lunch they perked up and started swimming around. Best trip I've taken in a long time!

Now the negatives:  the parking garage is stupid expensive. $40 for 2 - 24 hours, so either make alternative parking plans, or plan your day withing walking distance. The gift shop is pricey, but worth it. There's not much in the way of affordable food nearby, so if you're on a budget, either pack a lunch or budget more for food. We ended up grabbing food at the Imax theater, which was actually reasonably priced for movie theater snacks!
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of my favorite aquariums in the US. Incredible four stories tall aquarium with so many underwater creatures, including sea turtles! So much fun...we go every time we visit Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Great aquarium, with an intuitive layout for both large and small groups. The main part of the aquarium has a central pillar which is one of the world's largest fish tanks, and branching off of it are multiple floors of separate tanks.
The residents include piranhas, penguins, a set of extremely large turtles, electric eels, and seals!
In terms of interactive education, the aquarium provides a plethora of demos on each floor, and includes a tidal pool manned by staff to answer all your aquatic queries.
For lunch, you can either go to the cafeteria or step outside to walk about a mile to pretty much anywhere to eat.
The entire building, food court and all, is wheelchair accessible and definitely deserves five stars.
My single qualm with the place is its hours. Many times you find your outing to the place cut short due to closing time, but this too is justified, because the fish need specialized care too after all, and the marine biologists caring for them can't go back and forth between tourists and fish continuously.
All in all, a great place for an outing even if you aren't a student.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My favorite place to visit in Boston! They do an amazing job to make visitors feel welcome and they have great programs for research and public awareness! Great selection of fish and penguins! Very nice gift shop! A must see when visiting Boston!

text:
This is an amazing aquarium! I think I've been here 6 or 7 times during my time in Boston, and my partner and I have a membership, as well. It's on the smaller side, so you can easily walk the entire thing in 2 to 2.5 hours, depending on how long you want to spend at each exhibit.
They're constantly doing live interactions with the animals like feeding the penguins, training the seals and sea lions, and answering scuba divers questions from visitors. I would recommend checking the BPS calendar to make sure students aren't on break when you plan to go, because that's when it gets really crowded. This is a must-see attraction in Boston and I love bringing visiting friends and family here!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
A fun place to go with young kids. It can get very crowded, especially the line to buy tickets. I would buy them ahead of time if possible (we got ours through a discount from our work).

The stingray touch tank, penguins, and seals are super popular and easy to see. There's also a large muli-floor tank with two turtles and a variety of other large fish in it. The section with the octopus was insanely crowded and very small. They have a few small sharks, but there is no large exhibit.

There's a cafeteria on-site with reasonable prices. They stamp your hand when you enter, so you can also leave for food and come back in. The day we went (mid-April) was very hot inside. You may want to wear shorts and a t-shirt.

text: Not the best aquarium but good for its size. Lots of penguins and the multi story tank at the centre of the aquarium is quite impressive. Massive sea turtle is a sight to see.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great activity with kids!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Fantastic aquarium with a huge range of informative exhibits. Great for all ages. Allow 3 hours at least to properly see everything.
title: New England Aquarium

text: With 1.3million visitors per year I expected to see much more, like a shark tank.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great place to visit on a Saturday. Giant turtles, a lot of penguins, and some adorable sea lions. The place is a little small as far as big city aquarium's go but lots of variety. Go for it.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice place to visit with the family. Parking is expensive.  Social distancing rules are in place and you should  purchase tickets in advance to guarantee entry. All of the staff members were amazing.  I really enjoyed the large turtles lol
title: New England Aquarium

text:
This is a small but fun aquarium. You can pretty much experience everything in a half day. It has a unique multi story aquarium tank that has a walkway that spiraling around it.

When you enter they have a bunch of penguins that are a lot of fun. There is a light in the shape of a fish that you can move around and the penguins try to catch it. Think of a laser pointer for a cat but for penguins. Lots of fun.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very busy, but worth it. We spent nearly 6 hours there and easily could have spent more. The tide pool touch tank was cool,  but the ray tank was amazing!  So much to see!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice, but very small. Great location downtown. Worth a quick visit, but not many exhibits that you can linger at. The kids loved the "petting" area that contained crabs and rays inside the aquarium. We added the whale watch excursion to our tickets which gave us a full half day of activities. Warning, the whale watching boats are not well-being cooled inside. During peak summer it's a sweaty uncomfortable ride but we did enjoy seeing the whales dive.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Awesome experience, adds a lot to your knowledge on marine life as well as how to save our planet . If one is in Boston then it must be in your list of visit .
title: New England Aquarium

text: Enjoyed the visit .... by they way if you want to get free tickets to the aquarium and you are from Boston Go to a Boston public library with your BPL card and request one it will admit up to 4 people max... you welcomeâ˜ºï¸ðŸ¤—
title: New England Aquarium

text: A lot of nice exhibits and a wide variety of fish. It was very crowded but everyone just shuffled along.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Penguins,Seals and sea lions special exhibits. Awesome location on the harbor. There are multiple ecosystem tanks. You can "pet" starfish and stingrays at special interactive displays and follow the ocean tank up a spiral incline and view giant sea turtles from the top of the tank. Imax is across the plaza (30 second walk). If you don't like their cafe there are tons of restaurants nearby and your stamped hand gets you back into aquarium free. Earliest is best because they are feeding the animals. Also scuba divers cleaning the tanks are awesome people.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Amazing experience.

It was unique for someone like me to observe many sea spices in one sinlge place alive and touchable height.

Ticket was also reasonable and you can jump here if your ship to hull or hingum is late or you have missed it.

Amazing aquarium would love to visit again.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Very very busy when we went if it weren't for how many people where there I probably would give it 5 stars. All the sealife seemed very happy though the few employees I was able to speak to were not very informed on the species, I just wish we could have had a little more time at each exhibition before being pushed to the next. I would recommend going right when they open.

I particularly went to see Freya and Sy the Pacific octopuses they have. They were so active while we were there! (The image is of Sy spread across the glass in the back tank.) Freya did the same thing a few times in the front tank. These were by far the most active and happy seeming octopuses I have ever seen in captivity.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Well worth a visit if youâ€™re in Boston. The large central tanks has plenty to see in it, as you slowly climb up and around it. There are colonies of penguins at the base to observe and seals outside. Make sure you catch feeding time for the penguins and seals.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The layout of the exhibits is great and is easy to see everything. The staff is friendly too. Definitely a great way to spend an afternoon and the kids will love it.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Not many activities but touch ray is funny.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was a fun trip, but definitely very crowded. There were no absolutely amazing displays, but plenty to look at and keep young children engaged. The penguins and sea turtles were a big hit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I spent about an hour since my kids wanted to see penguins. I had 3 day Go Boston card which covers it and skip the long ticket line. Little small place if you are going on a weekend. I felt it was dark too. Do buy parking nearby before going there as it may save you some dollars.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Typical gift shop with every variation of sea animal product available. Shirts, stuffed animals, glass sculptures, puppets, etc, etc.

Fun to walk through and look around.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This aquarium had an excellent layout that really utilised the space to showcase their exhibitions. The structure of the exhibitions leads you through most if not all of the featured animals and fishes. The design of information was also very aesthetically pleasing to view. Some interactive elements seemed to be broken however. If I lived in Boston, I would definitely purchase a membership, it's very mesmerising to just observe the seals and penguins. I would recommend buying online tickets on busy days as that will save you 20 minutes of lining up.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A wonderful aquarium next to the sea. Winding circular route takes you up different levels around the main tank. Not too many big sharks in the tank - just bonnetheads and reef sharks - but itâ€™s quite a display nonetheless with its shape. Giant pompano in there. Also a massive Asian arowana. Penguins as soon as you walk in. An incredible reef tank with seemingly every marine fish in the hobby. Everything is well cared for. Great job keeping such an old iconic aquarium up to date!
title: New England Aquarium

text: My son loved it. And the staff was very pleasant. Just wish it was so expensive. But it is a tourist attraction.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
I was a member at one time so that I could bring the kids here and enjoy this famous, landmark aquarium. On my recent visit I did not go in as the line was long and I didn't have priority entry.
While in Boston you must make a visit even if you don't have kids. the tank is humungous and so aren't some of it's inhabitants.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice aquarium, lot of things to see.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I had a really nice experience there. All the staff was super friendly and the aquarium is beautiful. Perfect to spend a Saturday morning.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We were able to move easily through the Sunday crowd and see all of the exhibits. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, particularly the girl who spent 20 minutes explaining the details of tracking sharks to my 8 year old daughter.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Enjoyed it.  Probably best to come here with kids.  Wish there was a bit more info on some of the species.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My friend and I went and it was such an amazing experience. I loved petting the sting ray
title: New England Aquarium

text: Small aquarium with some interesting points. The main tank in the middle has a very interesting walkway where you can glimpse lots of marine life and even the 90yo turtle. They have a few unique open air penguin exhibits that are fun to look at. The reason I gave 3 star is because even though I love looking at animals, some of the exhibits seemed too small to be comfortable for the marine life. This includes the octopus that kept on anxiously  flitting from side to side of it's tiny tank. Their seal exhibit is quite small and looks a bit crowded for the amount of seals they have in there. I counted 4 or 5 in the pool at once.  And the gift shop was half empty for some reason. They were out of plenty of souvenirs
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great experience kids had a lot of fun!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
We were in Boston on a cold December Sunday and decided the aquarium would be a good place to get warm and spend some time.

The setup of the aquarium has you start with penguins, and who doesn't like penguins? We watched a little show also about penguins and it was very interesting. The aquariums main large circular tank spirals through the center of the building and goes from top to bottom. On the opposite wall from the tank on each floor are some different exhibits, some interactive. The staff was super friendly.

We also went outside to a small theatre and watched a show on seal training. That was actually really fun and the seals were great. Some of them were rescued and all of them liked to ham it up for the crowd and their meals or fish treats.

The cost of entrance was a bit expensive, about $75.00 for the three of us. We did get a discount for being AAA member and my daughter's university discount. We were there from about noon to 3:00 PM and fortunately there were not any large crowds. We enjoyed our visit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful place to have fun with your family. Four floors of amazing sea creatures. Reasonable prices.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My 11 yr old is the one who asked to go hair I have been here a thousand times cuz born and raised in the Boston that's what you do she still has a wonderful time it's a great adventure to hang out after visiting the museum and every visit benefits the museum as far as I understand
title: New England Aquarium

text: Got to be there to see the turtles being fed as well as the penguins. Nicely designed. Disappointed that the animal encounters are still not running at all
title: New England Aquarium

text: Over 1000 species of sea animals will be a treat to watch. The penguins at the entrance are so welcoming and kids will love murtle the turtle.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I think my expectations was a bit higher.. I. Mean it was beautiful but no sharks and no other interesting sea animals.. Even in the aquarium in Vegas they have crocodiles and sharks ðŸ¦ˆ
title: New England Aquarium

text: Loved the placed...a bit crowded, yet my children had a fantastic time, a great place to spend 3 hours....the hammer head and stingrays were two of my children's favorites!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I LOVE the Aquarium and am never disappointed. This trip was no exception! A parent/caregiver tip I would offer is to do the touch tank last. We went first and my son (almost 2) had a really hard time after that accepting he couldn't touch everything ðŸ˜‚
title: New England Aquarium

text: I had the best time of my life with my little chunkie. The staff are great. I didnt get a chance to go see the IMAx. But next time I will. You also have the opportunity to touch some animals!!! Definately a place to visit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Perfect place for kids to learn about the ocean, wildlife & conservation. Feels good knowing  $ spent there goes to help animals. First day using my membership - flew right past lines to get in! Plus members get in free all year! Special offers & VIP treatment on select days. Parking is the most expensive item, but members get discounts on that as well. Highly recommend it for nature & ocean lovers, plus the kids are kept in awe!
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of best Aquariums on the east coast. The central tank is excellent and the Anaconda is jaw dropping. A must visit in Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great, fun aquarium and clean. We had a blast!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Excellent, the place is not too big but they were able to pack a lot of species, it s very well done, with a huge circular aquarium at the center. could spend hours if you want to.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I was super impressed by the ecosystems that they created for each exhibit, it truly felt like you were getting a window into the animal's natural habitats! I can't recommend this place enough!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
One of the best aquariums in the country!
Tip: take the elevator to the top and then walk down the spiral walkway that surrounds the center tank.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Smaller than I had expected in comparison to Baltimore or Atlanta Aquariums so it doesn't take long to see all the exhibits.  Kids loved the touch tanks.  The downside was the large crowds there on the weekend.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Everything IT should have been & More,FROM helpful friendly staff to informative displays and hands-on experiences .Reasonably priced,knowledgeable staff clean throughout & family & disabled friendly,Cafe , gift shop & restrooms! The Animals are THE Priority here!As it should be!
title: New England Aquarium

text: What to say, I come to Boston almost once per year and I never miss a visit to the New England acquarium: amazing, good opportunity for young and old people to learn something more about our sea and about the creatures living there. Donâ€™t miss it . iMax movies are also part of the great entertainment
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is a must see when you come to Boston!
title: New England Aquarium

text: A must visit for anyone traveling to Boston. Kids love it. There are so many species here that one can really spend 4to5 hours here. It also has an imax and multiple shows daily to choose from.
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of the best aquarium weâ€™ve visited by far in USA. So far we have been to SFO, CA, Charleston, SC, Atlanta, GA, Chicago, IL, Columbia, SC aquariums. By far the best one is the Boston New England Aquarium. There cylindrical giant sea tank was our favorite. There is a giant sea turtle 90+ years old. Their dolphin show was on another level. Everything is well organized. Giant anaconda, unbelievable sea horses are awesome! Definitely a must visit place in Boston.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The Aquarium is very well maintained. the large fish tank which is about 4 floors tall is amazing. Different variety of penguins, fur seals, gaint tortoise. My nine month old daughter enjoyed touching the ray fishes. Totally it was a very good experience. Families with kids can spend more than 4 hours easily in this aquarium. Worth a visit!!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great place to visit . Nice attractions , the penguins , sea lions and the huge octopus are a must see.
title: New England Aquarium

text: OMG do not go here on the weekend! There's no control of how many people enter and how many bring strollers. Definitely a hazard if there's a fire or other emergency evacuation! Easy to lose a kid too. After an hour, we couldn't stand any more. Hopefully, next time we'll visit on a weekday. Myrtle the Green Turtle and the seals were cool, though.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Honestly the coolest place ever. There is so much to see and the best part is you can tell the staff love caring for all of the animals and that the animals are very well taken care of.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Really, really informative and friendly staff. We like the cuttlefish and watching Myrtle, Caroline, and Retread in the big tank. If the touch tank isn't crowded, there is a cute zebra shark who will occasionally pop up to say hi. The IMAX movies are fantastic. FYI the Galpagos film involves close-ups of spiders!

Extremely crowded and expensive at $27/ticket. Only go during non-peak times!
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium was a fun stop for our family on our last visit to Boston.  Their are hundreds of exotic fish that are mesmerizing to watch.  The tank in the center of the aquarium extends 4 stories high and is spiraled by a walk way. The layers of seaside were incredible. We watched a sea lion show, enjoyed the sea turtles and loved the ray touch tank.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's not bad. It's a little small compared to a lot of others I've been to like Baltimore (same architect design this one) or Georgia. Parking is expensive nearby.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This place is so much fun. It is really neat to have the huge tank in the middle and be able to walk up to the top, spiraling around it. There are touch tanks, lockers for rent, and bathrooms. Parking must be on city streets or in highly priced parking garages, if not taking the train.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium  is amazing! I never get bored not matter how many times I go. There is a wonderful variety of things to see and a ton of information about each species.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A little over priced for how small the place is. Mostly small thanks with one big tank in the middle. No sharks besides 10 babies crammed into a tiny tank. It was an ok experience but nothing that really set it apart from any other aquarium. The panguin exhibit was cool that it was open with lots of room however it does not look realistic. You can finish the entire aquarium in 30 minutes and the food was way overpriced.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Surely a place to visit when you are in Boston. It is not huge, but it has its charms. Some tanks should be bigger for the welfare of animals. Be sure to take a time to observe the penguins. They are really awesome!!!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Aquarium was awesome as always. Communication between the staff on what line serves patrons who have bought tickets online directly from the aquarium vs. Online tickets from a third party like Expedia REALLY needs to improve. FYI, parking in the garage next to the aquarium is $40 if you stay>2 hours. I'm from NH and hadn't been to the aquarium in over 5 years, so the locals may have known about the extra frustrations outside of just enjoying the Marine life. It was a fun day.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Cute aquarium. Can be quite busy with school groups. Good displays, healthy animals but not as much information as lost aquariums I've been to. The main feature was the impressive 4 story tank.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Happend to be there during feeding time which was cool and I really like the different cnidarians they had.
Overall though I was disatisfyed with the amount of space that the animals had to move around, wish the animals had more space.
title: New England Aquarium

text: When I walked in, I was surprised by all the penguins! The man giving the penguin demonstration was very informative. I was very disappointed by the lack of jellyfish, as those are usually my favorite exhibits. It's not a very large aquarium, but I enjoyed walking around and spending the afternoon there.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I loved the exhibitions, the animals and everything related to wildlife. My only "critique" are the prices of the cafe and the store...damn not even Disney! I wanted to bring gifts to my family back in Puerto Rico but those prices!! Too much. And for the food, literally spent almost $30 for a burger when for like 75% less I paid for a entre and soda on a restuarant like two blocks away from the aquarium
title: New England Aquarium

text: Cozy and well laid out aquarium. Large penguin presence on the ground floor, with sea lions kdd to the side
title: New England Aquarium

text: a very large aquarium there are three levels to explore many kinds of fish and children enjoy it.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A great aquarium! I had a fantastic time looking at all of the exhibits. The staff were all very helpful and polite. Touching the manta rays was really cool. The water column in the center was quite fun to walk around and watch all the fish and the sea turtle swim around.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Itâ€™s not often that a wedding ceremony is interrupted by a seal. You read that rightâ€¦a SEAL. But thatâ€™s exactly what happened at Alyssa & Andyâ€™s New England Aquarium wedding in Boston. Their wedding ceremony took place along Boston Harborâ€™s Harborwalk.
It was absolutely beautiful and we were so happy to do the photography and videography for the day. Alyssa & Andy had a Jewish ceremony overlooking the harbor and then moved into the aquarium for cocktail hour, and finished with the reception under the big tent.
Having everything in one place made the day flow so smoothly. The Boston Aquarium is a wonderful and unique wedding venue that is full of charm!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I brought my nephew here with my sisters and brothers and he absolutely loved it. I've been here several times throughout my childhood and even as an adult. It never gets boring and there's always something new to discover. I'm obsessed with the inner tank that you get to walk around and up to the center.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love taking my son to the New England Aquarium, and he loves to see the fish and the penguins and the seals! It's on the smaller size, but perfect for small children. Try to make it in during the day in the week, otherwise it's very, very busy. It's a good date destination, too. In the summer, there are some outdoor bars where you can sit by the water and eat as well. It's in a good part of the city for walking around and exploring after you've finished with the fish, too.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very underwhelming. Spent maybe 2 hours here. Should be called giant fishbowl with limited other animals. Or if you want to see penguins come here. Overpriced for an underwhelming experience
title: New England Aquarium

text: The best aquarium I have ever visited in USA. There is a nice 90 years old tortoise and they feed them very nicely. The main aquarium is so giant and so beautiful. Having variety of species of fishes, snakes etc etc. Nice collection of Penguin. They are so innocent and cute...
title: New England Aquarium

text: The Aquarium in Boston is definitely worth a visit. It is not the largest one out there, but very nicely set up with a mesmerizing water tank in the middle and a spiral walk way all the way around. There is quite a lot to see: amazing penguins, graceful sea lions with view of the harbor, octopi, giant sea turtles, anaconda, electric eel, moray eels (pictured), poison dart frogs from amazon, piranhas, and more. Prepare to see a lot of children here, and bring your own (my friend's baby loved it).
title: New England Aquarium

text: A small aquarium in great location. When not to full a place to enjoy the animals. Can recommend, but not on weekend days (overcrowded). The paths are clever built so you havr good views. Loved the seals and the good atmosphere of this place!
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Beautiful location in the Boston area. It was raining but we found the parking lot but very expensive for 2 hours itâ€™s 40$

So be aware of the parking expenses.

Aquarium was pretty place. Will visit again.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Awesome place with plenty of animals! The staff we ran into we're incredibly helpful and knowledgeable, always eager to answer any questions we had. Exhibits and building we're very clean and well kept, animals all looked very healthy and happy.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Great range of fish and mammals, with a penguin exhibit thats it feel like you are close enough to touch them.  The centre tank is a fantastic feature allowing the crowd to keep moving and viewing.  The seal training display was great to see and the animals look like they are very well looked after.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Zoo , Aquarium excites me more and when it's about ocean life I am like super duper thrilled . So was this visit , I enjoyed a lot and asked two questions here to the staff .
1. How the water is getting cleaned ?
Staffs are working here and cleaning the water regularly and there is other water source also from where fresh clean water is also coming .
2. Are the small fishes ðŸŸ getting attacked by big ones ?
Yes , this maintains the ecosystem and the normal situation .

The Penguins gave me a feeling of calm and peace and luckily I saw how the staffs are feeding them small fishes from their basket .
Other creatures were as well good , specially the  electric fish , Anaconda , Octopus .
title: New England Aquarium

text: A great place to see sea life. The giant tank is great to see. I always find myself being dragged to the next exhibit by the children because I'm trying to read the information.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Awesome experience for kids if you can save money buy your tickets through city pass or a vendor that provides sales or a member.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Beautiful facility. Everyone was so friendly. It was feeding time so it was very interesting to watch everyone.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Pricey.. But great for the kids. There should be a time limit on people ogling. Some rude patrons but great staff. We had fun.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Smaller than we thought. Lots of penguins, a seal show outside, and many many tanks inside. There is large central circular tank that spans about 4 floors and is very unique.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Kids had an amazing experience and love the place. Was easy to get around and lots of activities for the kids. Especially after being in Boston at several museums where as my kids say."we can't touch anything "
title: New England Aquarium

text: A very nice aquarium - the penguins are the highlight, as is the multi storey saltwater aquarium with all the big fish (sharks, sea turtles etc).  My favorite were the sea dragons.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A lot of fun wasn't as big as I thought it would be but definitely worth it the penguin exhibit was the coolest part in my opinion
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very busy but that's because it was Feb vacation, but my daughter loved it and the touch tank was awesome for kids.
title: New England Aquarium

text: How can you not love a place that has penguins right when you step in the front door?! This place is amazing for all ages and is always a fun and interesting time. Every time I go I feel like I learn something new. The staff is always super friendly and they all appear to love their jobs which really improve the atmosphere there. Prices may seem a bit high at first glance but it is definitely worth the price, trust me!
title: New England Aquarium

text: We parked about 2 miles away from the aquarium and walked. We wished we had brought bathing suits for the kids. They had an area on the way to the aquarium where water shoots out the ground and kids would run through it. Once at the Aquarium there were long lines to buy tickets. It's much better to buy tickets online. This aquarium is absolutely beautiful. So colorful. We all enjoyed petting the stingrays, star fish & horseshoe crabs. We missed petting the sharks. They come out in the morning and evening. We were there midday. The various species of penguins reminded me of the movie Happy Feet. The main aquarium is 4 levels high and is 23 feet deep. We were able to watch scuba divers cleaning the tank and the backs of the huge turtles. I loved the colorful anemani. I will definitely visit again.
title: New England Aquarium

text: The aquarium was busier than Disney during Christmas and it's August. Maybe people are trying to get out of the rain (still have to stand in the rain for tickets and another line to scan tickets for entry), maybe last outings before going back to school, maybe there was a promotion. Either way, waves and waves of kids. Aquarium was smaller than we thought. One central giant round tube with sea creatures, a wrap around Penguin exhibit that can be seen from all 5 levels. One can see sea creatures getting to the water surface on level 5. A few side displays along the wall on each level and that was it! Spent more time in giftshop thank the Aquarium ðŸ¤”.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This was the highlight of my visit to Boston. There was a long line to get in, but we realized half way through waiting that you could just go buy your tickets online and go right in. So we did that. It was jammed pack, but still worth it. When you go in, there is a large pool area seperated into 4 for the different types of penguins. We arrived just as they were getting fed, which was so fun. The pool surrounds the main feature, which is a huge 3 or 4 story aquarium. There are 2 giant turtles in there which are so cool to see. When you get to the top they have some chats there with the staff and they feed the turtles. There are also smaller aquariums throughout and a pool where they do shows with the seals. But our absolute favorite part was the interactive noseray and small shark pool. You can put your hand in the water and they come by so you can pet them! A couple of the noseray even wanted to cuddle, I swear! He kept trying to get onto my arm... maybe he just wanted to get out, lol. Make sure not to miss this part as it's not part of main hall. It's a seperate entrance near the exit.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A little high priced but my twins loved it they enjoy looking at all the aquatic animals, there could be more to it tho itâ€™s just that one large aquarium in a spiral to look at but for the kids Iâ€™d go back
title: New England Aquarium

text: Clean and convinient. They provide many staff throughout the aquarium to provide information and guidance. I enjoy the penguins and the giant aquarium. I gave it 4 stars because it is a bit pricey to get into and the aquarium is small.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
One of the best aquariums I've even seen!
In the big tank in the middle of the aquarium you can see different sorts of fish from little to huge and a huge turtle.
This aquarium also has a really rare blue lobster.
There is also a nice terrace outside from where the whole Boston skyline is seen.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Born and raised just outside of Boston, and recently came back to visit.  This reminded me of my childhood.  Even as an adult, this aquarium is still amazing.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I love the aquarium!! They're doing reduced capacity and timed entry to keep folks safe during the pandemic, and as a bonus, the reduced capacity makes the aquarium feel less claustrophobic.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had so much fun. The Inax 3-D  shark movie was great. The Seals and Penguins  were awesome.
title: New England Aquarium

text: So much fun enjoying the New England Aquarium in Boston with my 15 month old Granddaughter and family... Large well laid out exhibits make it fun and educational...
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is a fun friendly place to go adults or kids. A little disappointed that there's  no dolphin show anymore but still had a great time.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This is a great aquarium!! Lots of variety, very cool displays! Watching the green sea turtle chasing after bits of lettuce at feeding time is one of the most adorable things. The aquarists (?) are super friendly, knowledgeable and very happy to answer all of your questions. The membership deal is also very good - we got the package for 1 member + 3 guests AND the named member can be either me or my partner (you just have to be at the same address). It was $159 compared to $124 for 4 adult day passes. And we will definitely be back after a super fun experience!
title: New England Aquarium

text: A great aquarium with wonderful experiences and a beautiful central aquarium that you walk a spiral ramp around for 3 stories. Great staff and beautiful sea life shown off here.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
It was fun, but my 18 month got a bit overwhelmed.
I do wish there were more interactive exhibits for all ages.
But we had a nice time and once we find some more quiet windows in the large central exhibit, my son seemed to have a better time. Would recommend waiting for kids to be a bit older than 18 months.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's decent aquaium and my 2,9 y.o. loved it! It was great to see how the staff fed the rays - quite a spectacle! We didn't go to imax, just got a regular ticket.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My family & I love the aquarium. All the exhibits really are beautiful and the staff are so knowledgeable about their animals. The tanks are kept very clean for the fish. A great family fun experience overall.

text: Had fun seeing the penguins but the place is too crowded. A lot of fun and really interesting facts about marine and aquatic life.

text: It's a beautiful place, perfect for those cold days when it's not fun to be outside. Found it kind of small and pricey. The penguings and the octopus were the best part for my daughter.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Loved the penguins. Extremely disappointed that we weren't able to find the octopus
title: New England Aquarium

text: Super fun! Absolutely love how many penguin specifies were there. Very kid friendly. Clean and well kept. Definitely would recommend!
title: New England Aquarium

text: There are so many exciting things to see for a marine life lover! Penguins, octopuses, giant turtles, sharks, eels, all manner of tropical fish and rays to pet. It's even better than when I came when I was 10. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff who are happy to answer any questions.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
DO: purchase tickets online instead of waiting on long lines. You'll be able to head right in by scanning e-tickets (2 adult tickets for $55.90 + $3 surcharge)
DON'T: park at the lot on Milk St unless there is no other option. There are lots in the area that are far cheaper.

Upon entry your family will take a photo in front of a green screen which will be available for purchase
title: New England Aquarium

text: Myrtle the turtle is such a novelty! The aquarium has done such an amazing job keeping all of the animals safe and happy! Beautiful place!
title: New England Aquarium

text: I had brought my service dog here to see how she would interact with the environment she absolutely love watching the seals and penguins swim. We also brought her on a whale watch in she loves it I plan on going many more the summer
title: New England Aquarium

text: Nice aquarium with huge tank that runs through the center if the building, three stories tall. Good spot for 1.5-2 hours. Didn't see any sharks but I might have missed them.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My first time coming to an aquarium and it was absolutely breath taking! I loved watching the penguin feedings and going to the starfish and stingray touch ponds! Definitely recommend coming here during a trip to Boston and will definitely be coming back during my next trip!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Loved loved this place. It was a beautiful experience with 3-4 floors an amazing coral reef which is original. It's definitely a recommended place for any tourists visiting Boston.

text: I had a great time. Missed whale watching due to high winds but overall a great visit.

text: Best aquarium I have ever been to!  By far! Lots to see,  well maintained and good explanations of all the exhibits. A must see in Boston.

text: We got in with our Go Boston pass which made it well worth our time. Originally came at 1pm but on advice from some locals left and came back at 3:30 when there was less student groups. This place was really really cool! The penguins alone made it something I have never experienced so close before and all the workers made it very interactive. The aquarium in the center of the building was massive! At the top there was some demonstrations and got to see them feeding the turtles which was incredible in itself. Overall I think this is something you have to see in Boston!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Was amazing for all ages

text:
Main takeaways: not worth the price, but the kids did have fun. The exhibit was small, very warm (no ac even in Summer), and the main thing is that the dinosaurs appear to be inflatable? And in very poor condition (missing teeth, hair and feathers missing in large patches, sections of the inflatable not working etc.) the lighting is also very low and odd. It seems designed to be scary and colorful maybe, instead of actually being able to see any detailing on the creatures. I paid $25 per person (including the kids) and you can see the exhibit in 15-20 minutes (reading all of the educational material). It just isnâ€™t worth it.

The only reason this isnâ€™t a 1 star or a complaint to the organization for a refund, is that the kids did have fun. The dinosaurs are touchable (probably why they are in such terrible condition). And there is an interactive coloring program at the end that is pretty good (but even that was glitchy.)
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text: Had an awesome time with the family today the prices are not bad at all and there was no line. Friendly staff. Great day trip. Pack a lunch and eat on the green way. Also check out the street performers some where on America's got talent
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text:
NOT WORTH THE COST!!!
Save your money, and use the $25 for something that is more than 10 mins long. Also for $75 we could have   had hours worth of fun some where else in the city rather than 10 mins.

Is it a fun experience for children ages 3 to 12, yes! If money is NOT a worry for you then go and enjoy yourself. Our child had a great time for the 15 mins. However, $25 for adults and children is absolutely ridiculous. At BEST this is should cost $12 for adults $5 for children.

The only reason they can get away with charging such an absurd price is because it is in Faneuil Hall.

Our daughter had a great time. But for 10-15 mins of walking around for $25 is INSANE.
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text: We had such a great time - my 3.5 year old loved it ! He is obsessed with Dinoâ€™s - and isnâ€™t sure if they were real or not - but he is convinced the spinosaurous outside was totally real.  have seen reviews say that they took 10 minutes to walk throughâ€¦ I think thatâ€™s bad on those families , cause we were there for awhile and loved it ! Everything was high quality and the staff was so nice. I would recommend to anyone trying to find fun things to do during these cold weekends !
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text: This was the best dinosaur exhibit we have found in the area. My son is a big Dino fan, so we have attended quite a few. The dinosaurs looked realistic and there were lots of great facts near them. We also loved the scavenger hunt and the overall layout. It was stroller and wheelchair friendly. It was very well organized, but also gave you freedom to move at your own pace. I would absolutely recommend this experience to people of all ages.
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text: Although I am not a child I am a big fan of the original Jurassic Park movies so I thought it was really fun. The little scavenger hunt thing was cute. Just FYI the maps directions were confusing and didn't take you to exactly the right spot but it's attached to quincy market. It's very well marked from the outside but kind of hard to find the right place if you don't know the organization of that shopping area. It is walkable from North Station, about 14 minutes.
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text: While the venue space is limited, the dinosaur construction was high quality with decent historical information. text:
Please note: NO WHEELCHAIR or STROLLER access on the day of our visit. There is one small elevator serving all of Quincy Market and if itâ€™s inop - you cannot access the Dino Safari since itâ€™s located up a huge flight of stairs. They suggested we carry the stroller upstairs. Not possible due to weight of stroller & 19-month old â€” but also not safe for child. The folks at Dino Safari said theyâ€™ve â€œbeen askingâ€ them to fix the elevator for some time.
Just keep accessibility in mind if you have a wheelchair, stroller, or if climbing multiple stairs is difficult.
The exhibit was nice, tho overpriced, imo. Our little dinosaur-loving grandson was done in under 20 mins, incl the 5 min movie at start.

text: Iâ€™ve been renting from Yankee for more than a decade and I donâ€™t know which is better - the quality of the boats or the service.  Simply put, the owners are great people and the crew they hire is the best. They are all personable, kind, and hard working. The boats they rent are perfect for all your basic needs on Lake George - tubing, water skiing, fishing, picnicking on an island in the Narrows,  or just moored up at Sandy Bay.  They are well maintained and clean.  I highly recommend choosing Yankee over any other marina.

text: We rented a boat last weekend from Yankee. The staff was very friendly, and the rates were good! Great boats, good location, and nice clean bathrooms! Will definitely be coming back.

text: Our family has been renting boats from Yankee for 15+ years and this year did not disappoint.  Their boats are always in great shape and their customer service is unmatched.  Everyone is so helpful and courteous from pickup, drop-off and when you need help during the rental period.  We highly recommend renting your next boat from Yankee!!

title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: Very friendly, go only here  if you need a boat. Place is not (hi) like Thomas Hobag said. It is cheaper and the boats are newer than everywhere else. If your not from Lake George don't try to gauge pricing.
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text:
After a few years of renting boats from a local competitor that always had issues (non existent bimini, broken gas gauge, engine that was leaking gas, dirty and old boats, etc), i decided to try a new rental place.

I rented the 18 foot 150hp Bowrider.  There were no massive issues like before.  The boat was clean, fast, and fun.  The stereo didn't work but we had a wireless water proof speaker for this anyways.  We rented for 3 days and came back once for a fuel up in between.

The only downside was that we hit an underwater log in the middle of the lake.  They showed me the damage to the skeg and as I had taken a pic of the prop/skeg before the rental, it was undeniable.  Got hit with a $350 charge for repair, but I can't blame Yankee as this is part of the risk of boating.

I will be renting from Yankee from now on.
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: Great family fun! From boating to tubing! Beautiful  lake  and scenery!
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: good location and price

text: Definitely fun for everyone. We went on a Monday and got there basically as they opened. For about an hour lines were very short but around 11:30 the crowds started picking up. Even though some lines were longer we got through them pretty quickly. Surprisingly the restrooms were still pretty clean throughout the day considering how busy it was. Definitely recommend if you have the time for it.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Visited all the way from Texas. Inside the Mall of America ( largest mall in the US) I loved it was free parking. Price for park was affordable. $40 a ticket for an all day pass.  Visited on a Tuesday ( had Toddler prices for my 3 yr old) only downside was not all rides were open. Park is a Lil small but the kids enjoyed it . It really does have great rides for the small area. I enjoyed the rides too.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:
We were entertained. It's definitely worth arriving early as it got busy fast. We were all surprised that they didn't have any in person kiosks open to sell points. The automated kiosks' lines were super long. It would have been nice to have at least double the number of automated kiosks given the demand.

The lines were reasonable, but it did get busy fast. You almost need a few more maps around as there are a number of dead ends. We enjoyed ourselves but left before it got too busy. We will be back again.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: I came here at around 7:30 with my sister and bought tickets. The tickets are very expensive per person. We started riding the rides and realized how short the rides really were. Typical ride time was maybe 2 minutes. That felt like a scam when I was giving up 3-6 points per ride out of my 30 dollar 30 pt. Wrist band. Other than that the park was cool. Some of the rides were worth the money and I recommend trying the bigger ones if you arenâ€™t too scared. I donâ€™t recommend if you have motion sickness though. I am still sick 2 hours later.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Overall, a great time for the whole family. We paid $45 per ticket x 6 people. After the fact, we found that a 2 pack of tickets at Costco was $69.99! If you're a member, definitely go to Costco & pre-pay to save $$$! They have a wide variety of attractions for the little ones on up to the thrill seekers. If you're at Mall of America & enjoy amusement parks, make sure you plan a visit!
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: This place was a lot of fun, highly recommend checking out. We got the unlimited rides wristband that paid itself off. The lines were not terribly long and the operations were overall pretty good. I enjoyed pretty much all of the rides here.

text: I have been here twice from NC. Once on a Sunday and once during the week. Even when it's busy the lines aren't super long and move very quickly. There aren't a ton of rides maybe 20 in total but they are still fun and at 40 $ it's a good price. My kids love coming here and with the shopping mall and the restaurant selections right outside the gate there is something for everyone for sure.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: We don't visit here often, but they have some pretty fun rides here. We like the roller coasters best. The Ghost Blasters ride is pretty fun, too. It's a little on the expensive side but fun to do occasionally. We got the 5 hour wrist band and thought that was enough time to do everything a few times on a weekday. My kids loved it.

text: So much fun for adults and kids. We only went on one ride due to time constraints, but definitely want to go back and try all of the rides. Definitely recommend getting there right when it opens as we were able to get right on the rides with minimal lines. Walking around is free, but for the rides you have to buy tickets.

text: I know itâ€™s all over the nation, but seriously hire more people! text: We love Nickelodeon Universe!!!! They've got rides for toddlers, big kids and adults; face painting, caricatures, airbrush shirts. I've taken my kids multiple times and we all love it. Perfect anyday, especially if the weather outside is rainy/snowy/cold. Family friendly. Relatively clean environment. Nice selection of thrill and not so intimidating rides. I haven't experienced it, but they have a quiet/low stimulation room for those with autism as well. We went around Xmas and I was expecting crazy crowds. But it wasnt bad at all. There may be long lines for some rides but they move pretty fast. Most popular rides may have 30-40 minute wait times. There are places to sit and restrooms sprinkled throughout Nick Universe so you dont have to roam through the mall to find relief. Less crowded in the evenings after dinnertime. Wristbands allow all day access and wristband packages let you experience Nick Universal and other attractions like Sea World, Crayola Experience, mini golf, escape rooms, Fly Over America, etc. You can leave and come back to see the universe all lit up. It's a family favorite for us!!
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: The Shredder ride was probably the most intense. The SpongeBob coaster has that 90 degree drop, but it's so short you barely notice it. text:
The Nickelodeon Universe is just one of the best things to experience in Minnesota.
They have so many rides built inside the Mall of America. A very good place to explore with family and friends.
The prices are reasonable. The lines can be very long during the weekends, so plan accordingly. But overall its a great experience and highly recommended.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:
A kid themed, kid friendly theme park that 90s kids will love too, not just for the nostalgia, but also for the rides. The rides are thrilling without being too intense.

The fairly odd parents coaster was a lot of fun because it spun around while you were on it, the sponge Bob roller coaster was a pretty standard coaster, and my SO enjoyed the mutant scrambler. I like the jimmy neutron ride, but I apparently get motion sickness -_-. I used to ride 6 Flags Magic Mountain rides no problem. :(

They sell motion sickness medication at the nick shops. Just make sure to take it beforehand.

Overall, best theme park because you donâ€™t have to wait outside in a hot sun and itâ€™s indoors.

I wanted to ride the little kiddo rides too, but my SO kept calling me a weenie :(
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Auntie had the BEST Sunday Fun-day date with her Godson at this place! I'd never been to Nickelodeon Universe so didn't know what to expect but it was a definitely a blast. My little guy is 5. There are tons of rides and activities for him (some you can even hop on as chaperone without an upcharge!). The line to the play area was a wait so be prepared but for most of the others the wait isn't too bad. One tip: avoid the Caribou. The staff are not trained to manage a coffee shop and that was the longest wait we had all day for a simple coffee cooler. There's a Starbucks at the opposite end of the park. Just get there before the line gets too long! You will need caffeine to keep up with your littles! Loved the Dora Ferris Wheel, Crazy Car and Bus for the kids. And the Ninja Turtles made an appearance for pictures, at no extra cost! Points band are reasonable and there are many options. Wear comfortable shoes and make sure your phone is charged because 6ou will want lots of pics! Plan for a long day and go get a Auntie Anne's Sweet Almond pretzel with caramel dip for Adulting like a CHAMP.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Great experience for my daughter that likes thrill rides.  Not as exciting for my son.  You almost have to plan to do just that or other things in the mall to make the ticket price worth it for all day.  We ended up buying points only, but that is a more expensive way to do it vs the all access pass.  Few people were wearing masks (guests) and the lines are not distanced.  I wore a mask to be in solidarity with my children, even though vaccinated.  Some of the end of ride hand sanitizers were empty, so those are not being refilled often.  It's definitely a unique experience for children who haven't seen an amusement park indoors before!
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:
This place was so awesome! I've never been before and I had a ball with my three year old daughter!! The park is in the middle of Mall of America

- There are rides for all ages
- You can buy tickets per ride or the all day pass
- If your child is too small to ride by themselves you can ride for free
- Since it's inside the Mall of America there's plenty to do while the kids are playing
- Shops and food all around
- located on the first floor

This is a great place to go and have an adventure!!
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:

P.S. When buying tickets, be sure to check for current packages. You can even get a discount for the aquarium in the basement!

text: Had a ball! Would recommend for families!

text: The kids had a blast and so did the wife and I. A lot of rides to ride from 2+ to adults. The lines are super dead on Thursdays were we just kept getting back in line over and over. Dizzzzzy.... At night time when the lights come out are awesome looking and the place just has good vibes. We had a blast and well worth it for the 2 day pass if you're going to be staying a couple of days. We will be coming back to visit soon.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Theme park in the center of MOA. Nice theme park, reasonably clean and well maintained. Staff are typically younger, but this didn't stop a couple of them from chatting with my babbling toddler. They have a nice mix of rides for both older children and younger. I really appreciate that the chaperone doesn't need to pay to ride with the toddler. Toddler Tuesday is also a great way to have a few hours of fun with a great discount. They clean their Paw Patrol play place multiple times a day which was very nice to see given the number of tourists from around the world letting their kids play. All in all a nice diversion for the kids especially if your toddler loves Paw Patrol!
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:
Needs better training for staff.  My 3 and 5 year olds love Adventure Bay and brought them there for the 5+  times since it open.Â  However, I observed something very concerning yesterday that needs to beÂ addressed to the teenage workers.Â Better training for all staff.

There were still time to play, but some families were leaving. The worker was kind enough to open the exit gate for people to leave, but then at one point, a kid no more than two years old walked towards the gate and he opened it to allow the kid to leave on his own. The staff wasn't paying attention at all to who he was letting out. The parent was busy with her other child who was still inside. As you know, the place gets super busy for parents to keep an eye on every children and she could have done better too, but how does an employee just let a small child leave on their own without an adult!! Right before I was going to address this, (I had two children who were still in the playground to watch as well), the mother finally realized it and ran to her child who was at least 10 yards away thru the gate in a very busy area.Â  When I addressed this with the teenage employee, he seemed very clueless about his action and did not understand the magnitude for his mistake. I get that other families were leaving, but this child was a completely different race, so even that should have at least alerted him that he should not open the gate for a kid that is by himself.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: This place is lots of fun. There is stuff the whole family can enjoy. text: Haven't been to this mall since I was a kid. Major changes since the 90s. New rides and attractions through out the area. Now known as Nickelodeon instead of Camp Snoopy. Rides were fun and still has the Pepsi coaster.

text:
Nickelodeon universe is always fun. I think the all day wristband is reasonably priced, it's well worth it compared to buying individual tickets which will go fast. There's rides for all age levels and an arcade.
For an extra cost you can do the ropes course, zip line or Fly Over America, all of which are fun but not necessary to have a great time here. The park is always clean and I love the live trees and plants.
There's also snacks throughout the park and the food court is just up a level and easily accessible from the park.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: I am definitely bringing my son back here! Looks like so much fun. I walked around and took a few photos to show him at home. There is a ride for everyone and when your finished. There are so many restaurants. Then of course shopping at The Mall of America.

text: I will always have a special place in my heart for Camp Snoopy but Nickelodeon Universe is pretty great too. A lot of the rides were very much geared towards kids when I was younger but now they have plenty to do for adults now. Definitely a great place for families.

text: Never heard of this until my sister won passes.  It was awesome and my most relaxing amusement park experience we have had. Nothing like a climate controlled amusement park with little to no lines (we went mid week) and it was all close together.  I think our family favorites were the fairly odd roller coaster and the water log ride.  Without paying for the admission, you can walk thru the park and take advantage of getting pictures with all the Nickelodeon characters.  Even though we didn't pay for the tickets, they had many affordable options like Toddler Tuesday, buy tickets for one ride, or an after 5 option.  Staff was friendly an courteous and the park was clean.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:
It's your standard mini amusement park. Free to walk around in/ through.  About $8 a ride (6 point rides- which is most). More of the kiddie/ toddler rides are 3 point rides and maybe $6ish per ride. The Pepsi Rollercoaster was probably the longest and doesn't go upside down or too fast. Reminiscent is the whizzer at Six Flags if that resonates with anyone.
You could probably get it all done in a half day if you go early when it opens- lines go quick. Later in the day or weekends are probably busier times.
They also have carnival type games we didn't do.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Oh, the joy of unleashing the kid from within! Try not going on a weekend to avoid the long line at the rides

text: Busy but still not outrageous wait times like at Orlando theme parks, for example. Yeah yeah, these rides are not as big and fabulous. text: The Kids Loved this place and enjoyed it for hours! There are so many ride options packed into a mall its pretty incredible!  Good for family's or people of any age! text: Go on a weekday. It's so dead the ride operators wait for you to walk up so they can run the ride. And definitely get the unlimited ride wristband- if you're going to do any other attractions in the mall get one of the passes that includes those, too, it saves you a ton of money. Surprisingly concessions and souvenirs weren't badly priced, either. The rides were a bit painful but really fun, and the theming was cool for two 20 somethings who grew up with these characters but admittedly, most of the kids around had no idea who a lot of them were.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Well worth the visit. All my kids three to sixteen loved it.

text: The rides were more intense than I expected, which was great. Who knew indoor rides could be that thrilling? The staff made you feel like they had better places to be. I was bummed that you couldn't buy a ticket for just one ride. Also, it was very confusing to find where to go for each ride.

text:

text: Fun place to take the kids, majority of the rides are geared toward young kids. Only complaint really is the pricing. We do the points ticket for 3 kids which is cheaper than a day pass for each kid. Points never expire but then you are limited to how many rides they can go on.

text: Love this place, really nice with a lot of fun. I was working there in 2019. I really miss this place.

text: This is just great. An amusement park in the middle of a mall. Does it get any better! There are rides for all ages, a zip line and ropes course, and other attractions that will entertain and scare the bejebers out of you... :)
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text:
An amusement park in a mall is a really cool concept. We really came here just so I could say I've ridden a roller coaster in a mall.

We rode the Pepsi Orange Streak. I think we made the wrong choice because it was very slow with almost no hills and no loops. The SpongeBob one next to it looked more intense.

While it's fun, it's not cheap. A single ride costs about $8. You can do an all day pass too, but that is just under $40. At that price, I'd rather just go to a real amusement park with more/better rides.

If you're at the mall with kids, I can see this being a fun thing to do.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: Fun for all ages, being over 42in is helpful, come after 5pm to save on "all day" passes. Short lines during the week and can get your fill in a few hours. A 30pt card lasted an hour with two younger kids and they had  their fill for $30.

text: The rides seemed more geared toward teens. A lot of roller coasters and thrill rides. There were rides for my 6 year old, but they are all like fair rides, nothing unique. The high ropes course and zipline looked awesome, but it was a separate cost from the points system. Overall, I wasn't impressed. I just felt like I was at a glorified fair.
