text:
This park pays homage to a lot of great shows that older people and younger have had in their lives. Seeing some of your favorite childhood friends being represented by a roller coaster and/or a giant version of them is amazing.

A lot of the rides are underwhelming but there are a few that really stand above the rest. It's obvious that Spongebob's Rock bottom is really a highlight attraction for the park. With not only the most excitement offered for a ride there and with it's intimate connection to the episode of spongebob it's derived from. Up until my attempt to ride this attraction I was super impressed with the staff's ability to load people on rides and keep everything flowing well. The attendant at the spongebob ride was either very ill or extremely hungover. Every step seeming like an even heavier burden on him. Watching a coaster fly around for a minute and then waiting till just before he needs to open the gate to take long drinks out of a water bottle. And some of the slowest checking for seat belts and safety things being in place I've ever seen. Ironically another concern is his ability to pay attention to what he needs to because he just seemed so out of it.

Paying the minimum amount for a wristband to share with my family to go on a few rides is still 54$. After a day of spending too much money at other stores and trying to end it with some great characters and rides we cherish, we left disappointed.

Still an amazing place.
title: Nickelodeon UniverseÂ®

text: After planning my trip, I noticed there would be no characters the week I was bringing my 2 year old to celebrate his 3rd bday with Blues Clues. I called Nickelodeon Universe spoke with Michael who explained how they were doing things do to COVID, only sponge bob and a couple of his friends would be out. Michael took my email address  told me he would talk to his supervisor to see if he could do anything. I got an emailed a couple days later saying Blue would be there. When I tell you my son was excited,, he was excited, and we have Michael to thank for that, he went over and beyond and I appreciate that. Thank you for enjoying what you do and taking the time to extend that joy to others. We are forever thankful to you for creating such magic.

text:
Three wristbands were purchased for this visit. For the most part this was a very good visit. I've been here multiple times with my kids. Usually, with my two older ones. I did bring the two year old almost three year old this time. We did decide to go on the Dora Azul Train ride pretty basic right.  She met all the requirements for the ride, but I soon realized I may need to accompany her on the ride. I assume the attendant would understand and allow me to ride with my daughter, no that was not the case.
I was told NO!! Unless, I brought a ticket. I said, "she not going to stay seated she doesn't understand you." The attendant still say no and started the ride. My daughter stood up the attendant had to get on the mic and tell her to sit down and I said again she doesn't understand you. Can I now get on the ride and he said yes.
I soon realized I may need to go talk to a manager so I can let them know what is going on and get permission for the kids rides as chaperone capacity but was that's not possible. I got frustrated and blurted out that she is on the Spectrum which I wanted to avoid in the first place.
My issue is that if a parent tells someone that a kid needs a chaperone, that parent shouldn't have throw more money to your establishment to keep that kid safe. I'm already spending a fortune at your establishment.

text:
For only a little more than $30, you can spend as long as you want at this indoor amusement park, featuring a fair number of fun rides, even a few that are impressively thrilling given the limitations of a 4-5 story ceiling. The Rock Bottom Plunge and whatever the name for the Tower Drop ride is stand out in my mind, as does the Fairly Odd Coaster.

text:
NiteHawk is the best place around to play scenario paintball / woodsball / Req. Which is saying something because what few choices we do have in the area are all great! NiteHawk management is excellent and always willing to help as are the field regulars.
They offer decent rental equipment so you can bring your buddy, or for yourself if you're not convinced to make the investment in your own gear.
They offer food, and drinks at the field at fair prices and the field paint is reasonably priced also. NiteHawk is a passion project for the owner and regulars that come here and this is one of the things that make it special IMO. There is a sense of community at NiteHawk, and it's just an absolute blast  to go out and play paintball here.

text: For a small state this Zoo was awesome.  I absolutely loved how the animals were up close & were all out for everyone to see. This Zoo looks small from the outside but is really big. I love the feeling that they are all about the animals rather than profit. Make sure to take quarters cause you can buy pet food for the goats to eat which is so much fun for all ages.
title: Dakota Zoo

text:
Visited from out of town and spent family time at the Dakota Zoo.

I'm used to bigger zoos that are very crowded and the animals are 20 feet away.  I was expecting to see animals I see at my home zoo; I was wrong.  The variety and habitats of the animals is fun and interesting.

The zoo was not crowded.  My family could wander around at their own pace.  The zoo is very well covered by trees which provide shade in many places.  The paths are a bit run down, but fine for wheelchairs and strollers.  We did not have a map of the zoo which made it confusing to me.  My daughter knew her way around and there are info signs periodically to show the exhibit locations.

I did not see many food stands that I'm used to in bigger zoos.  I think everything is near the entrance.  There is a petting zoo at the entrance as well.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Everyone was super nice and shared a lot of cool info about the animals. Got a nice tour along with getting the chance to pet snakes! Only issue I would say I had was almost tripping a few times on the uneven paths. The rest of the park was very nice and was bigger than I thought it was gonna be with lots of cool animals! Thank you for the awesome visit!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Omgeee I loved it maybe because I donâ€™t see animals like that in Florida but this zoo is amazing. We saw camels , bisons , donkeys , grizzly bears, wolfs and the list goes on . It was very spacious and no big crowds which was another plus. I love this zoo!!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: love this place. visited on tuesday for the first time and lady at the front was very accommodating. thereâ€™s a huge variety of animals. even though i came on a weekday, it was somewhat crowded so thatâ€™s nice. thereâ€™s a cute gift shop by the front thatâ€™s surprisingly cheap from other places. if you want to go on a train ride on a weekday, i suggest coming after 4 pm because most of the drivers are high schoolers i believe? btw if you buy food for the farm animals, make sure you use a dispenser thatâ€™s somewhat full, if you donâ€™t, thereâ€™s a good chance nothing will come out but itâ€™s no big deal. will definitely come back!
title: Dakota Zoo

title: Dakota Zoo

text: I've gotta give this one â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ for sure. Well-maintained, lots of exhibits, plenty of variety, many high-interest animals, all in a spacious, easy-to-navigate setting. Having visited once w/ our six young children/teens, we'd definitely have interest in going again. The African penguin exhibit is brand new and very nice. You need to check it out!
title: Dakota Zoo

text:
The penguins were our favorite attraction this time. Little Ambrose liked my daughter's sparkly dress. We can't wait for the new otter habitat.
We do miss the mini doughnuts. That was always a tradition, to eat doughnuts while we ride the train. Also, hoping the gift shop gets some monkeys similar to what lives in the zoo. They are a must see and we would love to have a little plush as a memento.
Buy the annual pass, once is never enough when it comes to The Dakota Zoo!
title: Dakota Zoo

title: Dakota Zoo

text: This is the most amazing zoo I've ever been to. Only $9.50 for adults and they had tons of animals ( I must say, no elephants or african animals, but I did not miss them). We got to see all the predators up close, there is a really cool wooded loop for walking and all sorts of animals. Do not miss out on this great zoo.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Great family zoo. Has a fun train that you can ride and tour the whole zoo. It's a great way to see the whole area. They have a very wide range of animals. A kiddie park and really fun discovery area to go in and cool down on hot days. They also have fun family activities you can attend through out the year.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: It was a cute zoo and had many surprisingly exotic animals. I liked that they had a train and you can rent out wheelchairs for seniors. It was much bigger than I initially anticipated and the animals looked well taken of.

title: Dakota Zoo

text: I love going to the zoo, any zoo but having a home town zoo like the Dakota Zoo is the best. I  really enjoy watching all the animals. It's a great way to spend an afternoon.

text: It was a very nice Zoo. Small but with a lot to see. We got to see raccoons up close and you could buy food to feed them and other animals throughout the park, like the groundhog in the photo. They have lots of animals to see. We even saw a white tiger sleeping on top of an outpost and a Bangel tiger too. The white tiger was a sleep. The cost to get in was $9 each which isn't bad. We went on our anniversary in August. Which was very nice warm and not a lot of ppl there. You should stop in and see this place. Only reason I didnt give it a 5 star was because I thought they should've had more places opened in the park to get something to eat or drink.

title: CityCade Classic Arcade and Pinball Game Bar, Gastonia NC

text:
I finally got a chance to check this place out. Most of the barcades are in Charlotte so it's nice to have one close to home. I went on a Thursday night which is "guys night" and was welcomed as soon as I walked in, both the owners and the guests were very friendly. For Thursdays, about all games were free (at least for dudes) except for pinball, which were .50 a game. Normally it's $5 a person for unlimited play and pinball is $1.00 a game (ouch to $1.00 pinball!). There were maybe 6 to 12 people rotating in and out while I was there, so not crowded at all. Parking was abundant. It's about a 5 minute walk from Freeman's. Bar can turn cash to quarters or can give you quarters from your bar tab for a 10% surcharge. Bar had food and drinks at fair prices. There are 2 gender neutral restrooms. There are a few TV's playing sports and comic book movies and YouTube videos. Place was open until midnight on a weeknight which was cool. There was one tv hooked up to a Nintendo 64 with a pretty large assortment of games. There were a couple party/board games sitting near a table. There was a fairly large area for outdoor seating as well. I think what made this visit special was how friendly the owners and guests were, felt like you were just visiting old friends instead of strangers.

EDIT: Citycade did a reconfiguration and brought in a racing game, a shooting game, a beer pong game and a couple of pay to win games disguised as games of skill. I believe at this point they've gotten rid of the $5 cover entirely and just made the machines take quarters, which I think was a good move. Pinball is still a buck which is a bummer since there are better options out there for $.50 a game, but it's close to home at least and the price point isn't uncommon. Pinball seems maintained and Citycade has occasionally swapped out for different pins, which is nice. Bathrooms are always clean which is a plus. Only complaint is that sometimes it can get a bit hot in the building.
title: CityCade Classic Arcade and Pinball Game Bar, Gastonia NC

text: This place is huge, clean, and impressive! We went in the morning, and it was really fun. My kids got a lot of fun and exercise in, in just an hour! Their favorite activity was the go-karts. They're silent, speedy, & so much nicer than outdoor gas ones. If you're short on time, you could even go here for a quick stop-in and do just the go-karts. We were helped by Chase, who was nice and knowledgeable, and Holland, who was helpful and fun. We were also able to talk with the owners on our way out, who were also very friendly, attentive, and excited about The Hive. Good vibes here! Go check it out!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text:
Great place, definitely glad to have it near us. Yes it costs more than Hang Time, but it has more to offer. Plus a bunch of couches and several massage chairs for adults.
At Hang Time I'm always worried about where my smaller kids are because you can't keep a good eye everywhere. Feels like it's for older kids and young adults with more trampolines for tricks.

What I like about The Hive it's good for kids of all ages. There's a tetherball with jumping around it. Two interactive video game screens that actually show their picture on screen as they jump, so fun!
Zip line, jumping basketball, targets, go carts (costs extra), the biggest bounce house/obstacle course I've ever seen. Regular trampolines too, rock wall, ninja warrior obstacles, slack line.

There are drinking fountains, but they're by the go carts (kind of annoying they're so far).
They also have bands to wear that have lights that change color when your time is up. They do have lockers as well.
Overall, we'll go again, but less frequently because of the cost. Still, i thought it was worth it, especially for families with kids.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text:
Spent several hours reading my book while my 11 and 14-year-old boys got plenty of exercise. I saw many small children and big children playing on many different things and itâ€™s big enough that nobody was getting in each others way. Prices were not as high as expected for how huge and nice the facility is. Of course trampoline parks are pricey regardless but I thought it was worth the money. Will be back.

Glow putt did get busy towards the end of our time there but we never felt in the way of that we were holding anyone up.

text:
This was a fantastic adventure. I would recommend going as a group of 2 or more. As this would be a very bland one person experience. The other people make it a blast.

Its relatively cheap, only about 10$ a person, for an hour or longer depending on the size of your group.

If I had to describe my least favorite experience, it would be the lack of variety of some hole layouts. Few are rather creative, and have some cool glow in the dark features. Most are fairly straight forward and require very little creativity to sink the putt. I would have liked to have seen holes that allowed two or three different ways to complete them. Even this was not enough to deter me from having a great time at low cost.

They do offer different types of discounts and party plans. This was an excellent way to have fun out of the sun. The staff was friendly and courteous.

Also they have really respected the social distancing brought on by COVID19. Each putter and ball is wiped and sanitized before each new user. They require masks which can be fun if you get one that looks cool in the black light.
title: Glow Putt Mini Golf

text: If I could, I'd go here all the time. The vendors were so cool, there's quests to do from the characters in the park. So many people dressed up and there's ax throwing and archery. I went for the Lore event and I loved it! We also did the haunt and it was definitely worth it! I wish there were more food options though. Can't wait to go back!
title: Evermore Park

text: Went at 6 pm on Friday. Interacting with the cast of characters was a lot of fun. Some of our group really enjoyed the fright walk (think haunted house) and the vendors had a lot of really cool stuff. Overall everyone was friendly and made the experience well worth it. Bring a light jacket or hoodie as it gets colder as the night goes on. Kids already talking about when we go back.
title: Evermore Park

text: The cast was fabulous and engaging. You HAVE to go on a quest. The vendor tents are wonderful to discover. Firepits are everywhere keeping you warm on cold winter nights. Lobster bisque was a delicious find. The lights create a festive ambiance. Genuinely had a great time.
title: Evermore Park

text: Our company party was held here and it was a great night.  It was a great experience and fun atmosphere.  The Christmas lights were still up and it made for an excellent evening. I enjoyed the train ride and got a great view of the grounds. I really like that there were fire pits throughout and we were able to stop and warm up for a minute.  I will definitely visit again.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I love it here at Evermore. My husband and I have annual passes and we have gone multiple times in the year. I love the actors, and their apple cider is amazing! The decorations and different seasons and stories are so fascinating as well.
If I were to change anything, it would be the parking. We have two individuals that love to come with us, but they need ADA parking due to their wheelchairs. â™¿ï¸ Today when we came, all the parking for ADA was full (which there is not much) and people where illegally parked in the ramp area. We had to park over by Dutch bros, go in the area people drive into, then find a way around the cars that were parked illegally in the ramp unloading/loading areas. I just wish it was more ADA accessible for both the side walks before entering the park, and for parking in general.
title: Evermore Park

text: The reptile and bird show was engaging and led by an excellent host. It also had air conditioning which was a plus during the heat of the day. A guy named Jonathan gave our kids a second sample of cotton candy after challenging our kids to compliment someone they didnâ€™t know which was a very pleasant experience and learning opportunity for them. There were very few food options but the activities were great!
title: Evermore Park

text: This place is so fun I love going with my kids and having little adventures. If they would complete the park and have more thing to interact with like little cottages that are dedicated to potions or herbs maybe some more characters running around THIS place really has the potential to be absolutely amazing and a definite tourist attraction they just need to put a little bit more TLC into it.
title: Evermore Park

text: I have followed Evermore since the early concept days, with a booth at Salt Lake Fan-X. I can tell you the park lives up to and exceeds my expectations. One of the best experiences anywhere. My favorite season is the Lore season, because of the haunt. The whole park is very family friendly, and great for all ages!
title: Evermore Park

text: Their website is a bit confusing thus we bought our tickets in person. We visited during an off season so there wasn't much to do. However we were able to walk around and enjoy the lights and participate in archery. Also there were a couple alpacas we could pet. This time of year the tickets cost about $19 per person.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Really great theming, but absolutely horrible experience. No actors, overcooked warmed food (2 options). No alcohol when there's a bar. No actors. Simply don't consider it during the winter since they can't justify hiring off season.

I'd love to try and experience it later in the year, but couldn't justify the flight cost.

Consider having annual passes for locals and price discounts, but charge more for out of state. Hell, advertise! So weak, could be so much more.
title: Evermore Park

text: My granddaughters and I love this place! This is the second time weâ€™ve gone and it has expanded so much! Lore is awesome. My teenage granddaughters and I have dressed up both times weâ€™ve gone and I have to extremely encourage everyone else to also. Youâ€™ll have more fun.
title: Evermore Park

text: Went with my wife, mother in law and sister in law this past Saturday night. I thought in terms of lighting, display and the characters it was all well done. We even bought a small homemade chipmunk..trinket. I felt a sense of excitement however I wasnâ€™t sure if completely understood the story that was cohesively being told. That being said if this going on next year we will be back! Also, I will dress more warmly next time..
title: Evermore Park

text: So much fun! I went here with my husband, brother in law, and nephews! This is an awesome experience that you can't really get anywhere else! However, we came here in December and it was freezing!! They had many fires so you could heat up for a bit, but we could not finish the quest as we were all too cold to carry on!
title: Evermore Park

text:
Hereâ€™s some helpful info if youâ€™re going during Aurora/Christmas time. We were able to get into the park pretty quickly; there were two lines - one for buying tickets and one for scanning them if you purchased them online (which we did). So we only had to stand in one line. We decided to get the meal included in our combo passes right away and ended up waiting 30+ minutes in a crowded line at Kettle Cafe to order and get our food. We were incredibly lucky because we found a 4 person table that cleared inside with 3 seats so our kids were able to sit there and my husband and I stood shoulder to shoulder to eat our food. Most people probably had to eat outside in the freezing cold. They told us they were out of desserts, so we didnâ€™t get to order them. But lo and behold, the dessert window was full of fresh new desserts just a couple minutes after we got our food. This was frustrating because we knew weâ€™d have to wait in yet another line to get the desserts included in our combo passes.
The wait for the train ended up being 55 minutes, plus a couple more sitting on the train waiting for it to go. This was pretty excruciating because it got down to 15 degrees the night we were there and there was no heating in the line which is covered by a roof but fully outdoors. We had really bundled up but it was still super cold. Our kids were troopers and hung in there because they really wanted to ride the train, which of course ended up not being worth a 10 minute wait let alone nearly an hour long wait in sub freezing temps.
So after we got that out of the way, we waited in the confectioner shop for cookies since we werenâ€™t able to get the desserts weâ€™d waited for earlier in the evening. Another 10+ minute wait but at least it was indoors which was actually pretty nice because we couldnâ€™t feel our fingers or toes by then (we were all wearing thick socks, snow boots, and gloves just for the record).
We spent a short while exploring outside but werenâ€™t clear on where to go to do a quest. The map on the website isnâ€™t very helpful because you canâ€™t zoom in and actually read the words on it.
Going to Evermore is something different to try at Christmas time, but a lot of waiting in lines if you want food and especially if you want to ride the train. Iâ€™d consider going there once every few years but maybe only when the weather is nicer.
title: Evermore Park

text:
we waited almost three years to finally come here.  we always had some set back that didnt allow us to go. we wish we had made it work earlier though.  but this trip was so worth it. we enjoyed both nights here in the park and feel like we didnt even scratch the surface of the stories we could uncover. every character interaction was interesting and made us want to know more.

one thing though.... i cant tell if there was actually a mission in the haunt or not.  maybe it was just to distract us and get more scares. but. aside from that unknown so good. please visit.
title: Evermore Park

text: Attended in October traveling from California and loved every single minute. The haunt is well worth it as it's done exceptionally well. The staff and actors are all so wonderful and nice. Can't wait to go again.
title: Evermore Park

text: Really cute place. I love the architecture and design of the park. There's a lot of attention to details that makes you feel like you are in a magical world. I wasn't expecting the food to be so delicious! Cute little shops. Fun lighting. Just a cool place to go visit.
title: Evermore Park

text: We purchased the tickets that included the meal, drink, dessert, train and haunt. We thought this was a great value for the money. We had a lot of fun and really enjoyed the entire experience.  We encourage anyone to try this very fun and original theme park!
title: Evermore Park

text: It was amazing! The storyline was fabulous and the cast easily bounced between interactions with kids and adults. It was one of the last trips I could do with my dad before college and it was definitely worth it! I highly recommend for anyone of any age!
title: Evermore Park

text:
If you are into Cosplay, LARPing, Renaissance Fairs, medieval lore, magic, fantasy, Middle Earth, etc. then this is the place for you.  We did general admission, and dressed in normal clothes, and were treated wonderfully.  Full costumes were celebrated of course.

Bring a little extra money for cool stuff you can buy all over the park.  Be ready for a lot of standing and walking.

The potential of this place is unbelievable.  You would never know it is hidden in a traditional city like Pleasant Grove!  They are continually adding new venues and experiences.
title: Evermore Park

text: Literally my favorite place in Utah. It's simply magical. And in the fall, it transforms into a Halloween Village that's incredibly decorated. The best âœ¨spooky vibesâœ¨ I keep coming back - can't stay away!
title: Evermore Park

text:
I visited evermore on a Friday evening with my husband at the start of Mythos season. We ate at Vanderâ€™s keep to start our evening. I recommend the butter toffee beer! It has a horchata-esque creamy cinnamon taste to it. Yum! I wish there were free refills. We tried the poutine, patty melt and deer meat. It was all delicious except the vinicent was kinda nasty, a crazy flavor if you arenâ€™t expecting it! The prices were also more steep than I was expecting.
Then we ventured into the park itself. We wandered up the eastern side and noticed lots of unfinished buildings and construction, so our first impression wasnâ€™t the greatest. But then we stumbled upon the renaissance fair activity area with archery, knife throwing, and dueling and that was a blast! We loved exploring the mausoleum and talking with the evermorians. It was fun to chat with the barmaid while taking shelter from the cold air. I liked how compact the park was so that you could run around completing quests and not get too worn out.
The hand crafted shops were fun, some prices more reasonable than others.
Overall a fun experience that is very unique! I only wish they would give you a guide/notebook with the activities listed, times, and conversation starters so that wasnâ€™t so confusing. With some more work this place could be amazing. I canâ€™t wait to see how it develops in the future.

Pros:
-Delicious Restaurant Food
-Evermorians are entertaining to interact with
-Fun buildings
-Feels like you are in a different world
-Max the Macaw!
-Ticket price is great

Cons:
-Sometimes unsure on how to interact with the park/evermorians/buildings
-Expensive restaurant
-Unfinished construction
-Seemed under-decorated this season compared to the Halloween photos
-A couple more activities would be great
title: Evermore Park

text:
Had a nice experience the park wasnâ€™t as crowded as expected. There were times youâ€™d have to wait to talk to characters or participate in activities. And a few things were extra. The build your own adventure style park was fun and has tons of room to expand and grow in the future! Iâ€™m excited to see the park grow and expand in future years!

That said they do need to expand some aspects of the park like having a more consistent schedule. The magic act and last circus show we attended on Thursday night was super short and was missing performers. Schedules need to be met and consistency needs to be seen in these. Also some sort of established system of barter and trade consistency would be nice to see. You can earn gold during Lore (2021) and trade it but it was hard to figure out who would take it and what they had to trade without time consuming interactions with several different people even a little sign saying gold traded here or something of the like would have been nice.
title: Evermore Park

text:
So this last Saturday the 4th of June was me and family's first time at Evermore. Holy heck did we have a blast. And we didn't even really do everything. There truly is so much to do and enjoy for everyone.  My daughters ran on quests to join the rogue elves guild, my 4 yr old joined the fairy guild and won the kiddo costume contest and my son who has no idea about fantasy dove right in when in the arena lol. Not knowing how to really interact made it a challenge but the Evermorians there made it really easy to do when they engaged with us. So even if your shy and nervous and dont know what to do someone will send a smile and interact with you, but its up to you to interact back just play with it and have fun.
Diego the orc was an absolute blast and my family chatted with him every chance they got.  All the fairys knew my daughter by name and would say Hi every time they saw us walking around. Sir Darlan as well took it upon himself to show her how to use a foam sword when she nervously asked him if she could touch the swords by the dueling area. Basically I just wanted to be able to say a true thank you to all involved for making this trip a truly memorable experience and one that will be repeated in years to come. And for any unsure about the experience don't over think it and just dive in and wander around there's so much to enjoy for everyone. I can't express it enough and just wanted to share it, thank you, thank you,  thank you from the Boyer clan.
title: Evermore Park

text: This was such a delightful experience! Despite living in Utah my whole life, I'd never heard of Evermore until the Taylor Swift news ðŸ˜‰ so great publicity there. So glad to have discovered this place. Definitely want to come back for the different seasons! The beautiful grounds, excellent staff and fabulous players, quirky, thoughtful programs and quests, etc. All of it was magical! ðŸ™ŒðŸ»â¤ï¸
title: Evermore Park

text: Easier than a voyage to Mt. Mordor, if youâ€™d like to see dragons, elves, and practice some archery and sword fighting, you will find no better place in real life than this. This place is an experience. Come enjoy a meal, a train ride, a nice walk, and complete a few quests while youâ€™re at it. 10/10.
title: Evermore Park

text: Absolutely incredible. The actors are so kind and hilarious to work with and insanely good with kids. Very reasonable prices and so much fun to be had! Such an incredible vision and we look forward to coming back!â€™
title: Evermore Park

text: What a beautiful winter adventure! Evermore is such a fun place with a choose-your-own-adventure vibe. My hubby and I spoke to Tundra Maximus the miner and explored the village and even a castle while we picked up side quests along the way. We warmed up with a little hot cider on our way to find Winter Weavers (elegant winter elves!). There were local vendors features handmade costume pieces, sculptures, etc. We wanted to free the ice giant but our dinner reservation came first, so we hustled to Vander's Keep. Oh my was the food delicious! Samantha Fox, our server, let us know the beef stew was inspired by a 19th century recipe and braised for hours. My husband loved his pork chops and I devoured my venison with chili-citrus ginger glaze, which was served a perfect medium rare. The classic cocktails were on point too. We wrapped up the night with a little archery and  headed home wanting to come back to enjoy more of everything.
title: Evermore Park

text: I love this little place! I went for the first time and it was so much fun. I would recommend dressing up. Thereâ€™s so much included in the entry fee and that fee is pretty small compared to most places. Everything was so themed and fun. The performances were awesome. Would definitely make this a yearly trip.
title: Evermore Park

text: First time going to the park and was impressed.  Our group of 8 with kids from 14 to 6 all had a good time.  The younger ones enjoyed the circus tent, animal show, and fire dancers, while the older took some warming up to get into the "You mean I have to actually talk to someone?" idea.  But once a couple quick quests were done and some fun stories were shared, they got over their shyness and began running from one Evermorian member to another.  Great experience.
title: Evermore Park

text:
We visited on a Saturday early September with a 4 year old and 2 year old. This isnâ€™t for young children thats why 5 and under are free. It did cost $20 for adults. Any sort of activities inside is gonna cost you. The train was broken so that was a bummer. We watched the magic show and fire dancer.

Now, the real entertainment here which makes it worth $20 IMO, are for the nerds. I myself being a nerd enjoyed taking on quests with my little boy. He actually talked to the â€œNPCsâ€ (as I call them lol) Now this is not for everyone. It involves being social and role-playing which could be weird and funny. You are in charge of your own adventure. If you donâ€™t talk to people, you wonâ€™t get any quests. The mayor was super nice and accommodating to my 4 yr old. One of the blackheart guild members humored us and said my son was getting 55 EXP and leveling up soon. That made my son excited to take on the quest. They do get rewarded with gold for completing quests though. The employees stay in character while talking to each other ðŸ¤£. I appreciated that and it added to the immersion. We did not do the haunted adventure because it costs an extra $15 and too scary for the littles. The park is small, so if you pay that extra 15 you get to go to a different side of the park. That is why you need to really be into quests otherwise you could be done in a 30 minute visit and be completely underwhelmed.

There were a lot of single goers enjoying themselves too. There were some straight up characters. I got confused who worked there and who didnâ€™t haha.

Overall, I can appreciate this place because I play RPGs. If you want to escape to another world this is your place.
title: Evermore Park

text: My friends and I had an amazing time at Evermore Park this past weekend. The park itself is beautiful with so much attention to detail, you can tell a lot of love and care went into the creation of this place. The quests we went on were fun and engaging, and every Evermorian we met was extraordinary.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Nice and interesting  place , like you are in a game , can get a mission  , go around talk to people to get your answer , or  Solving quiz.  I would say is an interesting  place ðŸ˜Š
Watch out at the archery area , the service  white young lady in the afternoon worker was rude to customers, that's only problem I had when I was there .. and I changed to 3 star because of that.
title: Evermore Park

text: Excellent venue. It was cold but it was so worth it. There are pits set up all over the property so you can get warm at every stop. It was amazing and must be seen
title: Evermore Park

text: What an amazing place!!! I had no idea that this place existed until today. We ate at Vanders keep and the. Decide to visit the park. I was not ready for the wonder inside. Make sure you interact with the characters in the park to go on the special quests.
title: Evermore Park

text: I'm between a 3 and a 4 star experience here. The actors are fully committed and extremely fun to interact with. Most of the site is fairly polished but there are some areas in need of tlc ( boarded up buildings etc) The concept of this place is so fun and I love the welcoming feel for all types. Very fun to see all the different guests dressing up. Some major pain pains were the confusing "quests" and the difficulty in finding an adult beverage on the property. Our group had no idea how to go about "joining a guild" or in "completing a quest" that was mentioned at the entrance. Some people in our party wanted to grab a drink while there and the only place was the onsite restaurant. When we asked at the front they told us we could sit at the bar and grab a drink as long as we purchased food ( standard utah law) but when we went inside they said we needed a reservation and we couldn't sit at the bar until after 9:45pm ( not a utah law requirement fyi) pretty annoying. We ended up making a reservation and wow, the food was super over priced and extremely underwhelming. We ended up sending back the chocolate cake (super stale) The drinks were watered down and not worth the price, the time it took to get to the table and the hassle. The restaurant wasn't even half full and was still soooo slow. Cool one time experience but until they work out the annoyances it's really not worth the $19  per person fee. Don't come hungry or thirsty because it's disney prices for a 7 peaks level.
title: Evermore Park

text: We had such a fun time at evermore park! Iâ€™m not super into fantasy stuff, but you really can choose what you engage with and how much. The shops are fun and the characters are amazing. It really warmed my heart to see characters interacting with all different types of people in such a fun and positive way. Only negative - the food is overpriced and subpar. There werenâ€™t many options and I honestly would eat after next time.
title: Evermore Park

text:
It was even better than anticipated, as the man at the door said. They are in the smaller season for evermore as they are celebrating the winter fest. He had said that winter fest allows you to experience a small amount of what evermore has to offer. And with that being said I cannot wait to see what Mythos and Lore are like! This will probably be a good tradition to integrate into my future family outings.

And I enjoyed dressing up and parading around, we also stopped at a firepit and hung around with the elf bard who entertained us with his humorous thoughts on the dust under the strings of his guitar. In which he proceeded to spit-shine and then lick it away when the first didn't work.

There are many more things that I enjoyed experiencing here, but for once I will actually withhold that information. And ask that people who see this review go and take a walk around evermore for themselves. You will really be in for a treat!
title: Evermore Park

text: Though I went late in the day, and perhaps late in the year (missing summer activities), I truly enjoyed myself. As a fantasy reader, I loved eating in Vander's Keep with an authentic fare and flair, and the grandkids loved the outdoor activities.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Let me begin by saying that Evermore has such great potential!
The young ladies who greeted us at the front entrance were incredibly helpful! Rebecca and Lee - 5
The young ladies at the archery -5
The haunted house- 3 very creative
Park set up: 4
Park amenities: 1
It is not disability friendly at all!
I asked to rent a electric scooter
I have ms and itâ€™s difficult to walk.
Someone stole the one scooter they had? ðŸ˜† lol thats a first
Food- 1
What a joke. They have a very nice restaurant set up
But it only serves 2 desserts that could pass for McDonaldâ€™s $1 desserts
They have smaller getups
They open at 6 food (can beef stew and Mac n cheese or chicken nuggets and fries sold out by 8
We had to wait literally 30 min and another 30 min for chicken nuggets
The food definitely not amusement park quality.
Park Combo- 1
The train ride was down
I asked for a bottle water to go towards my drink
I was handed a warm bottle of water straight from the case of water plastic bag!
The guy was literally opening the can of beef stew while we waited lol
They also had a microwave
$1 dessert
A large bread bowl with a small scoop of canned beef stew
The other individual had a large bread bowl with a scoop of prepackaged Mac n cheese.
Do not get the combo
Not worth it
title: Evermore Park

text:
This place was awesome! It got pretty crowded once it got dark but when we first got there it was really fun to look around at all the different booths and the scenery was beautiful. One part I really liked was the parrot named Max who could talk, dance and laugh with guests.

One thing I think could be improved is information about the events, shows, quests, and guilds should be more accessible and easier to understand. I asked an actor what a quest was she said to â€œjust find one.â€ I was pretty confused because at that point I didnâ€™t even know what a quest was until I read other reviews. However, I still had a super fun time and I would definitely go again.
title: Evermore Park

text: We had SO much fun! The place was amazing, from the scenery to the characters you encounter along the way! The quests were a blast, as was joining a Guild, and the people were very professional. The characters were very much in character for the time period. The Haunted Adventure was really cool with the special affects! Just an evening of great fun and entertainment! Loved the Fire Dancer!!
title: Evermore Park

text: We had a great first time at Evermore! We love the festival feel, and the quests that you can go on. Just make sure that if you want to eat at Vanderâ€™s Keep that you make a reservation! We have eaten there before and itâ€™s absolutely delicious! So we were sad that we couldnâ€™t get in this time. We definitely will be coming here again for the Winter theme!
title: Evermore Park

text:
Visited Friday night with combo tickets.
Area was beautiful, well-maintained and an absolute joy to explore. At night, it is a colorful fantasy dream.

Food was 5 stars in Vander's Keep, the area tavern. Would recommend the Frye Bread and Huntsman Pie as it's a better shepherd's pie than I had in London and major kudos to the head chef. Actors and employees were all glowing, beautiful individuals who just wanted you to have a great time.

What took my review from 5 to 4 stars is two things.
First you need to scan QR codes to view the menu at Vander's Keep and to have a how-to/map for what to do in Evermore. With zero Wifi, that can prove difficult.
Also unfortunately they didn't have enough of many foods at their concession stands (where you use the credit for entree/side/drink/sweet with your combo pass) so we didn't get to use but half of our twenty-dollar combo passes.

Still worth it overall but next time we go will hopefully be able to grab food earlier without them running out or they are able to plan for a busy weedend.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Enjoyed my time here from a visual perspective. very well thought out as far as their displays and attractions. We went during the winter time during the Christmas festivities and got their activity pass.

Wasnâ€™t particularly impressed with their staff. They seemed to hire highschool kids who do cosplay as a hobby. Many didnâ€™t seem to treat it like a job. Although they were supposed to be in character I saw a lot of them on their phones and not really taking pride in their work. As the face of evermore I really expected a bit more in that capacity.

Additionally the â€œice skatingâ€ was a complete waste of money. You walk onto a cold sheet of plastic with zero ice on it. They advertise itâ€™s not true ice skating but this isnâ€™t skating at all. Itâ€™s walking on plastic and thatâ€™s the experience. period. I am proficient at ice skating so itâ€™s not like I didnâ€™t know how to skate. If I went again Iâ€™d pay for general admission and thatâ€™s it.

The food was also insanely long lines (45 minutes, and this was after being told they ran out of food and we needed to come back in an hour) for great value freezer food that was reheated. It was worse quality than food I make for myself and I have pretty low standards. (Truly watched them rip open great value frozen fries and put them in the fryer, certainly tasted like it too)

Beyond walking through the place and admiring the architecture donâ€™t expect much from anything else thatâ€™s offered. Still cool though!
title: Evermore Park

text:
This was such a great experience. We came during the summer mythos event. We spent two nights here and had a blast. There is still so much more to explore and interact with that I wish I could spend at least two more evenings here.
There were a lot of fun actors, but the pirates and bards are especially wonderful.
title: Evermore Park

text: Took my son and husband here for Aurora Christmas lights ... it was magical. My 12 year old was sceptical at first while we waited in the line to get in. Once we got in and saw all the different things... we could hardly get him to leave. I got my tickets online and it included entrance,meal,drink, dessert, a train ride and ice skating. It was well worth it thank you very much Evermore park and all the lovely staff we encounteredðŸ‘ðŸ˜ŠðŸ‘â¤
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore park does a fantastic job encouraging guests to participate in roleplaying and discovery through their immersive locations and unique cast of characters. Looking forward to the coming years and growth of the park and entertainment options. Absolutely recommend a visit!! Don't forget your imagination!
title: Evermore Park

text: Phenomenal. Everyone there was fantastic! The food in the stands could use a little work, but I'm not complaining that much. 10/10 experience. Tell The Whiff I said hello!
title: Evermore Park

text:
We had fun with most of the things we did. Some men who appeared to be workers were in the jousting ring with my family and we're extremely aggressive. I am glad they knew what they were doing but they were in a ring with newbies that made it not as fun for my kids. Not only were they aggressive but they were rude as well.
Bob the Engineer was a hoot and we loved the train ride.
We get we are not at Disney world but the workers were not very friendly they almost seemed that we were intruding.
title: Evermore Park

text: Went first time with my adult children. It was a lot if fun. I am by no means  fantasy role  player, but I will definitely go again and wear some elf ear additions.
title: Evermore Park

text:
This was my first experience at Evermore Park.  It was fantastic!
There were people in costume and others that were not but all having fun.    The cast members were great!  The merchants were friendly and helpful.
title: Evermore Park

text: This place is an amazing escape!!! I was so impressed with the actors and the environment... Imagine walking into a new world and immediately being put to work solving quests, collecting trinkets, trading, bartering, solving riddles all with the help of amazing staff. Pack up the family and bring your imagination. You wont regret it. I will be back with hordes of friends.
title: Evermore Park

text:
We arrived 5-27-22
Thank you to all the performers of Evermore!
Shaw, Wiff, the guild of Rogues (which took forever to find! Nice and true to form - you really have to want to be a member to find them!) The brother & sister of the inn - Happy Birthday! The wonderful gentle man from the Dragon trainers(?) Guild - I wish your Dragon great flight with the assistance of the power and magic of Wind. And so many more. Oh, yes, the Grand Weapons Master who stated that on that day I was his greatest challenge - and he did best me 2 of 3.
Gem & I (mage Aryk) were welcomed wonderfully to your paradise of Evermore. Your dedication to your craft blessed us many time over. Our hearts full of joy. We sincerely wished we could have blessed you in return. Some we did have the opportunity to do so. For we are from the subterranean land of Mount Shasta.  And we came with blessings of honor in the way of leather bracelets.  Common to most on the surface continents but held in the most esteem in Shasta. We found so much honor in you all.
I was able to find a crown of jewels from a local merchant in your town, which I'm certain was my true purpose for journeying to your local. Thank you.
Our hearts were truly touched by the loving energy given by all townsfolk, guilds, merchants and servants who chose to make sure townsfolk and travelers are safe.
Until next time.
Gem & Mage Aryk (edge & emerald) Bright Blessings to you allðŸŒº
title: Evermore Park

text:
Exciting side quests, great actors ask around and lots of places to explore!

The actors though, wow. We were sneaking around and paying attention to them and they never broke character, even when they didn't know we were there! It's like they actually live in this strange alter-world!

And the level of detail in everything is impressive. Every nook and cranny has had attention poured into it. And the harder you look at something the more you notice. Unbelievable!

Lots of fun, will be back over and over!
title: Evermore Park

text: Came here for a work event and literally have not stopped thinking about it since. The actors and quests make for such a magical experience. It is so fun to run around and get lost in the story. Will absolutely be coming back when the new season starts.
title: Evermore Park

text:
The atmosphere is great, we loved it. Great characters, all friendly and extremely helpful. They stayed in character and were great with my 10 and 9 year old boys who were shy about asking questions.

It was crowded and cold but the cold can't be helped and it's apparently popular so crowds have to be expected. We had a great experience. I would recommend it, just bundle up this time of year, get a map and be strategic if you are going to do quests.
title: Evermore Park

text: My family had a lot of fun as we are total fantasy nerds! Itâ€™s like living a D&D game. I just wish they had more in the way of T-shirts and hats. Overall, great fun!
title: Evermore Park

text: Super fun experience!! My 4 year old loved the train ride and all the decorations! Meeting a fairy and a troll was super exciting for him! We had a blast! Loved the characters. Amazing acting!
title: Evermore Park

text: Such an awesome experience,  so unique to anywhere I've ever been.  The staff/characters were 100% on point and made the experience amazing and fully immersive from the time we walked in the gates.  I would recommend this to everyone. We could have spent all day there doing quests. Can't wait to go back.
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore is a really interesting place. It's bigger on the inside than it looks. The decorations and activities are fun, and you can participate as much a you want and go on a quest, but the idea of what is happening is very esoteric to a first-time guest. There are no maps or details about what you can find and where you can find it. The quests have a very LARP-ing quality, but in lacking any kind of idea about where buildings even are, and the buildings don't have signs, it's easy to get lost and easily confused. I would visit again, though I wish it was open in day-light hours and there were more clear materials that correlated with general information (like when tournaments are and where they are/where to sign up, what things are included vs. what requires extra fees, etc). There is a lot of potential, but needs more direction and marketing materials.
title: Evermore Park

text: We got the combo ticket and it was the best bang for our buck. Definitely going back to see all the things we couldn't spend time doing that night. We came when they opened and left when they closed.
title: Evermore Park

text: Such a beautiful venue. So many fun activities to make the experience fun and memorable for the kids. I cannot wait to experience the various seasons at this location such as Christmas lights and Easter. Loved it!
title: Evermore Park

text:
We went for their winterfest event and loved it enough we are definitely going back! I had seen some videos about the park that made me want to check it out and much to our delight it was very well decorated and lots of fun. The Battle arena and knife throwing were highlights of our trip. We also were very happy to see the entire park is easily accessible with a stroller, wagon, or even wheelchair and the bathrooms were large enough you could bring children in with you if needed.
We bought our tickets online for $16.96 per adult after tax and fees. This was the price for the combo ticket which included the battle arena, archery, knife throwing, and ice skating.
title: Evermore Park

text: Me and the family had a blast here, would definitely come back. So many things to do, was a bit overwhelming at first. We couldn't find krampus which makes me wonder if we missed some areas. Sword fighting, archery, and knife throwing lines could be better defined, they were all over the place and sometimes you get bumped off when the employees tell you you're not in the invisible line. We'll come back for sure
title: Evermore Park

text:
Park is good, lights are gorgeous.
But ice-skating is terrible.
It's just plastic board with artificial ice.
It's impossible to skate.
You can buy hot cocoa here, also nice places with open fire.
title: Evermore Park

text:
First time was confusing, but fantastic in the truest sense of the word. It really felt like stepping into another world! The characters were dynamic and fleshed out, the landscaping beautiful, and the buildings were a step back in time. The customer service is mostly excellent (unless talking to some of the belligerent character, who are entertaining to banter with!) Greg the fire dancer was funny and talented, a true showman.

The only reason I didn't give them five stars is some of the prices. Artisan products are expensive and that's fine. You're paying for the labor as well. But $2.50 for a Walmart water bottle is... Hard to swallow.

I recommend fueling up before you get there, bring a camera/phone, and a notebook and pencil for quests.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I really didn't know what to expect from our outing to Evermore Park. I kept my expectations under control, meaning I didn't have any. What we found was an immersive and creative park with lots of smiles from the kids. From pottery demonstrations, axe throwing, fire dancer, pirate actors, train ride, animal show, to karaoke with hobbits and more. The booths for shopping were fun too!

Yes people dress up, yes some of it is a little "out there." But I did kind of enjoy being a mythical princess for the evening.

You can tell it is a work in progress and I can't wait to see what they develope into. The price was decent. We went from 6-11, I don't recommend going right at 6, the line was very long. Showing up at 6:20 or so might be a better idea.
title: Evermore Park

text: This was a very surreal and magical experience. The actors really got into their roles and it was obvious that they all loved their jobs. The actual location looks like it is out of a fairytale. Please anyone reading this, support this place and keep it around. This is a one of a kind experience, and everyone should go to Evermore, at least once. At 15$ a person, this place is a steal.
title: Evermore Park

text:
This place is absolutely amazing! Imagine an experience similar to Disneyland, but with a focus on the environment. There aren't any rides except for a train ride around the park- but this does not mean the experience isn't worthwhile. The main attraction to Evermore is to immerse yourself in the story. Cast members dotted around the park send you on quests to get information, solve puzzles, and stop an evil set on destroying the humble town known as Evermore, all while earning "gold", an in-park currency you can use to purchase fun trinkets from cast members.

On top of this, there is a town square where vendors offer handmade goods, which adds to the atmosphere of a bustling medieval village. There you can buy clothing, soaps, and even adorable dragon plushies.

The icing on the cake to all of this is the park's encouragement to all of it's guests to dress for the role. You can wear your best fantasy hero outfit, or choose to go in your casual, modern attire, whatever suits you.

Yesterday was my first time going to Evermore, and now that I have tasted this experience, I can confidently say that it will not be my last visit.
title: Evermore Park

text: One of my favorite places to go and immerse my family in a well thought out land of fantasy and adventure. Ever minute detail was brilliantly done and I plan on going back often. There was more to do than I could even have possibly had time to do and the costumes were all really quite amazing!
title: Evermore Park

text: So much fun cute props lots of cool vendors food lines were really long and the haunted house isn't included with the general admission and train rides sold out the day before the event but overall we loved it.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I wish I could give this place a better rating but unfortunately I give it 2 stars.
Very crowded, we were only able to do 1 thing there.  Archery,  we stood in line for almost an hour to shoot 3 arrows ðŸ¹.
Tried walking around a bit but unfortunately we couldn't really see or do much of anything. We luckily were able to buy a few souvenirs before being pushed out by a crowd of people, which was scary because I had my 2 year old in my arms.
We decided to leave after that and as we got to our vehicle only to realize we were blocked in at the overflow parking area. Our car and about 8 others were trapped for about a little over an hour because another car decided to block the only way out.
I and several others tried calling the only number provided for Evermore and were told the number doesn't exist. I sent my husband to the front gate to let them know the situation and no one came for 20 minutes then they just sat there looking at the car blocking the exit instead of trying to page the owner or calling a tow truck.
Luckily 2 groups in front of our cars were leaving and by that miracle they made an opening to let us all out.
Needless to say my family will not be going back and will be telling our friends about our experience there.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Great place to enjoy an evening with family. Loved the interaction with the staff, venders and other guest.
Loved that you had quests for children to adults.
Hope you continue the experience for decades to come.
title: Evermore Park

text: We were excited to take our kids to the Lore event at Evermore Park. When you pull up it looks cool. It's pretty to look at, but not worth it in my opinion. The website makes it look so cool, but it is decieving. It's very amateur. We were excited for the "confectionary" but it's little more than a few cupcakes, a few flavors of ice cream, and a dinky snow cone machine. The highlight of the night was the kiddie train. I don't normally leave negative reviews, but Bottom line is we had 6 adults and kids and we were all bored and disappointed.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I went during the Lore event which is dedicated to Halloween. Honestly, it wasn't that great of an experience like I had when I went to Aurora the year before.

Pros
- Atmosphere is pretty decent. It was decorated to fit the autumn and Halloween theme. There were their usual activities such as archery, knife throwing, and combat ring.

- Shops were a lot more organized. Back when I visited Aurora, the shops were just a mess. Everything was everywhere and it was extremely crowded (not with customers) but just overlapping one another. For Lore, they got that figured out, and the shops were well put together.

- Fire show was a total hit. From the little that I could see, it was amazingly enjoyable and humorous. I definitely recommend all Evermore visitors to catch at least the fire show.

Cons
- Shows. Maybe it's part of the "fantasy / medieval" theme where a bunch of people crowd around to watch something, but it was extremely difficult to observe their only attraction that was worth watching. They have a good amount of open space on the field that wasn't used for anything, I wonder if they could have just put up more hay bales since wooden bleachers would be too much of a cost.

- Food options were pretty limited. With Vander's Keep closed to the public, access to food was quite challenging. The ticket I purchased for Lore was a combo ticket that included an entree, drink, and dessert with the price. There were your options of soup and a burger, and the latter was a much popular choice but was served at one location. This meant a lot of people waiting in the cold for that burger lol. It was an experience for sure.

- Lines. Don't get me wrong, lines are a huge part of any theme park experience, I'm not entirely jabbing at that. However, I'm jabbing at the fact that there was little to no control of the lines. A lot of people were scheduled for a Haunted Maze experience,  but some just gave up on it because the line never shortened. It was like a horrible rush hour traffic in LA.

- Lack of interest from the NPCs is a common complaint of Evermore, and they still haven't really done anything to encourage their employees. Granted, not all are like this and are immersed into their character and the Evermore world; however, that's only an extreme few - enough to count on one hand. Yeah, not that many. I've seen and have dealt with NPCs who just looked absolutely bored. I thought it was their character concept, but when they started giving one-worded answers and even expressed boredom to people interested in partaking in their quests, it was more than enough to tell me that... they just weren't interested. Additionally, we spotted NPCs who were tucked away from the crowd and on their phones. No matter how we walked past them and waved, they kept their head down and kept browsing their phones. I could tell they were employees as well because they all had the glow-in-the-dark necklaces that only Evermore employees wore.

Honestly, if Evermore just had employees who were interested in the world their characters were in, it could help make the experience a lot more fun.

Evermore lost a lot of its "fantasy" theme and became a more comic-con / anime-con sort of experience. At Lore, a lot of guests had awesome costumes that were 1000% better than the employees, and it was a blast to see so many dressed up in many  different things. That was more enjoyable than what was going on at the park.
title: Evermore Park

text: I was highly impressed by this place. The actors were great, the activities were fun, and the environment was pretty believable. It feels like they've got a a ways to go till their park is fully built and their vision realized but for $15 a ticket with few activities costing extra, this place is a steal! I would expect to pay more than I did for a fire dance and aerial silk show alone but that was only one of the many things they offered. Come in costume and come ready to be a dork immersed in a fantasy world. I highly recommend this to anyone into costumes, fantasy, role-playing, and especially D&D.
title: Evermore Park

text: The park is very much entertaining, but, I would recommend selling some things with the park "logo" on them, especially T-shirts. They would sell like hotcakes! Also, why is the park only open on Fridays and Saturdays?
title: Evermore Park

text: Even though I'm not necessarily a LARPer I really had a great time here. I went during their Halloween theme and it was soo cool. I loved the decorations and little events going on. I can't wait to go back during Christmas time and see how cool it looks!
title: Evermore Park

text: Thatâ€™s a super fun place to walk around and do a few fun activities. The characters do a great job and itâ€™s a really fun atmosphere.
title: Evermore Park

text: Great place, accepting of everyone. Amazing experience even if you aren't as into the whole LARPing experience. Definitely worth checking out
title: Evermore Park

text: It was such a great experience. Me and my family had a blast! Weâ€™ll try to come more often
title: Evermore Park

text: An absolute joy. From Peter Peter and Rose Red to Mugsy, James Wickham and Mr. Tosher. The actors that give this park life, were superb. I literally could ask nothing more of this place. It was my dreams, fantasies, and nightmares (Thanks to the Haunt attraction) all rolled into one. Stepping through the gate was like entering into a world all its own. I will definitely be going back to experience the other seasons and probably Lore again.
title: Evermore Park

text: This place is always a good time! I've been here several times and enjoy interacting with the cast members and unraveling the mysteries and lore going on behind the scenes. The combat arena is fun and exciting, the shows are entertaining, and the cast are always a blast to interact with.
title: Evermore Park

text: It was a nice night visit, for a discount price. Weather was good, but dry. None of the little tent shops were open. Lots of colored lights. Maybe once is enough...
title: Evermore Park

text:
A very fun time, definitely shouldâ€™ve brought a costume but overall a very great experience.
An employee named Johnathon was very helpful when explaining was very helpful in explaining the rules of the park, and he was just a cotton candy machine operator.
title: Evermore Park

text: First time here and had truly did have a blast with my family and 3 year old! I truly do recommend you come and experience the park. BUT the park needs to figure out a few things, especially when it's crowded. A staffer told me that the day I went was one of their busiest days they've seen. It was so crowded that you had to wait in line to just get around the park to see places of the park. Even going into the park, the entrance lines were long and confusing and people were congesting the parking lot. No one knew what line was for what, the bathroom lines for the womens bathrooms on both sides were extremely long, good luck waiting in line for food and drink (they need to sell more food in the back, either shops or tiny stalls to help these crowds at the entrance), it was just utter chaos and not exactly great during COVID times. It was confusing to know who participated in the trading system. Then the Haunt event was also confusing. You buy a ticket for a time slot, but we had to wait in line an hour before our time because people would just line up for it and the line wrapped around the park. The staffers that checked our tickets didn't even ask what time slot we were. What's the point of getting a time slot? The event itself was mostly a walk-through to look at their pretty sets, not really a quest, wish it was more interactive, and then it had a rare actor jumping at you. Which, I can't completely blame the park for. They truly need more actors and staff. But currently, Haunt tickets aren't worth it. I hope they expand, get the actors and staff they need to help mitigate crowds and confusion, and seriously build bathrooms with more than 3 stalls for the women. Because aside from this utter chaos it really was fun! And I didn't even do quests because of my 3 year old! The pretty settings, face painting, the train, and watching people and actors was enough for my 3yo to have a blast. Watching people immerse themselves and do quests with the actors (when they actually got through the line to talk to them) looked super fun!
title: Evermore Park

text: I liked Evermore and it is probably something I will continue to do with my family every once in a while. I think the entrance fee of $15 was fair as well as the $3 fee to ride the train that wraps around the park. They do charge $2.50 for a bottle of water which i feel is too much. If they would lower that price I feel the experience would be better. The actors were very kind and did a wonderful job. The scenery was awesome and I hope they continue to grow. I would recommend being there as close to opening time as possible so that you won't feel rushed.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Update: we hit Octoberfest tonight and â€œThe Twinsâ€ are pretty much the funniest two people our family has ever encountered!  Thank you for an unforgettable nightâ¤ï¸

Our 14 year old son lives for this place.  Wear a costume and join in.  Itâ€™s definitely a role playing fantasy community and not Disneyland.  If you come expecting rides and Evermore merchandise for sale and lots of instructions and rules, you will be surprised.  This is not a typical amusement park.  The grounds are gorgeous and we can see the vision they have with all the projects they are working on.  Itâ€™s going to be even more stunning down the road.  The cast here is so much fun and they interact nonstop with the people in the park.  Donâ€™t be shy!  Chat with everyone and after a little while youâ€™ll lose yourself.  So many nice places to sit and hang out.  We bought an ancient game called Hnefatalf and sat in the Pygmeweeds Inn and played while listening to live music.  (It felt exactly like being in Bilbo Baggins Hobbit hole).   5 1/2 hours is never enough here, we come every weekend.
title: Evermore Park

text: Had a wonderful time here when I went for the Mythos event. There's a lot offered to do in terms of quests and general fun(such as axe throwing and archery). Staff is nice and enjoyable to interact with. Certainly worth visiting again, would definitely love to see this place for their other events.
title: Evermore Park

text: Atmosphere was so cool. Lighting is magical. Lots of cool shops, especially loved the witches cottage, the soaps, hats, and wands are so cool. So seasonally appropriate. I love it!
title: Evermore Park

text: We loved it! It was a really cute date. The only thing I wish is that it had been more clear on the website that the combo tickets came with food! If I had known we wouldn't have done Vanders.
title: Evermore Park

text: It took us some time to figure out what to do or how to play. There are so many things to do or see. Different types of quests. My younger kids gave up on the Quest and ended up trading the entire time. Ended up leaving with lots of fun trinkets. The shows were great we ended up staying until closing time. I wish there were more food options. And a few of the buildings were closed. The guy in the tavern working was so kind to my kids. He played betting games with them for quite awhile.  Be prepared to wait in line to talk to most characters. We went to mythos summer which I think ended up having less full costume characters like in the YouTube videos I've seen for the Halloween theme. We will definitely be back to experience Halloween and Christmas events.
title: Evermore Park

text: Enjoyed the entire experience. Beautifully themed. Characters ready for the guests and quests. Highly recommend for families, couples, or anyone who enjoys a different kind of experience.
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore was amazing! We had a lot of fun interacting with the actors. The quests kept us entertained for the whole night.
title: Evermore Park

text: I went on a date here during the Aurora event. And it was absolutely splendid! There was so much to go look at around the park, and there were tons of people to go around and talk to! My date isn't much of a nerd, but she loved the Christmas theme and all the activities to do including archery and knife throwing. The waits for the activities were fairly small so there wasn't much waiting around and more exploring this beautiful park. 10/10 would recommend!
title: Evermore Park

text: My wife surprised me for my birthday in August and we loved it so much, we returned in September, for our anniversary but this time we dressed in medieval apparel and so thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
title: Evermore Park

text: It was fun and entertaining.  They ran out of food at the end of the night, but we did wait until after 9 pm to request food.
title: Evermore Park

text: Kind of like a video game,  your experience will depend on how much you're willing to interact and run around.  We had one main quest and a few side quests,  and mistook another quest for ours,  so we had to backtrack. Help is available, but not always obvious. It was fun!
title: Evermore Park

text: It was so much fun. It may not be all that big of a place but it has so much activities and fun things to see. Had a mager blast.
title: Evermore Park

text: So fun for everyone! I love Evermore! You have to check it out! I've been several times with different groups, and not one person left disappointed! Sometimes we've done quests and other times we've just casually wandered, and both experiences are well worth the time and money. Amazing!
title: Evermore Park

text: We did a film shoot there so it was a closed set for us. The place is awesome. Lots of neat things to see and the food at Vander's Keep is delicious!
title: Evermore Park

text:
So FUN!! There were a ton of people there and both parking lots were pretty full but it was a big enough place and outdoors so we felt safe and comfortable with covid (although our whole party is also vaccinated). Still lots of lines to talk to different towns people, but you can potentially listen to the conversations of those ahead of you and save time.

It took our, not shy but not super outgoing, group a second to get going, but once we figured out some of the things that we could ask for, (or interact with characters at the park to do- like join a guild, do a good deed/help someone on a quest, earn gold-all the townspeople pretty much have it and will give you tasks to earn it, trade items (we brought a bag of rocks and gems and traded with a witch and a pirate for different coins and other things) we were quickly on our way to having a great time!!!)

Aside from the adventures there are craft stands to buy from, food to purchase (both in the resturaunt and in stands in the park,  arial silk/fire stick throwing/animal shows to watch, archery/hatchet throwing/battle arena foam battles to participate in, walking the grounds to see all the cool buildings and effects they have and continue to add, and there is some fun people watching to do too!

We saw all ages (from itty bitty to getting up there in years) dressed up and participating with great amounts of enjoyment!
title: Evermore Park

text: I absolutely LOVE coming to Evermore!! It's like stepping out of our world and into something magical. I honestly dress up and everything and completely recommend doing so. It's cheap and fun for the whole family. The park is clean and very user friendly. The staff are always in character and super amazing. They also change with the seasons and have ongoing storyline. I highly recommend this place!!
title: Evermore Park

text: We just visited for first time. It was bigger than expected and great fun. Three hours went by fast and we are looking forward to our next visit.
title: Evermore Park

text: I have seen pictures of the place before going, but they do not do it justice. The amount of craftsmanship and skill placed into creating the sets and buildings are amazing. Bravo
title: Evermore Park

text: Had a great time and more importantly my wife's nephew loved it. I highly recommend it.
title: Evermore Park

text: We visited for the first time during the 2020 Christmas season.  Highly recommend paying extra for the Christmas Carol experience, it was amazing! The acting - especially the parts of Scrooge and Charles Dickens - was excellent, better than we expected. The way you follow the characters through the park to different locations as the story unfolds was unique and so much fun! There were indoor and outdoor settings - some of which are only accessible for Christmas Carol attendees. The Christmas Carol experience was slightly interactive also, which made it even better.  Our young adult children all loved it, as did we. We would go back again for that alone! The Christmas Carol takes about an hour (we wouldn't have wanted it any shorter, we enjoyed it so much), so we didn't have as much time as we had hoped to see the rest of the park before it closed. So, if you are doing the Christmas Carol, be sure to leave extra time before or after to enjoy the rest of the park. The archery and ax throwing ends at 9:30, and the lines were a little long before that, so we didn't do either. Most of the actor characters we came into contact with were easy to talk to, and we really enjoyed our interactions with them! But some were too preoccupied with their interactions with other actors/characters to talk to us, so that was a little disappointing. The costuming is excellent, and the overall feeling within the park is magical.  Sometimes it was hard to tell between the paid actors and visiting patrons who dressed up, but the glowing necklaces helped. We enjoyed the fire dancers and the puppet show, and the hot chocolate was delicious! If you dress warm, the cold isn't so bad, and there are plenty of fire pits throughout the park to warm up by. We will definitely be going back!
title: Evermore Park

text: The staff is amazing! Everyone was so friendly and in full character. We joined the pirate crew, did a few challenges for an Ogre, there's a train to ride and a Haunted House (for Halloween season). Highly recommend! Is even more fun if you dress up too
title: Evermore Park

text: We arrived right at opening and bought tickets at the door. Didnâ€™t know it was a â€œsoft openingâ€ until the employees kept telling us that. It started out slow and we almost went back for a refund, but the food is amazing. We rode the train, shot bow and arrows and danced with performers. Kids loved the magicians and we walked the catacombs. Fire performer was great. Saw hawks and owls. It was more fun once it got dusk/dark. It turned out really fun. Weâ€™d go back for sure.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Having been to Evermore for both their "Lore" Halloween quests, and now their "Aurora" Christmas quests, I can officially say that I have seen them take a good thing, and turn it into something spectacular!

Overall for my first experience in Evermore at Halloween time, I found that the sets were AMAZING and very magical, the actors were fun and for the most part kind, and that I had a good time. Would have given it 4 stars. The negative things were that they had NO crowd management so it was very difficult to talk to the actors, and the quests were too long to finish in a night so you'd have to leave with one half completed, and the food was not very good or varied. I left with the park having taken my breath away, but the experience not one that I was completely satisfied with.

This time, ALL of the negative things I didn't like about the first time were fixed. The actors were spread out all over the park, so even though there were more people than the first time we went (The parking lot was overfilling) we never felt crowded. The actors were amazing, and so kind, and they worked hard to make sure that everyone got a turn to talk to them. The quests were short, and fun. We able to complete a few of them, even after not staying the whole time (We saved a robot from the cold, and made peace between three different groups of people!). The food was also way better.
