There were meat-pies, soup, hot chocolate, and it wasn't too expensive! We treated our group to 3 dollar hot chocolates and it helped everyone warm up and take a break without breaking the bank. :)

And, for those of you wondering, this experience is great for families. We had a baby, and a toddler in our group, and we found we could get through almost everywhere with our stroller, and that the actors worked to have the 4 year old toddler have a good time and understand what he needed to do to help the people of evermore. (At one point we wanted to take a break, and he wouldn't let us because he wanted to get the cure to the robot first!) :)

So, all in all, I would highly recommend going. My husband and I didn't dress up or cosplay (nor do we usually do that kind of thing) but we had a ton of fun regardless. There's something for everyone there: Bird shows, quests, a scavenger hunt, fun picture places, etc. So bring the whole family and take place in something that you will be talking about for forever. :)

UPDATE: Evermore is still amazing!! The addition of trading trinkets in the park, local artist vendors, and Vander Keep have made it even better than it was before. My recommendations- Bring things to trade, get a toffee butterbeer from Vander's keep, and say "hi" to the "Happy Viking" vendor -His stuff is great, and he is so kind! Happy questing!
title: Evermore Park

text:
We went here the day after Christmas 2020 and took our four little kids with us. The kids say their favorite thing was the fire dancers that went on every hour. They also enjoyed the bird and reptile show and the knife throwing. I really like the architecture of the buildings and the lights were beautiful. We also rode the train around the park and had fun looking at all the lights and buildings.  If there was one point of criticism, it had to be the radio station being played on the train ride, it wasn't really consistent with the theme of the park and broke the immersion in the park's atmosphere.
The characters we talked to were all interesting with their own stories to tell. Definitely going to spend more time talking to characters and doing quests when we go without little kids. The other visitors were also very friendly and sometimes it was hard to tell them from the Evermore characters if it weren't for the glowing pendants that the actors wore.
The food we had there was very good and service was great.
Overall, a top-notch experience which I believe will only get better over time and the more we go back.
title: Evermore Park

text: Amazing atmosphere for fantasy quests with characters. You feel like you are in another world.
title: Evermore Park

text:
We had a great night at EverMoore park! (We went to Lore, which is the Halloween theme this year) Opened at 6:00. Closed at midnight. You could definitely keep busy the entire 6 hours. Get there at least 30 min early. Come on costume if you can because it really adds to your experience but even if you don't you will have a great time.

Frustrations....
- Getting tickets online. The site is challenging and very frustrating to navigate. Finally got it to work after a long time.
- getting food was a long wait. Not enough people helping to move quickly. The shorter line for treats was 30 min just to get to the window. They were out of water and diet drinks. They didn't tell us that right next door in the gift shop they had water and diet coke and treats. Which is what we wanted. The churro doughnut was good!!
- no social distancing was going on. The bird show, that we really enjoyed was packed shoulder to shoulder as was the magic show.

Positives...
-The cast is AWESOME! They are engaging, patient and fun!
- Something for every age going on!
- Everyone wore a mask!!!
-The park is beautiful and impressive! The buildings and grounds are so will done with attention to detail.
-They have their own professionally done soundtrack on spotify under EverMoore park.
-They have a train, haunted walk through, bird show, magic show, archery, larping, a giant troll roaming around and entertainment everywhere. Photo opportunities were everywhere.

Go right when they open so you can see the park while it's light and then enjoy it in the dark. So much to see and so original! Get a map before you go in and it will tell you all the activities available. You can join one of the many guilds, (pirates, knights, witches, ect.) that they have, by going on quests and then you are initiated into their clan. It's very fun!
Two thumbs up from me!
title: Evermore Park

text:
Valentine's Day dinner experience was like being stuck at point of the mountain during rush hour. You're just stuck in the miserable experience with everyone around you because they already took your money.

We made reservations and thought it would be a good experience since it was their 3rd day of the Valentine's Day dinner and also because they had a set menu, in theory making it more efficient.

This was not the case. First they had two entrances to the check in desk meaning people that had been waiting in an established line for 15-20 minutes, just to check in, were getting cut off by people just arriving. The staff was not able to check people in, take them to their seats and manage the flow of traffic because there were just two of them running the desk.

Once we were seated, we had no cups, no silverware and it took a solid 15 minutes to get our preordered soup and salad. It was another 10ish minutes after the soup and salad came that we finally got silverware and cups. Between finishing soups and salad and receiving our main course, it was nearly 1.5 hours and the grilled veggies were incredibly cold. The Mahi Mahi was ok, but the steak may as well have been jerky, no exaggeration, it was difficult to cut with a knife. We had seen the wait times and sent our desert ticket in with our main course so thankfully that came out promptly but others around us were waiting at least 15 minutes to get their desert.

All of this would have been more understandable if it had been a full menu and if it was busier but it was a very limited, preselected menu and honestly, not very busy considering it was valentines day. I counted 26 tables plus bar seating and some of the tables were even empty. When wait staff would come out to the dining area, everyone's attention would shift to them in hopes of catching their attention.

I would not attend or recommend attending any sort of dining event here to anyone. There are some very clear organization issues that the customers as well as the waiters/waitresses are paying the price for. It was incredibly frustrating to experience for a special occasion. The only silver lining was our waitress had some funny jokes even though she was clearly frustrated herself.
title: Evermore Park

text: We loved spending the evening at evermore walking around enjoying the lights. The christmas carol walk through was entertaining and Fun. The bird show is a favorite! And I LOVE the food there! Everything is so delicious! So much to see and do there. Definitely worth the evening.
title: Evermore Park

text: Amazing atmosphere! If you enjoy imagination, art, storytelling, fantasy, games, or just admiring creativity and craftsmanship then you will love this park. And obviously, if you love D&D or cosplay or being in character then you'll be in heaven. You can just walk around and admire the buildings and incredible detail or you can play along and go on quests and solve mysteries and get to know the park's creative storyline. There are also fun activities like ax throwing and archery as well as taverns and concessions. There are all sorts of actors and shows and demonstrations that add variety to your visit. This is a fantastic place for kids! It's fun to see their imagination and wonder get sparked. There are some places during the Lore (autumn) season that are too scary for kids but the actors in the park (the employees) are very helpful to point out where to go. We want to go back without kids to do the quests but it was very fun with kids. A fair amount of the park is under construction so it will be fun to see it when it is finished. It's already beautiful but will be spectacular when finished.
title: Evermore Park

text:
This park is wonderful!! The experience is very one of a kind! The food is great reasonably priced.(except the drinks). The shows are a blast. Very worth the $15. Tip for newcomers

1. make sure you get a map! It has important tips and details on it with fun activities you can do on it such as a gnome hunt.

2. Join a guild! They give you fun tasks like sneak behind a cast member or learn types of magic (cast members have a glowing amulet)

3.Play the games they will give you a punchcard if you fill it you get a prize

4. Purchase fries or mojo onions. Not only are they delicious, but the newspaper they come with gives adventures and questions you can ask the cast members

Negative things but could improve in the future.

A. Some of the cast is not dressed up (operations mainly) I feel it would be more ingraining if they all are dressed even simply but it can be expensive so understandable

B. parts of the park are still under construction looking forward to that.

Finally me and my wife loved it so much we hope it stays afloat even in this trying time hereâ€™s some thoughts that could help

1. Volunteer/intern cast could save money

2. Since the park doesnâ€™t open till 6 (right now) you could set up photo times before: bridals, senior, family itâ€™s beautiful and would be perfect to sell it and make extra cash. I would love to take pics :)
title: Evermore Park

text: Really great experience, expect some of the food to be overpriced but the ice cream is amazing. The cast do an amazing job of immersion, and if you enjoy role playing there is a lot to do there. The place itself is beautiful, however the amount of walking you do makes me wish there were more places to sit, so be prepared.
title: Evermore Park

text:
The park is very nicely decorated and the employees donâ€™t break character. HOWEVER!! The food lines are LONG and within an hour of opening they were out of bread bowls, Mac and cheese, goblin goulash and they didnâ€™t even let the people in line know so we would all wait 30+ minutes to be disappointed. We ordered a soda and they said it would take 10 minutes to even get it (how is that even possible when they can just fill it right there and then !!?!) please staff your food areas better. Another huuuge disappointment was waiting another 30 minutes for the 10 pm showing of the aviary show and then the employee came out after there was a huuuuge line of people waiting for 30 minutes saying that there wasnâ€™t a 10 pm show when the sign CLEARLY said there was!! The employees literally let us wait for 30 minutes outside in the cold to tell us there was no show when they could see us out there waiting while they were cleaning up! PLEASE TELL US WHEN THE SHOWS ARENâ€™T HAPPENING SO WE DONT HAVE TO WAIT FOR NOTHING. PLEASE PUT UP SIGNS SAYING WHAT FOODS ARE OUT SO WE ARE NOT WAITING FOR LONG.

2022 UPDATE
My previous review rated this place a 2 but Iâ€™ve changed it to 1 star. Itâ€™s unfortunate how unprepared the park is. It could be amazing but being out of food and drinks within an hour of opening is not great(even on opening Lore weekend). Additionally, having the train be out of order sucked but the nice employees at the dueling arena allowed us to exchange the train combo portion for the fake swords so we could duel . It was opening week for Lore and I wanted to give this place a second chance after my horrible first experience but it greatly disappointed us once again. There were many people who donâ€™t know what to do, I suggest that you have the employees instruct people of what they can do, it would help so much. Furthermore, most of the employees seemed to be extremely bored with their jobs which doesnâ€™t really help with the experience. (except the animal show people, they really rocked!). I think that the only good parts about the park are the knife throwing, archery, and dueling arena (but still not the best ever). Overall I donâ€™t think I will give this place a third chance unless they really improve. I really wish things were different, this park could be such an amazing place.
title: Evermore Park

text: Absolutely amazing place. There is so much meticulous work on detail to maintain the magical ambiance; from the landscaping,to the architecture,  and the decorations, everything is perfect. The actors are wonderful and engaging without being intrusive and always stay in character. Plus when it's lit up it's visually stunning and in my opinion surpasses the lights at Temple square or Thanksgiving point (at least for their Aurora season). It's great for all ages, the extroverts and introverts, and nerdy and non-nerdy, there is something for everyone. I did wish they had more stuff for sale interns of souvenirs/gift, and really wish they had a liquor license so actual tavern appropriate drinks could be served.
title: Evermore Park

text: This place is epic.  When you first step into the park you're welcomed Disney-style by cast members hoping to share their story and complain about the mystery that has "befallen the land".  As you move from area to area interacting with characters (usually about 30-40+ each night) you find out more about this mystery.  Eventually, you realize that everything might not be as it seems and there are actually multiple mysteries and many different storylines to enjoy.  There are multiple levels of story that can be enjoyed by the first-timer, the introvert, extrovert, or the seasoned park-goer.  Come to socialize, to observe, enjoy the pretty lights and music, or to practice archery and axe throwing.  This place is truly loved by my 10-year-old boy, my teenage girls, and their grandparents.  My wife and I have taken some date nights here and didn't even tell the kids we went (or we'd be in trouble).  I am not into D&D and I hate dressing up for Halloween (sad, but true).  I'm a shorts and T-shirt kind of guy.  I still enjoy coming here again and again and playing along with the story and meeting new characters. Many people do dress up so if you're into that, you won't feel out of place.  While we don't dress up we still feel like we belong. Think of this as a "live theater" performance where you step onto the stage and the acting takes place close around you.   In the past, we've had season passes for Disneyland and have spent time in Disney World.  We also have had season passes for our local theater and love to attend.  I have to admit, the acting here is superb and a 10 out of 10!  I have been in situations where the tension could be "cut with a knife" and other situations where I've cried with the characters.  If you plan a trip, I'd recommend attending more than one evening.  You won't regret it.  The entrance fee is very reasonable (less per hour than a movie ticket) and the food there is well-priced and amazing (changes each season).  Make sure you arrive 15 minutes before they open and plan to stay until closing time.  Wear comfortable shoes. You don't have to walk a ton if you don't want to and I've seen people in wheelchairs and electric scooters....  but if you do enjoy walking and you get into the story, expect to get your steps in for the day!
title: Evermore Park

text: This place took me to a whole different world, I loved it!
title: Evermore Park

text: My family and I had a great time at Evermore! The park had so many interesting details to discover and the characters were fun to interact with. Our 3-year-old couldn't get enough! It seemed like there were lots of random "interactions" happening. We didn't stay as long as we hoped because our 1-year-old was ready for bed, but we absolutely want to come back when the kids are a bit older. I'm excited to see how it'll look when everything is built. Totally worth a visit!
title: Evermore Park

text: What an inspiring place to visit. Every detail is looked after. Halloween is especially fun and exciting. Check out the restaurant and look at that very funny menu. Certainly worth a second trip to.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Evermore is an MMORPG video game brought to life. Within Evermore, you meet its citizens, learn about their history and struggles and complete tasks for them while exploring their world. For the muggles out there, think of it as an elaborate scavenger hunt.

The actors are what make this park happen. Throughout Evermore you'll find citizens who are either quest givers or general NPCs with helpful info. Most of them are great at what they do and play off of anything you say quite well. There are four guilds you can join and each have tasks for you to complete as initiation. We joined the Dragon Trainers after finding the elf rangers to be too snooty (and also not the best actors). I loved the actor who led the Dragon Trainers. He had a huge history of dragons in his repertoire and was just cheerful and believable. I honestly felt honored when he initiated us. It truly felt like I was playing WoW. We had quests that led to other quests that led to other quests. Some were for the overarching story and others were simple tasks like selling a magic item for a merchant. Some NPCs sat around telling ghost stories, acting out tales or singing songs.

There were a few cons, but all are things that are easy to improve and will hopefully be fixed soon. Firstly, the park itself is not complete and they do nothing to hide this. During the night this is fine because the darkness and choice lighting hide all the under construction parts. During the day, you can clearly see metal conduit, wood piles, orange safety cones, rebar, etc. piled in certain areas of the park. They do nothing to hide this and it kills the immersion. There's also little things they could easily hide like in the mausoleum there was a speaker you could clearly see that was generating monster sounds, in the aviary there was a giant A/C unit and in the middle of the field is an electrical box.

We attended on a Monday night early in the Lore season and it feels like they aren't at 100% yet. It was open 6-10 pm. We arrived just after 6 and clearly they weren't ready. We didn't receive a map when we entered or any instruction. We wandered around and saw employees/actors not yet on their game or ready to interact. This is where we were able to focus on all the poor immersion areas because we basically wandered aimlessly the first hour. However, even after dark when everyone was in place and quests began rolling, there were still huge areas with no NPCs or quest givers.

When we finally did track down a map, we saw on the back a huge task list of things to do and next to it it said, "your first quest!" We spent a lot of time completing these tasks only to turn it in in the end and learn the "first quest" was a smaller thing hidden in the image on the page and all the tasks we completed were "just a scavenger hunt" with apparently no reward. I think there was just a miscommunication somewhere with this but it was a bummer.

Another improvement that could be made is better marking for who is an NPC/citizen of Evermore versus players. They encourage guests to come in costume and many of us who attended were but that made it difficult for me to know "is that elf over there someone I can talk to or another player like me?" The quest givers wear a glowing light necklace which is great but the tavern dwellers and fairies and monsters do not.

Overall, I had a blast and LOVE this concept. I think they are working towards an app or some system to track your progress as a player and that would be really awesome!

I would recommend Evermore but not going out of your way for it. I don't think you should buy a plane ticket to SLC drive the hour to Pleasant Grove and get a hotel to attend, but it's worth a day drive or is definitely something to do if you're visiting Utah anyway.

I'm very curious to see how far the park will come in two years. I think there's something great here but kinks are still being worked out.
title: Evermore Park

text: 100% Recommend! Evermore is a magical experience, and it's at a reasonable price too. There's so much to do and experience. We spent the whole night there, and I felt like we hardly scratched the surface! Whether you want to do quests, enjoy fun activities, or just explore and watch the performances, you're bound to have a wonderful time.
title: Evermore Park

text: We always have a blast just enjoying the atmosphere and people, being part of a live action adventure becoming a guild member, using your imagination. It's fun. I love that a park like this exists.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Pretty good idea and some of the costumes and buildings where amazing. But as newcomers we didn't really feel welcomed, it took a really long time for someone to engage with us and let us know what to do. When my sons were doing their tasks for the guild they wanted. Most of the "characters" were more engaged with talking in between them selves.
My kids liked the arena but mostly grown men going against a 10 year old seemed one-sided. Maybe doing a youth age group every once in a while throughout the day would be great. With all that said we do want to go again. Hopefully It will feel more welcoming ðŸ™‚
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore is just an absolutely amazing place! The stories and interactions are what you put in you get back out! You can do as little or as much as you like, and most of it doesn't even cost anything more than the price of admission! I so wish we lived closer so we could come much more often!
title: Evermore Park

text: I attended the pre opening party for Evermore park and was overall very impressed.  The front of the park which was mostly finished looked fantastic.  There were plenty of actors, animal handlers, musicians and performers to keep you entertained all evening. I was entertained for the 4 hours that I stayed at the park.  The only downside was how much of the park was still unfinished, and sometimes I felt unsure of what I should be doing. Overall it was a great experience and I am very glad that I went.
title: Evermore Park

text: Really Cool Theme Park. My kids who are 6 & 9 loved it. They enjoyed going around and getting the little quests to do. I wish the characters were a little more forthcoming with answers or what to do. The Characters did great though at there parts. Very well done. We went on a Saturday night and the later and busier it got the lines to talk to people were annoying. Same with the axe & bow tables the lines took forever. So I'd suggest going during the week.
title: Evermore Park

text:
The best part about Evermore is that it is as fun as you make it! If you are willing to interact with the characters, and are "quest-driven" enough to find answers then you really do become immersed. The scenery is so quality, and the characters and actors are so fun. They had fun treats and snacks, plus some pretty neat souvenirs. Tons of great places to take photos!

Really the only complaint our group has was that some of the park is incomplete. I think that would help with everyone getting the opportunity to talk to characters. But, we can't wait for it to be finished!

If you love fantasy, and are willing to step out of your comfort zone, then go go go!
title: Evermore Park

text: Great experience. Will return. Quests are fun to get into but some get super crowded. It would be nice to have a place to have a sit down meal instead of finger food. Very impressed with the staff. They are all in character and very nice to talk to. Heaters and fire pits throughout the park is a nice touch as it was extremely cold. Can't wait for the park to expand as some buildings are still under construction. This is a great family park.
title: Evermore Park

text: Wow wow did i say WOW!!  SO MUCH FUNNN. Yes i am yelling.  4 of us went i thought i have just wasted $22.  OMG we had so much fun. It is a build your own adventure park.  You talk to the actors and they send you on quests. They give you gold that you can give to others.  You can become a Dragon trainer and see Dragons.  What are you doing??  Go!  NOW!!!
title: Evermore Park

text:
Go. Just go. This place is awesome and suitable for all ages! The staff are awesome and really the food and beverages aren't too expensive. We had a bread bowl with soup and hot Apple cider. My wife and kids enjoyed it a lot.

Side note: If you're getting there when it opens up. People like to go left. However, if you go right and around to the archery and axe throwing you'll be alone for awhile! Which is nice.
title: Evermore Park

text: I have to come back again! It's was a different feeling :D feel free to dress up for the park! You can't wear mask, though. Wear some good shoes as well for your adventuring :D Everyone is in character who works there, it's like stepping into an episode of Westworld, but it's a fantasy world. Awesome idea for an amusement park!
title: Evermore Park

text:
We went during Lore and it was fantastic! So immersive and fun! Art is amazing, lights are beautiful, actors are fantastic it all looks incredible. And they have SO MUCH room to grow still! There are a few bugs they need to work out i.e long lines for archery and axe throwing but that is to be expected with a brand new first of it's kind park, I can't wait till it's completely finished

*Edit* went back for Aurora and it was equally awesome! They still have so much room to grow but it's still an awesome time!

Side note: If you don't interact in the quests with the actors you will run out of things to do, so come out of your shell and engage with them, that's the whole point!
title: Evermore Park

text: I had so much fun exploring this park and learning about the lore that weaves everything together. Joining the Epic allowed me to feel directly involved with the characters so I highly recommend getting involved with the Guilds and the in-world adventures
title: Evermore Park

text: Incredibly fun place for geeks such as myself. Fake weapons are aloud (my cousin brought a 7 foot sword). They have fun quests to earn gold, or you could become a knight or a hunter. They also have activities such as archery or axe throwing, shows, or a creepy walk through experience. They do still have come construction left to do but if its this great already I can't imagine what it will be like when it's done. Honestly the actors are just so fun to interact with and there is so much exploring to do.
title: Evermore Park

text: This was by far my boyfriend's and my favorite stop if our vacation. We went on a monday night, so we only got to stay for about 4 hours. However, going on monday was by far worth it for the sense of it not being crowded. We both got to dress up, and had a blast here. Its worthwhile for all age groups, with lots of things to do here. I loved interacting with all of the different characters. I had a 20-30 minute conversation with Aiden torrin about the character I had made myself to be, which was one of my favorite points of the night, getting to be whomever, or whatever you want to be.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Had the pleasure of having a private tour of the park!  Lots to see here and definitely want to go back when they are in full swing.

The people working there are super into it and are doing a great job billing it up.

Thanks to War Bear for all the additional information and the axe throwing demo!
title: Evermore Park

text: Food lines long, and could be more to the meal plan. Closed some attractions as the kids got up to event so they didnâ€™t get to do them. Overall a great experience no line for Santa that was really nice, Halloween all though it was crowded seemed to have more to it.
title: Evermore Park

text: Great place for the family, dates, or just friends. They offer archery, axe throwing, fun quests, music, and lots more. All the characters are fun and will help you earn "gold". Stay alert for the riddles hidden around the park.
title: Evermore Park

text: The most interesting and immersive theme park of its kind. Guests are able to interact with every character and go on quests to earn gold or even trade trinkets with the townspeople. The world of Evermore is ever-changing so you definitely want to keep coming back to be a part of the story and see how it turns out!
title: Evermore Park

text:
I was underwhelmed by my first visit, but I plan on giving them another shot.
I went oct 9th 2020.
The good:
The battle arena was lots of fun. It's the best thing there.
Archery was really cool. I wish the range was bigger so more people could shoot.  The wait to try archery is long. Like 30-45 minutes long.
My wife loved the hats and stuffed dragons.
Axe throwing looked neat but only two people could try at a time so the line was even longer than the line for archery.
We entered a large circus tent and saw a really fun show. Fire eaters, magic tricks, and gymnastics were all great to see.
There was a dragon skeleton.
The bad:
Long waits for most activities.
Some buildings were under construction and landscaping was a mess in some areas.
Questing for the various guilds could use a lot of improvement. Most of the entry level quests just don't sound fun. They will tell you some vague thing like "learn a secret", "gain someone's trust", or "learn three people's names". I wish the tasks were more fun. Why not find a monster? Fight somebody? Climb something? None of the quests sounded fun except for archery, and after I waited a long time in line to do that they closed down the range for a tournament right before it was my turn to go. Super disappointing.
Half the park was taken up by their haunted maze. It looked fun, but it was sold out for the night.
I'll probably go again in the winter or summer and just spend the whole day in the arena.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Some advice before I go to the review: go in expecting to talk to people, that's where this park shines - their actors. Everyone is friendly, and willing to help you build your own adventure. Talk to them, ask for quests to get gold, find out what factions they belong to, and explore the story. It's a nice park, by itself, but it's amazing when you start working with the actors.

We went for the Mythos Portal (which is the summer story), there are different portals open for different seasons, and it changes the story and the atmosphere when you go.

The park itself is very well kept (especially considering it's still under construction at the time I wrote this review). The buildings are gorgeous, there are beautiful statues, and it's just generally a fun town.

The only food we tried was the hot chocolate, which wasn't anything to write home about, but they did have some nachos and other food.

The biggest downside is the lines. Waiting to talk to some actors gets kind of difficult.

The actors are what makes this park shine. People dressed up in costume who know their parts. Goblins, Dwarves, Elves, Humans, Knights, Hunters, Rangers, Faeries, so many different people with interesting stories when you start talking to them. This is what will make or break your trip, is if you're willing to start talking to them and get into the roleplaying and the story of the park. If you start playing your own character the actors will join in and make you feel comfortable.

People come dressed up in costume, and it's fun if you do. If you are in the park, you can identify the actors by their usage of a glowing amulet that every actor wears.

You can dance to bagpipes with Faeries, throw axes with the hunters, go on a noble quest for the knights, meet some dragons (done with some awesome puppeteering). It's all in all a fun time, and you'll have a great time if you make it that way.
title: Evermore Park

text: Such a wonderful place to visit. All the characters were fun to talk to but I do wish the website was less vague on what to expect. Due to parts of the park not being open yet it was a little underwhelming how much there was to see. Also if you don't enjoy talking to people and following quests this place may not be for you however if that sounds fun then it is well worth the money. Just make sure you find a quest early in your visit so you can finish.
title: Evermore Park

text: By far one of the coolest places I've ever been! Went with my boyfriend last night. We are from Florida. Totally worth the drive to get here. Lore was an amazing portal! I loved telling ghost stories for gold! Amazing. Gonna create a character and come back again!
title: Evermore Park

text:
Do you love role playing, and/or role playing games? Do you like acting as a character, or watching people perform? Do you want to go on a quest to join one of several guilds and have fun knowing everyone around you is in the same fantasy world you are in? Go here!

Everyone was warm and friendly (unless their characters weren't). They presented quests, and help pull you into the world. You learned about these people and these stories, and could interact with the characters, and they held solid and true. I would take over conversations (As Finnius Feyweather.. Irish accent lol) and I would ask for stories, or ask for information, or ask for a song, and they never let me down, or broke character.

The musical dwarves, and wondering minstrel are must sees! They turned everything up to 11! The animal show was fun, and I even learned a few things! The park changes a few times a year, and I'm from Oregon and definitely plan on making a weekend trip down to see each one!

Great time for all ages! HUZZAH!
title: Evermore Park

text:
Amazing staff, beautiful place and they are totally doing all the right things. They are on top of precautions and great about enforcing masks be worn at all time. The staff is always in character and the higher up staff is great too.
I would recommend this for anyone and everyone. From kids, teenagers, adults and even grandparents. The layout of the park is great too. Not to big of hills and wide open place.
title: Evermore Park

text: We went with family and it was fun! The food was very good and all of the performers at the park were Friendly and very well suited for the parts that they portrayed! The magic show was great and the fire performers were great and put on excellent show!! We will be back to see the Christmas version!!!
title: Evermore Park

text:
This place is crazy cool! We found out about this place 2 days ago (open since Sept.I believe.). We knew we HAD to go. We arrived on the last day of World of LORE. We really wish we arrived earlier than 9pm and not on the final day. We also had no clue what to expect nor how long we'd need to do any of the quests. There were lots of people and it was hard to get a direction on how to begin a  quest.
If you plan to do any quests, we would recommend others to plan ahead for several hours spent here. We were there nearly 2hrs and didn't get to do much.
We absolutely believe this place is in the right direction and could be great if given more direction from the get go.
We will be back for Aurora and we can't wait!
title: Evermore Park

text: I took my kids aged 10, 8, and 5. They were a little unsure and shy at first, but then they warmed up and didn't want to leave at the end of the night. They said they had a blast! It was a little confusing how to get started but once we all got the hang of it we were having a lot of fun.  I think it would be a little more fun for adults without kids because you wouldn't have them holding you up at all and could really get into the intricacies of the tasks. I'm looking forward to coming back another time without kids! The actors were great and the scenery is amazing! The is still some construction happening but it doesn't detract too much and there is still plenty to see.
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore was so fun. We took our daughter for her birthday and it could not have been more perfect or magical for her. The characters were all so devoted and made the whole experience immersive and unforgettable. I cannot wait to come back!
title: Evermore Park

text: It's Aurora season and it looks amazing. We participated in the quests while we were there and loved them. Amazing interactive experience with a storyline and characters. It is definitely a immersion into a different world.
title: Evermore Park

text: We love this place, fully immersive, my kids felt like super heroes going on quests. Plans on staying for a couple hours ended up staying until closing. I'd choose evermore over other theme parks any day. There is nothing else out there like this.. it is a must see and experience.
title: Evermore Park

text:
We ended up going to Evermore Park tonight and although it was not completely finished it was a great experience! The details are extraordinary and talking to the characters provides insight into the story of Evermore without giving too much away.

My kids had a blast running in between characters sending messages going on quests and collecting items. It was amazing to see them in an immersive environment and being part of a theatrical experience.

The character spent time with my kids and showed interest in learning about them and the characters that they had created for their cosplay. Further they helped them to feel as if they were part of the experience. Where else can you spend time with characters and have them remember who you are at the end of the night? This doesn't happen but at Evermore it did. It was so cool to have 5 6 7 or even 8 characters talking to my kids and myself at one time! It was extraordinary!

Justin the manager was an amazing man and went out of his way to make the night special for my son who is celebrating his birthday! When this park is completed, it is my opinion that it will rival Disney and be destination for people all over North America not just Utah.

This park is not just for dress up and taking part in a cool Theatre experience but is also an educational opportunity for students and adults. Learning about the animals, the gardens, the mythology and various historical aspects of the park is fascinating. The characters use dialogue that is rich with vocabulary and the actors take the time to teach the meaning of the words to the young people that are there. My kids walked away having learned new words and their meanings. This is a fun and educational place and I cannot wait to see how the educational Outreach programs develop! As an educator myself, I would love to partner with Evermore and help them develop these programs!

I was astounded by the details of this park and cannot wait for it to be complete! It is hard to understand what is going on at first but if you are open and talk to the characters and listen to what they're saying and ask questions- you will have a delightful time. I highly recommend that everyone give this Park a shot.

If you are a perfectionist you may want to wait until the park is officially open before you attend. I hope that many people come and experience Evermore.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Evermore Park is foremostly a labor of love. As a park visitor, I see so much effort having gone into it: the attention to detail in the decorations, the sheer amount of money it must cost to build the park, the idea that they change the park seasonally. It fills a niche in theme park experiences, as it is a targeted to people who enjoy RPG/LARPing, although it is still accessible to much more casual park-goers.

My visit was with the guy Iâ€™d been dating for a few months. We arrived about 5m after 6pm on a Saturday. We waited in line for 35m for entry. Evermorians wandered back and forth along the line, handing out the daily newspaper. It mentioned a â€œdarkbloodâ€ disease that had been affecting the park; a wedding announcement for a couple named Ben and Ophelia; an obituary for an elf who had been found dead in the forest. Other ads and placements are in the one-sheet periodical, too. Come to find out, our wait was because of security. The Park checked each and every bag and pocket individually.

Once in the park, we saw a giant plaza under construction. There was a steep-roofed cottage selling desserts to the right, and an Elven Ranger greeted us, recruiting for his guild. We wanted food, so stood in line for another 20m. I got mac n cheese with chili and my date got pulled pork poutine. Iâ€™d rate our food 5/10; his poutine had too little gravy. As we waited, a small troupe did a performance in the â€œtown squareâ€. I couldnâ€™t hear them well.

After eating, we wandered towards the east side of the park, past a chapel under construction, and a games field with archery and axe-throwing. Itâ€™s important to know that there were many fire pits in small sitting areas on the path. We wandered three times through the mausoleum (where there was a giant spider!) because we had to count the candelabras in it for one of my dateâ€™s quests.

The park seemed understaffed. There were many stations where you could buy meals or desserts. But, only two people at each station. Any time we wanted food, it was a 15-20m wait, and half the time they were out of things â€” they had no bread bowls, no gumbo. I didnâ€™t pay attention to the number of restroom facilities, nor did I actually use them. But, as far as I could see, there was only one. They did have a special First Aid area which was easy to see and find. They had a merchandise shop, which was so-so. They had dragon eggs, shirts, postcards, horn mugsâ€¦

As to the plot of Evermore Parkâ€¦ it seemed like there should be an overarching storyline, but it wasnâ€™t quite there. There were guilds recruiting people (but only four guilds? rangers, hunters, knights, dragon tamers). At about 7:45pm, my date and I were in the tavern, when the announcement went out: Ben-the-engaged-guy had died. How? Why? If there were an explanation, I didnâ€™t catch it. There was a 9pm vigil in the town square. It was cringe-inducing. I thought someone was going to burst in on the eulogy and announce that Ben was murdered, or that Ben would reappear as a zombie. Nope. (It would have also helped if there had been a stage and mics for the actors.)

I wanted the timeline to be more on my schedule, and less on the parkâ€™s scheduleâ€¦ A Saturday night in Utah during October gets pretty chilly. There were fire pits aplenty, but I still was getting tired, and I felt I missed out on story because we left around 9:30. (Also, to be properly attired in October, wear a thermal base layer, grab some hand warmers and bundle up. And wear good walking shoes.)

I hear that the Evermore theme changes seasonally. I cannot imagine how much work that must be. The re-playability for the park is high; we shared a fire pit with someone who was at the park for their fourth time.

Anyway, I overall had a great experience. The best part of it was that it felt like a permanent Ren Faire: Park guests arrived in full LARP gear. Iâ€™m most excited to go back once more buildings have been completed and the storyline(s) more fleshed out.
title: Evermore Park

text: It was a lot of fun wandering through what  feels like a fantasy land and they have little quests to keep you busy. I think evermore has a lot of potential for becoming really awesome. A few things I felt they could work on is putting quests together that actually gets you somewhere with an end point instead of running it back and forth between characters for the sake of keeping you busy. Overall it's worth experiencing.
title: Evermore Park

text: This is the closest thing to a Disney theam park quality that I have ever seen! There is so much detail and craftsmanship in everything in that park. It's true that some parts of it are still under construction but I wouldn't let that stop you from going!  If anything it makes you more excited to go again and see what's new! The architecture is absolutely incredible and the actors know their story well!  I'm 30 plus years old and I was extremely impressed by the Evermore Park!
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore is a world of fantasy with characters to interact with and buildings to explore. There are quests to go on, a checklist of activities to accomplish and fun to be had by all. Even going in the winter was fun because there were firepits, heat lamps and warm tents to chase away the chill. To warm you on the inside they sell hot chocolate and delicious soup plus other treats. Enjoy ice skating and all the light decorations while they last.
title: Evermore Park

text:
This is a great place to go with the family or on date night for an evening. There are many ways to enjoy this park. Our family has two polar opposite ways of exploring and we all enjoy it.

One group goes full on into the "quests", leveling up, learning more about the story and trying to figure things out, learning more about the mysteries etc.

The other group enjoys getting to know the characters (coloring with fairies, asking about pirates, games, singing) eating, enjoying the scenery, going wherever kids want to go.

The park is fun for everybody! I'm so amazed by the characters and their commitment and development. The stories have so many layers and I can easily see how somebody could go here every evening they are open (Season passes might be a good idea). With younger kids, I tend to enjoy the animal show-which rotates animals, seeing the costumes and set, watching my kids' eyes light up, encouraging good manners, helping them in engage in conversations, watching them feel accomplished as they become a knight/hunter etc. There is something for everybody to enjoy!

TIPS:
-The Evermore Park cast/characters have a white pendant necklace that glows at night. Lots of people dress up. It helps to know who is official.
- Go to the left and go into the store for the first quest card if you want.
- Find the Traveling Story Tellers. Listen to multiple stories. It really helps to put some context in to what you're seeing and doing.
- Violet- the character with the parasol- is really easy to talk to and knows what's going on. She is often toward the front gates at opening of you need some context and direction.
- The park has a few themes/seasons. Some characters stay, some don't (ie go through the portal), some transform and adapt
title: Evermore Park

text: Great vision.  Confused execution.  Price too high for what you get. Extra charges for the interesting stuff...so why did I pay to get in? Most performers not comfortable enough in their own skins. I'll try again in a few years.
title: Evermore Park

text: Fun immersive fantasy experience. Do quests for people or just hang by the fire with live impromptu music and watch this magical world go by. The actors are also really great with kids.
title: Evermore Park

text: I see acres and acres of more Evermore, that's how amazing this park is. I believe Evermore Park will become a go-to international destination in the very near future. Thank you Evermore team for your wonderful imagination, immense creativity and stunning attention to detail. We have a winner.
title: Evermore Park

text: It was enchanting, mistic, fun! Its you have to interact with the cast members they are super friendly and helpful. It reminded me of being on a video game...its hard to describe you just have to try it at least once
title: Evermore Park

text: We should be able to give more than 5 stars!! This was an amazing experience!! Even got to stop and chat with Ken Bretschneider!! It was fun interacting with cast members, the lights are beautiful & the pub was one of my favorite places!! The meat pies and hot cocoa are to die for!! Definitely will be coming back!!
title: Evermore Park

text: Want to enter another world with fantasy creatures, delicious food, and interactive experiences? You need to try out Evermore! You are World Walkers and the inhabitants of Evermore are excited you are there! You'll need Elves, Dwarves, faeries, dragons, goblins, and much more! You'll learn songs, shoot archery, throw axes, and go on many a quest. I also highly recommend attending the bird and reptile show. The food wasn't too terribly pricey for a place like this and it was quite tasty. I can see why many people return here again and again, and even if you don't, you need to experience the Evermore world! The actors we're my favorite part. They talk with you and expand the story, many are funny, even the scary ones are friendly, and all are very well cast.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I want to love it BUT the park still has a lot of room to improve. The line to get in was unnecessarily long for having bought tickets and signed the waiver online. We waited 55 minutes before even getting inside. They needed more people at the entrance.
And no one let you know what to do once you were inside. I had watched some YouTube videos before hand and thought we were given character cards and an intro quest but after the long wait all we got was a map. So we started just by walking around aimlessly and exploring. It wasnt til 30 minutes later we realized the intro quest was on the back of the map! Would have been nice if the employee who gave us the map had told us that! And no one told us how to distinguish park employees from guests. (Because some guests had really elaborate costumes...) We figured out over time it was the people with green pendants.
But the BIG disappointment was after completing the first quest we went to the kettle cafe and turned in our gold to level up! The next quest we assumed would be something different but they simply handed us the same quest again and said they would have different ones in the future. They did say that there were quests to join each guild but it just felt like there was no reward or sense of accomplishment for that first quest. And the guild we wanted to join (the dragon trainers) we were told were "sick" or infected and were currently hold up in a building that was boarded up. So not sure if that meant we were supposed to find a way in side as part of the game or that the employees were just not working that night. We didnt stay to find out. We soon left after that after about 2 hrs.
But as I said I want to love it. The park did have a few things going for it:
The decorations and details were really awesome.
The actors characters seemed really cool and the ones we interacted with were nice and did a good job.
I would have loved if there was more to do. Bottom line all the quests (at least the ones available) seemed to be go somewhere talk to someone. And alot of the time the actors were surrounded by other guests so you had to wait to talk to them. The main areas to interact were crowded.
For the cost price I dont think it is worth it... Yet. I think they need some more actual attractions. It felt kinda empty. If you absolutely love DnD you could probably go spend 5 hours there and enjoy it completely. But if you prefer solo RPG videogames I'd say spend the money on those instead. For me and my wife it cost $64 bucks and now I kinda wish I had just bought a new videogame lol. But if you are considering going give it a shot and hope you enjoy!
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore park is a great theme park based on performance and costumes. As well as a park with a unique, ominous, fantasy atmosphere. Though it was not quite complete when I attended (opening night celebration) as several buildings were fenced off or still under construction, it has immense promise. The main appeal to me wasn't the gorgeous hand chiseled decorations, imported 400 year old statues, live instrument music, fantasy taverns filled with druids and fawns, or the dark gothic feel. But rather the inadvertant way the park enables everyone to show up as themselves. Free of judgment, and equally included. Regardless of their appearence or uniqueness. It's a much needed feeling in today's world. And that's how the park will likely be, for evermore.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Awesome place and an awesome experience.
So much to see and do and explore.
Family had a great time.
Enjoyed every minute.
Go on a search for a quest and explore a mythical and magical place.
Very unique and creative.
Thanks Evermore!
title: Evermore Park

text:
An absolute must see. The experience was amazing.  The actors were so fun and fantastic.  The art work on their sets and costumes and creatures was just amazing.The quests were a ton of fun, they give you reasons to walk around the park and see new things.

Large numbers of people there come dressed up and you can get deep into it and play a role or just hang back and watch.

The park is only half done anything it is already well worth the price to get in. I will be going back for sure.
title: Evermore Park

text:
It has great potential but it's just not there yet. It was still under construction in several places and it took away from the overall experience. I.E. construction equipment, metal fences, areas unaccessible.
The actors are great and stay in character very well. The kids enjoyed it but at the stage it is in now I think the price point is too high.
title: Evermore Park

text:
OVERVIEW - 4.8
Came here as a work activity.  We were enticed by how elusive the place is on details, let alone online.  We actually ended up looking at Evermore's social media to get a better understanding.

LOCATION - 5
Ever more is located in Pleasant Grove not too far the freeway and other surrounding businesses such as Essential Oils.  I had to use a GPS to find the location and then parking was a little confusing (I parked in the back thinking it was the front.)

PRICE - 4
Pricing was a little steep for my liking, but it was worth the experience.  My daughter had just turned 6 and so I had to pay for her, whereas if she was 5 or under she would have been free....  If I had to name the prices, I would set $15 at the perfect price for adults.

PRODUCT/SERVICES - 5
This is where this place excels!  The attention to detail was remarkable!  I was impressed by the Evermore cast.  They played their roles rather well.  I enjoyed the various roles they had as well such as the Druids, which were both serious and kind, the executioner was rather intimidating, the fairies were enlightening, the dragon trainer was so kind to my daughter.  If you have a chance to meet her do it!  She was awesome with my daughter.  I was even convinced that dragons were real after talking to her.

POINTERS/PERKS - 5
The objective of Evermore other than walking around and enjoying the detail is to interact with the cast.  Talk to them, go on quests.  They will give you tiny missions if you ask what you can do for them.  Keep in mind as the night progresses (especially near Halloween), that details and new quests can change.  Another trick I learned is sometimes you can listen in on someone else completing a quest, and then you come by a few minutes with the same details...  I would also recommend that if you have a poor memory like me, you may want to have something to jot down details such as a small notebook or your phone.  That's another detail, you may want to have a phone in case you get separated from your party as it is very likely.

If you complete a certain amount of quests you can become honor positions.  Such as a co-worker and his girlfriend both became honorary knights.

EMPLOYEES - 5
This is where they excel!  They stay in character the whole time.  Their details to their lives is amazing.  I also love it when characters interact with one another.  I saw a fairy talk to a soldier like they were the best of friends.
title: Evermore Park

text: Great park so far. Lots of fun actors/actresses to talk with and they are really fantastic! The park is on 15 acres and the environment is so good to the point where you forget you in the middle of a city area. It takes a second to get used to it but get into talking with the cast members and find some quests!
title: Evermore Park

text:
I've been to Evermore through 3 of their themed seasons now.  The park is still not finished.  I haven't tried the interactive story in a while, so I can't comment on that.  Don't miss the animal show.

I see the potential of this park and that's why I support them by attending.  It's enjoyable, but incomplete.  I recommend going, but recommend doing so with that in mind.
title: Evermore Park

text: I've probably been at least 5 times. I've enjoyed getting to know some of the characters. It's more fun when you dress up. I only wish that there were more physical activities to do, I liked the axe throwing, but what about a rope course, obstacle course, fake sword fighting, or things to ride etc. I'm also looking forward to more and unique storylines to participate in. And more ways to spend gold.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I think it's definitely worthwhile and would have been a lot of fun if we weren't in a rush. Our experience was about a 3-star, but I think it definitely can be a 5-star experience if you give yourself enough time. I give it 4-stars overall because I want to see improvement in their customer care and outdoor lighting.

Evermore is an immersive experience akin to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter (Universal Studios), Fantasyland (Disney), and Ghost Town (Knott's Berry Farm). There are a lot of characters to interact with, but no thrill rides. (There was a train ride, but it broke own the day we went, possibly due to weather.) It's definitely something you'll want hours to explore. I recommend getting the park map when you get there and seeing what is going on.

It was a lot of fun once we got settled in. But they do a pretty bad job of preparing new guests for the experience, so the first 10-15 minutes we're really stressful for us. Make sure you have plenty of time before any scheduled events.

We checked in at the front gate and had to work out what to do to get refunded on our train tickets. We had bought the additional Christmas Carol experience and they hadn't given us any information at the gate on how to redeem it. Luckily, we found someone else doing the Christmas Carol experience who told us where and how to redeem our tickets. Unfortunately, we ended up missing the beginning of the performance because of how long it took us to figure out what was going on.

We had about 30 people attend our Christmas Carol performance, which was probably the most it could handle. It was definitely hard for everyone to get the full experience. Additionally, someone had a double wide stroller, which slowed the group down a couple of times because of really narrow doorways and the uneven/poorly-lit pathways. It would have been fine, but the actors weren't trained on how to help someone with a stroller/wheelchair. It seemed pretty ADA and handicap accessible.
title: Evermore Park

text: There is really nothing like it. The park is beautiful. The actors are amazing and really draw you into the story. It's a world where truth and friendship win out in the end. In other words, it's exactly what we need.
title: Evermore Park

text: Had an amazing time. Fun for all ages. There is one spot that might be a little scary for smaller kids but nothing to bad. It wasn't crowded, which was really nice and going early meant we got to see the sunset.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Such an awesome creation with lots of imagination that went into this place!

However, I do wish more of the characters would approach guests, instead of it having to being vice versa. Approaching complete strangers is nerve-wrecking for a lot of people.
title: Evermore Park

text: A very cool place that is a one of a kind. Itâ€™s like a permanent Ren Faire on major steroids. It was our first time there and everything was pretty well done. The theming is amazing, even with all the construction going on.
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore is a really cool and beautiful place, I was very impressed with the architecture and design of the buildings and the park. The interactions with the actors are good but not the best, almost like you have to push a button for them to talk to you I think that if they came up to you more it would be more immersive, the other thing was the quest was very confusing and hard to complete  especially with the amount of people there. They should have some kind of quest paper to follow like a map. I think that the actors should also have a glowing madalion so when it's dark you know who are actors. It's a bit over priced also. With all said I was very pleased with the experience I had at Evermore, and would come again.
title: Evermore Park

text: The park looks amazing so far. It's still a work in progress, but you can see what it's going to be and it's going to be incredible. The atmosphere, the ambiance takes you in and transports you to another world, a different time. We'll definitely be going back.
title: Evermore Park

text: Amazing immersive experience! I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect in an amusement park with no rides. Walking through the walled town was like stepping into another world. A world straight from Game of Thrones, Dungeons & Dragons and Lord of the Rings all mixed into one.

text: Very fun and the buildings and costumes were great. Coming along and will be much better once it's completed. Food a little pricey and not many places to eat.
title: Evermore Park

text: This was such a unique experience. The more you are willing to get into it and play along the more you will get out of it. Amazing buildings and scenery. The actors and accents were believable and their makeup and costumes were even better. You truly feel your you've been transported to a different world when you walk through the entrance!

text: In time it will be ok.  Right now it is 40% complete.  My kids liked it but there was construction material everywhere and wires hanging out all over the place.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Tonight was way more fun than I expected! My daughter and I really got into the quests and finished the three main ones and lots of little ones, joined a guild (the adventure guild of course), watched a magic show and the fire dancers, and ended the evening with a decent cup of hot chocolate.
We bought the combo deal, with entry into the park, the two main quests which really gets you three, the train ride, and a meal with a drink. It was a bit spendy, but it was cheaper to buy the combo than buying everything separately, and in the end it was so much fun. Totally worth the price.
title: Evermore Park

text:
D&D in real life, without the fighting. My family plays D&D (paper & five, around the table) about once a month. This was an amazing experience and really complemented our game. We loved it. Took us about an hour to get into it and understand what to do. Very kewl concept and you can tell by all that they are building and landscaping that things are only getting started!

We were blown away at how professional, fun, and skilled the actors were. If you aren't afraid to let your hair down and be silly for several hours, go! You'll love it.
title: Evermore Park

text: Our son has had an excellent time running missions. I enjoyed the buildings and the restaurant.
title: Evermore Park

text:
I want to be super clear: I love Evermore. I've gone 3 times now and had a great time every time, except for this last one during Lore 2021.

The Haunt was a fun idea, except the time we reserved to go through it didn't matter at all. We spent an hour waiting in line to go in, far and away after our reserved time. Well, we thought, at least we get to go to the second haunt, maybe that one won't be as busy! Nope. We spent more time in line, then the second haunt that we paid for was the EXACT SAME haunt again, with a slightly different "quest". The quest was different by about 2 or 3 different lines in the script from the actors (who were wonderful, as always, but still). We were very disappointed with the haunt experience.

We also got combo tickets which included food vouchers. Guess what we did? Waited in line another 45 minutes for sub-par food. I think I saw about 2 people in the back making the food for hundreds of patrons. (Absolutely not the workers' fault!) Evermore is simply not equipped to handle this many people.

Perhaps if they limited the number of patrons in the park, so there are less people in general, it would help? I would happily pay more to enter if I knew I wouldn't spend literally 1/2 the time I spent there in lines. It's either that or bump up staffing to accommodate all of the people there.

I love love love Evermore with all my heart, and I so badly want them to succeed, but I wish some of the energy they put into their spectacular sets and costumes and actors also went towards straight up logistics. Even the bathroom situation is lacking. Only three stalls in the women's bathroom? No wonder there is always a line going around the building.

They tried something new, which is commendable! But in practice, it clearly wasn't the experience that was marketed to us.

I'm hoping that for the Winter theme they'll have learned a few things from the what they tried with Lore. I have every confidence that they'll try to improve the experience for their guests who love them and want them to succeed! And I'm looking forward to hopefully coming back to edit this review after we visit in the winter. I love Evermore!
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore is like a year round ren faire. Itâ€™s exciting to dress up and go on an adventure or just enjoy the atmosphere. Fun for my family, everyone can find something they enjoy.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Welcome to the magical realm of Evermore!
A space between our world and the magical, where something peculiar is happening..
We went in with no idea what was in store for us, and there really is no way to describe such a place of wonder!
This is only a fragment of what you'll encounter there.
There's so much to see and do we see having to go back for a second time!
It was an amazing experience being part of the story and figuring out what was happening in the realm!
I loved dressing up and playing my own role, and next time I'll actually be prepared.
If you're into the magical and mysticism, or not, I highly recommend you go check out @evermorepark and experience it for yourself!
title: Evermore Park

text: Absolutely love this place! The atmosphere is great, workers, artists, vendors are wonderful! Need eating options or snacks available throughout the park. Annual visits will continue! Love â¤
title: Evermore Park

text: Had a blast here with my wife and friends. Dress warm and commit 100% to all the fun things available there! Also we accidentally purchased extra tickets and they were able to refund us pretty quickly. Tina Jones helped us out and we sorted it all in 2 emails. Thanks again for all the effort you put into making this place magical!
title: Evermore Park

text: Such an awesome experience! There was so much to do. The actors were all amazing and made us feel totally immersed. Would absolutely go again.
title: Evermore Park

text: Evermore has amazing architecture, gorgeous costumes, delicious food, and fun quests. Their employees are in-character and quite entertaining. It was like being transported into a different time and place. I highly recommend!
title: Evermore Park

text: There is no shortage of entertainment to find here! Each season brings new excitement; whether it is the scares and haunting of Lore, the lights and cheer of Aurora, or any other event, you are sure to find fun at Evermore!
title: Evermore Park

text: This was our first time to Evermore, so we were not sure what to expect. It was absolutely incredible. They have something for all ages. There were trinkets to trade for my littles, battle competitions and archery to participate in, quests for those interested, aerial silks, animal shows, haunted garden, and the pyromancers were the favorite. We can't wait to go again!!
title: Evermore Park

text: He had a magical experience at Evermore. It was our 2 visit. We live all the way in Spring Creek, Nevada. Our first time must of made an big impression on my boyfriend because he chose to as me to marry him this time. All the magic and wonder added to making this moment in our life unforgettable. text:
We had so much fun exploring the park and doing a couple quests! We were only there for about two hours. We brought our 4 year old daughter and she absolutely LOVED all the characters and how so many people were dressed up! She made me promise she could dress up as a fairy or pirate next time we go.

We did find starting out to be a bit difficult with the acorn quest from the fairy, but after asking for a hint we were finally able to find our first one and know what we were looking for! Finding the rest was MUCH easier after finding the first one! Everyone was so nice and it was so cool! I loved seeing all the other visitors fully enjoying themselves in full cosplay! Luckily there were enough people not in cosplay that we didn't feel awkward or stick out. I'm not talented enough to put together such wonderful costumes.

If you happen to be in a wheelchair or a knee scooter (I was on a knee scooter) there are a lot of cobblestone areas and one area that is a little bit of looser gravel, so be prepared for some bumpy areas! Totally manageable, but obviously is a bit harder than just walking. Definitely looking forward to a trip without the knee scooter! Hahah

Also the tiny bottle of fairy dust you get from taking a picture of all the acorns is one of the cutest things ever!

title: Evermore Park

text:
Point 1: DO NOT COME IN SUMMER IF YOU ARE AFRAID OF SPIDERS. They are EVERYWHERE! Big too! Since Evermore opens in the evenings all the spiders are LITERALLY DROPPING FROM ALL THE TREES AND AWNINGS EVERYWHERE. We literally couldn't stay after that. I don't care if they aren't dangerous--pathological fears don't care.

Point 2: After coming every year I am officially over the fact that the park isn't even finished. While individual buildings are cool and fleshed out, the grounds are just...boring. There's lots of dirt, unfinished buildings, and broken set pieces. Even the magnificent statue in the fountain the park was famous for is falling apart. I have never seen the fountain actually going. It's all just...disappointing.

Point 3: There is no consistency. Not in the costumes, not in the art, not even in the lore. The Makers had this deal about not being able to be a proper guild, there are a lot of employees that don't bother acting or dressing up, and approaching the actors who are there feels like interrupting because they are often talking to each other. We didn't even know who worked there since no one told us about the necklaces until we asked. Yes, their acting was great, but there weren't enough of them and those that were there were always in a crowd of people. We didn't feel like standing in line forever to talk to someone so we moved on.

Point 4: We got a pastry from the pastry shop and while it was tasty it was hard as a rock!

Final remarks: I just can't believe that after all this time none of this stuff has been fixed. I know people come from across the U.S. to see this place. Sure hope they get a better experience than I did.

text:
At Evermore you participate in an interactive, live action story. You get completely immersed in one of (currently) three stories depending on the season. In summer it is Mythos, fall is Lore, and winter is Aurora.

While the stories are different, the mechanisms are the same. You meet characters portrayed by Evermore actors. They will give you tasks or quests to be accomplished. Completing these quests allows you to "level up" and possibly join a guild.

Expect to spend an hour or more completing a quest, and 20-30 minutes to finish a task. That's my biggest complaint with Evermore. You should be able to complete tasks faster and get rewards more quickly.

The other problem is sometimes many people will be backed up at a particular actively or character. The best way to avoid this is to work on multiple tasks or quests simultaneously. That way if one area is busy you can work on a different task.

Many people dress up but it certainly is not required. There are quite a few people walking around in street clothes. However, if you want to dress up in themed costumes, you definitely won't be alone. Note that real weapons (swords, knives, etc.) are not allowed but plastic or wood replicas are fine.

Be sure to look for the Evermore pendant to identify characters vs. your fellow "world walkers" (park guests) who dressed in costume. At night the pendent is lighted so they are easy to spot.

If you're new to Evermore, the best suggestion is to talk to all the characters you meet (even just walking around) & ask lots of questions. While the actors will remain in character, they will answer questions and help you enjoy your experience.

Pro tips:
1. Buy tickets online for a slight discount & generally faster entry
2. Bring a hat, sunglasses, & sunscreen
3. Bring a water bottle & stay hydrated
4. Bring a notebook & pen or pencil, you'll want to write down notes & facts
5. Avoid backpacks & large pursues, they are subject to search & will slow down your entry
6. Jump right in & participate in the Evermore story, you'll have a better experience

title: Evermore Park

text:
I think this place has a lot of potential, and I understand it's still under construction. It's not catered to crowds so probably don't go on a weekend for a better experience. I definitely would say it's a fun family experience. I went with my husband only and felt like we got lost and pushed around by the bigger groups a lot. Dress warm because it's outdoors. You enter a story. It's kind of like a village and you walk around visiting places, talking with actors. You usually end up having to do them a favor in exchange for information or gold.

The good: The actors were great! Especially Flutterheart, the knight with a teapot hat, and Drock the goblin. The buildings were cool too! Cool creepy spider monster jumps out at you .. Loved those sorts of things. Loved how everything was themed. I was even impressed with the bathrooms and drinking fountain ðŸ‘ I could see the kids having fun, getting candy and anti-hexing leafs from the fairies to trade for gold, and we were dubbed squires! That was fun. Fire show was cool. Loved the violin/performers that set the ambiance.

The bad:
Honestly, the biggest thing was that we were so confused the whole time! Especially at the beginning, and we wasted so much time getting gold to trade for information we already knew. I wish they had an opening video or something to explain some backstory, or a pamphlet describing the characters or something??? Also, it was so crowded that we had to wait so long to talk to the characters. And we waited way too long for the axe throwing just to only get two chances.  Couldn't even participate in the fortune telling and archery like I wanted because we would've waited in line way too long. This place is not catered for crowds and Saturdays are crowded, apparently. I kept thinking regular people were the actors because it's too dark to tell if they're wearing a medallion, but I can see how that fun for people to dress up.. I just felt very exhausted and like we didn't get anywhere. By 10:15pm we were too tired to continue and no where near understanding the story. I still have a black rock (no clue why I needed it because the actors kept getting distracted talking to other people, no one bothered to explain) and a piece of gold for the Fae King... The line was too long to talk to him as well. I feel left out. Just don't think it was worth $30, but understand why it's necessary to charge that much with all the people they need to pay.

In all, I do think it was fun for the most part, and a great family activity. I was just disappointed. Think they have some kinks to work out, and maybe it'll be even cooler when the rest of the park is finished. Maybe I'll return with a better review when that happens. As of right now, probably won't be returning anytime soon.

text:
Evermore is absolutely dripping with wasted potential. I am hopeful they can sort things out and make the park into something that justifies the extremely expensive entry price for what is there now. I may try again when the "season" changes for Christmas.

Everything from getting into the park to the way the "experience" is presented just feels unpolished, which is probably a metaphor for the fact that various really interesting looking aspects of the park are still under heavy construction and blocked off.

First off, the ticketing process is underwhelming. It would be nice if the tickets were a little bit nicer as a kind of memento that you were there. They could even be themed to the season for collecting, and it would be cool to incorporate them into the story in some way as in you're a traveler who has some kind of token.

Second, there is nothing encouraging you to engage with the characters or story. Lots of people encourage you to go in with the intention of being absorbed into the world and experiencing it like a video game. The problem is, there is no introduction to the world or back story to why you showed up like you would get in Skyrim or other RPGs. You basically just have to chat with random cast members who are obviously trained to respond to very specific trigger words that you can't really guess and the cast gives you no encouragement of what types of questions you should ask. So most conversations are the cast member trying to repeat themselves in a way that sounds like they are answering your questions but mostly just leave you confused. The park really should do more to draw you in, and encourage you to be drawn in. Without that, the ticket price feels like a waste of money and that's the experience of most visitors.

Third, the place is just insanely crowded. That means random conversations with cast members force people to either hang around overhearing what is going on, or stand around in big clumps waiting for their chance to talk to an important character. The park needs to figure out how to work around large groups of people rather than just one on one conversations.

Lastly, there is just a ton of immersion breaking material around the park. Mainly chain link fences and construction equipment. While the park is open they really should figure out a better way to mask these things because it does affect the overall atmosphere of the park to see big cranes and tractors just sitting around the outskirts of town.

Overall I can see what the park is going for, but it's still quite far from reaching it. Hopefully with a little more time to bake they can get there. If not, I can't see Evermore being around in the long term.
