text:
This is a very unique place. It has a lot of potential. I can see it growing to be really popular. I write my experience with the hopes that improvements can be made to really enhance the place.

The park vibe:
Very cool idea. It did feel like we were in a whole different world. Sadly I could still see some things under construction which I wish was covered up like Disney does it. But I also understand the new business budget canâ€™t afford that much. So not a big deal. I loved the characters walking around and being interactive. They were a lot of fun. At night the lightning is eery and fun. It would be kinda scary for young kids though. And it would be easy to loose a child in that lighting.

The costumes:
Very high quality costumes the employees wear. But also, many guests of the park wear costumes too. Which is fun but kinda difficult to tell who is an employee and who isnâ€™t. I wished the employees had glowing name tags so I could know who to ask for directions and stuff from. It would be awkward to ask another guest for help.

The food:
I LOVED the sandwhich I ordered. Very yummy! The monte Cristo at the dessert shop was very oily though and I wished it had been cooked in an air fryer instead. I also wish the menu had pictures. Itâ€™s a lot easier for me to order things that I can see.

The magic show:
The beginning was really boring. Your typical magic tricks that you see. Was not a fan of the â€œwordâ€ trick because there was no magic to it. He never even said what the word was. Maybe that was a distraction for his next trick but I didnâ€™t like it. The last trick was awesome! One of my all time favorite tricks to watch. Very impressed with that. Giving his act more of a WOW the entire time would really make this place have more credibility. Go all out!

The train:
We loved the train. Super fun to see the whole town and go around the train. Fun for kids and fun for us. Just a short little ride.

The map:
I like the graphics of the map. That is user friendly. But the magician tent and stuff isnâ€™t on it. And all the locations seem to be in the mythical words and make it not user friendly at all. I had no idea what there was to do and where it was. Many people around me were confused too. I wish we were given a map when we entered and I wish there were big maps around the park. I just need it to say the different places and what there is to do and explore at each one.

Getting Lost:
Aside from what I already talked about with the map, I wished each location had a solid sign of what it was right on the building or tent. I wasnâ€™t sure what buildings we could and couldnâ€™t go in. I need more than a chalkboard in front of the magician tent that says...
â€œmagic showâ€ and then a sign at eye level with the times of the shows. I arrived at 6:00 and the sign said magic show every half hour. But they didnâ€™t open till 7:00 so at 6:30 I was confused why nobody was there.

Haunted House:
Sadly I had to work and leave early so we were not able to experience the highlight of the park. Next time Iâ€™ll give you some info on that.

Website:
The website for sure needs help. It needs to be more simple in layout and show whatâ€™s in the packages and what there is to do better. I needed everything disclosed. I kept reading about some sort of circus and when I asked some of the employees about it they said they were the circus.. I expected a circus show with animals and tricks. Not just characters walking around. Maybe it was a misunderstanding on my end but yeah really confusing. There is also a bird show that looks pretty cool from online but I wasnâ€™t able to go to that either because I had to leave early for an important work zoom call.

I wish there was a restroom on the north side of the park too.

I also think it would be AWESOME to have a costume shop! Also little kiosks around selling hot coacoa, hand warmers, and fun merch.

Donâ€™t let the 2 starts fool you. This place has the potential to be incredible. Just a few tweaks will make a big difference.

Wouldnâ€™t recommend this for kids under age 8.

The haunted house was extra money, but it was totally worth it. You can join guilds (if you come mainly for that sort of thing) where you have to complete quests around the park. They also have places to buy food, which the food is decent. The price for admission was totally worth the experience.

text: One of the nicer courses in Portland metro area. It drains well so it's not a bad place to play in the 6 months a year when we have nothing but rain here. It is a bit hilly so if you're not in shape a cart is recommended. One of my favorites and a just beautiful, park like setting course.

title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Wildwood has it all in the name! It's wild and in the woods. Expect to use a cart or be sore the next day from walking- but those are both great options!

Nestled in the foothills of Forest Park (one of the nation's largest urban pakrs) the gorgeous setting allows unparalleled views. If you find yourself frustrated about your golf game, you can take a moment to see beautiful glimpses Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens, and countless other bounties of nature.

Oh yes of course- golf! The course itself is well-maintained, and has its own unique blend of challenges and opportunities. Navigating through a "normal" course is challenged in its own rite, but couple that with nestling into the side of a mountain and you have Wildwood!

You owe it to yourself to make the trip out there to enjoy it. You can thank me later!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Really enjoy Wildwood. The course is always in good condition and the prices always seem fair. I play courses that charge more or just as much as Wildwood, but are over crowded and not as pretty. The layout provides variety for the holes. It has a parkland feel that is cut into a hill side. There is only one house that lines the fairway. About half of the holes have an elevated gain at the green or tee box.  It might be a ride for some. If the walk from the first tee box or the walk to the 9th green look steep to you. You have a similar walk about 9 or 10 times. Even though it is right off HWY 30, it is really peaceful on the course.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Very nice course. Prices are good, staff is friendly, greens are well maintained.  Back 9 more challenging than the front. Get a gas cart, some of the electric ones can barely climb the hills. Oh and if you are not in shape take a cart as the hills are a plenty.

text:
Four of us from Honolulu, Hawaii played this course on September 26, 2016 and we absolutely enjoyed the round.  Great staff, course and surroundings. Had previously called Bob to inquire about the course due to the mixed reviews.  Wildwood GC provides exceptional value and we put this course on our play again course whenever we're up here in the Portland area. Our foursome consisted of three Waialae Country Club and one Mid-Pacific Country Club members.  Mahalo Bob for taking great care of us.

Returned to play with some other buddies on May 6, 2017 before heading back to Honolulu the next day after a  five day golfing tour in the greater Portland area.  They were impressed Wildwood is on their "will play again" list.  Thanks Tom and the rest of the staff for taking care of us and welcoming us back.  Will be back up there in early-October with the original 2016 Honolulu guys!

PS: Wildwood has great drainage so this is one of three courses we now know that is playable after heavy rains.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Wildwood is a great course. Lots of fun, fair prices. They have a friendly helpful staff, and keep the course in great shape.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Just played here on Sunday 10/6, about three weeks post-punching. The greens are fantastic. They're rolling very smooth and true..and at a great speed. They're firm, yet they're holding shots the way they should. Also, the traps were all hand raked, and fairways were very playable.

Look for a new expanded green complex and new lower tee on the par three # 6, and new tee locations on # 7. One thing that always impresses me about Wildwood, is the attention to detail, and the constant reinvestment in the course and clubhouse.

Also, the service is always friendly and accommodating. If you've never played Wildwood, be sure to give it a try. It's a real hidden gem of a golf course, with plenty of interesting holes, lots of character and challenges, and spectacular views.

And finally, Wildwood is in such a peaceful, serene setting, that it has an amazing overall calming impact on my game, as you can see in the photo below, taken at the 15th tee.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Glorious setting, great staff, and we love the weekend music.  Thank you!

title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Challenging holes are carved out of the hillside along the river at this course to provide something for everyone. First and foremost there is more vertical change at this course than many I have played in the past. Some pin locations are a hundred feet above the tee box while others are the same downhill. This makes it almost a must to rent a cart if you are playing 18, unless you are in peak physical condition.

The clubhouse is big and clean with friendly staff members to help out with your needs. The range is quite short and narrow, only 200 yards max by about 20 yards wide which makes it hard to warm up for the long shots you will need to be successfull right off the first tee. The carts are older and gas powered which made it tricky to get up some if the steep hills and there is some slow play if you are behind the wrong group.

Insider tip: make sure to study the course before you go if you haven't played here. There are hidden creeks and obstacles that ruin great shots down the middle. Better yet, play a practice round so you'll be ready before taking it on!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: The current theme is a very well put together display of a significant time is the history of Gaston County & NC. that is not tales about too often. The museum housed in an historical hotel and it has some examples of how it  looked back then;  it is pretty neat to see how elegant it was.

title: Gaston County Museum

text:
The kids absolutely loved this place. Best money I've ever spent for an outing with the kiddos. The planetarium started the tour and the kids were amazed! Very interactive with even the youngest. There's tons of exhibits, the place just keeps on going and going. It honestly took the better part of 4 hours. Then the outdoor educational section with live animals. Pigs, goats, chickens, roosters, etc, etc. Even dinosaur fossils to check out. Many many live creatures in tanks as well. Owls, snakes, softshell turtles
And a native American section that's very large in itself. We will definitely not hesitate to come back every time we pass through this area. Finally been satisfied with what we get for the cause when it comes to entertaining four kids ages 2,4,6, and 8. Absolutely had a great time as an adult too.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
We loved this museum, it has too much to offer!
The main building is not super big but it has many interesting exhibitions and information, this is definitely the first stop; but then you have a beautiful farm (outdoor) with an old cabins and many other stations and animals that your kids will love.
In addition to it you can also walk-hike trough a small forrest that is also beautiful and a perfect opportunity to enjoy nature. There is a lot to do ðŸ‘

title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
This was such a cool place to learn about so many different things. Local history, habitats, and animals beginning in the Prehistoric Era. Informative and well maintained exhibits.

The planetarium show was really interesting to watch about the Artemis Mission.

Outside there is a wonderful shady trail that it a half mile that circles the property. There are really awesome exhibits outside as well as a play area for the kids, a pond, an old mill, a stone age heritage site and a Catawba Indian Village.

There is also a small farm that you can enjoy with live animals. The cost to enter is $3/pp but we ran out of time today.

This museum could be an all day place to take the kids, pack a lunch and sit at one of the inside tables to eat or at one of the many picnic tables outside.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
The museum had some really nice exhibits an dinosaurs, and 'Creepy Nature' as well as a good permanent exhibit area.  The 'farm' area was a little disappointing, but that was probably due to it being November.   There were no staff around to answer questions or monitor the area that we could see.
The planetarium was small, but did a neat little show on the night sky.  Some of the non-sky images were blurry, and the show was definitely geared toward a younger audience than my just turned teenager, but we still enjoyed it.  Overall, I think it was well worth the $ and the time to make the stop while we traveled through the area!
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: Took the girls here for a little trip.  Loved the nature exhibits and the dinosaurs.  The planetarium was by far the best of the experience.   Took the nature trail for a picnic to close out the day.  You can go further up past the pond and there is a covered area with tables there if you need a lot of room.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: This museum is amazing! So many artifacts to read on. Iâ€™m a huge nerd for anything remotely related to history and this museum is after my own heart. text: Live animal exhibits were WAY too small for said animals and the care was very dissapointing. title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
We have lived in NC for 8 years and I wish we had discovered this place sooner!! This museum is fantastic for all ages.

From the life-size dinosaurs to the tiny creepy crawlers, my kids were engaged and eager to learn at every turn.

We came during a free Duke Energy Tuesday....they offer free admission twice a month and it wasn't crowded at all! I don't think many people know about the discount.

Everyone we saw was properly masked and social distancing wasn't an issue.

I can't wait to come back to check out The Farm and the planetarium!!

text: On this beautiful Saturday we decided to visit the outdoor areas. We had previously been inside and viewed the exhibits. There is a planetarium with a variety of shows that change from week to week. The outdoor areas include a â€œfarmâ€ with goats , chickens, and alpacas. There is a garden with a wide variety vegetables and fruit growing. The trails lead along a stream and showcase a time from history where technology did not make everything as easy as we have it today. Great outdoor space for the family.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: We love this museum! We have a yearly membership. The inside is fairly small and you only need about an hour and a half to go through the entire museum. Outside is a walking trail and small animal farm. The planetarium is great! We love to go to all movies that play there. Theyâ€™re 30 minutes long and very informative and fun for all ages. Gift shop is currently closed due to Covid. Fun place for all ages and very affordable.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: This is a great museum!  It's very family and kid friendly.  This is our 2nd visit and last time the room upon entering was a science room with blocks and such.  This time it was a dinosaur exhibit for kids (kid's dinosaur books, some real fossils, discovery stations, etc)  The animal farm is now open but most of the animals were not available (probably due to the cold weather).  The staff there is very friendly and helpful.  We caught a movie at the planetarium and it was very good.   The screen is not the best quality but it was adequate.  When the weather is nice, the nature walk is lovely!  The pond, trails, and streams are beautiful.  Some of the pics I posted are from last year when it was warmer out.  The outdoor play area is great for the kids (again, weather permitting!)  Admission is reasonable but the planetarium shows are extra but still reasonably priced.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: This was our first time visiting and we were more than impressed! text: This is a hidden gem for any naturalist. There's an emphasis on taxidermied animals and American Indians. There are some exhibits that have been closed for renovation for over a year, so there is less to see. Planetarium prices are NOT included in regular admission or even membership. The outdoor area is free to the public and has nice trails and historic structures along the way. Few things are interactive so there's not a lot for younger kids, with the exception of the pirate ship and a small puppet area.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: I stopped to visit the museum while I was in the area. It has many exhibits that are typical of a natural history museum such as dinosaurs, minerals/rocks, eco system displays, birds, bugs, and other animals. It had an American Indian section and a specific North Carolina area which I thought were neat. There were also live animals in some places and I wasnt expecting that. The creepy house and exhibition was very interesting to me because it was based on a real person's experience finding out what was true or false in nature. Overall I would recommend it, some of the areas just seemed small to me or a little older.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:

The pirate ship was fun. We didn't get to do the planetarium because.. let's face it. My 2 year old wouldn't sit through it. They have small live animals to check out too like a possum, snakes, parie dog and turtles. On the back side of the building there's pigs and sheeps. There's a trail with a pond and other things. It's a nice cheap family outting.

title: Landmark Suites

text:
Of all the hotels that I've stayed in my entire life, I can safely say, this is the most complete one yet. The rooms are so well planned. The separation of bedroom(1 tv here) and kitchen-and tv room(another tv here). The quality of the mattresses. The quality of the linen and the cleanliness. The stocked kitchen with cooking utensils and pots & pans. The safe in the closet. The quietness and the food offerings at the counter. And the value for the money can't be beat.
I could not stay at another hotel  in the vicinity, after staying here. My hat's off to the management and owners for such a well designed and planned offer. I highly recommend your stay at this great hotel. You won't regret it!
title: Landmark Suites

text: Well designed and efficiently run hotel. Everything you need for a comfortable stay. Great breakfast, very clean, lots of hot and cold choices. text:
The hotel was fine, looked nice on the surface but definitely not maintained at all. Our room had a busted divider frame in the seating area as well as a broken closet door mirror. I let the front desk know about it immediately apon us checking into our room, they said they would let maintenance know right away... we stayed 4 days and it was never addressed. The other negative part was the pool, my daughter was only able to swim once due to the extremely over chlorinated water. It was hard to sit in there it was so bad. Her eyes burned for days after swimming in there.

The staff was friendly. The room was clean, it is just sadly starting to get run down from what I can tell.

text:
I stayed here for a few nights after a work trip so I could visit with family before the holidays. The room was nice, but needed some tlc. There were a few spots on the ceiling where the plaster was noticeably cracked and bubbled, as well as a large spot where it was missing. The curtain was also a tad stained.

Other than those small issues, everything else the room was in great condition. The room was well-cleaned and both the sofa and bed were comfortable. I generally prefer to stay at this location as it's quieter then staying near the airport. The staff here is also very friendly and accommodating, which is a huge plus for me.

text:
Thanks for the great stay Hyatt Eden!!  A group of us drove from Winnipeg to Minneapolis to catch a Vikings game. We were concerned this hotel was too far away but it didnâ€™t turn out to be an issue. Itâ€™s easy enough to drive around the city. Maybe took us half hour to get downtown. The Harley store, Target and Menards are close to the hotel so that was nice.

The rooms are big!! King Bed comfy, shower pressure great and lots of hot water!!!  Pull out sofa.
Could have easily had 4 adts share the king room.

Front staff check in was pleasant. They didnâ€™t realize we were all traveling together so they ended up placing us on different floors. But that was our fault for not speaking up.
We also didnâ€™t speak up about having a room away from the elevators. It was annoying to be woken up super early from guests checking out and kids running up and down the hallway etc. By the elevator. Things yah just donâ€™t think about sometimes.

We would all stay here again!!

The awards this place has won speak for themselves. First stayed their by chance, then intentionally went back a year later. Highly recommended.
title: Harmony Inn & Suites

text: Was very surprised at the quality of this motel.  Excellent service, good self serve breakfast, newly remodel rooms, easy parking, and very clean.  We stayed in one of the suite rooms with a whirlpool tub, and couldn't have been happier.
title: Harmony Inn & Suites

text: Very clean facilities. Breakfast didn't start until 6am, we had to leave at 5am and breakfast was hot and ready at 4:45am. Thank you! Great service.
title: Harmony Inn & Suites

text: This place is a gem in the rough. Very friendly staff, rooms cleaned daily, beds were comfy.
title: Harmony Inn & Suites

text: Clean and convention location
title: Harmony Inn & Suites

text:
Location, staff, beds were great. Breakfast was good, except the choice of Turkey sausage for a protein. Can we just get pork sausage? Otherwise, buffet was a hit.

More significant, we chose the King "executive suite" room for the larger room and the separate bedroom. Well, except for the strange choice of clear windows for the doors between rooms. Why?! No privacy in the bedroom.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: When I travel for business I like to stay the Hampton Inn for the service.  Always have good experiences. Although,  I'm a  bit disappointed with this location  because the decors and furnitures are a bit outdated.  My bed wasnt made.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: We splurged on the King Suite.  It had a bedroom and living room. There were two TVs although the living room TV was small.  Would be nice if you could connect streaming devices easier.  Good lighting and outlets.  Comfortable bed.  Pool adequate for laps.  Hot tub nice although timer/jets not really working.  No guest laundry.  Incredibly helpful staff.  Several chain restaurants within walking distance.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. We enjoyed the pool and the hot tub. There was an exercise room too. I absolutely loved their breakfast. The lack of a mini fridge and a coffee maker in the room was very disappointing.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: One of the larger Hamptons in which we've stayed. Easy check in and out. Ample luggage cart space. Clean, comfortable, quiet room - made for good sleep. Wish there were tables (even a small shelf) on both sides of bed. Clear desk and bedside table with plug-ins made setting up computer, phones, and other equipment easy. Companion enjoyed the pool (could be cooler) and hot tub (could be warmer). Good equipment options in workout room. Breakfast options included blueberry or malt mini-waffles, cheese omelets, bacon, biscuits, gravy, fruit, cereal, breads and pastries, yogurt. REALLY appreciated separate seating with one television instead of having to hear others' choices; our table was in a quiet, large, open area. Omelets ran out so staff member brought them to our table when more were ready. Good location near highway.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our quick, overnight stay here. The staff was friendly, our room was clean and the breakfast was hot and fresh.
While there, we also discovered that we were the first to ever bring a pet to their hotel, ever! My dog, Grimley, greatly appreciated his welcome goodie bag and how close our room was to the exit â˜ºï¸
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: We were driving across the country. Made reservation on my app. We arrived late at 11:30pm and the Receptionist was very friendly and helpful. We got to our room quickly and to bed even faster. Had a wonderful nights rest. Got up for a morning run and there us a beautiful trail along the Platte River. Housekeeping were all very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast was perfect. We would recommend this Hotel.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Superb dog-friendly hotel. Upon check-in, we were given a helpful information sheet, dog treats and a spare doggie bag. Room was very clean and quiet. Two restaurants within walking distance with a 10 % discount if you show your card key. Very friendly staff. We went to a dog park referenced on our information sheet and it was a great park! Waggin Tails!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text:
Reserved our deluxe king room with jetted tub for Sept 19th back in mid June 2021 & requested a quiet location (if possible). They put us in room 314, which was located on 3rd of 4 floors, right outside of the elevators & across from the ice machine room (very noisy).

The bath towels were thin, rough, and worn (one had two rips on edges... see pics). Jetted tub was the best part of the room, but took forever to fill up. But, for some stupid reason there was NO vent fan in the bathroom! Horrible!

The furnishings were a bit dated & I wouldn't call the size of the king room a "deluxe". Reserved that room purely because I knew after a 12 hr drive I'd want to soak in a nice big bath tub. Mattress was comfy, but only 3 squishy pillows (not 4) on the king sized bed (no neck support at all).

I wouldn't pay $172 (after taxes) for another stay in a king sized room there (booked thru Expedia.com). A bit disappointing.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: We got upgraded to the suite, which allowed for a little more room. There was a couch instead of another bed. The shower had a tub, and a great shower head. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast was good. Would stay again.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Well the room, people and services are great as expected.  The hot tub is ridiculously small.  The pool area is huge but has a hot tub made for children.  They have plenty of room for a 8 to 10 person tub but have one that is cozy for 2 adults.  We also had some equipment stolen off out trailer.  The lack of security is very surprising.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: First time here, did the reservation online on the way.  Brandon called just as i was getting off the freeway to check on us, so thoughtful.  Great price,  friendly service. The room is nice and clean.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Facility was clean and they let us check in early as we were driving all night. Kids loved the pool. The o ly suggestion I would make would be to improve the pool area. It looks like the hot tub is plagued with black mold, and there is rusty metal in the pool.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Love it! I'm staying for almost a week. Everyone here has been wonderful! They even called me when my lost luggage came in and took it to my room. Very clean rooms, cleanest pool and spa I've seen at a hotel, the biggest free breakfast (including omelettes, meats, potatoes, waffles, etc.) Great hotel!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Easy to find, access, and exit Hampton. Conveniently located at the highway exit and next door to three resturaunts  and a Sinclair gas station with mini-mart. Clean facility with very good service and a complimentary breakfast. Trucks with up to 30 ft trailers can manage this lot others can easily park curbside. It has all the usual ammenities.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Had a great stay here! Would definitely stop in again if Iâ€™m passing by!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Old, run down. Saw ants & a spider by the pool. Rooms are dated from the 80's. WI FI is shoddy @ best. Given the wrong room. No refrigerator! 2nd floor ice machine takes at least 5 minutes to produce ice, not alot of ice btw
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Very clean rooms and very helpful staff. The breakfast was also very tasty and provided lots of options as far as the buffet goes. 10/10 would stay again!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: The place was exceptionally clean. The staff bent over backwards to make sure everything was taken care of. The place has SOFT WATER!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Very nice employees, great rooms and a good breakfast
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Awesome place! Very friendly staff!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Friendly- clean - accommodating
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Great place, semi family with a little adult on the side. Has walkout villas which we stayed in and condos. Villa -10 is personally owned and configured differently but has same layout as other villas. Huge tall living, large baths, large rooms. Lots of space inside. Sit on a Lawn chair and and do activities on the turf grass out back. They provide most everything but would recommend more toilet paper, sand chairs per person, shade if you want it. How you rocky point - bring loads of food, prepare with a Costco run, condiments and snacks and good food. Then mess up the dinner plans by instead of preparing it, go into town for tacos.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Peaceful, So relaxing, Beautiful, water perfect temp. Sun sets Awesome !! Beach 4 to 5 min. Walk for your room. Swim up bar. Several restaurants in the area. Don't take life for granted You have to experience this At least once in a lifetime !!!! It's only a 3 and a 1/2 hour drive from Phoenix.........
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Awesome resort ! Loved the pools and jacuzzis went in off season January it was very chilly but the condos were quiet and security is great. Very nice area and the front desk staff was awesome and helpful . Will come again.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Three days before arriving, we were informed that the condo we booked was sold. My wife called and spoke to Rodrigo. He accommodated us with a stay in 2 different locations 2 days each. The initial location was larger than our original reservation and had the smell of musk and mold. I didn't complain to the front desk because we were moving locations in two days. The second location was smaller than our original reservation. Here for an event that we didn't want to miss, so we made do. Special thanks to Rodrigo for helping us with our stay so we could attend the event we booked our stay for. Photos are of moon lit sea at sandy beach.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text:
Ummm I probably wouldnâ€™t come here because of the security, they were super strict, couldnâ€™t do much but then again itâ€™s their job, but they made us feel uncomfortable. We booked on Expedia which then brought me to Virbo and I had to create an account and the owners name is Tom. It was a little confusing but figured it out.
The apartment was very spacious and clean,to bedrooms and a set of bunk beds, it had everything you need such as laundry soap, condiments, utensils, plates etc. So we were able to grocery shop for the week.
When you go to the pool, the kiddie pool is not warm and there is an adult pool for night. The beach is beautiful but there is always a low tide so you will have to walk a little to get to the water.
The town is not fully developed, so donâ€™t expect a Cancun experience but you will find authentic Mexican food when you drive into the town.
In the tourist area of Puerto Penasco, they sell very expensive souvenirs, charging in American prices. Donâ€™t forget to try the Oyster farm! 100 pesos for one dozen oysters
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: This was a great condo & beach facilities. We went on the jet ski, had piÃ±a coladas, swam in the pool, cooked breakfast in the room and slept comfortably in the bed. There were four of us on a very roomy 2 bedroom with beautiful views on the 9th floor. We didnâ€™t get to use other amenities as we were only there for 24 hours but we will venture back. Please keep in mind the border in that area closes at 8pm SHARP from the Arizona side so get there with plenty of time for a line up. Also â€” watch out for sand storms in the area, we encountered one and it was a doozy that would have been very uncomfortable if we werenâ€™t already in the taxi! The surrounding area is not very interesting, more of a resort oceanfront experience then a sightseeing adventure. Good for a contained group of friends or family. The ocean was gorgeous though, warm and salty!
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: We came for 4th of July weekend and our friends booked our Airbnb here at Las Palmas I love the resort entirely! First time in Puero Penasco! So walking from the Condo to the beach was just a few mins so close by the beach. Our view was amazing & breathtaking! The resort pools we absolutely loved and enjoyed. They have the kid family pool area which is impressive cause they have really cool slides and shallow area for littles. Plus offer his eats and antojitos while swimming and lounging. The resort has zero tolerance for partying too late and loud obnoxious ppl will be addressed or kicked out so I like that too. Definitely booking this place again!
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Very nice beach resort ðŸ‘Œ
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Definitely the right choice for us. Staff is awesome. Beach and views incredible.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Good stay in if you have kids , you guys wonâ€™t regret plus you can bring your own cooler
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Great location, condo and service will be staying here again and get views
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: This place is awesome! Definitely coming back!
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Excellent place, will definitely go back.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Awesome place
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text:
This is not a 5 star hotel but it should be a 5 star Best Western not for luxury but for comfort and ambience.
Nice place to stay for a drive from California to Portland.
The parking for moving trucks is awesomely abundant and easy access.
The rooms are small but clean, some rooms have two doors with access to the grass area as well as the hallway to the lobby.
The entrance area is beautiful for a Best Western, the dining area is huge.
There are stores, a gas station and Chase bank right across the street.
There a a few restaurants around as well and plenty of places to walk your dog.

We stayed her twice and will probably always stay here when making that drive.
I highly recommend this place.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Loved it, the room was really clean the beds were comfortable and the staff was really friendly loved the fact that we can park right outside of our room ðŸ˜€ will definitely recommend this place and come back when we visit again ðŸ˜€
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: It's an old hotel, and it reflects in every aspect of your stay here. We went to the front desk four times in the first 24 hours to get our room access restored. It still doesn't work for the back door. They have a good pool but a namesake gym.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Cute hotel with log cabin vibe.  Rooms are fairly standard.  Good lighting.  Decent Wi-Fi.  Our room had a great view of Mt Shasta.  Pool and hot tub. Hot tub had so many suds it was almost unusable.  No complimentary breakfast. Restaurant on site.  Reasonably comfortable bed. Fairly good outlet placement. We could connect our own streaming device.  Generally quiet room however the multiple trains with horns after midnight were loud.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Not a luxury 5 star hotel, however i am not aware of any accommodations in the area that are. If your looking for a mountain lodge feeling, this is the place! Conveniently located with only about a 20 minute drive to Mt Shasta Ski Park. They DO NOT have the traditional free breakfast, however they do have a restaurant onsite. Also have a bar and grill. Food is a little spend but good, as expected for hotel restaurants. They were short staffed but the waitresses did their best and were very polite and accommodating. We decided to stay an extra night on a holiday weekend and while booked, the manager Joe pulled through for us and got us an extension. All of the staff work hard and are very polite. Hopefully some hotel upgrades/remodels are planned for the near future. If you plan to stay, suggest you book early, this is the go to for skiers and hikers and it fills up fast!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Nice grounds an a clean room and bathroom but that's about it.  The shower in the morning was only like warm... very disappointing. The bed was old and brokendown or just incredibly soft and very uncomfortable with small very LUMPY pillows. Worst night of sleep on the trip.
The restaurant is a bit old and the furniture is pretty broken down. I sunk into my seat about 3 inches! The food was pretty disappointing too...medium steak (at over $30!) Came out cold and raw. Could not send it back because the ONE server was completely overwhelmed with tables. That said...her service and attitude considering the situation was incredible! She really tried very hard to get to everyone.
It's probably a great place to being kids...nice outdoor courtyards between the buildings and little waterfalls.  There is an indoor pool that looked pretty decent.
With all the disappointment aside, the staff at this hotel is just...WOW!  From the front desk to the maintenance and housekeeping folks...every one of them was super friendly, kind and professional!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Fantastic location for a short trip around Mt. Shasta.

Our first ever stay here. There are cheaper lodges too in the area but our risk appetite was limited, hence went for this one with higher security and better arrangement in terms of breakfast and room quality.

I just wish they could have provided housekeeping service too since we spent more than just one night. I remember how during pre-covid times the hotel rooms in any place used to be cleaned and well arranged each day by the time you were back. Miss that luxury!

Breakfast isn't a buffet. That also surprised me. They have a standard list of 6-7 entres and you have to choose your breakfast from it. Us being vegetarians had limited options and repeated the same thing the next day. It was, however, delicious. Lovvvedd the hot chocolate with whipped cream.

If there had been fruits, bread, juices, muffins and things like that as a buffet I could have adjusted the quantity and variety.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Nice big room with a view of Mount Shasta.  Didn't get a chance to try the room or bar. Two-story building but no elevator.
Update: great location and staff! Recommend!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Pros:
LOVE LOVE the Best Western Tree House! Will stay again!

Loved the cabin-esque feel with the high ceilings.

It was great that you could get to the lobby and restaurant all internally.

Great views of the snow capped mountains from our window.

Great prices at the restaurant but there weren't menus readily available. Nice diner to sit down to eat.

Close enough to popular attractions like Burney Falls and McCloud Falls.

Rooms with external door and kitchenette options available.

Felt safe here.

Ryan was great at check in.

Cons:
Pricey but better than all the other hotels around.

Heating/Cooling system didn't work very well.

Pool and hot tub closed due to Covid.

No free breakfast.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Simple place but clean, very welcoming staff, and has everything you need.  We were concerned it would be noisy due to location. Not at all. There is live music on Friday nights. Fun! Nothing special with the food and wine choices but great to have when you arrive from a long trip. Beautiful scenery. I was able to enjoy great espresso from their new machine.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Super cute hotel! Clean and decorated wonderfully! The rooms were spacious. They have a double suite with two rooms and it was great! They do not offer free breakfast which was a bummer. It looks deceiving online. They have a lot of fun restaurants close by though.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: We were greeted warmly while checking in at midnight and the rooms were squeaky clean. Breakfast was amazing!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: This is a wonderful hotel. The staff are so friendly. The rooms are cozy, clean and the beds are comfortable. Great bar. The restaurant makes wonderful prime rib and the breakfast, blackberry French Toast, was perfect. The 25% off breakfast for hotel guests makes it really affordable. The indoor pool is huge and our son loved it. We couldn't have been happier with our experience.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: It was a decent place to stay. Room was clean. Food was good. The view of Mt.Shasta was decent depending on the angle due to some trees, etc. However they do charge extra for a pet, but they don't tell you till after you get there if you book online, and while explaining the pet policy to you and signing some paperwork they neglect to mention the designated area to walk your dog. Other than that it was a nice looking hotel and i would stay here again.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Good morning from Mt Shasta.
This is my view from the hotel window. Stayed here last night. The room has 2 rooms with a kitchen with dishes etc.  Outdoor theme. Last night we had dinner in there restaurant it was awesome food. They also have a separate bar and inside heated pool and spa. I would highly recommend this if you get up here to vacation. Across the street there is Ray's market so you can stock your kitchen. We are moving on today but the kids love this place.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
For a view of Mount Shasta, this place was one of the best in town. It was centrally located, within walking distance to most of the restaurants in town. The rooms itself could use some freshening up, not really outdated, just looked a little tired. Couldn't tell if the refrigerator in the room was working, didn't seem to get particularly cold and there was no adjustment. The restaurant was good but do yourself a favor and DO NOT PURCHASE THE PRE PAID BREAKFAST PACKAGE. They charge you $20 per person for breakfast. You get your choice of one entree and one drink. My wife ordered the Granola and coffee and wanted a bagel. She was told that she would have to pay extra for the bagel even though the total with the bagel wasn't over $20. You're better off paying as you go because you don't get the difference if your total is under $20. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, our stay was ok, I'd stay here again if I were in town but I wouldn't pre pay for breakfast again.

Just got a response from Best Western. They state that their breakfast package are $10 for adults and $5 for children. Going through Bookings.com we were charged $20 per person. Our total for breakfast for the 5 days we were there was $200. I will say breakfast was good but not $200 good. And at no time were our meals over $20 but we didn't get the difference back
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
I visited here twice while in town only to watch the Warriors game in the bar area.  I did not stay in a room.  The bartender was so nice and accommodating.  I appreciated being able to sit in there for one entire game and half of another game on a second day.

I was struck by the beauty of all the woodwork in the hotel lobby.  See the photos to see what I'm referring to.  There is a Tesla charging station in the parking lot.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Very good location. On highway I5. Friendly staff.  Clean.  Free parking.  Free  WiFi.  And many many restaurants are nearby. It has laundry,  you can wash all of your clothes for only $ 5.5 only. Unfortunately breakfast is not included.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: It was a great place to stay. Non smoking rooms which even as a smoker I liked. No stale smoke. Great rooms and restaurant inside with a bar even. Plus the view is or can be incredibly amazing that is the view from the room I had.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
The place is lovely. If you get a view room, you can see Mount Shasta, but you may also see roofs and stuff. See photos.
And, they no longer have the free breakfast buffet Best Westerns are known for. In fact, you can't even buy a breakfast buffet. We were very disappointed by their breakfast menu.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Nice hotel. Ok food at restaurant. rooms in the 3rd floor are way too hot.
Nice indoor pool need to control chlorine levels eyes will start burning after a few minutes in the water.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: This place was great, view of the mountain from our room, indoor swimming pool, nice food. Had everything we wanted! Thanks for a nice stay.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Got a room here to rest on a long drive. Cute cabin-y vibe and decor. Friendly staff. I'd stay here again.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Service desk clerk is friendly and the rooms are clean they could use some updates and pet friendly easy access to gas stations and fast food
theres also a restaurant in hotel good food and service there's no longer a continental breakfast you have to go to the restaurant
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Excellent place to stay with clean ðŸ§¼ rooms and a super friendly staff. We couldnâ€™t see the lines on the road because of late night snow fall. Pulled off the main road for some rest and couldnâ€™t be happier. Restaurant on site with warm and cozy rooms.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Extremely loud banging early Sunday morning in our room because of construction on the wall next to our bed. Not cool! Paid a lot of money to wake up in a construction site!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Great place......!
On Bikes & this place has it all.
Good food a Bar & provide a Bike wash kit to clean up your ride....
100% Positive Stay....
Thank You....
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Loved it here! When we were evacuated from the Carr fire, this was one of the only places that would take our dog! Love this place! Thank you!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Friendly staff, clean and comfy rooms, heated pool and spa, loved the view of mount there.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: I came here 6 years ago. I really like this place. Very nice view!!!!!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Great place to stay. Clean, friendly and nice view.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: It's a little quirky, but has local charm and history and family values and is the nicest place to stay in the area
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Place was great. Got put of the storm and the party in the room next door seemed like a lot of fun!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Our favorite place to stay when driving through Shasta. 5 stars.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Thanks for hosting the Tesla superchargers.  Clean bathrooms and nice lobby for guests as we wait for charging.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: The hotel was nice, right in town. If you love nature you'll love Mt Shasta.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Friendly and efficient staff, reasonable rates, beautiful rooms, excellent architecture.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Love the staff and the room are very clean i also loved the view
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: We stay here every year beatiful view of mt shasta
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Very clean and they have nice restaurants
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Clean, comfortable rooms with a fantastic view!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Stunning views of Mt. Shasta on the East side second floor.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Extremely friendly,clean, great food
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Nice place to eat
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: This could be my most favorite best Western that Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. And Iâ€™ve stayed at dozens. So much beautiful woodwork and the lobby is huge and beautiful. Thereâ€™s hiking trail Maps,  thereâ€™s plenty of parking the staff is really really nice, including Shlomie who took great care of us.  No free breakfast but the first black bear diner is right next door.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Circus Circus was very clean and well staffed the first night. When we went again 3 days later, half of the bottom kids area was blocked off. All of the games were working except for one and the employees were very nice and did not rush the expereience for the kids. We did not stay in the hotel.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
I only stay at the best hotels when I travel, and this hotel did not disappoint. I didn't win any money here, but nice hotel.
Excellent stay!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Great location if you want to be near the night life and other casinos. The rooms are spacious and comfy and the water pressure and temperature are perfect. It's difficult to deal with customer service when there are issues; they are very dismissive. I recommend booking from a 3rd party for the discounts (of course, always call the hotel and compare prices first) but there will always be a separate resort fee, as with most hotels and casino's. The casino smells like the rest but the kids area seems to have better odor control. Worth the stay ðŸŽª
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The room was spacious with a nice view of down town Reno. Check in was quicker than I expected and I love the "express check out" option. My only complaint (more like a suggestion) would be that a microwave in the room would be a very nice addition to have.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Circus Circus is a Great Place For Family and Fun!! They have lots of food options as well as a midway carnival and arcade.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Hotel was ok. Was not the cleanest but was ok for one night. Bed was comfortable. Got stuck in the sky tower which was quite a walk from the lobby and casino. Midway arcade was fun, casino was average.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
I would never stay here again. AVOID!!!

The overall atmosphere is depressing and lackluster. The lobby, casino, elevator, and rooms are all extremely under kept and dirty. I spent close to $150 a night to stay here, and I have stayed in $50 motels nicer than this.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Just dont expect the same level of entertainment thats found at the Vegas location.  There was only one show per day. There was only 2 roaming drink servers...which we rarely saw. Plenty of games for ppl with kids. I was surprised that indoor smoking was permitted. I was approached and asked if I wanted to buy perfume. My friend was approached and asked if she wanted to buy gold jewelry. Two ATMs were out of money. The room staff was exceptionally friendly. The concierge desk was not manned the majority of the time. We called airlines and departed a day early.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Housekeeping was still cleaning my room at check in so I had to wait a bit. The bathroom was still dirty hair in the tub, toothpaste spit in the sink. The casino and amenities have been a plus. I would give Circus Circus ðŸŽª another try.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We stayed the night on a Saturday night when there was an event in Reno. $260 for a room!!! No microwave in the room. The room was clean and comfortable but definitely not worth $260!!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I truly enjoyed my trip, to Circus Circus. The room was nice with a great view. The staff was amazing!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Friendly service, Gorgeous Casino Hotel with Old Circus Style, Excellent Coffee, Clean Room, comfortable beds. Many amenities, walkable to downtown.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Just wanna say their amazing arcade provides a great break from the slot machines and poker tables...esp if you are with your loved ones.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I didnâ€™t stay at the hotel just wondered the casino. The Circus area is really cool. Definitely a good spot for kids. The actual casino itself is starting to look a little dated. There are three casinos in a row so you can easily navigate between all of them. They also offer circus shows but we were told due to Covid they donâ€™t offer the shows every day and no one knew exactly when they had the show.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Crazy place , none in the bell to give us the luggage , the sailing was filling down with water dart, smell very bad, the room close by. Kids yelling, the only good part was the guy from reception ! Crazy place
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Disgusting. Came here before and after Burning Man, our rooms were dirty and had hair everywhere- even the cups in the room had used coffee all over them and there were used paper towels shoved into the crack of our bed. Gross!!! The bell hops were never at the desk and when they were they refused to help guests with their bags because they were dirty. Mind you most of these guests were people of color who did not attend Burning Man and had perfectly clean bags. I am disgusted by the service here and will never come back.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
We had a mini suite, the room was decently clean but the shower was horrible, it was like an ultra pressure super blast shower and you couldn't change the spray angle, also it would fill with water quickly because the drain didn't work.
By far the worst part of the room was the lack of curtains or any type of shade (see pics), we had to use couch cushions in the main room to block the glaring morning son, the management and staff were no help at all.
Would not stay again.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The casino was great. I went with my kids to the arcade and they absolutely loved it. The mattresses were so comfy, I slept quite fast. The bathrooms were so clean! I recommend! Super satisfied!!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Just here to play with my little one! Def couple of nice places to eat and also to chill/hang
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I booked a high floor spa suite. Advertised to have a mountain view. Ended up on the fourth floor with 2 small windows looking at the side of a building. Notice in the pictures duct tape to fix the carpet. There is graffiti on a picture on the wall. The shower was dirty and the pull out sofa was so worn out. It had old dirty sheets and a large stain. The room was worse than I could have imagined. My son had fun in the midway.  But next time I will definitely stay in a different hotel.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We decided to come here to have breakfast and then hang out in the Arcade. First impression coming in the elevator weâ€™re old and dirty. Once you get inside the Casino/Hotel it looks way better. We had pancakes and eggs which were delicious but the sausage looked like it had freezer burns on it so we didnâ€™t eat that. The staff at the restaurant were great and not too long of a wait time. The arcade was fun. A little over priced but the convenience of having it within the hotel could be a plus. We were able to make enough points to cash out for some goodies at their Arcade store. We were able to catch 2 shows while we were there so that was fun as well.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
The whole experience is rather a dream than real life.
When you get out of the room and go down, you literally enter another univers.
The three hotels, called The Row: Circus Circus, El Dorado and Silver Legacy are interlinked and you cannot even realize when you arrive to another hotel if you take a stroll.
It is such an amazing experience, full of people, lights, restaurants, clubs and, of course, many many casinos :)
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Hotel is at the head of Virginia Street. Close to El Dorado and the Silver Legacy. Restaurants were good and plentiful
Our room was on the 23rd floor, great view! Clean.
Valet service wasn't up and running and the bell station was poorly manned. Bell hops were extremely lazy.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
A Fun Hotel in The Reno Rowâ€¦
5 Stars!!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Very nice place to the whole family for vacation get away and Spend some time away from everything
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Upstairs is all about the kids. Lots if arcade games for points. There are some older style games and newer. Did not stay at the hotel. The place has some history for sure. Casino is cleaner then the one in Las Vegas.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Visited there with my family and my friends family and we had four kids with us. All of them including all the adults had really fun playing the games. Me and my five played almost 10 games and won so many plush toys.

There is something for everything I'm sure you would go and find something that you love since your childhood and you will definitely try to win that game.

They have a kiosk machine on which you can get a new card or load your old card. Machine accepts both card and cash which is really easy to use.

Stuff is friendly and helpful. Overall the place is really good for kids I would strongly recommend to keep this in your visit list whenever you go to Reno with your kids.

And I'm sure even if you visit it as an adult without kids also you would love this place.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
I've stayed here twice within the last year, the first time my room in the casino tower was a lot more run down and old than I am used to and I low key had an eerie feeling from the room I stayed in the first time. Maybe something happened there before I don't know, but I felt this odd coldness/a feeling that made me uneasy. I was hesitant to stay here but I decided to book again since I was only here for a couple days.

My 2nd visit this past week was decent. The hotel itself is older of course, but it gives the basic necessities. I was in the sky tower this time and it felt more updated than the casino tower?

Heating/cooling system worked perfectly. I had a corner room which had a nice view of the city.

I would give this rating a lot lower for the incident that happened, but I will assume it was a rare occurrence where someone walks in your room without knocking. The woman Apologized, but I felt really uncomfortable because I could've been naked or in the shower. It was totally inappropriate, I messaged the concierge Ivy person thing and they apologized but never offered to do anything...

Water quality from the faucets were questionable, I ran the hot and cold and both looked heavy, see photo. But cleared up after I ran it for some time.

Shower ran well too. Water temp was well controlled. So everything else was fine with the room. Nothing extravagant, I just got a normal king size room.

Anyways, I like the convenience of the hotels location and how it's connected to the other, Silver Legacy, el Dorado, etc. We enjoy the arcade and circus shows too. Staff are friendly for the most part. They have a better food court now than they did 12 years ago, so there are improvements here and there.

I love that they still have a lot of old mixed with new. I love the history of the buildings and seeing that throughout the halls and rooms of the buildings. Please maintain the history  I think that's what really entices visitors too!

Overall I would stay again for the location for sure.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Stopped by for a few hours on our way to Cali. I have memories of being here as a child and seeing animals and circus acts. I took my kids in and found the arcade with the stage. There was a short balancing act while we were there. There are lots of shops. The kids blew $95 at the arcade in about 20 minutes and came away with a few cheap stuffed animals. I think they had fun, but it didn't live up to my memories.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: In town for business. Surprisingly nice rooms and a quite stay at BOTH  towers. Bargain  priced.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Nice place.  Lots of things to do for kids and young at heart. Lots of games like being at the fair. But beware the once the taxes and resort fees are added the room charges double the price. Which is probably true for all the resorts. It was nice to have wifi and parking.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Booked a King deluxe, got a queen normal with a horribly noisy AC. Charged more for king too. Hotel was pretty filthy. Will not be back
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The valley guys are the best, but I did find the front desk extremely rude. I was hung up on for asking for room service.. then I tried to order inn and they refused. I brought my pooch I ðŸ¤” think he enjoyed it more than me. At the end of the day, great view ðŸªŸ 21rst floor.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
It's been a few years since we have stayed here and unfortunately will probably be the last time. I received an email inviting me to stay there which stated they had newly remodeled rooms, which made us want to go ahead and book here instead of our usual other option. Well, our visit was less than satisfying. We drove up Sunday afternoon to check in and were told there was no valet service - park across the street, and walk back to check in (was not allowed to keep my car in their driveway while checking in). Not a good start. Check in line had about 10 parties waiting to check in and only two front desk folks (after about 10 minutes one more front desk agent showed up). Once in the room, I was confused how they could state the rooms were remodeled(?). Bathroom was great (only one hook to hang towels), the room was painted, but the furniture was still old and scratched up, the chair was creaking with every move and the thermostat was very dirty (not huge, but very noticeable). The casino had no live tables, so we had to go somewhere else to play - I prefer to just stay in my hotel to gamble. As far as the 'Resort Fee', it lists 2 water bottles (helpful on a 100 degree day), but never got that - I called down to see if they could be brought over and never got them. There were a couple of coffee pods with a sign stating they will be refreshed every morning, they are not. I called the 2nd morning to get a couple, but ended up running to Starbucks instead (Why are they charging a resort fee???). If this covers the parking, maybe think about charging the people parking in your lot and not staying at your hotel.
In any case, with all the alternative hotels in Reno I will not be booking another room at Circus Circus. I'll keep the old memories of what they used to be years ago.
One plus, we enjoyed the view from our room.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Came on a Tuesday night. Masks only suggested for non-vaccinated guests but a surprising number of guests and staff wore one.

Check in was quick. Had a suite room. Clean, spacious, with dual temp control. Large bathroom with shower/tub. Keurig available with coffee pods. Hidden mini fridge. Extra pillows in closet.

Housekeeping came by only to ask if anything was needed, not to clean. I believe they only clean on request and upon check out, but ask the front desk if that's accurate. Asked for extra bath and hand towels; was given two of each.

Check out was 12pm w/Express Check Out option. Dropped off keys in Express Check Out box by elevators.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Hundreds of people in line to check into a room. No end in sight, I'm standing here right now. It's anarchy.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I come here mainly for the midway arcade. Annually play the ring toss for a win. The prizes are hit or miss, and the claw game prizes tend to pretty good. The workers are quick to answer questions and offer plastic bags for winnings. The casino is tiny and never crowded.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We stayed at 27th floor nd the view was good. Casino was also good.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Stayed here for my bday. Got a great deal. Room was clean. Had a mini fridge, keurig coffee maker with starbucks coffee pods ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ We didnt spend much time in the room. It did have a blow dryer and iron. Its a nice hotel for families with kids. Plenty of free parking available.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: It was fun gambling at Circus Circus. The sports book was small and did not have much of a selection of games on but it was okay. I ended up winning on the table games and on a few sporting events. They also had the midway with all the arcade games and carnival games. The kids enjoyed it and was a great spot to take them. I think I lost more money at the Midway than the whole weekend gambling in Reno. We did not stay at the hotel some this review is not about the hotel. Overall it was a good experience for us and I have nothing negative to say about Circus Circus.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Goods. Room was clean, working personnel nice, friendly and helpful from front desk to security and housekeeping, has a fym/fitness center, nice location, staying here pretty much gets you access to 3 casinos with a walking distance to Reno signature sign.
Bad stuff.
LINES ! If you there on the weekend when everyone else is there well let's say this place can't handle it's own capacity. To check in long line, to get to your room at certain  times there is a (no joking) 40 minutes wait line for elevator, now  it's not always but try to get back to your room when you really need something can be frustrating time in line for elevator.
Noise, I am talking hotel room, you can hear a lot from rooms nextdoor and hallway.
Bathroom!  Now that could be subjective but bathtub is very small, shower pipes makes loud noise while waiting for hot water and sink makes loud bubbly noises after use.
That's all major points. You can have great time staying there if you do it on not busy days, but if you have regular schedule and go there when most of people do, you might get frustrated standing in 40 minutes line for elevator when you just need to go to your room little quick.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Room wasn't quite up to PREMIUM DELUXE 2 QUEEN standards...there was a coffee cup attached to the smoke detector with band aids...We thought it was an example of American ingenuity...
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: One of the front desk workers was rude when I tried checking in early. The person that actually helped us out was sweet and fast. Room was okay. Found thing that didn't belong to us in the room kinda nasty. After taking a shower my friend pulled out a towel and this comes flying out!! Luckily she wasn't hit but this. After a worker washing them this must of fell out of a worker pocket or something?! Truly sad and disgusting. We called a supervisor to come see this and all she had to say was sorry. She didn't bother to remove it or anything. I'm truly disappointed on my stay!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Circus Circus is the destination when the kids come to visit! We were able to even catch an acrobat Act! So way cool and so much fun for adults also!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Staff was accommodating and friendly.  They made sure that the entire family was on the same floor, which was very convenient for all of us.  The rooms were cozy and the AC worked great - everything that you could ask for in a nice stay while in Reno.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I took my grandsons there and their ages are 3, 11, and 14.  We had a blast.  We arrived at 10 and it was not crowded.  Plenty of games to play.  Lots of teens arrived around 1 and then it was crowded.  I had fun myself.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
One of the better hotels in the area it would seem. Rooms are very clean and modern in comparison to the competition. Plenty of food and entertainment options as this hotel spans across three different hotels that are all connected. The arcade was cool.
Fitness center was probably the hottest, most poorly ventilated fitness center Iâ€™ve been in, and one of the smallest. Very difficult to do extended amounts of cardio. However, it was clean and available for use. So it was appreciated.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Frankly less tacky than I assumed. Love the carpeting!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Circus Circus is part of the Row you can walk an indoor Skyway between all 3. The 3 being Eldorado,  Circus Circus and Silver Legacy. Of course Circus Circus in very children's oriented. Between the food court and video game room.
Very pleasant â˜º atmosphere.
I really enjoyed photographing it all.
Blessings, John
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Very kid friendly place. Made a stop for the kids to unwind on our family trip, and they did enjoy the large game room. Limited ability to eat during weekdays, and the arcade hours are limited during school hours( I guess to prevent kids skipping)- so plan accordingly to avoid problems. Lots of free parking available. Clean rooms and nice staff.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: It was like a ghost town in the casino. Kinda sad really. Getting into the room my allergies kicked in big time! Im allergic to dust and mold... Room looked clean enough. The pizza at Piezzeti was awesome!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I have not stayed in any rooms at this casino but have spent a little bit of time here gambling and eating on a few occasions. I've always had a good time and the food is always been phenomenal. Everyone here is always been very friendly from the slot associates, dealers to the security staff. Upstairs on the second floor before you go to into the sky bridge over to the silver legacy there is a large game room for the kids to spend their time in while the parents are here enjoying themselves. I wish I would have came here when my children were younger would have been an awesome place first our family entertainment as circus circus is the only casinos that I have ever encountered that are truly catering to the whole family.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Easy check in no line and fast and friendly service WILL STAY HERE AHAIN
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Great place for kids to feel involved. They have free mini shows on stage in the circus game arcade area for kids.  A food court gambling for adults
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I was excited to hear the hotel was "fully open" after the Covid shut down, but upon arrival it was apparent it was not. No circus shows, many stores and restaurants were closed and half the midway was closed. It's a new, non-sensical world and my kids experience here was nothing like I had expected to pay for. Very disappointed. Bell desk guy was great though!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
A great experience, quick free shuttle from the airport. Clean room with nice view from the 12th floor. Thermostat controls and a 50inch TV. Two very comfortable queen beds. Found extra pillows and cases in the closet.

Haven't been in a casino in a few years, prices are higher, the days of the 99 cent TBone steaks and crazy deals are gone.

$60 lunch for 2 is common unless you stick to fast food. Was a good meal and great service. We found a great deal through Trivago, but realized we could have saved more with a direct reservation.

The hotel promise is lowest price, after you find the the best deal call direct they will match the price and refund an additional 10%. Something I'll remember next time. We'll be using this Caesars affiliate again.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Stayed here for the weekend for USATF nationals. The discounted rate was great. Overall the hotel was good. Our room was updated and modern. The room wasn't as clean as it should be at check-in, they clearly did not vacuum. We got moved to another room and it was the same. Staff was friendly. Parking was free and easy, there is also valet and a shuttle to the airport. Views of the surrounding mountains were nice.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Good place for kids, nice play area for games and carnival type games.  Excellent entertainment every 45 minutes in the carnival area.  This acrobat on the hoop is an amazing talent.  The place feels a little rough and not clean and polished but itâ€™s not dirty. It just needs some polishing and a decorating consultant.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Nice rooms, buffet is closed, good parking.  We left a jacket in our room after check-out and it took two days for someone to go to the room to look for it.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Always a great place for the kiddos! One big negative is the place smells like an ashtray! Kids even smelled like cigarettes when we left. But all that aside nice to have a place that we enjoyed as kids still available to take our kids to!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I stayed here for a conference. The rooms were big, bright, and adequately clean though worn in places. Definitely request a higher floor for the view. I was disappointed with how limited room service was; breakfast is only available on weekends and can't be pre-ordered. Skipping having my room cleaned for a credit at The Row restaurants was worthwhile, especially as it was cold enough that I didn't want to walk around outside. The bed was comfortable, but the desk chair was not. The size of the room contributes to accessibility, and there was a grab bar next to but not inside the show/bathtub.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Kids had a lot of FUN in their arcade, which was not crowded Friday @ 12:30 p.m.  Staff was quite helpful...spent about 1.5 hours playing games. Redemption Center was kind & lots of nice prize choices!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Look, I know this is a place that was the place to be back in the days.  But, I truly enjoyed  my stay. For the most part it was clean. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable.  It's connected to 2/3 other Casinos/hotels. It's huge. Great for walking around if you are not a gambler. Would love to visit again. Way after Covid leaves. Lol
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Always a fun place to play. They have a midway with great circus acts. I was surprised to see that they took out the Buffet and put in a  food court. It might have been good, it was busy today.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: My kids loved it!! The hotel rooms weren't very nice but the games for the kids were awesome!! There are different levels of floors that they can play games at and it was a blast.. went to play games two different days for my daughter's birthday..
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We stayed here five nights. The three connected casinos offer great restaurants, games, and entertainment, without ever having to leave the complex.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: DO NOT COME. Their tariffs are not transparent. They charged US 200 extra dollars when we arrived to the hotel, even if their website wasn't working and we weren't able to get the rooms on the internet. They are understaffed so we lost a lot of time trying to make the check in. If that's not enough, we FOUND A NAIL IN OUR ROOM!!! THIS PLACE IS NOT CLEAN.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
A nice, fun, and big casino-hotel. You can lose as much money as you want!
Looks a bit old on the inside, like most casinos these days. If gambling is your thing they have everything you can think of (I guess)

Parking space is fairly abundant in the area nearby
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Amazing place. Lots of atmosphere and activities for all ages. Most of restaurants are closed due to covid19 regulations.  Although lots of other food shops and so.e restaurants are open inside.  Tons of slot machines old and new. Skme card games are open to.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
This place was awful! The rooms were disgusting. I told them before checking in that my husband has heart failure,  that he can not be in a dirty environment. They assured me numerous times that there rooms were "very clean".
They were anything but clean. I immediately called the front desk when we arrived in the room. They wouldn't send anyone to look at the room. They made me take pictures and come back downstairs.
The manager wouldn't speak to me so the guy at the front desk had to take my phone back to his office to show him the pictures. The manger never spoke with me. They did put me in a better room eventually,however the next morning when I checked out they ended up charging me more!!!!! I asked to speak to a manger and was denied again.  This is absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. No
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Since it was new year eve day, it was very crowded.  ...
Lots of people. Mostly was family.  ... kid playing. ... it was truly a family friendly.  ... the place was like a indoor carnival plus amusement.  ... with a bit of live show. ... guarantee to win stuff animals. ... it was so fun. ...
Be prepared  restaurant and restroom is always a long line. ...
We had  a wonderful time. ...

text:
Love this place!
Kids love too!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The room was very clean and the pillows were better.  For the price it couldn't have been better. Stayed on the 28th floor so the views were breathtaking.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: When I first was told I was staying at Circus Circus, the old, worn Vegas location came to mind.  This place is definitely newer and cleaner.  The rooms were styled nicely and comfortable. This casino connects to others as well (Silver Legacy) which was nice since it was cold and snowing outside.

text: Lots fun, but smoking made me couldnâ€™t stay longer.
