text: Clean hotel,good drink service on casino floor
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We had a good time, it's pretty small and when its busy it is hard to move around. The circus acts are short less than 10 mins. Games are each $1 to play and the prize redemption line is long. We had a good time but I think I would rather go to a other place.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
Always fun to visit!

Rooms are relatively new , good decoration , room was well lit and decoration on the wall behind the bed was cool! Furniture looked new and trendy , had coffee pods as complementary, had coffee ðŸ™‚

Bathroom had a trendy and upgraded look! Liked it very much!

What else!! Casino is fun, the gaming zone is fun, the walkway is connected to Silver Legacy and Eldorado!!

The short circus show were one of the main attractions! ðŸ˜‰
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We had a great time there celebrating my mother's birthday.  We stayed in the north tower which had very nice updated rooms and clean bathrooms.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: This was the only place i was allowed to go when we were out there about 20 years ago i was only 13. Now that I'm well above the age I was so excited to go back so my younger sisters to see what i seen also my 2 year old son. He had a blast on the midway. I think its awesome that they have a place that is just for children because not everyone is over the agr of 21 when they go there. We werent even supposed to be there but due to airport issues we had to stay an extra night and they put us in a hotel 2 casinos down from Circus Circus which is linked with the casino/hotel we stayed in.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: While I've never stayed at the hotel here, I've visited the arcade and restaurants many times. Food is always very good and there's lots of fun things to do here, as well as a live performance every so often. Great place to come with the kids!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Stayed for New Years, and got to see the fireworks which were spectacular. Definitely geared for kids. We loved the arcade and the circus acts happening every hour. The arcades, I think are good value, usually around a dollar to play a game and prizes were generous. My son also loved the free train that goes to and fro the sky tower. I would almost say this hotel as kids friendly, but I cannot because of their smoking policy. Them owning, the whole â€œrowâ€, I wish they could make the circus-circus third, smoke free, and then I would honor them 5 stars.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Kids had a great time. They loved the games and use adults loved the shows. This visit we only stopped by to let the kids play games. We will be planning a trip to stay at Circus Circus next time. Nice to have the acarde games apart from the ticket and carnival games.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Great place to stay during the Italian festival
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I've been standing trying to get my $10 cash our for 45 nins. Garbage casino. Stay away. Unless you want to loose your money. I asked pit boss for help, bald guy mid 30s. I went to cage and they said they would send someone. But still here
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Hotel rooms were clean and comfortable. They were outdated but still nice. Not fancy, but nice. Worth the price. Midway staff was depressing. They seemed to hate their life and job. The games were reasonably priced though. The family enjoyed the performance and games. Just don't expect even 2nd rate treatment from carnival staff. They weren't rude, just not nice. No room service. Hotel is confusing to maneuver at first but we caught on quickly. Overall, a good value and we enjoyed ourselves. Will stay again if in reno.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
I haven't been to Las  Vegas but if you have limited time and you are heading to San Francisco or  bay area and if casino is in your bucket list then you definitely need to add Reno to your list. We went on Saturday night and all the casinos were filled. We stayed in circus circus, it's one of the casino among the three giants which hosts its own casino. A perfect place to stay and enjoy in a casino.
Easy check-in and check out.Rooms were good, what else one might in need of. One drawback which I thought is number of boards were very less and casinos were all filled with digital ones which seems to be slightly bothering. All the bar and restaurant were good. Even if you want to take a walk , best time is to go after 10PM . You can have a good view of the lights .
The row is all integrated and you can move between all the 3 casinos . They too have play area like arcade games for little kids . Please note children are not allowed inside the casino .  You need to have alternate arrangements for that.
We loved this place more as this is only 50+ miles from Lake Tahoe and this was helping us to take rest after tiresome day in Lake Tahoe
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The FULL, hot breakfast is great here! Its a rarity to find a breakfast like this these days. There were many many options. Something for every family member and saved our family of four at least $30 had we gotten it as a restaurant. So if you take that into account with the price of the hotel staying was very affordable! Clean hotel. As a Mom, I couldn't give a hotel without a pool for the kids more than four stars. Also, the bathroom in our room needs a new toilet seat and a new shower head. Over all very happy we stayed here. ***If you liked my review or found it to be helpful give it a thumbs up. ðŸ‘ thanks!
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: We were just passing through and come across this gem of a hotel. Great price, Nice clean rooms, great hot breakfast. The hospitality was amazing. Pet friendly and understanding of our 2 dogs that don't really care for other people or animals and bark when they see them. An amazing big off leash dog run behind the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with pets and anyone else looking for a quite clean place to stay.
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text:
This IS the best value in Elko! The room was $60 and some change and I cant say enough about them!
Room was clean and modern. There was a tub, which is ALWAYS a plus. Hotel was quiet and well stocked. (See photos)
But the number one thing about Quality Inn and Suites was the above and beyond Customer Service. The young lady was polite, thoughtful enough to put my Pooch close to the dog park out back amongst other things.
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: I have a Room on the bottom floor and I like it because I can see my car out the window. Also when I got into the Room it was really clean and smelled great. Everything in the Room is lovely there is a refrigerator freezer and microwave. They also have a coffee maker and a nice flat screen TV. Plenty of light in here and also plenty of plug INS I can't tell you how important light and plug INS are to me. I will definitely stay here again! Also they are pet friendly!
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: This Inn has rooms with direct access to a deck that looks directly over the beautiful Salmon River.  We loved sitting on the deck drinking coffee, listening to the flow of the river and watching the wildlife. The rooms are clean and large with kitchenettes for those who want to make a quick meal before venturing out to snowshoe, snowmobiling or hiking. We also enjoyed the location as it was near the Mountain Village Resort  where they serve prime rib on Thursday and Friday nights. We were very happy with our stay and the supporting staff. Definitely deserves 5 Stars!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Visited for our anniversary and loved this place! It was a great stay for our time between Stanley and ketchum. Rooms were clean and we got one with a small kitchen. Couldnâ€™t believe the room had decent knives. We were able to cook breakfast, lunch, dinner ex like we normally do! Loved it.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Great views from the deck, night or day!  Lots of improvements since my last stay, and it was great then too! Love the ambiance with the fireplace, candles, kitchen essentials, bathroom upgrades.  Definitely will return!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: And the views were amazing, the rooms were very neat and clean, and the staff were excellent. They were super accommodating to a late check-in, and even provided us a pamphlet with information about the area. We will definitely be coming back in the winter time!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Getting a room by the river is so incredibly worth it. Nothing can mimic the sound of the salmon river while sleeping on a very comfortable bed. My husband and I have decided to make this one of our go-to vacation places!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: We were here the end of April.  The views from the back balcony are stunning over looking the river. But the views of the snow capped Sawtooth mountains as you come out the front door are jaw dropping and breath taking! The room was cozy,  bed comfy, loved the assortment of different firmness of pillows.  The kitchen was well stocked. My only suggestion is to get a room on the top floor,  we could hear our upstairs neighbors walking around until late and early in the morning.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Really liked the enormous room with the comfy beds, the kitchen, and the super friendly front desk. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: My FiancÃ© and I had the most incredible time staying here! We went for New Years and weren't really sure what to expect, but ended up having our expectations blown out of the water. The staff is incredible hospitable and warm to everyone they meet. Their restaurant on the main floor is, in our opinion, a 5 star dining experience. We were blown away by the chefs choices, we ended up trying almost everything on the menu during our 4 night stay. We honestly could not pick a favorite. We LOVED staying here. The rooms are comfortable with large beds and beautiful sights. I don't think you could be disappointed if you stay here. Also, their hot tub is large and a wonderful addition to our stay.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Cozy, comfy, amazing views!  Great, friendly service!  Love this area for a perfect getaway to unplug from the daily grind!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: The quaint log inn is located on the bank of the Salmon River in the small town of Stanley, Idaho. The gorgeous Sawtooth Mountains add to the beauty of the area. Each room has a deck to enjoy the sound of the river or stargaze in on of the dark sky locations. A most picturesque and peaceful place to unwind and unplug.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text:
Wow! Was a quaint place to stay. We made our way through a pretty bad snow storm â„ï¸so we were pretty glad to de-stress when we got here.
The woman at the front desk was more than helpful and made us feel very welcomeðŸ˜Š. The room was clean and thereâ€™s even a little kitchenette in it room. ðŸš°
Iâ€™d highly recommend staying here! ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ðŸ‘ðŸ¼
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: What a wonderful place! Check-in and check-out was such a breeze. We were arriving late into the night and called ahead to make sure that was fine. They were super accommodating and the room was quaint and cute. The stove and dishware were a welcome surprise. Falling asleep to the sound of the river and waking up to this view made our stay that much better. Wish we couldâ€™ve stayed longer but we will be back again soon!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text:
We were in awe when we stepped into our room! From our view you could see the sawtooths as well as this gorgeous view. We loved the sound of the running water.
Not to mention that the kitchen was fully equipped with everything you can imagine. Very very nice and cozy place.

We will definitely come back b
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Great views from the front and back door. The first 10 minutes in the room, I tightened the toilet seat, readjusted all the hangers for the shower curtain and fixed the heating element on the stove top. If it wasn't for those things, I would have given it 5 stars.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Great stay at this wonderfully located Inn. The room was clean and comfortable. A non-functioning fridge was fixed very quickly. The view from both balconies were incredible. Will definitely be returning.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: We loved our stay at the Redfish Riverside Inn. The room was clean and comfortable and with the kitchenette we were able to make our own meals! Friendly and helpful staff and riverside views! Canâ€™t beat that! We will definitely stay here again.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text:
So,  we decided to wing it and drive to Stanley for an overnight adventure without making reservations at the more popular place to stay in Stanley.  We were pleasantly surprised with the price ,location, quality, friendliness, and scenic view  that we were able to obtain at the redfish riverside inn.  The office was closed when we arrived but called Dianna and she came over within five min.
The room came with two queen beds with what I believed to be 1000 thread count sheets.  Refrigerator, two stovetop burners, microwave and beautiful view of the Salmon river.  We saw a wolf, fox and herd of elk the next morning while having coffee on our deck.   This place was awesome and I can't say enough good thing about it. The pic shows elk upstream from the room.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: This gas gotta be hands down our most favorite place we've visited and stayed at. The river view is absolutely breathing and the town is tiny but so beautiful.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Beautiful place in Stanley! Right along the River and Sawtooth mountains in the front. Canâ€™t beat it! Loved everything about our stay! Would return and would recommend to anyone!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Enjoyed our stay here! Comfortable beds and beautiful view of the Salmon River and surrounding area!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Nothing nicer than falling asleep to the sound of the river. Lovely dinette, gorgeous porch and kitchenette. Highly recommend.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Perfect for what it is, views views from the second story and sound of the creek is amazing!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Beautiful inn with an amazing manager with rooms overlooking the salmon and kayak rentals during peak season.
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Absolutely wonderful and a must stay for breathtaking views and comforts from home!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Comfy clean rooms next to the river
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Great views from our room!
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: One of my top ten trips ever
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text:
This place was better than I expected. Very very comfy and cozy. I slept wonderfully listening to the rolling water of the salmon river every night! The river is literally right behind the back balcony or porch. We were upstairs and had an incredible view of the river, the mountains and even a couple of elk that came down to drink water from the river.
We reserved a room with two Queen beds and a room with a king. Both rooms were great, but the king room was extra special for my wife and I. We loved it. I would have even enjoyed sleeping on the balcony! Hahahahahaha!
When I first called to ask a few questions regarding making reservations there, the wonderful lady that helped me went above and beyond what I was expecting. I booked a room immediately. Later on that day, I booked a second room. The pricing was way better than I expected. The service was way better than I expected. The rooms were way better than I expected. And the view was beautiful! I promise that I will be back again! It was a beautiful winter and our first time in Stanley
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

text: Ate at the lounge/bar, didnâ€™t know it was even there. :) It was very good, considering the food/deli in the fuel desk side is pretty much hit or miss. The portions were large, the food was very good and the service was great! It got pretty busy in there when we were leaving and the server although very busy and by himself still provided excellent service and even refilled our drinks. I definitely would recommend this place.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: I didn't stay at the hotel but I've stopped here several times for a food break and fuel stop. Bathrooms are clean. The tables could be better cleaned/maintained as customers leave. The food is good. I had the chicken bacon wrap on this visit. Fuel station is large and has I think 12 stalls for autos. Good place to stop.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Becareful when you but something. An item I choose said $16.99 but rang up $19.99. They reimbursed me but it was a hassle. Also I took a picture of history, a large picture of this dinner in 1956. Not a single ethnic person is being served at the counter. Good thing we as a country has come a long way.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Very much appreciated the old/new furniture and decor, great bed and I loved the bathroom. I really love staying in these places that aren't like the new, remodeled, turn key everything. What a great experience with all the amenities. Food was good and very easy to order. I hope places like these stay in business for a while.  It's s fun visiting them.  An oasis in the desert, almost literally. Good customer service and great ice cream cones ( especially the prices at $75 a piece).
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We're trucker park here for the night. Every time we stopped here we always go to the bar. Nice ambiance, very clean bathroom. Great customer service. Crispiest fried chicken we've ever had, it was delicious. Love there steak fries. Salad was good too. Couple of beer and we're good.. Keep this place clean. Free dump and water for RV and large car.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This place is a must !!! Big, comfortable, quiet rooms. Great restaurant as well. Even saw a lot of wildlife right behind hotel. Would definitely recommend. I travel a lot and have high expectations. This hotel met them all !!!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
The suite we were in was beautiful. Like walking into grandmas house. Our sitting room furniture was very comfortable. The whole room was clean and my wife loved having a place to do her makeup.  Beautiful grounds And the hallway wasnâ€™t dirty. Something Iâ€™ve never seen is the refrigerator and microwave Are in the bathroom but they blend with the decor so itâ€™s kinda cool.  Some negatives. 1. Where you check in is not the hotel you have to drive to your room or as for me (truck driver) squeeze your truck in their parking lot or walk half a mile to get to the suite. 2. Small bathtub. 3. Short shower. If your tall your going to have to bend to get your head under the shower. 4. Pillows got rock hard after laying on them for a few minutes 5. Very few phone charger stations.

They do serve buffalo burgers in the convenient store and the do have a small restaurant in the hotel lobby. They also charge a 20$ incidental fee when you check in.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Absolutely love the 'vintage' decor! Like stepping back in time! Room is clean. Really great room for the rate.
Would be 5 stars if there were a microwave in the room. It's a very long walk to the truck stop to use a microwave. Also,
We were told there is a tub. No tub in this room. Bummer. As a trucker, a tub is a luxury.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: I've been coming here since I was little to get the 25cent ice cream and browse the gift shop. This is the first time I've stayed. Loved the 3 double beds room.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: 5 stars for the quality 75cent ice cream cones. Hands down best stop going through Wyoming.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We stopped for the dollar ice cream cones-yummy!! The place is filled with tourists which is fine since this is a road trip stop off. The gift shop was overwhelming-they sell so much stuff. I am not complaining because when I travel I enjoy stopping on the road to stretch and take a break-this is perfect for doing that and since the gift shop is so filled with snacks and souvenirs youâ€™ll be sure to find something for everyone. Or just stop for the ice cream cones-itâ€™s worth it!!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We stopped to fill up with gas and purchase some snacks at the extremely well stocked retail store! This store has everything! You want popcorn? They got ðŸ¿!!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: I always stop here on my trips between Reno and Denver. The grounds are nicely manicured and the store has a large selection of food, drinks, and travel supplies. They have a grill with reasonably price food and $0.75 vanilla ice cream cones to sweeten the stop! While I have never stayed the night, the hotel has a Victorian style feel to it and the employees wear cute vintage uniforms. The restrooms are usually pretty clean and employees have always been helpful and friendly.  I will continue to make it a pit stop on my travels.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: The bathrooms had a cleanliness rating of: fair. I didn't check the actual crapper stalls though. Place was bustling and had a long line if you wanted to get any of the foods they offer. Kids run rampant in this place, you've been advised.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This place is awesome, and super unexpected in the middle of nowhere. I feel like they could charge whatever they want for their food since they have pretty much no competition, but it was some of the most fairly priced food we've ever had. I had a massive stack of pancakes and was super happy with them. Plus there is lots of room for kids to get their energy out!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Little America is a good option if you need a break from freeway driving. The bathrooms are clean and the convenience store has about anything you need while traveling. The grill has decent options if you want a hot meal. Gas prices here are always inflated so I generally choose to fill up elsewhere. The hotel rooms seem clean, but the decor is very interesting; it reminds me of furniture and decorations my grandma would have had in her house back in the 70s or 80s. The service has always been pretty good. If you ever get caught in one of Wyoming's infamous 1-80 winter storms, Little America can be a refuge.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Make this a must stop on your 80 drive. This was one of the nicest gas stations I've been to; they even had lounge chairs in the bathroom! A great selection of drinks, snacks, and fresh food. Plus it's a Sinclair so the cute dinosaur is out front.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: My girls loved it and deemed our large double queen room with pink tiled bathroom - a princess room. The beds were comfortable and we had one of our best nights sleep there during our travels. The bathroom fixtures are a bit strange but it just takes a bit of testing to get it right. Overall the hotel was very quiet for us despite the property doubling as a 24 hour truck stop. We were in a very quiet unit (no pets). I've heard others say the other units can be noisier (pets allowed) as they are closer to the trucking amenities. Lastly, there is a playground and fun statues for the kids to get on - the Sinclair dinosaur and a giant buffalo. There is a once live penguin in the check in area. Really cool place with gorgeous Wyoming scenery. Planning a big family trip there again with more relatives! What a find.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Awesome place to stop! Cheap ice cream cones, Deli, rotisserie chicken, hot and cold drinks, awesome Donuts and friendly customer service. Lots of truck parking, showers on, ATM and a very comfortable Lounge. They also have seating near the deli. They have your standard cold to go Foods and Novelty items in store.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: The guys marketing this place do an incredible job making you feel like you havenâ€™t been to I-80 Wyoming if you havenâ€™t stopped and had an ice cream cone at Little America. And for 75 cents, itâ€™s not a bad stop at all. My son counted over 40 Little America billboard signs coming in from the eastbound road.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: I ordered their short stack with a side of bacon and coffee. The cakes were huge, they covered a 10" dinner plate and were very thick and fluffy. The bacon was thick cut and the best bacon I've eaten in at least 6 months. All in all I was impressed with the quality and quantity of the breakfast!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Had to stay here because of my truck broke down. 01/30/22 -01/31/22
Edited:
I havenâ€™t complained about it right away because I checked in around 2:30am. I was just exhausted. But, I left a long notice on your check out card.

Bedding were covered in some paint and someoneâ€™s hair. Also, the cleaning lady starts knocking doors around at 8:50am despite the check out at 11am and eventually wakes you up!WHY????
Hopefully, wonâ€™t have to stay here again.
And of course nobody will reply. Because thereâ€™s nothing to say, right guys?!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Hotel is extremely outdated and staff needs to brush up on their customer service skills. The property probably hasn't had any sort of renovation since the 90's and it is long overdue. I was offered a package when I checked in which included a discount if I spent $30 in the gift shop/restaurant/gas station. I was told to bring back my receipts and they would apply the discount. The next morning I went into the front desk with my receipts only to be told I needed to turn them in the night before. I told the front desk attendant that I was not informed that it had to be turned in the same day I checked in, only to bring my receipts back and the front desk lady would take off the discount.  The front desk attendant rudely said,  "yeah her and she's not here". I then asked for a manager who quickly resolved the problem. If you're going to have a strict policy on how long customers have to turn in receipts for credits on a package I didn't even ask for then you need to inform the customers of that policy. Additionally, having a bad attitude with a customer who was obviously not informed correctly by your staff will not earn you business. I will NEVER stay here again!  Gross, outdated and rude staff!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Clean from one end of the complex to the other. Great staff. Comfortable rooms. Lacks a real restaurant, but the short order grill serves up food that is pretty good at a reasonable price.  Very friendly towards pro drivers - CDL rates for rooms,  plenty of truck parking (you can park a bob tail right by the hotel), separate truck stop at diesel island.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Food and fuels stop. Nice place with ice cream cones for $.50 or something like that. The food is good too. We kept seeing penguins on the souvenirs, which didn't make sense a first but ask the lady at the checkout!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Very nice little place in the middle of nothing. I mean there is literally nothing around for miles. That being said this is a nice little place that is reasonably priced. We got the deluxe room. They are old fashioned style but well maintained and is basicall like a suite. In a big city you would pay top dollar for a room like this but our rate was close to $100... not bad at all. Definitely recommend if you are traveling and going to pass through here this would be a great place to stop and get some rest...

They hotel grill closes at 10pm which no one told us but if you are really hungry you can head over to the truck travel center, that grill is open 24 hours...
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Nicest roach motel I've stayed at.  It looks cute and quaint from a distance, but don't be fooled into booking a room there.  AC was not adequate.  Had to leave the sliding patio door open for air, which was really hard to move because it was off its rollers.  It was also not secure because the patio is shared with every room on that side of the building.  The room was not clean.  There was trash left from the previous occupant: receipt in the dresser, pizza crust under the bed, comb on the bathroom sink, and water in the ice bucket.  There was a brown crusty substance on the edge of the bathroom garbage can.  The bed sheets were too short and because I'm tall my feet were rubbing on the rough protective pad underneath.  Both beds were like that but I was the only one tall enough to notice.  The map of the grounds they gave us was a bad copy and it was hard to read the amenities.  I thought there might be a nicer version in the amenities book in the room but the book had nothing in it at all.  This means we knew nothing about the hotel other than what was on the bad map.  We didn't have any phone numbers to call for service or if it was possible to order food from the restaurant.  We went in the pool, which had several places where it had cracked and was missing chunks of concrete and tiles.  The deep end separation floaters were all destroyed and were held up by the rope.  We avoided several bad sections of the pool due to it's horrible condition.  When we checked out in the morning it was so early (6:15 AM) that we had to check out at the gift shop and the staff there were not pleasant.  This was also where you payed for gas, and it had the restaurant in it.  The restaurant menu was horrible.  I couldn't order anything due to the limited menu.  The payment system was down and they didn't seem to have a manual backup system so we had to wait, delaying our departure.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We were getting tired and decided to stop here for the night.  We have been visiting this place off and on for many years but had not ever spent the night.  We were surprised at how reasonable the prices were and the rooms were clean and actually stylish.  Made it feel like a small apartment.  Seem to be fairly well sound insulated as I did not hear much nose which made for a good night's sleep.  The little store has beer which rocked after a long day of driving!!  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I will be making a point to stay here in the future.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Nice clean truck stop with some pretty good made to order food at the fuel island, 4 wheeler gas station, or at the restaurant.   Have always found truck parking here even at 1 am.

Love the little lounge just to the left of the motel check-in/receptionist area.  Pretty close to a full bar and they sell packaged liquor/beer to go.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
We LOVE western Wyoming's Little America! This was the first Little America we ever visited (over two years ago) and it is our favorite by far! (Little America Flagstaff is a close second.) We've never stayed at the hotel, but the travel center is excellent!

The shower rooms are always spotless and so cozy, each having its own huge, glass-doored, tile shower, and a separate soaking tub as an added bonus that we always look forward to. Showers are $12, and they provide mineral bath gel, bars of soap, and plenty of clean, warm towels. We stop solely for the amazing showers, but stick around a little longer for the food.

The grill has exceeded our expectations as far as a travel center food stop goes - the menu is kinda limited, but they have several different choices, from burgers to breakfast to fried chicken. The food is made to order and everything we've had has been so delicious. (My personal favorite is the breakfast burrito with sausage gravy.) The grill is also open 24 hours a day and serving everything on the menu all day long. Sure beats a basic fast food stop at any of the other travel centers!

In our experience, the staff at this location have been very friendly, welcoming, and happy to meet whatever need that arises, round the clock. If you're a trucker, get here early (or super late night) if you hope to find a parking spot. This is the last travel stop for a while if you're eastbound, and the veteran drivers already know how awesome this place is, so the lot fills up quick and there's usually a ton of create-a-spot tetris going on come nightfall.

The Little America experience is never short of amazing for us, and so memorable that every time we leave we can hardly wait until our next visit! Plus, they have a great view from the parking lot. Rolling hills, plateaus, and snow-capped mountains are hard to beat!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This was an awesome place to stop for a break on our cross US roadtrip! I can't wait for the trip back to do some more explaining!. We didn't stay at the hotel, we were just passing through to eat, fill up the tank, stretch our legs and play on the playground!.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Stayed in my truck. The truck side bathrooms leave a lot to be desired. The car side was awesome! Food wasn't anything to write home about. Had the cheeseburger and fries the night before and it was totally flavorless. Had the jam eggs hashbrowms and toast for breakfast and it was worse, if that's possible. Got my eggs scrambled with cheese and the cheese ended up on my toast.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
I have driven by little America a few time on trips. I had to do some work in Wyoming so this time I stayed there. Really cool place, kind of takes you back in time.
Nothing really negative to say. The key system is a little different. Itâ€™s a electronic metal key. Had some issues getting it to work in my door. Maintanance came got it open. But even the next day it didnâ€™t work as quickly as it should. Kind of had to find itâ€™s sweet spot. I donâ€™t think it would have been as much of an issue during the summer. It was about 10 degrees out while Iâ€™m screwing around with it.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Two stars because of the tiny bathroom.this tiny bathroom had two doors going into it. One from the bedroom, and one from the front room/bedroom.
The place is adorable! What a throwback to yesteryear! Theplumbing going into the wall in the bathroom was shoddily done. The it was just a hole in the wall without the tile put around it professionally. If you are 5 feet tall then the shower will be perfect for you. Beds were exceedingly hard. Dogs are only $10. Room was $104 which is quite expensive for where it is.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This is the most amazing place. Free dumping!!!! Free fresh water!!! Everything is reasonably priced!!!The photos u see were taken by where we parked our rv for free! They have everything you need! Restaurant, laundry, post office, gift store, friendly Staff!!! We stayed for three nights and of course contributed $150 in sales from food, gas, and the gift store! Reasonable prices! Best spot! Free rv dumping and fresh water!!!!! I have asked employees for stuff that is a little beyond what is offered and the answer is always yes and with a smile! They have 17 marble showers and lots of washers and dryers with a great room to wait in and watch tv and they have devices in the room to plug in your laptop and charge your phone while u wait. The WiFi could b better.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
I was road tripping from Denver, CO to Salt Lake, UT and saw a bunch of signs for this place. We had decided  to stop on a whim. Turns out to be a little truck/road trip stop spot.

The place is a little campy and lovely. Clean bathrooms. Plenty of parking. Overall its a great spot to stop and chill for a bit.

Also, 75 cent ice cream cones!!!!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: 50Â¢ ice cream cones, clean bathrooms, hot food, gas and play area! We travel from East coast to West coast and back several times and this remains a great place to stop, either with the kids or without. Open 24-7, it's a great pit stop. The kids love it and don't mind shopping for that odd something you don't find elsewhere in the gift shop. It's strategically placed in the middle of nowhere, but has just what's needed. The lawns are green and it's surrounded by trees. A true desert Oasis.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: So happy this place had last minute availability on Labor Day! So pet friendly with $10 upcharge for 2 dogs. There is a huge grassy area and nobody seems to care that my well mannered dogs were off leash. Cute store/deli, gas station and a little lounge that rocks (ish) til 10. Trucker parking is plentiful and on the other side.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This is one of the few remaining independent truck stops in America. They have a large parking lot for trucks. Clean showers, two stores and plenty of food choices. Also the 75cent ice cream cones make me want to scream for ice cream. Just as a reminder to my fellow truck drivers the parking lot ain't your urnal or your trash can.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Restrooms were acceptable, but not especially clean. Lots of fun shopping, which was nice, since the food took sooooooooo long. We were really on a time crunch to get to our next destination, due to car trouble, and it took 38 minutes to get 2 meals of 3 chicken strips each. I do not recommend using this as a meal stop...
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: An experience all unto itself, Little America is an historic bit of motoring Americana; a nicely-kept, relaxing hotel, diner, playground, gas station, and gift shop out in the wide-open of Wyoming along Interstate 80.  Stop in and fill up your tank, fill up your stomach, snag a gift or a bit of road trip memorabilia, or check in for a good night's sleep.  The place has been here since 1934, and continues to offer motorists a nice respite from the road.  No, it's not The Ritz, but there is no Ritz within 500 miles, and there's plenty to enjoy right here.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
This is a nice Oasis on a long drive. It is clean, well maintained, has friendly employees and a great place to stop with kids because there is a grassy playground.
It would sure be great to see souvenirs from America as opposed to China and Pakistan. Give American artists an opportunity to be part of Little America.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Little America is a great place to stop when driving across Wyoming.  The restaurant has good selections, there are lots of travel treats to pick up for the road, and the gas is always a good price with easy access off/on the interstate.  Be sure to get a picture with Emperor.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Endless truck parking. Small pet area to let the doggies roam leash free. They also have a nice grill that cooks up quick delicious food at least for a truck stop.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Always a great place as I pash through. Space for truckers such as myself.. Nice helpful staff..super clean.. Go and experience it yourself and the simple vanilla ice cream cone is so delicious
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Had to stop for ice cream and as usual, the bathrooms were great.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Pretty neat little truck stop. The cafe is great! Open 24/7 as well. They sell a variety of items. Including cricket snacks?!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Lots of parking. 2 stores. 1 for truckers and 1 for cars. Each one has a small fast food restaraunt. Plenty of choices on the menu. Large clean restrooms.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Still an iconic stop when travelling through Wyoming.  Pool was down... during peak summer, which was enough for us to continue on.  No longer a dedicated restaurant andngoft shop, which was disappointing.  However the grounds are still beautiful and the rest of the hotel seems unchanged.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Ok, I donâ€™t like giving less then 5-stars, but between the broken shower head, super slow service & it seemed like everyone was confused/out of it. The food was ok, but between waiting 15 min to order and another 15 for a pancake/bacon, then the condition of the showers (which they were CLEAN! Big difference between clean and something broken, clearly a better cleaning staff then repair staff), I was kinda disappointed after going to another Little America, (AZ I think...)
I will go back though, still got a great sense of safety compared to other truck stops, which makes it super worth it:)
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
03-19-19 Back for a shower. Maybe a soak in the bathtub. And definitely some home cooking from the kitchen where the big rigs park.

08-7-18  OMG this little kitchen cooks THE best bacon. Hands down. Also the scalloped breakfast potatoes are excellent and with the very good gravy. It's better than home cooked. (Almost) it IS the next best. Good job to the travel center kitchen crew. Oh ya and the pancakes, they are using Krusteaz mix, it never comes out this good for me at home ðŸ‘ðŸ‘.

05-16-18 This morning bacon fried eggs English muffin and hash browns. I feeling like I'm eating at home, the best.
Hmmm. Deep fried peanuts? Says you can eat em she'll and all.

05-06-18 Chocolate glazed today. And bacon cooked to perfection. French toast.

04-01-18 Have only seen the truck side. Very good kitchen there and travel store. Good prices on deli food.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This is a newer hotel.  We have stayed several times.  With the youth baseball activities in the area, it will get a lot of use, and really was needed to help with housing the families that come to the area for baseball events.  The location is great.  The parking is ample.  There are several food options in the immediate area.  The hotel is right off of Rt 95, with easy access.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text: You will miss your bed at home real quick! The only thing keeping me from giving a two star or worse rating was the fantastic customer service: front desk, housekeeping, and the breakfast attendant. Otherwise this Hilton-brand Hampton Inn and Suites is not worth the higher price point than many of the other options in Aberdeen and is way overdue for a refresh (maybe we can blame Covid-19). The colors and finishes in the lobby, halls and rooms are dinged, scuffed and just plain ugly. The king-sized bed in our non-suite room was caving in and needing replacement. When booking, be aware not all the rooms are like the pictures on the site, some are very plain with no kitchenette, just an awkward mini fridge and microwave by the desk in the room. No real dresser if you like to unpack just a small hutch with sticking drawers that the TV sits on. Pull out style love seat sofa seemed like a great option for the kids, but the window was very drafty and our son about froze the first night. The blankets were very thin waffle weave style. We asked for a second for the next night and he put on extra clothes and was okay. Not comfortable enough for an adult, he slept on it backwards, because even he could feel the metal. The bathroom was a good size which was nice for a family traveling with younger kids, but the bathroom fixtures were loose and the shower almost didn't work. The toilet took several flushes. The pillows in our room weren't the usual mixture of firm and soft (feather and polyfill as it turned out for here), but housekeeping brought us new ones when we inquired at the front desk during breakfast. The breakfast was quite good. Many choices, including an oatmeal area with fixings, plus other hot options, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and gravy one morning and the next eggs and sausage patties. Coffee options were hot. Pool and hot tub area was small, but we had fun anyways. Pool towels were restocked regularly. Elevator floor became sticky one evening, but as we were in and out, right away they had it mopped I noticed. Again, great customer service that way. We also did laundry which was weirdly on the second floor off in the corner, kinda creepy, but washing and each dry cycle was just a dollar in quarters. Front desk had change.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text: MOLD AND TERRIBLE HOUSEKEEPING!!! Front desk has great customer service. Kayla was very attentive and has great customer service. I stayed ten nights and housekeeping would show up every other day. I had to do my own bed, and take out my trash on the days that no one would show up. On the days that they showed up it was around 4 PM and in a bad mood. I talked to a manager by the name of Kyle three times and he did nothing about it. My shower was never cleaned even though I mentioned to the housekeeping lady that I had mold in the shower. I stay at Hampton Innâ€™s all the time and this is definitely the worst house keeping in the country. They should win a Golden Globe Broom for the worst housekeeping service.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text: It's my first time traveling to the Dakotas and I'm glad I decided to stay here for a few nights before leaving,  I got to relax in a luxurious/business room , kept up with my workout routine and even enjoyed the pool and whirlpool for a lil bit , everything you need is in walking distance if need be. Jordan from the desk was kind and informative. I recommend this place for all my friends.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text:
Ate at the buffet only; no gambling or hotel. Our server was very nice and kept us refilled on drinks and the plates cleaned from the table. The food overall was good and there was a nice selection. I loved the Brussels sprouts casserole. We had plenty of good crab through the whole meal. The prime rib was cooked perfectly.
They have a brick oven for the pizza and ironically the pizza on the buffet looked awful. Dried out, burnt and unappetizing.
The tables were arranged in such a way that we were very close to the table next to us which happened to have two people who talked way too loud. They were SO annoying after just a few mins. The waiter even commented on them after they thankfully left.
We tried a couple of desserts and both were good.

text:
I was excited to stay at this haunted hotel until I checked into the hotel. The lady at the check-in deck, didn't get her name, was upset and rude when I asked if I could stay in one of the haunted rooms. This is how our convo went:

Her response: "we don't have any. Because we aren't haunted."

My response: "oh that's not what I read online."

Her response: "Idk where you read that because this hotel isn't haunted."

Keep in mind she is saying this as a total Karen.

My response (joking tone): "weird. Better not tell you the website then (laugh.)"

Her response: "no you better go ahead and tell me the website so we can get it taken down. Tell me now. What is it?"

Me: "idk the website"

Her as I walk outside to get my bags from the car: grabs phone to probably look up website.

Overall, I loved the history of the hotel. Its a shame that they added a casino to the old Ball Room. Vintage is what's popular right now. The hotel is owned by the Silverado across the street, maybe keep the slot machines in the Silverado and restore the old Ball Room? People my age would dance and have a good time in the Ball Room to any music. Square Dancing, hip-hop, ect.
title: Silverado Franklin Historic Hotel & Gaming Complex, Legends Steakhouse & Silverado Grand Buffet

text:
I was very disappointed.  My stay lasted no more than 20 minutes.

When I arrived, the Clerk was disinterested.  I was told to park in the "school" parking lot.  What I was NOT told was that someone needed to be there to unlock the gate.  When I pulled up, the lot was locked.  I had to drive around the block to get back into the hotel, to inform the Clerk it was locked, for one of the bellboys to say someone needed to meet me out there to unlock the fence.  I then drove around the block again and was able to get into the parking lot.

Upon entering my hotel room, I was in disbelief.  I understand this is a historic building, but was surprised to find that to them, historic meant outdated, dingy, dirty, and simply un-maintained.

I rented a 2 bedroom suite.  The kitchen was in a room off of 1 bedroom, while the bathroom was in the other bedroom.  So, to use the restroom, you had to enter the other guest's room.  If you wanted to watch TV, you had to go into the bedroom with the kitchen.  The kitchen was outdated.  The kitchen sink did not have handles and was filthy.  The fridge didn't shut unless you slammed it.  I understand now why their website has minimal photos of their rooms.

There is no AC or central air.  The wall heaters were on when I arrived.  I turned them all off.  To cool my room, I opened the windows.  I was on the 4th floor and had no screen on my large windows.   A loose nail was just sitting on my window ledge.  I called down to the front desk and had them bring up 2 fans, which I put in my windows to attempt some form of cool air in my suite.

There were dead flies and bees on the floor, on the heating units, and in the windowsills.  A live grasshopper was on my bed.  Again.  I was on the 4th floor.

The bed in the room with the TV was broken.  When my guest sat on it, I truly thought she was going to flip off the bed as it sank so far down, so quickly.

After maybe 20 minutes total, I could no longer justify the extreme expense of my room ($630 for two nights).  When I went down to the Clerk, I asked for a manager, and she came up quickly.  I briefly explained my concerns and without hesitation, she said she would cancel my room.  While I was pleased with this resolution, it seemed odd that the immediate response was simply to remove me from the hotel rather than find a more acceptable room.  This leads me to believe this is a common occurrence.

Overall, I would give this hotel 0 stars if I could.  I've read other reviews of this hotel and am floored by those who had a pleasant stay.
title: Silverado Franklin Historic Hotel & Gaming Complex, Legends Steakhouse & Silverado Grand Buffet

text:
Hotel rooms are not great. They have not been updated since the early 1900s. The room my family and I stayed in had 2 bedrooms and a kitchen room that had the sink drains covered with a sign saying " Do not use sink ". The bedrooms didn't have doors. The only bathroom was very small and was in the room with the two beds. The king bedroom used to have a bathroom but the door was locked with a table pushed up against it. In the entry room there was a big closet room where the king bathroom used to be,  which obviously was not useable. The entry door wouldn't lock. I had to stick a folded up card behind the door lock to make it latch properly. I was worried about a fire in the old building. I made sure I knew where the fire escapes were. One was out of a window in the main hallway that led to the fire escape stairway. Room left a lot of room for improvement.
The gambling hall was old but had some new remodeled bathrooms with gold bars and new tile.
The dining room downstairs was very nice. Newer design features with newer bathrooms too. Could get down to restaurant from the elevator.
title: Silverado Franklin Historic Hotel & Gaming Complex, Legends Steakhouse & Silverado Grand Buffet

title: Best Western Premier Bridgewood Resort Hotel

text: If you are looking to stay at a top-notch hotel. The Best Western Premier Bridgewood (Neenah) is an excellent choice. Our family of 4 stayed here recently while on our family vacation and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which is a must for us with two teenagers. Each of the kids had their own bed in their own room, we had a separate room with a king bed and there was also a spacious family room. Three 65 inch tvs in each space kept everyone entertained during our downtime. The room was clean, nice and spacious. The hotel itself was very clean and nice in all areas. The pool is nicer than average hotel pools featuring a shallow wading pool for small children and main pool with basketball hoop and a larger slide for older kids. Two hot tubs one indoors and one outside were nice and relaxing. On site restaurant was very good and convenient to get to within the hotel. After our stay we received an emailed survey and personal response letter from the hotel manager thanking us. We would definitely stay here again.
title: Best Western Premier Bridgewood Resort Hotel

text: My family came here as opposed to a big waterpark hotel to hopefully experience a smaller crowd and quieter atmosphere to get away in the winter cold. The stay was overall enjoyable. The rooms felt very clean and we were comfortable. The pool area had everything our kids needed. The water was very warm and that is definitely a plus. Unfortunately there was quite the crowd in the evening and there was plenty of noise after quiet time hours from neighboring rooms but that's to be expected anywhere.
title: Best Western Premier Bridgewood Resort Hotel

text:
I had a great time at 3 Rivers! We stayed in the Pacific cabin and it was perfect. It would be a great basecamp for adventures on the Olympic Peninsula. We will be back.

The Pacific is like a fully appointed house! You have laundry, a dishwasher, a huge fridge, oven and stove...the works. It doesn't seem small! When we came in everything was spotless. Very, very clean.

The Resort is super welcoming, they have everything you'd need on site. Staff was friendly. We loved the Salmon Candy. Definitely 5 stars.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: We really enjoyed our stay in the Surf cabin! The cabin was clean and had all the amenities we could want, including good WiFi. The restaurant had excellent food, too!! We slept better than we had in ages-it's so peaceful on the property!! I love the fun Twilight signs and menu items, tooðŸ˜We hope to come back and visit again this Spring or Summer!!

The wood is a little to expensive at their store comparable with other stores in the area. They have an emergency line and they will help if, even if is a little late and that is always good ðŸ‘

At the city of Fork you will see the Swan house and Bella's truck parked at the chamber of commerce. Overall a great experience.

text: An awesome campground! Their burgers were delicious, and the store was quaint and helpful. Really exotic feel among the mossy tall trees and mysterious fog. They also have some cute little Twilight references throughout their campground!

They have cabins and homes for rent.

text: Cute, and very clean little cabin. The beds were super comfortable. It had complimentary coffee/hot cocoa. Friendly staff. There is a restaurant, and small store within a 1-2 minute walk. title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: Stopped here for dinner. Although they closed at 7pm they accommodated us shortly after that. Outdoor seating, incredible burgers, fries, and shakes. Should be on your list to stop when visiting the nearby beaches!
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: This is a good place to rent a cabin or camp with an RV but is terrible for tent camping. The showers they advertise are pay showers, it uses quarters with no place to set your clean clothes except the floor nor anywhere to sit to dress. The tent sites are very close to a busy road which you can hear road noise all night long. If you bring a pet they charge you $5 extra per night even if tent camping. There is also no water spigot for tent campers, only RV. The place is beautiful but that's all it has going for it.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text:
We came here by recommendation. We heard that their burgers are excellent, so we had to try it. Yes, it's true, their burgers are excellent! No only the burgers, also their milk shakes are a must-try.

Anyway, the ambience is a bit dark and outdated and the water cups were dirty inside. I'm sorry but this leads to one star degradation.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text:
Would highly recommend this great little Campground. The property was clean, very well kept, and had everything you could need. Play Set for kids, cozy tent & RV sites, coin operated showers, laundry, dishwashing station and even a place for fishermen to clean their catch. Convenient store with the basics as well as some handmade goods and local foods. The quaint little grill in the back makes a mean burger and has tons of food options. I enjoyed the seafood basket which was plentiful (shrimp, clam, scallops & fries).
Everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. The only downside I might mention is that there is only of toilet and one shower for the whole park. We came in the off season, so this was no big deal. Not sure what it would be like in the busy season.
Overall a great place and we loved our stay! Will be returning for sure! Location is key and this place is perfectly situated between, Rialto Beach, La Push, Forks, & the Hoh. Didnâ€™t hurt that they fully embrace the Twilight mania that has over taken this area either. I was here for the National Park, but am also a Twilight fan, so I really enjoyed all the little Twilight touches they had. â˜ºï¸
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text:
This place was a recommendation and man are we glad we listened! It's a little hole in wall joint. Has a pretty good size menu. You order at the front and can take a seat and wait. They have a Twilight themed menu for those visiting for fun(; I had the Bella Bananas Split and it was amazing. I'm a vegetarian and had a few options which was nice. I had a salad and my husband and kids had burgers. There was hardly any crumbs left. The onion rings were AMAZING. Beer battered and fried to perfection. There is four of us and we each got a meal with sides and everyone got a dessert for $50 bucks the prices were very fair. The workers were all so nice and friendly. We will be coming back for sure!!!!!!

If visiting for Twilight they also have a Treaty Line sign across the street and a few different tourist items to check out!!!! Stop on your way to La Push and grab some burgers to eat at the beach!
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text:
Gorgeous spot close to Rialto Beach. There's camping and cabins and tiny houses - we stayed in a cabin. It was quite comfortable, very clean and quiet. The shower was small but had plenty of hot water and good pressure. It came stocked with pots and pans and other things you'd likely need, including a gas stove.

The owners operate a convenience store and restaurant. They're lovely people, friendly, and the food was good (not fancy, if that's your thing, but it was tasty).

Very conveniently located and they even had a gas station. Certainly worth staying here if you want to see Rialto Beach and soak up some nature.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: Booked cabin via airbnb. $20 fee for one pup and supplied a goodie bag with biscuits and poo bags. cabin was clean. bed comfy. has some Twilight stuff so that's cool. restaurant and convenience store open til 7pm. ordered bogie burger, tator tots, and corn dog. order was correct. staff in store and restaurant are friendly. order was ready quickly and tasty. would definitely stay here again!
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: We camped in the tent area.. but we plan to rent a cabin next time.. very friendly staff

text: This review is really mostly about the showers. Haha. Stopped in the store here today during an epic journey through the Olympic peninsula. I was searching for places to shower and came across a trip advisor review from 8 years ago that said there were showers available for 75 cents.  After hiking around in the sea breeze and camping out, I really wanted a shower, so we decided to stop in and ask if they were available and luckily were pointed in the right direction. There is a single stall shower in a small room, it is self serve, you just need quarters. 4 minute showers available for $2.00, 5 for $2.50 6 for 3.00 and 7 for $3.50. The water got hot, the pressure was average. The ladies in the office/store were friendly, shower was good, the camp itself looked clean, however, we had camped elsewhere.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: Nice place in a campground environment. The cabin we stayed at was a mini cabin. Perfect for 2 people. It also had a 2 person hot tub. text: My wife and I stayed here for our 20th anniversary the staff was very friendly everything was perfect. The small kitchen is pretty well stocked for its size itâ€™s got most everything you would need for making simple meals. There are nice gas grills also available for use. text: Beautiful area and cute furnished rooms. My wife and I were very pleased with the amenities and cleanliness of our room. We stayed in the whirlpool suite. text: This place was awesome. Kids loved the spiral staircase up to the loft. Very clean and staff was very friendly. Excellent location right in the middle of everything. Only negative thing was that it was very hard to get ice. We will definitely be back.

text: The perfect place to stay in the perfect town for a Door county vacation. Ephraim has wonderful views of the harbor. Everything is within walking distance from the Eagle Harbor Inn. We'll definitely be coming back :)
title: Eagle Harbor Inn

text:
Why Eagle Harbor is the place you want to stay when in Door County?
Eagle Harbor is located right accross the bay and walking distance to Penninsula State Park. When we entered the property it was beautifully places homes giving you a royal feel of a town. The homes B&Bs are well kept and looks eye pleasing. Upon checking in the host was very friendly and informative about door county. They made us feel home. He check us in and off we went to our room Tilla. Tilla was the 1st room up the stairs on your left. Room was rather small but well designed and very cozy. The antique looks gave it a very stylish english look. The washroom was large enough and had a sky light to it. B&B main building was well decorated (pics attached) and well kept. This beautiful B&B was one of the best we have visited so far. Their breakfast was really good with some freshly baked chocolate Croissant, Cherry Yogurt, Juices Cereals and much more. Their toiletery items were good as well. Very good smelling and nice in quality. This was the best experince for us we felt right at home. Coziest B&B ever. Don't wait make your bookings right now.
title: Eagle Harbor Inn

text: This is the second time we stay here. Room is clean and comfortable. 10/10 for room services. We love Christine, an amazing lady with beautiful smile who works at the front desk.

text: Great place to watch sports don't really like playing the slots here had better luck at the gas station my bf thinks the same . Not very busy like Rosemon casino but I guess there rebuilding in the next three years so we'll see how that goes them t
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: We went on a Monday night to celebrate a 21st birthday. We ate at 99 Hops House. All the dishes were really good, I had the chicken panini and it was full of flavor and really delicious. My dining companions had the pot roast sandwich, the burger, the BBQ chicken flatbread and the fish & chips. Everyone said their selection was really good. The service was great, they even brought a happy birthday slice of cheese cake to the guest of honor, we did not order or ask for this, it was a kind gesture from the establishment. Afterwards we went into the casino gaming area and we're happy to see it wasn't crowded on a Monday. This gave us an opportunity to learn different games and we especially had a great time at the craps table. The pit crew were really informative and helpful in learning the game, it was a tremendous experience and a lot of fun! It was a great birthday celebration and the welcoming staff made it feel even more special.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: Most of the machines didn't work, or would stop working. People hog machines with their stuff or hog the next machine so you can't sit down. Place to waste money.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: Absolutely horrible place to stay!!! We stayed on 4/18/22. The king size bed was like sleeping on cement. Coffee was chalky taste.  Their breakfast bar had to be day old brought!!!! The staff at the hotel acted like we were a nuance. We just checked in and out. Never asked for anything but to checked in, and don't  forget if you take the hand soap it is a 10.00 fee, but ours was empty....lol
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: 3 stars because there is not any rewards for someone out of town. The reward gains are small and grow tier points slowly.  They give you rewards but when you live in Central Kentucky and they send them to you in the mail it really doesn't do me any good.  If they could print them for you would be much more enjoyable.  Also, they just got electronic roulette but it's not been operable for all the 2 months it's been there.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text:
We were in and out super fast since we lost $$ fast ðŸ˜¬ðŸ˜‰
I will not give less stars like some other reviewers here just because I lost money, you come and play you either lose or win that's the deal .  I am giving 5 stars since the environment was cool , clean and employees were helpful . We didn't try the restaurant inside but we are planing to come back and spend a little more time to lose more ðŸ˜„
Have fun people and play wisely!!!

text: Our hotel room was rather disgusting.  The carpet is full of stains and the wallpaper is pealing off of the wall in the bathroom.  As you will see in one of my pictures they have a holder in the bathtub for decent size bottles of shampoo, conditioner and soap.  The holder locks which I assume is so that nobody can steal their products.  However, the soap wasn't in the locked container.  I guess that is so that their guests can carry that soap back and forth between the shower and the sink because that was the only soap in the room.  Also, the large bottle for conditioner was completely empty.  It seemed more like a $59.99 room instead of a $159 room.  Very disappointing.  Also, it is quite a long walk outside to get to the casino.  Luckily it was decent weather while we were there.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: $25 casino credit for new members. Lots of machines. If you love casinosâ€¦ this a must stop.

text: Nice place to go to on a weekend, slots are tight but then you are in a casino. Drinks were super reasonable and the place is nice and clean. Good night out overall.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text:
I love going to this casino. It's clean, the staff are friendly. And hey winning isn't bad either. The only thing that could be better is if one of the other 2 restaurants upstairs besides the Hops were a little less expensive.
Update 12/11/21: the casino has made the social distancing very comfortable. I actually prefer the machines set up this way - a little more distanced, (not that it's a TON) like they are, it makes it quite nice. About the 2 restaurants I mentioned before, they're both amazing and worth the price and as the casino added, you can use your card to help out. Enjoy!!!
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: I enjoyed the place. Clean and not crowed. No real food options, just a cafe type.

text: Casino was ok. Buffet looked awesome everything looked fresh and the cooks stayed on top of things that were just sitting. Casino had many slot machines poker tables and at least one black jack table. I wish the gift store actually had something cool for purchase. Plenty of parking and I think they offered a shuttle bus. I did not check out the hotel but the casino is okay.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: 5 I had a really good time here tonight I can't see why anybody wouldn't come to this casino it's very casual very relaxed very open very friendly very nice everything you can say good about a casino I would say you could say good about this casino right here Hollywood Casino and it doesn't matter if you win or lose it matters about the Friendship the personality and the the the friend the friendship you gained with other people here to Great most excellent I would give it definitely a pop stars all the way across the board God bless you all in Jesus name
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: I was only able to stay one night RV Park but, rest assured, I'll be back. Very well-kept park with free dump station, water and electricity at sites, laundry room was acceptable, bath and shower looked very nice. And a free hot breakfast in the hotel lobby, cheese omelets, bacon, toast, bagels, oatmeal, cereals, fruit, orange juice, apple juice, and coffee. And you can go back for more if you'd like. I don't see how anyone could go wrong there! Definitely goes on my list of places to visit again, thank you!
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text:
Best RV Park in the area and closest to Chicago. + a Casino.
Check in is easy, You check in at the hotel. The Girls at the front desk are awesome, friendly, and knowledgeable of the area. During our stay RV Sites included free breakfast and $5 off coupons for food at the casino.
The sites are huge, grass everywhere,  and the area is well lit.
Partial hookups; Electric and Water with a nice dump station behind the hotel, easy access and clean.
The Casino has 3 great places to eat and live entertainment on various nights. Slots and Tables. We've had good luck at the slots. Haven't tried the tables.
There is a shuttle that doubles as security to take you to and from the casino.
And here's a cool plus,  evening visits by deer. yep there is a small herd that lives in the area and the wander through most evenings.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: Great casino, I'm not much of a gambler but the casino is in beautiful deco design.They have a sports betting restaurant area. We had the grilled chicken panini it was fantastic.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: We are Drivers and visit a few casinos here and there around the country. I thought it was pretty cool.The visual aspect and overall look and design of the place is actually pretty awesome! (You immediately feel like your walking into a top notch establishment). They have a decent number of the front line slots to play, "Money Cash" for instance along with alot of the old reel style machines on the lower level (where the table games are at)The Deli was pretty good Salena was great. Definitely a class joint throughout would love to come back again someday.

text:

title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: The RV park is small, well maintained, right on the water, and the site we had included full hookups. I absolutely agree with other reviews that the road noise is significant and that site #14 is only appropriate for a smaller RV.  We were able to back into #14 with a 20' trailer, I cannot imagine doing it with anything larger. It seemed that several of the concrete pads were not level, we noticed an RV with both of its front tires off the ground after being leveled. We enjoyed kayaking but found strong and irregular currents in front of the PUD building. We didn't notice any real beach, but maybe the tides were off while we were there. We were able to launch kayaks from the bottom of some rock steps. It's a great spot, really well kept and we will be back!
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Great location, recently remodeled, stayed in a two bedroom cabin. The cabins have all the basic cooking tools you will need, the dishes are set for 4 persons, so might want to bring extras (paper/plastic), else you will be running the dishwasher a lot. The view is great, staff very friendly and helpful. Note: the cabins are close to the highway, you may consider earplugs in the bedroom if highway sounds are an issue. Some of my RV friends said the same. There are fire pits and picnic tables. The cabins have a couple chairs and a small table. It fine to smoke on the deck. We'll be back next year
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: A recently renovated,  luxury and spacious cabin. The kitchen comes with a dishwasher and two sinks. Kitchen paper towel, hair dryer are provided. The cabin has a nice view of Hood Canal. The people in  the office was very friendly. The cabin is very close to Highway 101, it can be noisy at night.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Easy check in! Room was great! With a amazing view. Bed was comfy. Room was clean and had no odors. Overall great experience. Clean towels. My room had a blow dryer and a keurig coffee maker. Also had a nice little porch to sit outside. If the reception area is not open in the morning you can just drop off your key in the key box right outside. Casino is just a short drive away and they also have food there.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text:
We finished off the decade with three nights in the RV portion of the Waterfront offering, and enjoyed it immensely.  We parked less than 10 yards from the water with a great view.  The water here is so clear you can see the bottom like looking through glass. Even when wind whipped up some small waves you could see through the waves to the rocky bottom.

The facilities have very nice and clean showers, and a commons room you can gather in for a game. The road is close and busy through the day, but traffic dies off through the evening and it is very peaceful.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Room was hotel quality but the view was fantastic and the room included access to Lake Cushman parking. Staff was very nice though not always in the office. You can ring them from the front and they will pull up in their vehicle. Check-out just requires that you drop your key in a receptacle and you're ready to go!
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Flat paved sites. Some are a bit tricky to get into but well worth it. Views are amazing. The babbling creek at one end is almost enough to drown out the highway noise. Staff was friendly. Club house is well appropriated with puzzles, movies, a small kitchenette and a fake fireplace. Definitely worth the price.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Second time here and as the first time we love it! So peaceful looking out at the water. Yes there is road noise from Hwy to 101 but the view and the staff make up for it. I would stay here again!

text:
We were driving from Portland home to Canada and it was getting quite late so we found the little town of Shelton and it seemed like a convenient place to stop, being only an hour and a half from the Port Angeles Ferry. We googled a place to stay in Shelton and there was a very limited selection so we pulled into a couple and looked for reviews. Letâ€™s just say they sounded like rat motels from what we read from other travellers. Once we saw there was a Super 8 in Shelton it seemed like the natural place to say as they are typically a decent place to stay being a franchise and all.

We checked in around 8pm and the front desk person was friendly although seemingly bored with his job. The lobby was clean and nice. We had a truck full of purchases that we didnâ€™t want to leave outside overnight so it was nice that there was an emergency door close to where we parked for bringing all our stuff in. The front desk person did state that the hotel was located in a decent part of town and our stuff would probably be fine.

We paid $70 for the night which was high considering it was a fairly old hotel. It appeared to have been renovated at one point but the work was amateur at best. There were simple things like repairs to the towel bar which were just never painted over. Little touches like that go unnoticed when done but become BIG eyesores when left not finished. The temperature in the room was hard to keep consistent. I had to keep turning on and off the heat because the room likely is not well insulated. The bath towels were small and the caulking around the tub was gross. There was a mini fridge and coffee area, which was a nice touch. We could hear the voices from the other rooms and the aroma of the Mary J was thick in the hallways. We did not stay for the breakfast unfortunately as we were up and out to head for the ferry.

We didnâ€™t use any of the amenities, we literally just used this hotel to sleep as a crash pad and it did its job. We felt it was pretty clean and mostly quiet and if we had to stay in Shelton again this would definitely be our first stop.

3 solid stars from Doug and Shannon - It wasn't horrible but it was likely the best option in Shelton.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text: The best Super 8 experience I have ever had. Thank you Space for making it possible. They are lucky to have an employee like you. The rooms are clean and  the staff care about their guest. Great place to spend a night.

text: Came here last minute. The reviews were awesome, this place didnâ€™t disappoint. We stayed in our RV. The gift shop is adorable, the staff friendly. text: Was there over Valentine's weekend. Snowed aprox 2ft. The snow was expected, the amount not so much. The staff were busy each day with a tractor, snow blower and shovel keeping it as clear as possible. Obviously it was impossible to take advantage of much of the amenities like the pool, playground etc. The gift shop was nice and had some items we purchased. Ate one meal from the bar/cafe as take out due to covid restrictions and outside seating was a bit cold, although they did have several heaters out. The cabin, 5B was clean, warm and romantic. On Valentine's Day a staff member brought a rose and a card to our room. Nice touch folks! I will recommend the Lone Fir to friends. Thank you for working so hard to make our experience a great one under such trying times, restrictions, and conditions all around.
title: Lone Fir Resort

text: This hidden gem was a delightful surprise. Because they have the unique attribute of this specific location, they really don't need to try very hard, but they do. They are clean, up to date, friendly, comfortable, and stocked up. The restaurant was yummy too. My only frustration was dubious for such a place- poor internet connectivity. But isn't being cut off half the point of coming to the mountains?

text: We were exhausted and feeling cold coming from mount saint Helen when we found this place almost in middle of nowhere. We were amazed with the customer service and cozy atmosphere here. Customer service was beyond exceptional here. My next trip to Washington state I plan to book couple nights at their hotel.

text: Great place to stay. Beautiful grounds right on the beach. Staff is attentive. Rooms are clean and updated with nice amenities. The pool is fantastic.  Food and drinks are excellent but pricey. Highly recommend Brooke at the poolside bar & Melvin at Latitude restaurant! Fantastic service.
