text: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our first stay at Perdido Key Resort. It is one of the cleanest resorts that I have ever visited. Special thank you to Don and Kadine who cleaned our room prior to our visit and left their card. The room has plenty of charging stations even one if you forgot to bring the wall block and wire. Wifi and valet are complementary. Additionally, it is maintained well as we constantly saw the friendly staff working. Voyagers (the fine dining restaurant), Latitude 30, a pizza place ? Name with Icees and Hersheyâ€™s ice cream, and an outdoor bar and grill are all on site. They were all delicious (and great service). The rooms are not cleaned until after checkout unless a guest requests cleaning. Any extra towels or other necessities are available upon request. I always prefer not having cleaning service during my stays at hotels. Iâ€™m good with making my own bed, or not, because Iâ€™m on vacation. Bottom line is this resort exceeded all my expectations, and we were really impressed.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
This was an outstanding place to stay! Definitely recommend to others and a place to come vacation!
We were here on my son's Make-A-Wish trip to the beach and they sure knew how to make it special for him!
Thank You!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Loved this resort. Beautiful surroundings, grand piano live music nitely. Excellent experience!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
As a local from Baldwin County, the Perdido Beach Resort is a great option for anyone wanting to spend some time at the beach! It could be challenging to someone not familiar with Orange Beach to decide where to stay, but this place will not disappoint!

Situated just west of Alabama Point at the bridge, the PB Resort is located near The Gulf, a great casual dining option, plus other dining options across the street and nearby. The famous Flora-Bama is just a short drive east!

The PB Resort offers ample parking, but it does fill up quickly. On-site valet is also available. To enter the hotel, you can walk up the side-facing stairs leading from the parking below or remain on the lower level and follow the sidewalk around beneath the upper level.

Upon checking in, we received elastic wristbands that were our room key. Definitely an easy way to keep up with your key instead of always fumbling around in pockets, etc.

Our room was very clean! There was no carpet in our room, just vinyl plank style flooring. A nice upgrade from gross hotel carpet you often find nowadays. We had a small balcony with a bar height table & chairs, that offered a great side view, West facing both the Gulf & the adjacent cove area/ Robinson Island across the street.

The outside bar/patio offers great drinks & food! I thought it was interesting that each time I ordered a Mango Margarita, I got something different but still tasty lol. Bartenders were friendly and quick! Food was also good.

The pool & surrounding grounds are great & create a nice relaxing atmosphere. There was also live music on the days we were there.

Voyagers, one of the many restaurants inside is great! Perfect for date night, or any other celebration.

Really love this hotel! Great for families and everyone visiting Orange Beach!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
The hotel phone and online reservation staff, parking lot, and conference staff are disconnected and disjointed.

I WOULD NOT recommend this place for a conference just based on trying to reserve a room and set up for conferences.

The front desk folks are nice and polite.

I COULD NOT stay at the hotel because they would answer the phone and transferred me to a number that would just disconnect you and emails go unanswered or vague responses with no answers to your questions.

They seem to be focused on valet services and conference fees but making vendors at conferences jump through hoops. You must leave keys with the valet to unload and you can't use the side doors because it bypasses the valet.

They respond with the ability to ignore your issues with short useless comments.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
I stayed here for the NENA conference last year, and I'd heard only negative things about the hotel.  I'm happy to say they were wrong!

The hotel underwent a renovation at some point in the last few years so the rooms are more modern.  From what my co-worker said it "used to look like a dump".  There are some issues with quality of the rooms where it looks like a flipper did them.  An example is the shower doors where they will slide open on their own.  My room as well as my co-worker had this issue.

The pool is very large with a nice bar and a window to order food and drinks from while outside.  There is also a clear walking path to the beach.  There is an inside and outside pool area.  The inside area has a hot tub and a little area for swimming inside (it's connected to the main pool, so if it storms - you'll need to get out).  The inside area is slippery, so watch your footing and DO NOT LET YOUR KIDS RUN.  The main large pool has a walk over bridge and a gazebo where live music was played every day I was there.

If you want food, they have two restaurants that serve dinner (one casual and one fancy), but they are a little pricey.  The fancier option you'll need to make a reservation for as they are small and don't have space for walk ins.  There is also a little cafe that is open in the mornings with coffee and muffins.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We had a very relaxing vacation. The pizza was really good, as well as Latitude 30. I have only 2 things to say that would make the stay more pleasant, and those are: 1. Get better toilet paper. The stuff they have is so thin you canâ€™t wipe your nose without putting a hole in it. And the coffee in the rooms was just awful. I like Royal cup but that bold stuff was undrinkable.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great experience staying at PBR. Great service everywhere we were in the resort. We enjoyed all of our meals at the resort and really didn't need to go anywhere away from the resort.  We had a great time.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This was my first time visiting this resort! Absolutely wonderful!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Nice hotel offering everything you would want for a pleasant beachfront vacation! The rooms are nice and quiet. Hard to beat the Voyagerâ€™s restaurant! The pool is clean and large, within a beautiful setting. They have a wonderful exercise room. Nice extras like a coffee shop and ice cream parlor add to the fun. The beach and ocean area is breathtaking!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Absolutely beautiful resort! The rooms are absolutely beautiful, spacious and top notch! The shower is absolutely unbelievable! There is beach access and lounge chairs for you to use and enjoy! The pool is very nice and very pretty at night. Inside they have two jacuzzis and a portion of the pool indoors as well. There is an amazing gym for those that want that. The restaurants are all great too. Highly recommend!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: I have visited Perdido Resort for Nine Years! It is simple an Excellent and Exceptional Service! They will make sure you had a great visit! The entire staff provide exceedingly service! I would love to mentioned each individually employee, but it would take long time. I never want to leaveâ€¦after September 16, 2020, Hurricane Sally moved onshore in Gulf Shores, unfortunately the resort experienced some damages, but the Resort has been remodelâ€¦it is beautiful! The rooms have beautiful floors and decor! The lobby looks so exquisite and elegant! It was good to see the same staff, especially Lauren and the crew members. You can laid back, relax, listen to some music, drink at the bar, swim at the pool or get in the hot tub or you can stay all day at the beach! Enjoying the beautiful Atlantic Ocean. The location directly on the beach and 5miles to beautiful State Park. The entire resort and room were clean and well kept. The on-site restaurants and bars are wonderful with lots of food selections and price ranges. Want a snack or drink by the pool-right there. I loved our stay, didnâ€™t want to leave, and canâ€™t wait to come back! â€
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: My friend's it doesn't get better then a private beach in the most beautiful spot in the south. This resort stands by their name and you dont ever have to leave.  The food is great and the service is the best I've ever reviewed.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Lovely room. Great service. Close to everything and right on the beach.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Weâ€™ve stayed here before and it was such a lovely time! Lots of dining options, a very nice pool and music with live entertainment, located on the beach. The Thanksgiving feast in their ballroom is so good! It was a real treat to dine here with the entire family, have an incredible meal at such a lovely place. Of course, we will be back!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We went in December for a getaway before Christmas and it was perfection! The hotel is clean and modern, we asked for a corner room with beach view and it did not disappoint! Gorgeous views, so even if it's raining or foggy the views are amazing! The restaurants are delightful and getting to the beach is so fun! And then the beach is just on a whole new level. White pillowy sand, warm water and enough wildlife to keep anyone entertained. Cannot say enough good things about this place.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Wonderful, relaxing visit. My favorite was watch the Dolphins feed at sunrise
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Exceptional Hotel!  We will certainly return in the future.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Had a great experience while here. Rooms are clean with a mini fridge. Has an indoor and outdoor pool area as well as hot tubs that were really cool. Walk out to the beach and get your feet in the sand as this is easy to do here. Has a few bars with food as well as a coffee shop in house for those who need caffeine.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Staying here was the best decision ever, this resort is spectacular, a perfect 10! The resort is beautiful and sparkling clean from the welcoming lobby to the fabulous guest room with a gorgeous view. The entire staff is phenomenal, special shout outs to Crystal and Chris who made our trip outstanding. The awesome private beach is stunning as is the fantastic pool. There was wonderful live music at both the pool and lounge. The restaurants are incredible, especially the desserts at Voyagers, special shout outs to Eric, Fernando and Joni who were amazing. Also had a blast on an afternoon dolphin cruise. Stay here, this place is heaven on earth, highly recommend!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great place to stay. Just stayed here for 3 nights for a conference. I stayed in the East Tower in a brand new renovated room. The rooms were very nice, extremely clean, tons of space, had a balcony, and nice sized bathroom. The room also had a safe, half fridge, microwave, mini bar area with sink. The bed was very comfortable. The lobby area was all brand new and very nice. The bartenders were all great. Resort is located right on the beach, canâ€™t beat that. Looking forward to returning again next year.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: OMG, all I say is wow. This is my 4 or 5th visit to this wonderful hotel, my first visit post pandemic and I thought I was in a different hotel. They completely renovated the inside and the rooms and they did a great job. Ms. Nancy in the lobby is an awesome addition. Latitude restaurant in the lobby is a must and the prices are good as well. The resort is dealing with staffing shortage like everybody else but you canâ€™t tell it. The staff present did a great job and presented a wonderful attitude.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
This was a great place for the conference I attended. I never knew the gulf coast of Alabama was so beautiful. The resort is still recovering from hurricane damage, but it's doing a great job. The hotel staff is friendly and was a great help when needed. The three restaurants all have great food (loved the gumbo). Voyager wait staff will suggest the perfect wine to go with whatever you've chosen and the ice cream from the pizza joint downstairs is the perfect way to cool off after getting that sun burn.

When you get there, make sure you check the hours of the restaurants...the hours didn't match the website at the time of my visit and the bars seem to close earlier than most. (I do suggest the signature 'stress reliever' cocktail....yum).

Ride share services are available, but amazingly spotty. I hope that improves as the country opens back up and more people are getting back to work and traveling. A ride from the nearest airport (Pensacola) can be between 60 and 80 dollars. The resort wasn't charging for parking at the time I was there, so a rental may suit you.

The view from my room was great. Sitting on my balcony and just listening to the ocean, even in the dark of night when you couldn't see it was awesome. I doubt the pictures did it justice. During the day, you can just watch the waves roll over onto the shore, until you decide to stop being lazy and getting down there!

The beach was a fine sand thanks to its quartz and coral mix, which also accounts for its light color.  We were here in May, so the water was about 70 degrees. It took a min to get used to, but was perfect once you did.  Pay attention to the flag at the end of the walkway. Red flag days may be good for sitting and watching but the waves can get up there. My last day was a double red flag day and the waves were up to about 10 foot. Great for the local surfers, not so much for swimmers.  The cushions and umbrellas for the lounge chairs on the beach are about 30 dollars per day. I believe there are discounts if you book multiple days. When you get to the beach, there is staff to help you out with all that, and you can charge it to the room.

All in all, I had a great time. I look forward to going back for next year's conference! Thanks Perdido!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Did not stay here as a guest, but came for a conference hosted here. Indoor/outdoor pool looked awesome (didn't get to swim), did have a few drinks at the poolside bar, and there's easy direct access to the beach!
Can't speak to the guest rooms or accommodations for guests, but I would certainly consider coming here if ever on vacation in the area!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
I was so impressed with Perdido Beach Resort at our recent conference. All of the staff went above and beyond to meet our needs and facilitate the conference. Front desk staff,  catering/restaurant staff, maid service staff were all excellent.  My hotel room was beautiful, clean and comfortable.  The complimentary valet parking was so appreciated upon arrival! The food at all meals was wonderful.  The lobby, with live music in the evenings, was such a pleasure.
Looking forward to returning.
One suggestion I would make is to get rid of the plastic table attached to the balcony railing in the ocean-front rooms. It obscures the view - not so much when you're standing in the doorway, but when you're seated in the room, it really blocks the view. And, while I see the benefit of the bar-height stools on the balcony, for enhanced viewing while on the balcony, they are very uncomfortable after about 5 minutes.  I have a bad back.  I called the desk to request a regular height chair for the balcony, but none were available.  I ended up buying a chair to use on the balcony - left it in the room, as I didn't have room to take it with me.  If you're planning to replace the rest of the balcony chairs with the plastic bar table and bar stool chairs, please reconsider - maybe offer both, or have some regular chairs available, upon request. If you've already committed to installing the balcony bar table, please consider moving it to the edge of the balcony so it doesn't obstruct the view so much from within the room. One small suggestion in a wonderful stay.
There was a very long wait (45 minutes) on the phone to make a reservation. We had to phone in to get the conference rate. Once I reached a reservationist, everything was great.
The live music in the lobby was most memorable. It just made me happy every time I walked through. The musician did an excellent job.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This was by far the best hotel experience weâ€™ve ever had! The outside didnâ€™t impress much but once you walk it it was like a dream. The staff was absolutely amazing and I donâ€™t think there was much they wouldnâ€™t do to help us make our stay the best it could be! The pools were very nice, and the indoor pool does not have a closing time which is great because we usually save swimming for the end of the day when we get back after exploring. It was about 55-60 degrees but the outdoor pool still felt nice because itâ€™s heated. Inside has 2 hot tubs! The room itself was pretty standard, but the view was unbeatable (after they upgraded us free of charge just because they had the availability!) the beach is absolutely beautiful as well. The location is great because it isnâ€™t too far from gulf shores or Pensacola. They offer free valet parking as well which we would have used more if it was busier but we were able to just park ourselves
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This resort checks off all of the boxes for a great stay. The staff was very attentive and pleasant to work with and made us feel like home. The facility itself had all of the amenities you could think of and more. The beach is conveniently right behind the resort for nice walks. The rooms are very spacious and is very well-kept.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Love this property and it has everything you need.  Great spot on the beach.  Close to all the best eating spots.  Donâ€™t want to go off property for breakfast, lunch, or dinner? No problem, all the restaurants on property are excellent. Check out my Voyagerâ€™s restaurant review.  Rooms are nice and you get an excellent view from every room. Some views are better than others but you can always see the beach.  The outside and inside pool are nice.  Plenty of lounge chairs.  Reserve your beach chair early and for your entire stay, thatâ€™s how you save money.  Rooms were cleaned daily, an all around excellent experience.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This was a very lovely place. Valet parking complimentary. Helped get luggage to and from car. Very friendly. Make sure you have tip money. This place isnâ€™t cheap by any means. Did have staffing issues so some things were closed but I mean thatâ€™s everywhere. All photos were taken on the property or in room/balcony.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Had a great stay here. The serenity of being on the beach is amazing. I loved waking up to hear the waves crashing in the ocean. The resort lived up to my expectations. Comfy room and great service. Beds and pillows where nice and soft. The rooms are pretty typical of what you would find in common hotels. Nothing to spectacular. The beach access from the resort was very convenient. The architecture of the pool is very aesthetically pleasing. All my worries went away while I was there.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: It is truly a 5 star hotel. Very nice place. My son had his culinary competition their for his high school. GOOD JOB ON HOSTING!!!!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This place is amazing! If you book, try to get a room on the 8th floor. It's very restricted and you must use your room key card to even get on that floor. It also has a lounge where they offer cocktail hour and free breakfast every day. Also you can go in at any time and get free canned and bottled drinks,  candy bars and chips. This hotel also has beach towels to use on the beach or at the pool free. The rooms are very clean and nice. The beds are so soft and comfortable. The landscaping is beautiful. The staff are all so friendly and willing to help in any way. It's the only hotel I will go to when I return to Orange Beach! Please like my post! Thank you!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great place for family vacation! We had a wonderful time. Club level had a great breakfast, lots of snacks and drinks that would have been very expensive otherwise. Beach access was fantastic and not at all busy. The employees were all very nice and so helpful. We'll definitely be coming back!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We had a great time! Resort is amazing. My boys loved being able to walk to the beach, and the indoor pool was a lot of fun. They also have some really good food. It's a place you can go and not have to leave if you don't want to.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
DON'T OVER PAY -- I paid for the king pool view thinking it was a room with a better view. I stayed in room 2009 (2nd floor) and could see the beach from my room, but not the pool. The only thing I could see near the pool is the rarely used hot tub/children's pool because the roof of the restaurant obstructed the view. I didn't complain because I could see the beach (and honestly, I didn't remember the quirky rates). It wasn't until the night before I checked out that I went to the hotel website to confirm the check out time. That's when I saw that my room was a king angle view beach room that was at least 50/night cheaper. The hotel staff refused an adjustment saying it is a pool view room, just on a lower floor (check the picture - you be the judge). You may be able to see the pool from a room directly above mine, but I think managers should take this obstruction into account. They also said they were booked to capacity and that I should've said something on the night I checked in. What difference would that make if you're booked to capacity????
I'm writing this so future guests don't get duped. Don't pay more for a pool and beach view (pool view room) when you can pay less for an angle beach room. The view from the room below is considered a "pool view".
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Another beautiful adventure at PBR. The desk staff, especially Tracy, is the BEST ðŸ‘Œ
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: What a beautiful place! Went here for a weekend getaway, and had the club level room. It was absolutely breathtaking and the service is wonderful. I think it was well worth paying extra for club level. Snacks and drinks are available all the time in the lounge and you can get complimentary adult beverages and breakfast at certain times a day. Coming back!!!!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We came for a soccer tournament with about 50 kids and families and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were great, the staff was friendly, and best of all they had resturants in the resort so we didn't have to leave once the games were over. The kids loved the pool area as well. And our view was amazing.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: I loved this resort. Pool is open 24 hours along with the beach. The staff was helpful and they had complementary valet parking. There are restaurants and small shops located inside. They are really set up to handle kids too. They have a decent pizza place that we enjoyed. They set my room up for my birthday with balloons and a card with free icecream card. We had a great view from our window. They had live music with a gentleman who played piano very well and with singing. Thanks for a memorable time.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Absolutely loved my stay here. Staff was very professional and greeted you with a smile each time. The only reason I could not give 5 stars was due to a minor issue with our room. When taking a shower the tub would fill up with water instead of draining. Like I said other than that a great place to stay!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Enjoyed the stay... Parking provided, fine dining onsite and an excellent view of the gulf from my suite. Did I mention the indoor/outdoor pool or access to the private beach?
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Visited this hotel for Spring Break. Everything was outstanding. Free valet, great service, registration crew helped me choose the right room to accommodate my family. Hotel is clean, and they took care of all our needs. Nice pools, very short walk to the beautiful white sand beach, and a workout room that includes 3 Pelatons. This is a great hotel and we had a great time.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Enjoyed our stay, and will be back!   Had family staying at a nearby newer hotel and they came to visit us at and said ours was much nicer. Staff was always friendly and accommodating.  We ate at all of the restaurants on site and everything was great.  Planning on staying longer next time.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Very nice place with great views. The rooms were nice and the staff were very helpful. The restaurants on location were fantastic. Would stay here again.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: My mother in law, sister in law, and I took a short girls trip (my 3yr old son also tagged along) & spent 2 nights here and LOVED it. Everyone was extremely friendly. We enjoyed the pier that led to the private beach. It lit up at night, which was nice. I had wished that for the amount of money we were spending on the room, at least breakfast would be included. That and the fact that the separate 2ft kiddie pool was not well lit at night, no lights around it at all, are the only reasons I am giving less than 5 stars. However, although a bit pricy, I can say that the breakfast buffet was VERY good. The servers were great. I would definitely recommend having dinner at Cotton's up the road also! Overall, we had a great girls trip and I can say we will be back! ** I have added photos of the view from our room on the 4th level and a photo of the kiddie pool during the day. **
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Great resort with plenty of things to do on site and nearby. The Lobby Bar is great, but was under-staffed. Karrissa the bartender did a heroic job handling a large group by herself. Note to management: If Lisa is on that piano, overstaff.

The rooms are nice with great views. The pool area is beautiful. Voyager is the main restaurant and has an excellent menu and a very attentive wait staff. Everyone strives to make it an experience to remember.

I added my fingers to the photo because all my pics turn out better that way.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
The amenities are perfect, if you like having a good time this place is for you. They even have room service.....
By far one of my favorite places to stay.
Awesome fun for any age kids. They are in walking distance of the jetties if you like to fish but not for the faint of heart those rocks are treacherous. Also only a very short drive from Zekes Marine Mrs Brianna is the boat
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great resort! Location is perfect and the beach is so nice. The pizza kitchen down by the pool actually makes really good pizza. Close to lots of stores. The restaurant in the resort is really good too. Nice breakfast buffet.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great place. Was doing some work in the area brought my wife along so she could relax and shop while I worked. We decided to stay here. The staff is very nice and courteous and the restaurants have very good food and drinks.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Fantastic experience at this property, starting with our bellman, Nathan Searcy! Loaded everything (we own between 4 people) onto one bell cart, brought it to our room and unloaded it, all with a smile and a "no worries" attitude. Thank you for such a smooth transition from our vehicle to our room.

Our stay was primo at this resort. Nothing outrageously fancy but everything we could ask for in a weekend impromptu beach visit. This "end" of the beach was not crowded (in early May) possibly due to the jetty we were situated near, as the property is near the waterway and bridge. This actually made for an awesome location! We perched till sunset and enjoyed the view.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
When I called to make arrangements with them. I told them what I wanted/expected and they delivered. I believe that we had the best room in the whole resort. I love the fact that everything is right there. We drove in instead of flying so after 12 hours we didn't want to be in the car any longer. They have everything. Your food, alchohol, and if u forgot anything from home, there is a good chance the gift shop has it.

The restaurants available had some amazing food. Not a huge pizza fan but the pizzeria is really good.

Oh and did I mention you can take your alchohol anywhere?  We loved that. You can bring your own or choose from a couple of different bars on site. One of the staff told us only rule was no glass outside. So if you choose to bring your own, make sure u buy cans or aluminum bottles. Also allow coolers on the beach but not in the pool area.

Hotel was very clean (yes I inspected it),every staff member we came in contact from bell hop to bar tenders were super nice and very helpful with any questions we had.

We recommend Perdido Beach Resort to anyone looking for a place in this area. We will definitely be back many times over.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Recent renovations are beautiful!! Love spending NYE here. Onsite restaurant Voyagers is one of a kind. Staff is wonderful!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Older rooms but still nice. Had a great view of the pool & beach. Beds were fairly comfy with 4 pillows. Nive balcony for 2 people. The beach was sooo nice. Warm water in April. White sand like talcum powder. Employees very nice & helpful.

Only negatives: kinda seemed more like a family resort (bachelor in 30s), bars & food shut down by 10pm.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
It's a pretty nice place. Very convenient to have shops and restaurants on site. Beach access right off the pool is great. The beach is very well taken care of.

The chairs and umbrellas on the beach are for rent. We got out there early and we weren't away of that so we were told nicely to move our stuff. We didn't rent from them as we had our own things but the option is great.

The pool is a pretty big size. It was too cold for us enjoy it though but so was the beach. We went 5/23-5/27. It's not a heated pool. Wish it was and we could have enjoyed it. The temperature when we went was high 70s, 14mph winds and felt amazing outside of the water. If the pool was heated, it would have been amazing. The kiddie pool is also nice but also not heated.

We stayed in room 601 and Our room was nice, room service and house keeping were great. We didn't have enough towels or know how to turn on the shower on but we called house keeping and they were there in seconds with more towels and shower us the shower. (You just pull down on a fixture directly under faucet lol and to turn it off, you just shut the water off. I felt a little dumb haha) Our room had a fridge but no microwave. Beds are super comfy. But oh!!! The sliding door had me about to rip it out. The sliding balcony door has a frame that is above the floor. I stubbed my toe on that frame at least 15 times while I was there and by the last time I did it I wanted to rip out that door. My daughter also stubbed her toe a few times and cried every time. It hurts! So beware of that door. Not sure if all the rooms are like that but 601, yes. I warned you.

Breakfast buffet was super good! Definitely give it a go. Priced well too. The pizza downstairs is also really... Really good!

This was our first time to Orange Beach/Gulf shores and it was nice. If you plan on chilling on the beach of resort the whole time, I would recommend this place. We didn't find much else to do here. Yeah there's a park and The Track is pretty cool but I was expecting to see a bunch of restaurants and activities. None of that here. It's nothing compared to Destin which is just 90 min away but if I go back, and the price is right, I'll stay at this resort again.

Staff was super friendly and helpful. From the time time we checked in to the time we checked out, we felt super welcomed.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This resort was perfect place to stay with a large family. They had a pizza/ice cream place for the kids and 2 bars for the parents ðŸ˜Ž. There's a gym with plenty of equipment including a couple peloton bikes looking at the ocean! Would definitely stay again
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Great resort.  Very clean and the customer service is excellent!!  This is the place to stay!
(Add on statement) This resort has live entertainment around the pool during the day and in the lobby at night.  The talent here is unbelievable!  We witnessed 3 gentleman that put on an impromptu show that was incredible!!  You could not walk through the lobby without stopping to listen.  The piano player (John Brust) is here regularly, the clarinet (Tom Owen) stops in occasionally, and the trumpet (Roger Reupert) was here on vacation and say in. This is well worth stopping in for a free (tips) show, even if you can't get a room here!!  See YouTube where I will post a video in a few days.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We stayed at Predido for an anniversary vacation and enjoyed a wonderful experience.  Can't say enough of the great staff. Special kudos for Brittany (the Club Level hostess), all the bellmen and valets. What great bunch for folks! We loved the pool area and overall facilities. Pool area bartenders were terrific. Food all downstairs grill and pizzeria was delicious.  Next time we stay in the area, it will be at Predido Resort!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: GIRLS TRIP!!!  Love this place! First time at Orange Beach and I am soo grateful we chose Perdido Beach Resort! The guests here are very friendly ~ the hospitality from the workers REMARKABLE! No time to be bored nor hungry and honestly, once you park you don't have to drive again until you journey home! I will definitely return with my family!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We enjoyed our stay for the conference. Our room was newly redone. All the colors were very calming. We stayed on the club floor and enjoyed the club room. Breakfast each day was very good and always included fresh fruit. You could get comes, water and juice anytime. They also had chips, candy bars, yogurt and granola bars available too. At night, there were light appetizers and drinks. Wi-Fi worked great in the room and at the conference.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This resort was really amazing. The grounds were huge. Free valet parking and two restaurants. The room was nice but was just basic hotel size. I visited in the off season but all the facilities were open. I would like to return during to peak season.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We visit often and always have a wonderful trip. Everything you need is right here, you don't even have to leave the resort if you don't want to.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: The resort was beautiful and situated perfectly within walking distance of multiple attractions and dining options
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great rooms, excellent service and location! Lots of great Gulf views available as well!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Been here multiple times and I always enjoy thr great service and accommodations. Staff has always let us check in early. There are lots of great restaurants and a great poolside bar. I highly recommend Perdido Besch Resort for summer vacation or for a weekend getaway for a concert at the Wharf.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Awesome experience. Loved the beach access.  Sitting on balcony listening to the waves come in as night slowly turns into day is so relaxing.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: The staff and the resort are TOP NOTCH you will not find a place better than PBR . It has some of the best food you will find the Chef is an award winning Chef with great people working with him I can't say enough how great PBR is. Visit it and then thank me for the recommendation #HappyDays
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: A very nice place, right in front of the beach. Was given attitude from some staff about service animal, my service dog. I'm going through brain cancer and I have a service dog. Other than that,  had a very nice time, enjoyed the food and piano player Lisa Zanghi!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This place is sooo awesome and inviting.  My wife and I can't wait to come back to Gulf Shores and visit the gulf coast and we'll definitely be staying at Perdido Beach Resort.  Not to mention that I have never seen such a beautiful sunset.  Thanks for the blessed experience and clean room.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We had an amazing time our 5day stay was great ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ we will return Phoenix VII ðŸ˜ ðŸ¤© BEAUTIFUL CONDOS
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Beach side room with a gorgeous view! Poolside live music during the afternoon and poolside grill and an ice cream shop just inside. Live piano music in the evenings, too! Loved our stay there!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This place is gorgeous. Their staff is superior. The food from 5 on site restaurants are second to none. Best location, directly on the beach, with amazing views and privacy. I will be returning soon.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: It is so beautiful here!! The staff is top notch. They are friendly and very helpful. It's our home away from home.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: A very, very nice resort. We stayed there for a couple of days during the 4th of July. Their breakfast buffet was very good with omelettes made any way you like them. The fireworks display was right in front of the resort on the gulf. Great fireworks display with an all you can eat bbq buffet prior to the fireworks. We had excellent weather and the room very nice with an excellent view of the Gulf of Mexico! We attended a concert (Tedeschi Trucks Band and Blackberry Smoke) at the Wharf Amphitheater which was just a few miles away and needless to say the resort pool and the ocean was incredible! Plenty of things to do including boat rides, parasailing, restaurants galore and plenty of shopping. Over all, we had an excellent time with the only drawback being a whole week would have been nice!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We celebrated our dads 80th birthday at the Voyagers restaurant. Beautiful setting, delicious perfectly executed dishes.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: We just loved this place! We will be going back at the end of April. Top notch!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Perdido Beach Resort starts first with the wonderful people who run the hotel like Susan Newsom who made sure our stay for our 38th anniversary was PERFECT.  The rooms are clean and quiet and the breakfast this morning was fast and the omelet chef made a creation that Wolfgang Puck would be proud to share.   If you want a great place to enjoy the beach with wonderful people to take care of you book now.

Update.

The last night we decided to dine at Voyager's.  Eddie got us the perfect window table and the cuisine is the best on the coast from Pensacola to Orange beach you won't find a better view or better service or better steaks.  Save room for dessert.  I do recommend reservations.

Final Thoughts

Well we have been gone for a few days and the glow of a wonderful weekend at PBR is still warning our hearts and we continue to smile.  We are looking forward to returning soon to enjoy the nicest people, the best food and the best service.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
Always a joy coming here , incredibly friendly staff and will go out of their way to make sure you are happy.

This was our 2nd trip and hopefully there will be more to come.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Amazing resort. Staff is friendly and professional. Large pool for the whole family was fun. Easy beach access.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: First time there canâ€™t say enough good about. Excellent donâ€™t ever have the leave the place has everything you need. Music by the pool, music inside piano that is.  Just a great all around experience. Oh ya short walk to there private beach.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: One of our favorite places to stay in OB. We love everything it offers. Voyagers (our favorite), Perdido Pizza Company, The Splash Bar (delicious shrimp po boy and a literal beach bucket full of nachos!) Latitude 30 (awesome breakfast buffet!), the piano lounge bar, the pool, the hottube, in there is always something to do without even leaving the hotel.

text: It was so beautiful..  Just relaxing, clean and seems exclusively yours.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Great place to stay. The sand is beautiful, not as crowded. Food is Awesome, service was top of the line. Great views from your room, We will be returning.

text: The room is so nice and comfortable. The people are so nice. There is live music by the pool during the day and a pianist in the evening. The view is beautiful.

text: We absolutely loved it, beautiful clean rooms and facilities, the pool is stunning with a poolbar and live music which was amazing! Not to mention the gorgeous view of white beaches and the Gulf of Mexico.

text: Very small rooms, not worth the price. No ventilation (or wash rags) in the bathroom. Shower had issues and when I told the front desk she sent someone up who "fixed it". When asked what she was gonna do for me because of all of the trouble, all she did was give me a card with the gm's name on it and said he might be in tomorrow.

text: Loved the great views! The rooms are clean and the bed was comfy. We loved it! Amenities were great. We will be back!

text: Amazing views, direct beach access,  very clean, stFf was friendly and the resort was clean.

title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: This resort is so beautiful. I enjoyed my stay there. The view from my room was amazing. I would love to go back. ðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜Š

text: Love it! Everything was right there for you. The rooms were great and the view magnificent. Calm and peaceful beach.

title: Perdido Beach Resort
