text: Beautiful beach. Rooms are beautiful. Great place to spend time with family. Great restaurant and conference rooms.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text:
We utilized this property for a work retreat, and over 4 days we saw the staff in action. Housekeeping was excellent, with the only less than excellent item being that they didn't vacuum my room each day. Front desk staff at reception was attentive. Lobby was spacious and beautifully decorated.

We also used a meeting room that was staffed by food service workers and hotel management, and this was an interesting situation because the first day we were there they took excellent care of us.  The second and third days of meetings, our service was noticeably dropping off. Staff on the first day were well aware of our dietary restrictions in the group and were very detailed to make sure everything was correct. Not so in following days. The last day they basically disappeared after lunch, zero dessert options or drink refills, and we did not see hotel staff again until the end of the day. However, food was good and our drink station was properly maintained most of the time. Views from the meeting room were beautiful, overlooking the river.
Overall this was a good experience and I would stay at another Hyatt for business travel.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Iâ€™ve stayed at several Hyatts, this is one of my favorite just because of the view. Definitely splurge if you can. I totally enjoyed my stay. My room was clean, with a refrigerator, coffee machine, no extra shampoos and conditioners ðŸ˜it was a wonderful view of overlooking the river. Nice to see the windows were clean also, to enjoy it. Hotel and customer service was great, to the valet, even though itâ€™s steep $40 extra a day. ðŸ˜¬ðŸ¤·ðŸ»â€â™€ï¸ I personally would not have stayed there if I was placed in one of the middle rooms, which overlooks the reception/lobby/bar etc. but some people donâ€™t mind that as Itâ€™s located in a great spot, an easy walk to everything, restaurants, bars and of course historical sites, monuments. I did have dinner and drinks one night at the hotel and they were OK, actually waiter & waitress was excellent. Iâ€™ll definitely stay here next time and refer my friends. The one star missing is due to the fact, breakfast was extra, reallyâ€¦
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: 1st class service from the minute you drive in. The valet service is excellent, the front staff were great and personable, the concierge was helpful with whatever we needed. Beautiful view from a corner room overlooking the river and Riverstreet. Beautiful room and grounds. The staff made our anniversary very memorable with  everything being so perfect.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Bathroom was dirty, moldy -- even the shower curtain was stained.  Bed was comfortable and other furnishing appeared well maintained.  Only provided decaf coffee pods in room.  Room service unavailable during "lunch" hours. Elevators were slow.  On one trip, door would not close.Just not the standard hotel experience one would expect from Hyatt Regency. Offered an upgrade to City View for extra $15 a night.  View was overlooking hotel courtyard
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Service was outstanding from the valet to the concierge. They were treating me like family the whole stay. The hotel has a good view for river street. And I have to say that their gym is absolutely big and well equipped. Jazmin and Iris were amazing and the concierge,Sir too.

Thanks for the stay and the excellent recommendations from tours to restaurants.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We lived two nights here. The experience are extremely bad. We got the room at the third floor. Facing the lobby side. There are very noisy in the lobby until 12:00pm in the night. And I fell asleep around 12:30am. Wake up because of the fire alarm around 2:00am in these two nights. Don't live here if you want to have a good sleep.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: So disappointed with my stay here and very disappointed with how our issues were handled. Came here with friends and booked 2 rooms next to each other. Both our rooms were filthy. Mine had a few dead roaches by the bed/tv, some random dirty boxers, and a giant layer of dirt all through the carpet. When we complained they did not take any action for a whole day. They offered us either a cleaning or two (much worse) rooms that weren't even together. The manager didn't even reach out to me until after we checked out. Given the price point, absolutely NOT worth the stay. 24 hr gym is nice though
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The bed was firm and the bathroom was dirty. Not worth it. Iâ€™ve stayed at motels that were cleaner. The hotel was so loud.  The stairwell doors slam shut and vibrate the floor. Stay at the quality inn or  anywhere else near by and youâ€™ll have a better experience for cheaper.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
I've stayed at numerous Hyatt Regencys throughout the world. I've never stayed at such a filthy Hyatt. Far from the one in Bangkok.
Throughout the room you see long-term grime, dried unknown fluids on the floors, doors, doorknobs, cabinets, and counters!!
It's so obvious that nobody has deeply cleaned this room for months if not longer. The room smelled exactly like the damp scent I've experienced while staying on offshore fishing boats.
The soap dish is broken and sharp.
My colleague has empty beer bottles on the top shelf in her closet. Toothpaste on the bathroom walls near the mirror. The mirror is filthy as are the grimy glass shower doors.
There's pink mildew growing all over the shower tiles. The towels are the worst. Super thin and non-absorbent. The pillows are terrible and the mattress is too firm. The blanket was so thin it didn't feel luxurious in any way. Lastly, there was some brown liquid dried on the toilet lid.
Here for a conference and the bathrooms in the hall downstairs were equally dirty.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: My son took me on a trip to Savannah for my birthday. I can't begin to even explain how impressed I was with Hyatt Regency Savannah. When you pull up...valet and busboy. Check-in was seamless. The Christmas decor was gorgeous! Not tacky...very tasteful. The gym is the best gym I've seen in a hotel. The indoor heated pool was huge, and very clean. We had it to ourselves for nearly two hours. The room was immaculate! I e worked in the hotel industry...the housekeepers there don't skip any steps. I appreciate that. Within walking distance (some right across the street) were souvenir shops, breweries, pubs, restaurants... everything you need! Our view was a gorgeous clock tower on city hall. Sounds odd...but it was really beautiful. When we go back, we will be staying at Hyatt again. Well worth the price!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Tiffani at the front desk was awesome. You can't beat the views! Valet parking is a little high at $40/night. Walking distance to many restaurants. Lots of opportunities for a romantic walks. The hotel has a bar and restaurant.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We were in town for a leisure trip with the parents. We were given a corner room on the terrace floor that had views of the city on one side and the water on the other. Very spacious, clean and well appointed. Loved the walkability to everything in the river street and historic Square district. Great amenities. Parking was a bit pricey, but I preferred covered and secure valet as opposed to parking randomly on the street. Highly recommend the hotel.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great location on the river near lots of restaurants. Easy walk to many historical sites. Rooms are clean and modern/updated. I had a river view which was nice- I saw many cargo container ships go by which was cool.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great location leads the list of reasons to stay here. The hotel is beautifully done inside with fantastic common areas. There are great views to be had from both city view rooms as well as river view.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The staff at the Hyatt Regency Savannah was exceptional and went above and beyond to accommodate us. Everyone from the bellman and valets to the ladies (Sierra & Tiffani) at the front desk to Housekeeping (Digna) to the staff at the Moss & Oak especially Tena, Tuana, the kitchen cooks (breakfast buffet is delicious) and bartenders were kind, courteous and dedicated to ensuring that we had an outstanding experience. We are looking forward to staying at this Hyatt again soon.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Clean rooms, pleasant staff, great views of the river, bridge and river front shops from the Hyatt.  This is our "go to" place any time we are in Savannah.  It is very convenient to walk from the Hyatt to many tourist attractions in the area.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Would have lived to rate this hotel 5 stars, but the valet service was not up to par. The valet staff were friendly, but the processes seem to be broken or are not being managed. We stayed here while participating in a ballroom dance competition. Incredible location on the river and convenient walking distance to so many local attractions and must see places in Savannah. Beautiful hotel where the Front desk and maintenance personnel were super friendly and helpful.  Bar service was slow. Views from the roof garden and also the sun deck are worth the visit - even better that they are not super busy!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: I have came here with my friends and there Christmas  Spirit is through the roof I love it so much itâ€™s so pretty and donâ€™t even get me started with the  balcony view most definitely recommend
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We stayed here for 4 full days (12/18/21-12/21/21 and everything was so clean and beautiful in our room 322! During the evening we had a very nice view of the river and lights! In the morning across the river is not beautiful but not bad either. I actually loved the mornings drinking my coffee and watching the cargo ships come and go and other various boats.  The pool was nice, my son loved it. There was a problem with our refrigerator as it wouldn't stay colder than 40 degrees so we had to throw out our sandwiches.  The hotel comped one breakfast for us each so that was very nice.  Later I figured out that if you put ice in the ice bag and tie it, then place it into a laundry bag and place that inside the refrigerator- plus keep the cabinet door open to let heat escape- it kept the refrigerator at 35. We would put our leftovers ontop of the ice and it worked. Maybe if they take the cabinet door off that should allow the refrigerator sensor to adequately adjust ðŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸. But other than the refrigerator everything else was excellent.  Service, very friendly! I will stay here again.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great hotel. Friendly staff. Very clean. The rooms were quiet, (except when the guy decided to play his trumpet on the riverwalk. You could hear it on the six floor,  but running the fan helped to drown him out.) We paid for a river view, and it was worth every penny! Moon River was inspired here! Would definitely recommend. (View from our hotel room.)
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Thin Walls - We paid a decent price for our room on the top floor with Riverview. Not only did we hear the couple from next door enjoying themselves, but we felt the all the "rocking" in our bed as their movements transferred to us through the wall. The shared door probably didn't help the noise, but I've never felt bed movements through a wall before.

It was pretty disgusting. I called to request a transfer and was put on hold for ~10 minutes until the call dropped. I called again and was told that every room was taken. They offered for security to come and knock on their door but I declined. All things considered, our neighbors weren't being terribly loud or obnoxious. We just heard (and felt) all the "commotion". I don't necessarily blame our neighbors for cheap walls. Plus, a visit from security might encourage more noise/motion as retaliation.

I've stayed in several hotels and never made a google review. Wish I hadn't stayed in this one. I attached a photo to corroborate that I actually stayed on the top floor.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The Bar and Valet get 5 star they were amazing.  The rooms are nice large and updated..  This cleanliness of rooms n bathrooms could use attention. For Example dust on furniture n cabinets n bathrooms..  Dirty grout n shower.. Bathrooms mirror weren't clean previously guests..  One of my comforter sheets had been bleach to death and stain was still there .. Throw it Away!!  This rooms aren't cheap l expected more!!  I only gave a 4 Star do the valet and the bar staff!!!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We went to savannah for a weekend trip and we booked Hyatt regency for the trip. The check-in process was easy and loved the staff they have. They were friendly and ready to help the guests. The room we booked was the king room with a city view. The room was neat and clean and had all the essentials required for the trip. The hotel has a gym, pool, bar where different types of drinks are provided, they also have a small restaurant where one can get breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Hyatt regency is an amazing hotel and we loved our stay.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: I've stayed in a motel 6 that was better than this place. The hotel was nice, but the room was not worth $500 a night. Then $38 for "valet parking," but I had to go to the garage to pick my car up. I could have just parked in a public lot for all of that. The AC didn't work well. I turned it all the way down just to get the room to a comfortable temp. There was a chicken ball under the bed, as well as a random pill. Lastly, they put me in the handicap room where the door automatically stays open for about 1 min. Giving the hallway a full view of my room. This is the worst hyatt I have even seen. I'm truly disappointed in this!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hotel was in a great location on the river. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Housekeeping could have been better, the curtains were stained, the carpet could have been vacuumed better and the bathroom was very dusty.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: My wife and I had a very nice stop over here while traveling. The hotel has recently been updated and it's very well done. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. We had a river view room which was really nice. Watching the cargo ships go past while fully loaded is a neat thing as well as the rest of the boats doing their thing. This hotel is also right in the middle of everything happening on River Street. VERY convenient location when walking the shops and restaurants while enjoying the river front. This hotel should be highly considered when planning a trip to Savannah.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
The view to the city is really nice. The hotel is really beautiful inside. I loved the decoration. The gym is really good equipped and the pool is old but still nice. My main issue is the cleaning I was trying to dry my hair with the hair dryer and it's the most disgusting thing that I had ever seen in my life. I'm adding a picture I'm marking in a circle the scratch to the dirt that I did with my nail just to see the amount of ( i don't want to know what is it ).
I'm on room 652 if someone from the hotel wants to take a look to it.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hotel looks nice and clean.  There are seats for relaxing in many corners, delicious food, good service, beautiful rooms on the river.  complete facilities.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great view of the river walk.  Room and furniture were comfortable.  I don't understand why but the standard room service did not happen. Granted, the front desk did tell me about it at check in. But I don't feel like it should be necessary for me to call down for fresh towels
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Huge hotel, centrally located to everything we wanted to do on River Street. Near tons of things to see and do. Love the digital check in and out. Friendly and helpful staff. Bed was very uncomfortable. ADA rooms a bit far from elevator. Nice breakfast buffet. Parking (valet) expensive. Overall a great place to stay.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We stayed at the Hyatt to be central in our trip to downtown Savannah and it sure was. Everything we did was within walking distance. We used the valet parking and walked around our entire trip. The hotel is very large and the bar downstairs was good. The room had a balcony, but a super tiny one, just to stand and take in the scenes. You can see the boardwalk below and endless flow of river traffic as well as the bridge. The room was spacious and clean. I gave four stars for the price. I feel it was overpriced in relation to the view and type of room. Not sure why Google placed a figure of $137 on this review when I paid over $500/night ðŸ¤¦ðŸ»â€â™€ï¸ The staff were all meh ðŸ˜‘ no one stood out. From the valet to the front desk.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The view and location are amazing. The bar and valet staff were great. The room was dirty, the elevators were broken or slow and the front desk staff was rude at checkout. I have never had to carry my luggage down 4 flights of stairs in my life. We enjoyed watching the container ships go by, though.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Beautiful hotel. Really clean. The staff is incredibly accommodating and helpful. What I loved most was the lobby area, and the lounge spaces that overlook the river. Although our room also overlooked the river, my husband and I just sat and talked there for at least an hour. Valet is swift, but the location is in walking distance to almost everything. We had one very small hiccup which I wouldnâ€™t even mention here, but I only do so to tell you how amazing and caring management was to rectify it IMMEDIATELY. This establishment prioritizes their visitorsâ€™ experience from beginning to end. I will definitely stay here again.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
The good. We were on the river and had a great view. Location was great. Amenities were good. Receptionist were all nice and polite.
The bad. Room was just a little dirty. K-cup still in coffee pot. Some garbage left in the can. No coffee. When they came around to swap tows and refill the coffee we still had no coffee and we were 1 towel short. Valet parking is expensive.
I will stay again when we come back.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Property is gorgeous! The lobby - Wow factor. On-site restaurant is good and has an outdoor patio with a stunning view of the river. We stayed on the 4th floor because the rooms have a private access to the "garden terrace" (also with a stunning view facing the other view of the river). We had an issue on the 1st night of our stay. There was damage to the room (spring break). Manager Chloe went above and beyond to take care of the issue. When in Savannah, we will stay here again for sure!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Spent 3 nights here. It was a decent stay but due to the Covid restrictions we really couldn't take advantage of what the hotel offered. No room service which was disappointing.

Rooms were good sized, beds were comfortable although the pillows left a lot to be desired. Good water pressure in the shower but the bathroom products were a little boring. Good WiFi strength in the room.

The real value in this hotel is the location. It's right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to everything a person would need in Savannah.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great location right on the river.
We enjoyed the view from the public sitting room.
They offered us a free pack and play for our small travel companion and it came with some travel size goodies which I thought was a nice gesture (even though baby powder is a no go).
The room was modern, clean, and good overall.
The gym was great and the pool was good for a little swim (itâ€™s on the smaller side).
Staff at check in was friendly.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: What a beautiful lobby! The staff continued to showcase that Savannah charm and equally matched hospitality. The room was clean, spacious, and ready when we arrived. You can't ask for much more being in the heart of the historic district.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hotel is definitely at a great location but the service really made us mad. We changed room twice at midnight due to the malfunctioning heater (we had engineers check it but they cannot fix it). The front desk was super cold, never said sorry, didn't want to talk to you. Really no professionalism. Not recommended.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great location.  Inadequate housekeeping for a hotel of that standard and price.  A big pile of hair, yes indeed a pile, had been left in the shower drain.  Made me wonder if they had cleaned the bathroom at all.  Additionally, the main widow was completely smudged as if someone had applied a greasy face onto it.  We mentioned both issues to the front desk and the drain was cleaned up but not the window.  I ended up cleaning the window with a towel.  Another disappointment was the food options... Overpriced 7-inch pizzas for $16 per person, which fortunately tasted good, but $50 for 2 small pizzas and 2 beers... That's ridiculous.
Follow-up from management: received a reply that seemed like a "cookie cutter" apology.  I am attaching a picture of the note from housekeeping that was left in our room, I am assuming in hope of tips. My advice: focus on cleaning and skip the ridiculous notes.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great location right in the middle of the river walk with excellent access to the walkway.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.  The view of Savannah River from our room, as well as from the outdoor seating at the cafe bar was outstanding.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The lack of USB ports in the room are the only thing that kept me from rating this hotel at 5 stars.  The location was perfect for accessing the river walk and the city market was just two short blocks walk.  We will definitely stay here again!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Excellent location, clean, beautiful hotel, close to everything
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Traveling during a pandemic can be stressful, but the Hyatt Made me feel so comfortable!! They have a mask mandate and even Valet has to wear a mask.
The check-in was friendly and fast!
The lobby and general common areas were PRISTINE!
On to the room...AMAZING! The room was so clean and the view is to die for!! Its right on the river and I had two walls of windows! (1 of the river and 1 of River st.)
The bar...A+ !! I forgot the bartenders name but she was great! We went and sought her out for night two as well.
The entire hotel is relaxing. You now have to reserve The indoor pool so that only 1 group or family is in there at a time. You get 1hr. which was fine with me.
I will definitely be back!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Very nice hotel with excellent staff and service. Beautiful views of the river from the lobby lounge area. Saw a couple of huge container ships pass by up close and personal.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Absolutely amazing hotel! The people here are so friendly and helpful. It is right on the river and the views are Beautiful. Definitely worth the price for a river view. It was nice to see how safe they are here during COVID. There are plenty of restaurants near by, Including one in the hotel. Everything is within walking distance.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
If you're looking for a nice, clean, upscale hotel, located centrally to all attractions, this is your place.

The front desk is exemplary. Far exceeds your ideas for the best customer service, and truly takes care of you.

Their marketplace was also top notch. They have a variety of quality goods, from banana bread, bagels, candies, gourmet sandwiches with chips, variety of beverages/sodas, fresh hot coffee, and an entire freezer full of Savannah's best ice cream, Leopold's! (Sandwich kit is a lil pricey at $15, but it was good).

Also, when the Hyatt's computers went down, they were still able to handle and help customers. Really impressed with the level of care and the helpfulness. The valet was also pretty good. They lost my keys initially, but it was due to the system being down, and in a downpour, the valet ran my car to us. I would recommend this hotel over any other in the downtown area.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Beautiful hotel in the heart of  Savannah. Great river view with some of the rooms and easy access to all the restaurants and shops. We love it.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Stars for location, view, service, cleanliness, and... location again. We were literally dropped into the happenings of the Riverfront area in Savannah, GA. Our room and the hotel had amazing views! The hotel made the trip so enjoyable. Watching the river as we relaxed and popped in and out of the hotel when we wanted to was perfect.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Older facility, but clean and nice. Lobby is reminiscent of a cruise ship with the glass elevators. Had tv issues, but staff tried to fix it. Must have been provider issues. Our suite had a wonderful, big, L-shaped sofa that was super comfy. Wish there was a microwave in the suite, instead of down the hall and around the corner. Another phone would be nice, too. Only phone was in bedroom on far wall. Just a couple of suggestions. Very convenient location for downtown shopping and strolling. Would stay there again!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Beautiful hotel and rooms. We had the river view with balcony. And it's such a gorgeous location. Def recommend!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: I enjoyed staying here, beautiful views of the river and cargo ships. Also, the sunrises and sunsets were amazing from my room and the roof top deck.  The 4th floor garden deck is a wonderful place to relax after a day of meetings. If you room on that floor, you have access from your room (I didn't but it seemed like it would be a nice perk). There was easy access to the ferry to the conference center footsteps from the hotel.  The front desk staff was helpful and friendly.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Incredible customer service! Immaculately clean! Great location! Felt very covid safe! ALL staff were 100% fully masked . You reserve a 45 minute slot for the pool.. only 5 allowed in the pool area at a time. Gorgeous lobby! Great choice!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Nice food. I was a bit early in, about 5:15, but this is a weekend night, Sunday, and there was little server support. Later the bartender weighed in and saved the day. Nice! The food I got was the Buffalo Chicken Flat bread. It was good. The drinks were good. There are wonderful Hyatt hotel views of the Savannah River. This hotel is nice, open, and focused on excellent conference spaces. And even if you aren't seeking conference spaces, you'll likely enjoy this location on River Rd. Figure out the views you want within the hotel and reserve those room views. Nice place in a nice location with quiet, clean rooms.
On another night I got the blackened pimento cheese burger and it was AMAZING!!  Totally awesome!!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Absolutely wonderful hotel.

We stayed here for a drive from FL to Atlanta, and wanted a change of scenery instead of going up I75 again.

It's in an perfect location, on site valet parking is a bit pricey, but the Whitaker Street garage is a very short walk to the hotel and much cheaper to park at.

Walking along the river is quite nice too. Watching the ships is quite cool.

The sun deck on the 7th floor give a nice view of downtown Savannah, and the Garden Terrace on the 4th floor has a great view of the river with comfortable and quiet seating.

When we arrived we saw many signs for the Georgia Association of Realtors, so we were a little worried it'd be noisy, but it is dead silent in the room.

This is by far the quietest hotel room I've ever been in. In the hallway is quite a bit noisier, but in your room it's literally silent.

Even with someone above you, you can't hear them take a shower unless you are in the bathroom deliberately trying to hear it. It's fantasticly quiet.

The bathroom is fairly small, I will agree with those reviews, but it's not unreasonable at all.

In my opinion the only thing that gives away how old this hotel is are the elevators. They look so incredibly dated it's hilarious. The boxy glass elevators are in desperate need of modernization. One of the 3 are out of service for updates, but who knows when that will be done. There's enough reviews on here saying it's been in progress for a while. Only having two elevators was not a hindrance at all though.

The bar was pretty nice too, and the outdoor seating area has a great view of the river. I'd totally recommend the River Street Rendezvous cocktail. It's excellent if you like rum and pineapple juice.

Overall, I'd definitely stay here again. Hyatt continues to deliver on their legendary quality.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Our first experience in Savannah, and we loved the Hyatt Regency!

After checking with Google Maps, Expedia, and Priceline; we felt that the Hyatt Regency was our best choice!  Not only were their online ratings high, but the price was not to be best for the historic district!  It was centrally located, and within walking distance of so much!   We were only two blocks from Lady and Sons (Paula Deen's restaurant).  And in a very safe area, which was nice because once you get off the bridge the area is kinda shady.

I'm very funny about hotels.  I like staying in very nice hotels, and expect clean rooms, good customer service and convenience.  Hyatt was all that.

We were met by the valet as soon as we arrived, and I regret not getting his name, because he was such a cheerful fellow!   I think we chatted for a few minutes before he took our car.  Be mindful that the valet service is $38 a night though!  But unlike other parking downtown, we could retrieve our car was much as we wanted, even though we walked everywhere.

The front desk hostess was equally as polite, and we opted for a room upgrade to a king size, river front room.  The room was large, off the fourth floor, and spacious.  L shaped couch, spacious king size bed, beautiful bay window overlooking River Street and the channel.  The room was extremely clean, and the bathroom was equally as nice.  Loved the shower!

We had a wonderful weekend getaway, and just Hyatt Regency certainly made that possible.  When we return, they have our business!

Oh, as a note.  Even though room checkout was 11 AM, they valet parking allows you to keep your car there till 3 PM.   That was really convenient, since we decided Sunday morning to walk to breakfast and then do a little sightseeing.

â­â­â­â­â­
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great location by the river and conviniently located close to most downtown Savannah attractions. Very friendly staff responsive to most requests.
Nice rooms with river views.
Breakfast at the hotel was excellent (not included) with some items clearly labelled as gluten free.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Our window opened to an elevator so no window for us. Small, but clean bathroom. Pretty comfortable bed but no blanket or bedspread. Just sheets so felt a little...uncovered. Great location for walking about and carriage ride we booked picked us up right in front.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: What can I say - if you want a great view of the river, this hotel offers it. The staff was super friendly and gave the best suggestion for local eats. The hotel is an upper class style hotel which we don't usually stay at, so there were some nice perks we weren't accustomed to. Someone took our bags from the vehicle, to check in and up to the rooms (tips are customary). All vehicles are Vale parked (which incurs a cost). There is no late check-out option (something my family usually looks for... Mainly because I tend to enjoy sleeping in!). Regardless, it was a very elegant and comfortable hotel. My favorite part? The elevator requires your hotel key after 10 - nice feeling of an extra layer of security. The photos attached are the view from our room.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: No room service due to Covid.  Staff are great.  Breakfast staff are super!  You don't know until you check in that they have to valet your car.  $39 plus tips a day.  Location close to everything.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Really nice hotel, I was here for business for 2 days, got a room on the sixth floor with a view of the Savannah river, beautiful lobby, nice pool and gym.
Definitely coming back here next time
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Beautiful hotel with a great staff on the Riverwalk.  We met friends who were staying at this hotel and enjoyed drinks and snacks before going out on a cruise. Based on the experience in the lobby and bar I would definitely stay at this hotel on a future trip
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great views of the River if you upgrade your room. The conference rooms are nice and keep the noise down from the adjoining rooms.

The bedrooms are clean, but the staff won't have most of the rooms done until late afternoon.

Signs are posted saying quiet hours are 10 pm to 7 am. The noise in the center area carries to the rooms and it was loud every night until around 1:30 am.

There are better options in the area and I was sad to see this was only slightly above an adequate hotel.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: I had a very good experience at this location.  Chloe and Tezuilla ( I am so sorry if I misspelled her name) but, the two of them was great. I felt like the two of them showed that they cared about allowing me to check in early and having my rooms together,  they showed they was willing to work with me for an easy check in. Now, Mary was a different story, her customer service was not inviting. I wanted to see about scheduling pool time and she wanted to give me what she wanted me to have but, I had to stop her to ask what are the times for the pool. Second,  thing happened with checking out. I told her that a charge on one of my room was not mines.  She acted as if I was trying to lie about a charge but, she reluctantly took it off and never said have a good day or safe travels.  She just said next person. The hotel is beautiful on the river side. I was able to see the ships comes in all day. The hotel was cleaned with great housekeeping service. I would definitely stay at this location again.  I forget to mention that they do practice covid with the masks and space. I love how this hotel is right on the riverstreet.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: This hotel has 6 story lobby courtyard in the center of the hotel. Be advised the rooms facing the lobby do not have views to the outside. Right on River St so it's very convenient. Overall the hotel is very good condition. The view from room 605 was amazing!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
This was an absolutely perfect hotel! The Hyatt is very classy, and located right on the river. The room we stayed in had a balcony, and river view, and they were perfect. The room was clean and spacious and very classy; it was just what one would expect from the name Hyatt.
I have provided a photo form the balcony view and the room we were staying in, on the 7th floor.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: I had a great time good food great view awesome service
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Nice hotel! Great breakfast buffet.  I wish our room attendant did a better job cleaning before we got there. I guess the previous guest taped there hair to the shower handle to help flag the possible  incompetence of the cleaners.  I sometimes make sure I leave a little makeup stain to help assure that the next guest gets clean sheets, pillowcases and towels.

Nice view of the Savannah  River
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great hotel, great location at a very reasonable price. Beautiful river view from our room  During this covid times, we felt completely safe and taken care of. Will definitely book again.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Rooms were nice and so we're the convention facilities.  Almost all the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  Had a small problem at check in when I was given the wrong type of room and had to drag my luggage up and down several times, after a long day of travel across the country.  Also, on my first day it appeared as though housecleaning had not cleaned my shower at all.  Ever ything else was terrific!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Beautiful hotel, very well located, comfortable accommodation, just too expensive.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great Hotel, the only issue is that when you book and you expressly request a "River view" they will agree, confirm, and process your payment. Once you arrive, nobody will know anything about the room, the  request, or anything else. The reservation will be there, but no specifics, or notes. And there will be no refund.
Oh and they also don't have breakfast.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: From the valet attendants to the nice and friendly individuals checking us in we felt welcomed.  The view from our room was gorgeous. The food was another great treat. I can't wait to book another stay at the Hyatt Regency.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Very nice hotel. Centrally located to everything by the river in Savannah. Only giving it 4 stars because if you don't pay the 40 dollar valet parking, then you have to park in a public parking garage that charges and its about 2 blocks away. A minor inconvenience.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The restaurant is great. The food delicious and beautifully presented. The valet/garage service is very accommodating (Ask for Barbara, she is terrific) Great place for a conference and convenient location. But the housekeeping was the worst ever. They did not clean the tub or the sink and I had to call after the second day due to poor cleaning...but that didn't help at all. Despite that it was a nice hotel. Note: Few rooms have windows that face outside. Most look into the hotel.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Hotel and rooms are very nice. Large lobby area with views of the waterfront. Rooms are nice with lots of special touches. Staff were pleasant. Only parking available was valet. The area the hotel is in was very lively. It was fun to walk around and check out.  Getting a good night's sleep was challenging due to the hearing everything from neighboring rooms, the passerbys outside when the bars closed, and the cargo ships going down the waterway.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We stopped at this particular hotel because Google reviews confirmed that the pool was indoor, heated, and OPEN! Most of the areas hotelâ€™s pools were not open due to COVID (bit wasnâ€™t advertised outside of peopleâ€™s reviews). This place is wonderfully located with many restaurants and drinkeries about.  Highly recommend if you want to swim in and warm indoor pool.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Wonderful location but the housekeeping staff needs to step up their game. I've been cleaning with Sodexo at several different places around the country. With that said, management you need to round your staff more because at a Regency this is unacceptable. (See attached pictures)
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Wonderful riverfront hotel in the Savannah Historic District. Close to everything!  Great service, amenities and staff.  Valet parking ($35/day) or self park a block or two away. Restaurant food was ok - limited menu. Views and outdoor spaces were awesome!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Pros:
Service staff other than the front desk was amazing
Food was awesome
Beds were comfortable
Gym setup was spot on

Cons:
Too musky and humid feeling inside the whole building
Vending machines malfunctioning
Front staff was very short with people
Too pricey for accommodations
Pool wasn't worth it
No microwaves in rooms
Elevators were sketchy and not working with ZERO ventilation

I think the bell staff was AMAZING and gave great suggestions for hot spots and restaurants. I felt they went above and beyond.Â  Along with the restaurant staff they had during the breakfast.Â  The gym facility was also a plus as you don't find many hotels that dedicate that much money to health amenities. Not to mention the cooling towels,Â  that was a nice touch! Beds were very comfortable too and clean.

As far as the stay goes I believe it was lacking significantly especially for overÂ $200Â a night for a room with no view and for what was advertised online.Â  The air quality in the building all together was humid and sticky feeling the whole stay.Â  The elevator air was MISERABLE! The bathrooms in the rooms have no ventilation to move air when showering.

Numerous elevators were broken and unusable on a consistant basis to where I felt the need to take the stairs as a safety precaution not to mention with the fire alarms going off (I understand they might not have the ability to control fire alarms).Â  The mini fridges could only hold a few items and there was no microwave except for one we found 2 floors below us.Â  The vending machines also seemed to be malfunctioning as we had family choose water and it gave them a soda.

The breakfast served was AMAZING! The peach pound cake was out of this world!  Again the staff's hospitality... they were 100% Johnny on the spot. But with such pricey rooms I don't understand why there isn't a complimentary breakfast or to charge a lower amount.

The pool downstairs was also another area that was overly elaborated on the website and in person, was a complete let down...it was murky looking with high chlorination and not much to work with when more people got in (10 people was pushing space).

Upon our departure we called the front desk to have a cart brought up to take out our luggage,Â  we were told it would just be a minute and they would take care of it (this was really the only staff I don't feel weren't so welcoming). After 30 minutes of waiting we looked out into the lobby to see if it was busy because it was around check in time and there were NO lines.Â  My mother went downstairs and spoke to a bellboy about getting a cart and he had no idea someone was waiting for one to be brought up.Â  Again bellboy hospitality was spot on! He even clarified the quickest directions to get us home.

I also want to mention the cleaning staff... although we did not encounter them taking care of our room, everytime I passed someone in the hallway they were smiling and saying hello. This was our first time to Savannah and while being leery in new places I must say we felt like we were welcomed there as though we were family stopping in for a visit.Â  I just wish the hotel amenities were more up to the standards they present online. This was our first time staying in a Hyatt hotel as Hilton has been my #1 go to for years and venturing out has shown why I have been loyal to their hotel...

It's unlikely that I would stay here again, but if I did it would only be due to how awesome their service staff treated usðŸ˜Š!!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great experience! Very nice staff, rooms have been recently updated, Libby is also nice! Not a better view of Savannah than from the sun deck; we also had a great view of the Talmadge bridge from our room.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: This hotel had the perfect view of the river and was in a great location. I stayed here for an on-site conference, and the customer service, facilities and food were top notch. I would highly recommend this hotel for your conference needs. This view is from the terrace which is a great spot to unwind after a long day.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: First time here, love it! Rooms are classy, but modern. This is the view of the river. They have a lot of lounge areas, which is great for larger groups. Located right off River, so it has all the food access around.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Nice hotel, horrible house keeping.
On our second night of our stay I pulled back the sheets to discover a dip / spit stain. And by staying I don't even really mean stain I just mean a nasty marking that could have most likely been laundered away .on the mattress pad that was not from me or my husband so it had been there when we started our stay. I had unfortunately noticed that the room wasn't very clean upon checking in and just chalked it up to bad housekeeping but this was beyond acceptable.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Very clean; great location- right beside the river and right above the River Walks. Better price than similar hotels in the area. Small rooms though; paid $31 for valet parking; $30 to upgrade to a river view room; $19 per person for breakfast.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Very nice hotel along the river. It would have been nice to have a river view but the best part of our visit came at breakfast. A bit of river traffic. A first for me (see photos). All in all a nice, quiet hotel with very nice accommodations.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We go here once a year and were so disappointed. We have never had a problem  checking in a little  early, but this time they said room wasn't ready. No problem. Walked by the river  & came back at 4 (check in time). Still not ready. Offered to comp us an appetizer or cocktail. Got one cocktail each and waited for them to contact us. 5:40 We were able to check in. We met the couple next door on the balcony and they had same problem. Just a shame because we loved coming here until  this.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The rooms are a bit stuffy and dark and it's weird that "during Covid we can't have glasses brought to your room" but they use glasses in the bar. The view from our room was beautiful, though!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Beautiful hotel, great location.

Everything costs something and parking is an additional $30.00.

Itâ€™s a $200.00 per night hotel. I didnâ€™t appreciate the petty charges - breakfast not included.

Rooftop view of the city.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: One of the best hotels I have ever stay on. I was able to book a room with a river view and on the 5th floor, I also enjoy having an indoor pool and the sun deck ðŸ™ŒðŸŒžand the garden deck were some great amenities! I highly suggest a stay in this Hyatt have some of the best views of the city in the heart of the historic district.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The rooms are great..the views of the river are amazing ..!! The only complaint is the valet personal has a lot room to improve very unprofessional
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Bathroom was full of mold and rotten wood. Restaurant staff was not attentive, took over 15 minutes for the server to greet us after we were seated. After 30 minutes of not taking our order the manager took over and served us.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Very nice hotel right on Riverstreet. We had a corner room wIth great views. But corner rooms only have a stand up shower, no tub which I didn't like.
Very beautiful lobby & atmosphere. I think the bar could be updated to measure up to the rest of the hotel. But great rooms & friendly staff & excellent location!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
On arrival Jan.25, 2019 valet was a lil hectic around 5pm but check in went smoothly. Valet is $30.00 per day I think rather you move your vehicle or not.. We arrived and let a family member picked us up each day. So our truck just stayed parked.

We had  booked 2 king size riverview rooms. $424.46 each for 2 nights. You can see the Queen Mary right outside of our window. The room was nice and spacious. The bed was so comfortable. The elevator came quickly. There's a restaurant on site. The hotel is just absolutely beautiful.

You can hear the barge when it comes by early in the am it blows a loud horn.

You can exit the building and go right onto River Street. We went for a night scroll with everyone else out and enjoyed the night life. Thanks Hyatt
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Beautiful hotel! The bed was comfortable and everything was clean. All the staff were exceptionally nice. They were polite and friendly. Great view of the river.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Stayed here for the 4th of July week. Not a bad drive from here to Tybee island, about 30 minutes one way. Everyone seemed to enjoy their job or acted well. You can always tell the one or two ppl who don't want to be at work, but they still were helpful. The gym and pool are below the lobby are seem nice. Plenty of workout equipment and never crowded. Too many restaurants to choose from and the food was awesome! My wife and I did the breakfast at the hotel every morning with our daughter for the convenience. It cost around 20ish per person. There's a horse carriage ride pick up right outside the front entrance. So everything seemed really close to this hotel and if you stay on July fourth book a hotel room facing the westin hotel. We had a perfect view of the fireworks with perfect 72 degree ac weather. All in all a great experience and we will definitely be back next year!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: My husband and I vacationed in Savannah for July 4th.  We stayed at the Hyatt from June 30 to July 5. From the time we arrived til we left the customer service was excellent. The valets, restaurants servers and the front desk were all great. They also help you purchase tickets for the trolley tours. The hotel is very nice and we had a riverview room and watched the cargo ships pass by and the fireworks on the 4th. They have an elevator that takes you down to River St. The only con was breakfast wasn't included in the price. The buffet was $19.95, but it is very delicious.  Also you pay an extra $30 per day for parking and its not optional. Overall staying here made our vacation so much more awesome. I would definitely stay here again and hopefully soon.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Amazing hotel with first class service. Can't wait to visit and stay at the Hyatt Regency Savannah again!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Hotel lobby was awesome, as well as the room view of the river! However the room was not clean to match the price point & advertisement! Rooms Definitely need some renovation!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Went for just the weekend. Absolutely loved the staff and the hotel. The views out of hotel are great. It seemed like just about everything was in walking distance. The only thing I was not a super fan of was the restaurant, but it was still good, just not as good as they charged. Btw the art is beautiful.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great hotel. Right on River St. Definitely would recommend. The staff were there to accommodate every step of the way. Only issue being they were doing a lot of remodeling but that is to be expected to improve.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Wonderful Experience! Friendly, attentive, & helpful staff! Very clean rooms, wonderful view of the Savannah River! Every staff member is very quick to address any concerns or needs. Hyatt Recency Savannah's goal is clearly 110% Customer  Satisfaction! My family had a SUPERB 4 day/3 night stay. You truly get what you pay for! Will definitely stay here again! :)
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hotel has done some upgrades, but the room furniture is very used, small bathroom and it could be cleaner. Great location to River St.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hospitality of the staff Charles, Martha & Chloe were top notch. I've stayed at a few Hyatt locations and by far this location has been the best! My husband and I will always stay here when we come to Savannah...no matter what! Kudos to this staff!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great place to stay! Convenient cause it's right on the river walk. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and clean. Tje staff are very nice and the service is great! This is our sunrise from our room â¤
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We attended an event the Savannah Ballroom Classic at the Hyatt. Even though the facility was renovated a few years ago, it is incredibly well maintained. Light, bright and spacious in the Commons areas; grab-n-go was well stocked with healthy snacks, mini-meals and the standard convenience foods. Surprisingly, there was a thoughtful emphasis on Savannah foodie specialties and GeorgiaGrown treats, condiments and drygoods. The ballroom set up was tastefully prepared and catering staff were on top of the meals that were part of the competition specialty package. The entrees served were creative and beautifully presented. The restrooms were clean and well stocked. Every interaction with hospitality staff was terrific, a vast improvement on years past.  Although we did not stay overnight, our experience as a day guest was terrific. I would have rated the review a five-star, however the internet, even as a guest, was slow and glitchy; same as last year.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Every one is nice and go out if their way to ensure the guest are happy and enjoying their stay.   Restaurant food is great.  Very busy due to storm...but the staff including leadership stepped up and made sure everyone was served timely
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Excellent place to stay in Savannah if you want to be in the middle of the sights an views.
It can be expensive, Parking a $39 a day add. The rooms with a river view were worth an up charge.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Very good older hotel right on the river. Very well maintained and rooms have been upgraded.  Staff is excellent and the location is perfect.  There are rooms facing the river, facing the city or facing the interior atrium the hotel.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: House keeping not at all up to Hyatt standards. These are vents in the closet of the room i stayed in.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great customer service.  Clean rooms. Great buffet.  Beautiful views of the river.
Excellent across the board.

text: The team at the Hyatt Regency Savannah truly went above and beyond to make our stay accommodating and enjoyable. Jason, Cloe, Dre, and Tequila were fantastic! Thanks for all your hard work in this crazy covid times! We sincerely appreciate it!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Very nice place in a very good and convenient location... ride the (silver) elevator in the lobby down to access river street and walk right out on to the street... or walk out the front doors to many shops and places to eat... of you like walking around in a very neat, historic and charming town... this is your place!!

text: Wonderful place to stay but the pool is in an area with no open areas so the chlorine is very over powering.

text: Great place to stay your in the middle of everything straight out the hotel to the river walk
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: So I love Hyatts and are even Hyatt members (but am not necessarily brand loyalist) and thought how can we go wrong with staying here especially with the location. Well other than the location, I have to say for a Hyatt we were disappointed. To begin with we upgraded our room to get a water view with a bacolony. Being a member and having the app it allows you to upgrade the day or two before your reservation. Well, our room was ready early but it wasn't the right room we paid extra for. ðŸ˜’ it was a water view from the side of the building (oh I see what they did there that's sneaky) but where is my damn balcony. To make matters worse every time I went down to deal with it at the front desk there was a huge line and only 1-2 people working the front desk ... Which seems a little short staffed considering its such a huge hotel on the weekends. I would always just give up and resolve to come back later. A couple times I tried calling on the phone and no one would even answer the phone just pick up the phone and hang it up. ðŸ˜¡. The major problem we had was the Valet service. SLOW, SLOW, SLOW. Again, because they are often parking your cars off site (we were told this by the actual staff) they DON'T have ENOUGH PEOPLE WORKING. I had read the reviews and peioke griping about the valet so I told me husband hey call about 20-30 min before we need our car. We would get the phone call to our room "please proceed down to valet your car will be ready in 5 min" and THEN STILL WAIT ANOTHER 15-20 MIN. This is ABSOLUTELY unacceptable especially when they are charging you $30/night and MANY other hotels in the city that are just as expensive are free or not nearly the cost. I dont mind paying, don't get me wrong I actually love the convenience of valet.... But DAMN you better get that service locked down because it is making your hotel look like ammature hour! Just because the inside is nice and reflects a Hyatt chain doesn't mean you can SKIMP on customer service because the word will get out and the Hyatt Brand will come calling. End of rant.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great rooms,nice staff but you would think they would have parking for guests,let me rephrase that,they do but $38.00 a night.(valet parking only).you must park on the street or public parking garages.
