text:
This park is excellent.   Itâ€™s well laid out, plenty of guides into the caves.  Trails are very well maintained.  Dog friendly, and lots to explore.

Was a gorgeous place to see the fall color.  I really want to leave more time to do the longer trail here, only thing I noticed is one trail smelled like a septic system on a portion that wrapped just below the cabins.   I bet the water dripping from the rocks there was sewage.

But other than that this place is excellent.  Next time Iâ€™ll check the lodge out.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Went to Carter Caves to watch the magician Mike and dinner for Valentines.  I highly recommend.  The dinner was booked by tables, you went downstairs by tables then to the buffet so there was no mad rush or long lines.
The buffet was great and had three entree choices, chicken, prime rib and something else.  A good sale, mashed taters, Brussels sprouts, green beans and rolls were other choices.  The desert bar had chocolate candies, strawberries covered in chocolate, cupcakes, banana pudding and a chocolate cake so yummy.
Mike the magician made the event interactive and the made the night fun.  I laughed until my jaws hurt.  We had a good time.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Another great Kentucky State Park. Food was excellent in the dining room. Lodge is starting to show its age a bit. Comfortable beds and good water pressure.

Cascade Cave tour was very interesting and educational.

Try all the trails. Each one is a unique adventure.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: I recommend staying here, the lodge is beautiful and the rooms have comfortable beds, coffee makers, every room has a deck overlooking the forest. The trails are all close by, some just feet away from the lodge. The visitor center has something for everyone.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Carter Caves Campgrounds State Park Adventure. We stayed at the campground this December in our Toy Hauler TT for five days.
They have 33 miles of hiking trails. 5 caves for exploring a 3 Natural Bridges that are spectacular. The campgrounds have full to primitive hookups. No water in the off season they do have electric. 20-30-50 amp. Two large bathhouses which one is open souring off season. Play grounds and a put put mini golf. Ice machines store is open during the offseason.

Welcome lodge is very nice itâ€™s also where you will need to get permits for cave exploring.

Dogs are allowed on trails but not the caves. 2 people minimum to explore.

2000 acres of exploring with a small lake for fishing.
Must definitely a beautiful place anytime of the season.

#camping  #cartercaves   #stateparks   #kentuckycaves
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
This place was exceptional. Everyone was extremely friendly. The food from the resturant was delicious. I missed breakfast but dinner was great.

And all the activities at the Resort. The trails are well marked. It is all dog friendly. They do cave tours. I went in the off season  and was told about all the stuff they offer in the busy season.

I 100% recommend and I will definitely be visiting again.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Absolutely beautiful. Room was clean, comfy and had a huge private balcony with chairs. Staff at Lodge, restaurant and visitors center were beyond fantastic, so helpful, above and beyond friendly and knowledgeable. By far one of the best places we've stayed at for a very long time. We will be returning.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
So it's very confusing but we stayed at the Carter Caves Campground not the resort or cabins.
We arrived one day early figured we would try our luck. We were met on the office by a disinterested kid. Once we got through that, we discovered that our sight #8, had the electric pedestal aprox 75' from the site.
We returned to the office and were moved to sight #3. Once we backed in, we discovered that the electric pedestal had 20 or 50 Amp. No 30.
Back again and moved into #6. It worked but I had to back all the way to the end of the pad and my power cord just made it.
Water took two hoses to reach and had to wrap to the opposite side of the camper.
We had a nice view but the picnic table was not usable due the the slope.
The showers were ok but the curtain bottom was covered with mold.
Overall a busy Campground, dogs and some guy in a tow truck that liked to let everyone know he had an air horn.
The park overall was beautiful and the hiking was great!
Just be warned to really look over the registration as it's not your typical campgroud.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This park is a great place to visit. The caves are just one part of the experience. They have a lake here for fishing or just paddling around. There are many nice hiking trails to explore. All are well kept and clean. The cave tours are very interesting and informative.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Awesome park!! Gotta see all the trails that lead to amazing cavesâ¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ This lil fox paid us a visit~ he was so very friendly. He was looking for some snacks, but we didnâ€™t give him anything ðŸ˜‰
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: A great place if you love the outdoors. 30 miles of hiking, rock climbing and repelling, biking, kayaking, awesome cave tours, horseback riding and nature lovers. Campground packed on weekends in summer but quiet midweek. Outer edge sites woodsy and most are a decent size.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Plan to come early, caves require a permit, they are free of charge.  The best things to see are on the trails  But several attractions are near the road.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This was a great trip.  The lodge was well priced and we enjoyed the room.  It could use some updating but nothing that would deter our stay.  A lot of hikes to go on and cave tours.  We did two cave tours and they were both a lot of fun.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: An amazing vacation!  The lodge was very nice and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The park is one of the most beautiful places I have ever seen. The cave tours were educational and awesome. Everyone in our group had a wonderful time, and we can't wait to go back. In fact, we started planning our return visit before we even left.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Wow such a nice area!  KY State Parks are a real treat. Nice amenities, so much to do and see. Highly recommend. Folks are incredibly nice and helpful.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Decided to explore Carter caves and found a beautiful park along a beautiful drive through green forest canopy. Park had many spots to go and see, and cave tours were reasonably priced ($8-10 for adults). We took the Cascade tour and enjoyed how our guide took her time explaining history, cave formation, and the flora and fauna of the caves. Time and money well spent, will definitely come back!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Incredible caves and caverns. We arrived late to the park and we're only able to tour 1 of the many caves. This place has so much to offer for families but definitely bring a comfortable pair of hiking shoes. I will be coming again to spend a week camping at the Carter Caves Resort on my next vacation. There are endless photo spots. Kudos to the state of Kentucky for this state park.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Beautiful place - pristine. Lots of caves to visit for free or small charge. We did Cascade Cave interesting especially where the connecting part of the cave has fallen a d the waterfall worth the small admission price. While there we did the 3/4 mile Box Canyon hike such a cool huge rock formation and squeeze bridge to enjoy. Also did the 1/2 mile natural bridge- that was spectacular!!  Great way to spend a day. Much much more to do there if you have more time
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We had a great time at Carter Caves. The cabin was spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a covered deck. The hiking is great. We really enjoyed the cave tours. Spent one afternoon at the pool which is free for cabin guests.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
The rooms are great. Occasional ant, fly etc.- but you should expect that in a lodge near woods. The room felt clean. The balcony is wonderful. Only thing I missed was my pillows. Their pillows are not the greatest. So you may want to bring your own. We were there on a weekday, so the restaurant didn't stay open as late. But we were still able to order pizza and have it delivered. Tyler's Pizza is AMAZING. You have access to the campground pool. We didn't do this though. The food we had at lunch in the lodge restaurant was great. The waitress was a very charming, young blonde. Very sweet.
The cave tours were super easy to sign up for. Took like 2 mins. We took the Cascades tour and we were fortunate to get to do the Ghost and Legends tour which was a lantern tour of the Saltpeter Cave (a portion) and the X Cave by Mason. The lantern tour was SUPER cool. Highly recommend. Wish there was a way to tip your tour guides. They do great. We also took a hike on the 3 bridge trail. (3.8 miles I think)
Beautiful scenery. Wish there were markers saying how much further you had. It's hard to keep track when you have a tour later in the day.  Overall, this is good for a day/ 1 overnight trip. We did everything we wanted to do almost in a day. The park is well taken care of. If we had stayed another night, boredom could set in. So I recommend this for a quick, short getaway.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: They have a beautiful little lake. It looks a little run down as some of the buildings are just left sitting empty. We picked up a lot of trash kyaking around. But it was a pretty calm little lake.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We camped here, went in three of the caves, and hiked a ton of the trails. I highly recommend it all. The caves were cool, but especially the Horn Hollow cave that we got a permit to explore. The trails, except the old golf course, were beautiful. Make sure you find and explore around all the arches on the map.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: One of the absolute best experiences I have ever had in a state park!  Their trails are true nature trails  Do not expect to walk on paved paths in most areas. They have self Explore caves which are amazing short experiences.  You do have to go get a permit to enter these areas but there is no charge and it is only for your safety.  Extremely dog friendly!!!! I will be coming here annually. This is definitely my new family vacation spot.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We had a great time here. There are miles and miles of hiking trails and Horse trails.  We took a cave tour that was a lot of fun. It took about an hour ND was more of a historical tour but they have several to choose from.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This place was way more than we expected. We loved it so much we added an extra day! Very pet friendly. The trails were gorgeous. We stayed in the lodge, but next time we are going to try the cottages. The only negative...housekeeping knocked on our door early both mornings. This set off our coonhound. We were already up. So it wasn't too bad, but if we were sleeping in it would have been irritating. That being said....we can't wait to go back!!!!!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Wow! What a great place! Everything was outstanding.  The camp host has the responsibility of keeping the entire campgrounds clean, including restrooms.  They did a fabulous job and very attentive to guests.  So many amenities in this park including activities.  Most everything has an extra charge.  Swimming pool is huge and very clean. Life guards are a little rude,  but they're young college kids. The tour guide for caves is very knowledgeable as well as the tour guide for canoeing.  The hiking trails are great.  Not a lot of fishing spots, but a few.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This has been a special place in my family for as long as I can remember!! Always so much to do, beautiful trails to walk and playground for the kids and those still kids at heart!! A Great place to take your family
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This is obviously a much smaller cave system and park than mammoth caves.  However mammoth caves while impressive due to size doesn't really have quite as much cave feel to it because of that size... That being said these are not claustrophobic caves that make you crawl on your hands and knees it's just most areas are closer to a standard hallway with larger rooms scattered here and there.  I enjoyed this trip more than I thought.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Camped here for four days. beautiful park, great hiking.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We had a great time here! The first staff members we interacted with were at the park store and they helped us get set up with a cave tour and answered all of our questions. Chelsea our cave tour guide was awesome and informative! Our room in the lodge surprised us by how clean, spacious, and updated it was. Beautiful balcony with pretty views of the trees! The girl working the front desk was very sweet and friendly, as was our waitress at the lodge restaurant. The food was great there too! 5 stars for this beautiful state park, and you can tell that the people who work there really enjoy it, atleast that was our experience.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Awesome park. The guided caves are cool, the unguided caves are cool, the trails are cool, the land bridges are cool, and just the overall place is just fun to be around. I stayed in the cottages, and they are nice for one big or two small families. Well kept. Definitely recommend.

If you come, make sure to check out Horn Hollow cave. Thereâ€™s a short little crevice near the main entrance of the cave, and if you follow that, it narrows and narrows. Prepare to be crawling on your stomach in an underground creek. Youâ€™ll need to be pretty narrow and pretty flexible (Iâ€™m 6â€™ and 180 lbs. and I made it though with some difficulty). It goes back a good 200 feet, until it opens up on this huge underground waterfall fueling the creek. Itâ€™s almost as big as the one in Cascade. Iâ€™m not sure if this water fall is well-known, but itâ€™s well worth the difficulty of reaching it. If youâ€™re up for an adventure, I highly recommend it.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
We stayed in a cabin for two days twice this spring. We enjoyed the cabins. They are showing their age, but they were clean for the most part. They were working on the entry ramps to some of the cabins while we were there. That is a good sign.

The restaurant in the lodge was very, very good. We enjoyed our meals there.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Such a fun place! Tons of trails of varied difficulty. It's a lot better in the summer than fall/winter because leaves obscure the trails so it's easy to go the wrong way in the colder seasons. You'll need a caving permit to actually explore the caves or take one of the guided tours. We really like the amount of trails you can go to and there's enough open space that you don't feel like you're hiking right on top of another group.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: My nephew and I just went for his very first camping trip. The camp grounds were quiet and peaceful, the trails were beautiful, and he declared that he had the best two days of his life (he's6). Ms. Haley gave us a private tour (because no one else signed up for the Tuesday 10am X-Cave trip) and she did a great job with him! He astounded me by telling his mom and dad just about every single thing she taught him on that tour! She definitely kept his attention expertly. Thank you!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: What a great Park! After living in KY for 6+ years and realizing we had never been to this state park, we decided it was past time to check it out... and I'm so glad we did! The lodge rooms are a bit dated, but clean with private porches overlooking the trees. The hiking trails and cave tours are AWESOME, though. No pictures can do these justice. We checked out both X-Cave and Cascade Cave, as well as a couple different trails. It was a bit rainy / cloudy when we visited, so we'll definitely be back to do more hiking when the weather is better!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Nice, quiet place to visit. There's a campground, miniature golf, and in the summer, a swimming pool. And of course there's hiking trails, and don't forget the cave tours. We stay in the lodge, but there are nice cabins available.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: What a great place to camp!  We stayed late November for the weekend and it was just perfect!  Quiet and clean campground.  Hot water shower.  I will definitely be back to take advantage of the trails, caves, riding, and climbing!!!!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We really enjoyed the X-cave and Cascade cave tours. My 10 and 9 year old sons preferred the X cave as their favorite   due to it being narrower and trickier to navigate through. Made them feel like real explorers, and they got to get closer to the rock formations. We also enjoyed the hike to Natural Bridge. A little secret we discovered... if you walk down to the creek behind the welcome center and follow it about a quarter mile downstream, you'll find where the creek passes into a cave through the mountain side. Bring a flashlight because there are no tour guides waiting to take you through this one.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Beautiful cottage with a beautiful view. It was an amazing experience, and the cottage was extremely clean. The guest services folks were super friendly and helpful. We can't wait to come back!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: The access road is narrow and winding with nonexistent shoulders in places. The campsites are good sized and most have shade. There are a lot of amenities including a riding stable, cave tours, and a putt putt golf course. The utilities are oddly set up with one power pole for two sites with one 50 amp and 2 30 amp outlets. The power poles are also somewhat randomly places so depending on the site you will need an extension cord.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: I love this place. I had the best tour we were almost late. I didnâ€™t schedule anything ahead of time. Very knowledgeable our female guide was. I told her she could just run us through the cave. See I didnâ€™t want to take up all her time however she insisted that everything was ok. She loved the fact that we were interested in spelunking. #Besttourever
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Great place to stay,eat and explore. Wonderful and kind staff.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Great hiking trails and a nice creek well suited for little kids to play in.  Cascade Cave was a nice distraction from the heat.  The lodge is in good condition but could use some increased maintenance.  The restaurant needs a swift kick in the butt.  Slow service marginal quality food.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: My family had a great time tent camping here Memorial Day weekend. Tons of interesting and beautiful nature to see and explore. Campground was clean and quite all staff interactions were friendly. Mini golf looked fun though we didn't play. Nice pool and good hiking trails. We plan to go back again sometime.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We stayed 3 nights in the lodge. Although it is older, they have made some updates. It met my expectations for the price. The room had a nice sized refrigerator but no microwave. There is so much to do in this area. From hiking trails, kayaking, putt putt golf, swimming pool and horse trails.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Carter Caves State Resort Park is one of the crowning jewels in the Kentucky State Park system. The hiking is truly awesome, the fishing is vastly underrated and the staff, from the front desk, the kitchen, housekeeping and park employees all work hard to insure your stay is enjoyable.

You'll find natural rock arches, massive caves (some which you can explore self guided), a couple waterfalls, trails for every skill set, a boxed canyon and enough wildlife to have you googling what kind of bird you just seen. (It was a bright red and black Scarlet Tanager for me.) In the summer, they have a nice pool with a diving well.

With capable leadership from Park Manager Chris Perry, Carter Caves State Resort Park is poised to deliver good times and millions of memory making moments for all who are wise enough to visit.

I loved my visit and I love the people working at CCSRP. My advice is take a few days and visit. You'll be glad you did.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Always a wonderful trip here! We made tie dyed shirts and bandanas. We did a tour with Lauren, she is amazing by the way! Overall just a great te making even better memories
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Park is beautiful and well maintained. If hiking and you start the 3 bridges trail loop across from welcome center, go left. That way you will walk down all the stairs to Fern Bridge and to Smokey Bridge. If you go right to smokey bridge first you will have to walk up all the stairs! Trail is shaded and beautiful.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Camped here for 4 days. Had an absolute great time. Lots to do from mild to adventurous. They keep the park in excellent shape even weedeating the trails. Some activities can get a little expensive with large families, but its not something you do everyday and there's enough free things to do to make the difference. 2 things keep it from a 5 star rating. 1. THE SHOWERS WERENT CLEANED THE ENTIRE TIME WE WERE THERE. 2. They need to control the mice around the dumpster area. Other than that, its definitely on my return list, with my own can of Lysol.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We had a neighbor tell us about Carter Caves so we decided to do a day trip here. During our visit we toured X Cave, Horn Hollow, and Cascade Cave. The park was very clean and well organized. We didnâ€™t know what to do and where to go at first but were quickly and easily able to find staff that showed us the ropes. Our first tour was with Tristan at the X Caves. Tristan was informative and the Cave was interesting overall we enjoyed it. The only thing we wish he would have done differently is slow down . We moved so quickly through the cave that it felt like at times we were trying to keep up with the group instead of getting to enjoy the experience. Our next tour was a self guided tour to Horn Hollow. We were informed that we needed to bring flashlights with us so we purchased some at the gift shop. The permit process was easy however finding the cave not so much. They literally circled it on the map and said â€œitâ€™s somewhere around hereâ€ and to stay on the green trail. We kept walking and walking at one point we saw a couple walking down what appeared to be a creek bed and wondered to ourselves is that the cave entrance? We pulled out our phones to Google it, it was. Then once we got to the mouth of the cave we saw that it was flooded. We were not aware that the mouth of the cave was going to be in a creek bed and the water at the mouth was already at shin level. Not wanting to spend the rest of that day in wet shoes and socks we decided to not venture inside. Our last tour of the day was to Cascade Cave. Our tour guide was Skylar. Skylar has a family history when it comes to this cave and it is clear that he is both knowledgeable and passionate about it. He has a great personality and really took his time sharing the cave with us. He also told us about some of the other caves and tours we would not have known about otherwise and would love to check out in the future. We were so thankful that our tour was with him as he really made the experience. Overall it was our favorite cave of the day.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Fun place. Rescue group awesome as wife broke her ankle in 3 spots 1 mile from the welcome center. 10 guys came out with a basket to carry her out. They were quick and helpful. Now the hospital we went to was a 1 star thought. Kings Daughter off exit 181. Do not go their if you can help it.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We visited Cascade Cave today, some for the first time and a few of us had been here before. Our guide kept it running as smoothly as possible and we had light again at the very end.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Very well maintained state park with some great hiking trails. There is a 9-mile loop (4C) and a 3-mile loop (3 bridges) with cool caves and interesting rock formations. Mild elevation change and plenty of access point to the river.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Amazing trip thus far and we have only been here 24 hours.  Staff have been kind, amazing and so accommodating.  The cabin is spacious and beautiful.  We've been on the Cascade Cave tour and then went horseback riding.  So much to do at the park!!!

text: Site 71 electric 30amp and water hookup. The site is very level, large, partially shaded all day, and less than 25 yards from shower/restroom house.  A fire ring, lateran or trash hanging pole and picnic table are provided.  It rained two days during our stay, we had no issues with mud. The shower/restrooms house are clean, however the shower stalls, 4 total, are small but individually divide. A small shower stool is provided, however no hooks to hang towels/clothing. Water pressure is great. The park provides 3 washers and dryers, $1.75 each. We did visit the pool, $3.00 for campers, it was cold but clean. Great after a long day hike. The campground also has horseback riding and miniature golf. Overall the park is quite, clean and worth a visit.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
This is such a wonderful, kid-friendly place go visit.  The resort is easy to access and just a short drive from I-64.  There are so many activities to do here such as hiking, fishing, mini golf and camping.  The main attraction is the cave system.  Our guide was Bev and she was great.  We had 3 kids under 5 with us and not only did she keep their attention, she was also patient (one has learning delays and can be a handful) and friendly.

There is a visitors center with various items for sale, free maps and a wonderful front porch equipped with rockers, chairs and love seats to catch a rest if you need to.  At the front of the center,  there is a free water feature where kids can pan for treasures or in our, splash around and have a good time just playing with the water.

We were there celebrating a special occasion so we went to the lodge for lunch.  It was $15 all you can eat from a buffet for adults and kids under 5 were free.  A menu was available as well.  The buffet as well stocked and the food was tasty.  The catfish was particularly delicious.  The restuarant staff were very polite as well.

I highly recommend this place to individuals,  couples and families as it truly has something for everyone.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Carter Caves has always been a favorite place or mine to go for a day or a week. I rented a cottage and did some day hiking. It is a great place to hike , mountain bike, canoe or kayak, and there is now a climbing and rappelling area. I like to go there in the Spring and Fall best. I go there dozens of times each year. Just did a overnight backpacking trip on the Four Cs trail to Johnson Home Place back country camping. You need a permit but you can get it at the lodge. Nice trip

text: Beautiful park. Lots of trails, a small babbling brook to play in , a nice lodge , 2 guided cave tours. We went on the X cave, which was a little disappointing for an experienced cave tour lover, but a nice introduction to caving. Kids will especially love it since you're IN  A CAVE! haha. There are only a couple of highlights and not really anything kiddos will hurt if they touch (although touching is discouraged) Quite chilly inside. You might want a jacket. There are lots of above ground trails and the ones we wandered down were quite easy. The lodge is more upscale, with a nice stone fireplace in the lobby. We didn't stay there, so not sure of that experience. The road leading in is slow and winding. So take your time.

text:
Carter Caves State park is a gem in Eastern Kentucky,  located near Olive Hill Kentucky and just a short pleasant drive off of Interstate 64 it offers cabin rentals, rv camping, primitive camping and a very nice lodge with a excellent restaurant.
They offer miniature golf, horseback riding, kayak and canoe rentals, fishing, a swimming pool, axe throwing, tennis,  basket ball courts, bicycle trails but Carter Caves signature is its amazing caves and hiking trails.
Cave tours are typically guided but they do have some that aren't but do require a permit.
Prices are very modest and affordable.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

Kitchen ware was scarce and in bad shape. I told clerk...she was not helpful. All cave tours and activities were closed upon arrival. There were no discounts offered. Cleaning people didnt offer to come in one time.

Had a good time on trails with my people though. Will not be back to rent a cabin.

text:
Had a great family vacation get away! Stayed in the Cottages, was not expecting to be as big as they were. Very roomy, had everything we needed. Only negative things I could find were no fire pits outside (some cottages had fireplaces inside) and the water pressure was pretty low. But the water temp was great! 2 bedrooms with 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms. Kitchen was an added bonus as they had a full oven and microwave to create our own lunches and dinners. Charcoal grills are provided at each cottage out front. The cottage area is a private circle with a full-size playground in the middle grassy area. Newly paved roads made it nice to also ride bikes in the circle area for the kids.

We ate at the lodge restaurant and it was as most, open but with select foods. Also had specials and desserts. Price was ok, I thought it was more on the higher side. Staff very friendly as theyâ€™re also staff that manage and run the lodge on site.

The walking trails was a great way to spend the time when not lounging around or exploring the caves. There is a boat ramp for canoeing and an area that was great and way out of the way for fishing!  We went on the guided tour of Cascade Cave and it wasnâ€™t anything out of the ordinary of a cave but the guide was knowledgeable and made the tour fun.

For never being here before, this was a great family vacation! Iâ€™ve already been talking about returning and doing different things while coming back. For it being a State Park, this was well kept and clean! Highly recommend for those even with younger ones to experience a KY State Park.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text:
Update 2/14/23

Walking up to the main entrance of the casino was worse than before.  Cigarettes are all over,  things need painted and everything could do well with a good powerwashing.  Nothing about this 1st glance gives me "destination resort" vibes.    We arrived around 8:30 in the morning so it was obvious this littered mess was not fresh.  If this place wants to pull in new customers and become a major moneymaker,  things need to change.  When your facility is much less clean than the local gas stations,  you have an issue.   Granted,  the inside is clean,  but the outside is what sets the tone.  Do better, Mardi Gras!

Original review:  We have stayed here numerous times through the years.  This last visit was already a letdown due to no pool and none of the amazing breakfast foods.  The room was not the cleanest and the gold fixtures are now chrome and gold due to someone using the incorrect cleaner.  All of the restaurants in the casino were closed and there was no room service.

My suggestions to help would be:

Breakfast:  Since the old buffet style won't work,  the easiest way to serve the delicious hot breakfast would be for each room to put an order in either online or by calling concierge.  Their items would be prepared and could be dropped off contactless outside of the room or could be picked up in the lobby.

Cleaning:  Supervisor checking rooms to make sure they are bring cleaned properly.  They should also be sure to teach proper use of cleaning agents and which products to use on each surface.

Restaurants:  If none of the on site eateries are going to be open,  either offer meals via room service again or at least put together a listing of nearby restaurants and contact information.   Maybe even see if any would be willing to give hotel guests a discount.

I know some of these items seem small but if you want to call yourself a resort and be a destination vacation spot,  you can't overlook the little things.
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

Poker room barely had 1 to 2 tables open in the past and 1 craps table. Today Poker room is closed for the next few days and craps closed too. One thing I'll say is the Cafe has some pretty good food. Can never go wrong with the burger.

text: Hubby and I were headed home from vacation and got a room for the night. We did a "Serendipity" vacation and stayed in 4 different cities in Florida before heading back home. The Best Western in Smithfield was hotel #5 and very clean with friendly staff and a great breakfast. Highly recommend!!
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text: Chris greeted us with biggest smile and even bigger personality all while remaining professional and courteous. The room was super clean, bed and pillows super comfy, room temperature was just right with quiet heating/ac units and breakfast wasn't half bad!
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text:
This place doesnâ€™t look like much when you pull up, but once inside you can tell that they take pride in this hotel.
Everything in the lobby was very clean, neat and orderly. It looked like this place had been remodeled recently.
The breakfast and sitting area are located right off of the main entrance across from the lobby.
It too was very clean and neat.
I stopped here for one night on my return trip home from Florida.
I always choose a Best Western because the rooms are very clean, they give you complimentary toiletries, blow dryer, iron and ironing board, a coffee pot and free coffee in your room. You also get a refrigerator and microwave in your room and free WiFi.
I always try to get a king size bedroom. The beds are super comfortable, and Iâ€™m able to get a good nights sleep.
With my room came with a complimentary breakfast. This is standard with most Best Westerns.
This Smithville Best Western has an indoor pool which is permanently closed and a gym. I did not use them.
For breakfast they serve scrambled eggs, ham or bacon, grits, homemade waffles, that you make yourself. Cold cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and sausage gravy, bagels, toast, muffins, pastries, coffee, tea, juices, or milk. You can have as much as you want. The breakfast is constantly replenished by a sweet older lady.
Checkin was very easy. The front desk staff was extremely nice, and made some recommendations when we asked. They have a free parking lot.
This hotel is located off I-95, this low-key hotel is an 8-minute walk from shopping at Carolina Premium Outlets and 2 miles from the Ava Gardner Museum. The prices were reasonable for this hotel.
I would definitely stay here again.
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text: Very clean hotel!  All around great experience.  Every employee was kind and courteous.  We really enjoyed chatting with the young lady working the breakfast area.  She was a breath of fresh air.
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text: We stopped here for the night in our way to Florida and then again going back home. It was a good experience because the hotel is new, in a new area, the room was big with two beds and so much room around, same for the bathroom. I need to say the place is really in good conditions. This was the first time for us in a Beat Western. Prices are on average, we paid less the first night, something around 40$ cheaper than the second night 19 days later. Staff is friendly. Lots of restaurants in the area and the Carolina premium outlet is less than 5 minutes far by car.
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text: I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was kind (Chris was particularly awesome) and the cleaning staff were also very kind. I was having issues with my card at some point and a person cleaning the rooms helped me while I got my card key covered. I tried to give her a tip for her service but she wouldn't take it. It is about 30 to 40 minutes away from Raleigh, BUT there are still plenty of eateries and cinema nearby. I also enjoyed the hot breakfast AND whatever little towel creature this is! (Yoda perhaps?) So cute!  Overall, I would come back here.
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text: I'm really satisfied with my stay @ BW Smithfield.... The staff was extremely helpful and very friendly... Which makes all the difference! Rooms were very nice and very clean. text: This was a little hidden gem! We stayed in the Town House Lux Suite. Lots of room for 2 adults & 3 kids! Full kitchen plus dish washer. Added bonus, a washer/dryer! This was exceptionally amazing so I didnâ€™t pack damp swim suits after the kidsâ€™ morning swim. The bar had this cool â€œblack magicâ€ margarita. Very tasty!
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: We came to Lancaster to enjoy the New Year. We stayed in the King Villas. The room itself was beautiful. The bathroom could have used some updating. Also the  kitchenware needed better cleaning, but nice nonetheless. The real issue with my stay and why I would never decide to visit again was the customer service and my personal property. I stayed overnight on New Yearâ€™s Eve. I woke up in the morning to find my white car parked in the lot COVERED with confetti. My car was the only one within that lot covered. I was understandably upset, and wanted to rectify the situation. I called the front desk and explained the issue. I understand it was not the hotel, but rather other guests and my personal property is not the responsibility of the resort. Where is the accountability for the guests they house? They offered minimal help or care. The most they could offer to assist was windex and paper towels or filing a police report. They had no usable hose on the property where I could have rinsed off my car. They offered no kind of compensation towards a car wash, even $5.00 would have gone a long way. The confetti had to later be POWER-WASHED from my car. Again, I understand it wasnâ€™t the resort directly , but I would not trust my car on this property again, personally.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Hosted our daughterâ€™s wedding here and could not be happier! Our coordinator, Katie B, was amazing from start to finish. The Courtyard Ballroom provided a romantic atmosphere and every vendor recommended by Eden did a superb job! Food, bar service and banquet staff were top notch! Highly recommend
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Came here for a conference years ago and visited recently for a 2 night getaway. Had a wonderful relaxing time. Great location to many places in the Lancaster & Lititz, PA area. Perfect to have a conference, family reunion, family vacation and or a getaway with your spouse.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Staff was fantastic and dinner was delightful! The rooms are clean and comfortable, you won't want to leave! Will definitely be back for fun as this trip as for business.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Fantastic rooms.
Fridge was broken, and was told they would send maintenance right up. Never came. Fridge was only slightly cool and was leaking on the floor.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Been coming here for years, beautiful hotel, great salt water indoor pool & spa. Heated outdoor pool open until end of October. Also outside has small playground, basketball, pool table, ping pong table, shuffle board & bocce. Reasons for 3 stars, 1. had absolutely no WiFi the entire 4 days their in our room. It was located poolside by the indoor pool. WiFi worked outside of room & in lobby though. Spoke to front desk twice, & they said they didnâ€™t need to come to the b/c router was outside of room. Was texting with someone & they gave me the password to another WiFi, but that didnâ€™t work in the room. 2. Weddings all weekend so very hard to get a parking spot at night. Rooms lack USB ports to charge devices. No more free coffee in lobby. Gave a card now for towels, 1 towel per card, if you donâ€™t turn card back in $25 charge, see pic. Hotel is $200 -$300 or more a night depending on when you go. 10-15 minute drive to Route 30, where all the stores & activities are.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
We stayed for an overnight stay this past weekend and had a wonderful time! We were in a poolside room which had a door right into the indoor pool. This was so nice to be able to walk right out, swim, and head right back into our room. The room was clean and comfortable and had plenty of space. The outdoor pool is a good size and has plenty of seating available. We used the mobile app for check-in, check-out, and the key to our room which worked great and it was so nice to not have to go to the front desk for anything.

We explored the hotel and the event rooms were so beautiful. The location isn't directly near much, but it is pretty close to downtown Lancaster which had some great restaurants and shopping.

The main issue I think worth noting is that the wifi in the hotel, at least in our room, was basically unusable. We had to use mobile data to use the internet and the app for our room key. If you need internet to do any work while you're there I would say it isn't going to happen. Overall our stay was great and we'll definitely consider going back!
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend to visit family.  We had a room right off the pool so our grandchildren could come visit and spend time swimming. It has a tropical atmosphere and a hot tub. The door to the pool is locked from the outside at night and there is an alarm that alerts you if someone opens the door from the room. This is great for safety for families with small children. The room we had was spacious with 2 queen beds. The room was clean.  I liked the vanity make up area outside the bathroom but the lighting should be more conducive to being able to see better. This hotel has a bar off the dining room and the dining room had certain hours of operation...which is ok as I like the option to eat in the dining room instead of going out.There was a convenience store which carried lots of goodies including great coffee from Lancaster County. I really like the classic charm throughout this whole resort and the  service of the staff was
superior throughout.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is the comfort of the bed. We woke up each morning with backaches. Maybe mattresses should be upgraded ðŸ¤”. Otherwise a classic hotel which I enjoyed.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: I love this place! My kids love this place!  It's so family friendly. As a single mom who takes her kids on vacation every year, this place was the easiest location yet for me to actually relax on our vacation.  I can't wait to go back next year â¤ï¸
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: I can't even guess how many times I've been to the Eden for events, numerous. From formal to more casual, buffet and served sit down dinners, we've always been pleased with the food and service given here. I was even on a committee once that organized an event and dealing with the staff was a breeze. Beautiful atmosphere, great location, you can't go wrong here.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Very kid friendly place, fun pool area for both little and big kids, ping-pong, pool table, large playset, basketball court, putting green, indoor and outdoor pool. The â€œfitness centerâ€œ is extremely small considering this is a resort which was disappointing.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: We went to the Eden for a banquet.  The courtyard and lobby were decorated beautifully and very festive for the holiday season.  The only complaint that I would have is that the line for the bar was very long and the people that wanted drinks were taken away from the event for about 20 minutes at a time. All in all it was an excellent night!!!
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Absolutely loved our experience! Our daughter had requested a night at a hotel with a swimming pool for her birthday. We had made mention of this to staff when booking and asked for a ballon in the room as something special. Staff went above and beyond by including some snacks for her as well as a card in addition to the ballon. Needless to say our 4 yr old freaked out when she saw it. Thank you so much to the staff that made our night special for our girl! We got a poolside room and so we were able to make the most of our time swimming. Our room was spacious and clean. We look forward to staying here again.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Overall, we had a good stay. Came here with my sisters, mother, and nieces for a girls night out. The room was clean and comfortable but a bit dated. Staff were friendly and helpful during our stay.

The pool was heated, but it was still cold in my opinion. They ran out of towels when I had arrived to the pool so I had to wait until I was ready to leave and they had just restocked the towels. The playground was small, but nice. The basketball court was also nice. The table tennis could have been maintained better, the net was broken so was the 1 paddle that was at the table. While I was there the restaurant was closed for renovations. So were unable to get room service despite the front desk telling me the other restaurant was opened, but I was unable to get connected to that restaurant.

Other than the few minor hiccups, we enjoyed our stay, I do feel the resort was overpriced based on what was offered.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Had a group stay here. Very comfortable and clean rooms. Used the laundry facilities here and they were reasonably priced at $1.50 per washer & $1.50 for 45 minutes of dryer ( add 25 cents for 15 minutes extra time on dryer)

Bathroom was clean. This hotel gives extra supplies as well such as 2 qtips, a nail filer etc etc.

Room was spacious, clean and had its own printer for business folks

Bed was so comfortable and soft to the touch.

Overall, a great experience with this hotel
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Really nice family resort, indoor and outdoor heated pool. GREAT service, friendly staff just a text msg away. We will definitely come back.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Top notch from check in to check out!  I love that someone texts you periodically to see how youâ€™re doing. The beds are super comfy, the pools are refreshing and everyone is so helpful!
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Great place to stay in Lancaster with your family.  This hotel has been around for a long time and yet itâ€™s kept immaculate.  Very clean rooms and all common areas.  Kids and adults get to enjoy a fairly large indoor heated pool and jacuzzi.  The rooms are like everything in the hotel, pristine and orderly. Beds are very comfortable so much my wife and kids want to take the pillows home.  The hotel is just off the ramp when you come off the highway.   Great place to stay definitely recommend it.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Great wedding venue! Always have good experience here! Itâ€™s on the expensive side, but worth the price!
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: The Eden never disappoints. Rooms are always clean and offer the right amount of space. The staff is nice and very helpful. The service desk is very quick to respond and are very helpful. It is worth every penny. It is great for adult only time as well as lots of things to do with kids and family.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Staying in the Villas are a bit different than the rooms inside the main building. They give off apartment vibes. Very nicely decorated and clean. They do not offer complimentary breakfast!!

***If you are traveling with an ESA they are now considering them as pets and will charge you a daily fee*** this resort is a 100% smoke free environment

Indoor pool and jacuzzi to enjoy. Also has plenty other amenities to relax. A bit pricey but definitely worth it.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: 10+ service! Not only was the staff attentive to our needs, the Resort itself was beautiful, our room was perfect, spacious, and included every resource we could need, IE microwave, fridge, cabinets for dry food/snacks, cereal, ext. The housekeeping, staff, front desk went far and beyond what we expected (Jacob was awesome!) We literally live not even 30 mins away and decided to stay at Eden for 2 days as a "Staycation" for our family of 5, so great we extended an extra day and I must say, we enjoyed every min, from the huge indoor heated pool to the playground and even mommy got to enjoy some time in the jacuzzi!:) Plenty of dining nearby if you choose not to use the delicious food at Arthur's, Bloody Mary's are outstanding! Needless to say, husband has vacation again in June, we are definitely looking forward to spending 5 fabulous days here again. Thank you Eden and staff for a wonderful few days away!:)
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
We checked in today and so far this place has exceeded our expectations. Staff has been incredibly friendly and helpful. We checked into on of the suites snd recived a text from. The concierges to help us with anything we needed. We texted them a few times to get some information and they were very prompt, helpful and really nice. The room is wonderful, very clean  and modern. See pics. Were going to us the heated pool , hot tub and will try the on site restaurant, will update our review post.
Update, we did goto the indoor pool and it was enchanting. Indoor heated pool was great. You get cards for towel service when you check in and get a fresh towel when you arrive to the pool. The jacuzzi was corded off due to maintenance. While that was dissapointing for our evening I greatly appreciated thier concern for guests safety.
We also had dinner at the restaurant and that was incredible. They have this seafood dish with a tomato broth that was divine. Everyone in our party raved about thier food.
Breakfast, we would advise to skip the buffet, it was not up to the rest of the standards. Pastries were days old, the hot fares were mediocre.  The fruit was nice but that was not worth the price. So I would suggest breakfast offsite and there close places to choose from.
Breakfast aside this place us great and we'll worth the price, we loved our stay.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: We had banquet here for a large group. The service was excellent and the venue in general was great place to host. Spacious banquet room with plenty of space for people to mingle.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: This was our first weekend away from our 5 children in over 2 years and the Eden Resort and Suites did not disappoint. From the welcoming atmosphere, cleanliness, and phenomenal staff we will definitely make this our first choice for another staycation. The staff was accommodating and courteous.  While walking down the hall to my brother and sister-in-law's room carrying her birthday gifts a staff member in front of us turned around and asked if we needed assistance carrying anything.  The room was spacious and comfortable and we loved the adults-only floor. We all actually decided to not go out and do an activity but stayed in the room and had beverages and played cards till after 2 AM. A big plus is where our room was and the "J" entrance we were a mere 100 steps to the Sheetz :) The only complaint we have is with the pool. We have no problem and understand the booking of time slots to ensure everyone's safety I wish it was open later for adults. Most places we have visited only allow adults after 10 PM.  It was kind of hard to enjoy the hot tub. Otherwise, I really have no complaints at all. We easily made reservations for Arther's Terrace and the food was delicious.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:

text: Always a pleasure at the Tropicana. It's so big, it's the only casino I ever got lost in! Security is everywhere, and will point you in the right direction. I played roulette and won around $1,300 in 4 hours, went to Hooters downstairs and enjoyed a salad with chicken strips, met some beautiful waitresses, left a nice tip, then headed out with plans of returning soon. They have a convenience store right near the slots and one of the restrooms. The atmosphere was a happy one all night. I'm definitely going back next time I'm in Atlantic City.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I love walking around inside of here. Such beautiful design and love the area which is like a food court. Casino had fun games. (Not a gambler) I am walking with a cane, so it ended up being wrong Casino to stay at, since it a distance from most places on boardwalk. Plus we had a long way to walk for our room. I'd only give credit to a couple bellhop & valet, but don't know their names. Room was gorgeous.

text: I get that Covid slowed things down for businesses. But that should not be why the rooms arenâ€™t clean and in many aspects unacceptable. I did not complain to hotel staff but I would never expect to walk into a room with spills on the walls and broken faucets. If this was not for a celebration weekend, I would have left. Staff was nice, location is fine. Elevators for the west tower are awful on weekends. 4 elevators to get all guests to their rooms for that tower - there was always a line and wait. At times we had to take the stairs after 15 minutes of not being able to get an elevator. I would not recommend to stay at this hotel - we paid approx $370/night and I was quite shocked at what this hotel thinks is acceptable. Photos are from the walls right inside the bathroom and the knob in the shower.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
The check in process is a kiosk. They sent us to the oldest, farthest room in the place we felt like 3 rd class citizens. An old wing with old rooms far away from everything.. we called the front  desk  to change the room for a price  and no one answered the phone .  We called from the cell phone and there were no signal.  No Internet either. An emergency and no one could have help  No handicapped parking available
because the parking tower is  is closed.  Never again. Not even for  free.  I paid  a lot of money. This room looked like the shining. We were in communicated.

text: A great hotel with exceptional service. As soon as day one of the conference ended I headed to my room to kick my feet up and relax. I gotta tell ya, this is the BEST rest I have enjoyed in a long time. If you are ever in AC, please check-in here. You wonâ€™t regret it. Tag me in the review as well. I guarantee you will enjoy your stay.

text: I stayed at the west tower and it sure need some new paint, letâ€™s say a good upgrade. The bed was not too comfortable, but for the night it was OK. Once your down stairs is beautiful and nice so much to do. I was shocked we had to paid for parking even though we stayed at the Tropicana. Will return, but would like to try some of the other Towers in the hotel to stay.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Be aware that unless you book directly through the Tropicana hotel (website), you're more likely working with a booking agency (not directly affiliated with the Tropicana Hotel) and you won't  know the total cost of the room until you check in at the hotel.

Your room is subject to taxes and fees (TOURISM FEE/TAX 2; CASINO FEE/TAX 2; A.C. OCC SURCHARGE/TAX 2; RESORT FEE/TAX 2) that booking agents don't disclose when you make and pay for your reservation (a least ours didn't).

These additional fees and taxes increased the cost of the 2-night stay from $92.70 to $184.01.

While the final cost may not be outrageous, it is certainly (at twice the listed nightly rate) more than you expected when you booked the room.

In addition to that, our booking agent charged only $50 (of the total cost of our stay) to my credit card at the time of booking, leaving the remaining balance to be paid at check-in. And the reservation was not confirmed for the section of the hotel whee we prefer to stay.

Our room was cold both nights but after a 'jump start', it started to warm up a bit (recycling regularly on it's own for the 1st time since we arrived). Annoying, yes. But not worth relocating or having to wait for someone from maintenance to show up and address the problem. The room was clean, good sized, uncarpeted, poorly lit (and heated) with just a desk, one lonely desk chair, a safe and mini fridge (that whined) and no microwave.

Spacious bathroom with pull bars in the tub/shower but only one hook to hang things on (towels, PJ's, wash cloths or anything else).

Parking is NOT FREE, but it's reasonable.

As long as you know what to expect when you book, you can relax and enjoy the place. It would be nice, I think, if Jersey lawmakers would require these booking agencies to disclose their status and all of the additional costs when they take your call.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Rooms were very basic. No carpet.  The bathroom had leaks in the sink faucet,  the bathtub and toilet.

My phone wrong 2 days in a row at 6:30 a.m. even though I didn't have a wake up call.
If it's windy the 41st floor has something banging all night outside the building.

Finding the self parking lot was a major challenge.

The signs for the lobby are not very good. I had to use a self check in kiosk.

The casino area was good.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Used to love staying at Tropicana. The new food options are good but everything else is sub par. Stayed this time in the Chelsea tower and despite how nice the walkway is to get there, the rooms are gross. Smelled like mildew and the blankets, light shades and table were all stained. The curtains looked like they had blood stains all over them.  The windows were wet and the wallpaper peeling off. The carpet was not clean in the room or hallways. Itâ€™s dark n dingy in the hallways. Plus you can always add an additional hour and half to check-in and get out of the parking garage.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: We had such a fantastic time. The staff was so helpful, and security was spot on. Even stop me from eating at the slots, but I respect their wishes and covid protocols. Also, we appreciate security for their fast response to a 4 AM noise complaint. My mom and I stayed in the north tower and loved every minute of it. The shower was hot ðŸ¥µ in all the right ways. No dust was found, and the mirror and air ducts were spotless. The beds were extremely comfortable and spacious. You may need to call for a blanket if you enjoy your room below 65. The north tower was closest to the marketplace. My mom and I loved it, as it took us 1 minute to get to the breakfast and food section. The quarter isnâ€™t too far, but we loved our stay and flight. We have already booked another trip. I wish we did have the north tower again, but I didnâ€™t mind exploring the other tower's benefits. Please visit, and wear your walking shoes or chunky heels. This hotel is lovely, full of great people, and has too much fun for a short stay. In addition to that, visit the Hash House of Go-Go and get Yvette. Sheâ€™s a genuinely unique waitress. I promise you wonâ€™t regret the meals or air drinks.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: How you have 2 people check in people that donâ€™t have rewards on a Friday. The check in Kiosk machines donâ€™t work at all. I was in the West Tower 41st floor there was no carpet on the floor, and hair that didnâ€™t belong to me on the bathroom floor and in the shower. While I was trying to rest people above me must have been moving furniture then someone next to me kept knocking on the wall. They really need to get that hotel together as much as it valet park and stay there I would expect it to look and be way better. text: Didn't stay at the Tropicana, walked around. Found it to be comparable to a Vegas style hotel. Nicely decorated for Christmas ðŸŽ„. Nice shopping area with beautiful palm trees too. Good choice of restaurants like Carmine's and PF Chang's.

text:
Made our annual trip to AC and had a good time at the Tropicana. Plenty to do inside the casino, centrally located to everything we wanted to do outside the casino. Attached parking garage.

Decent selection of restaurants, bars, lounges stores and eateries in the casino and mall. No complaints, good customer service.

Stayed in the West Tower, rooms were nice enough, but the elevators and bathroom could use an update. Honestly, how much time do you spend in a hotel room on vacation?

text:

text: Whew, I wonâ€™t ever stay here again! Check in was simple & the line was not long. I had a room in Chelsea. There was only ONE elevator in service. Checked into my room: there were roaches, the bathroom was not cleaned, there was hair in the shower a scrunchie was left in the shower, the toilet was filthy! text:
We had an overall great experience! Food selections were fantastic. I'd give it a 4 star but we stayed in the West Tower and it is desperate need of a renovation. Wallpaper peeling, we found a cockroach on the wall and the bedding is very poor quality. Room was freezing with no way to change the temperature.
At the casino, drink service at the table games is SOOOO slow and a soda if you go get your own is $5. There should be drink rounds at least every hour, not 3 hours.
Valet service is super slow so give yourself time.
It's vacation though so all of these kind of things happen but some small changescould make this place better!!
Come on Ceasars, you can do it!!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Stayed at the north tower with my boyfriend back in September. There was a horrible storm those two days so couldnâ€™t venture around AC much but we still had a lot of fun as there is plenty of things to do in the resort.

Room/cleanliness: Iâ€™m a smoker (horrible- I know) so I appreciated there being smoking rooms and smoking areas in the casino so I didnâ€™t need to go out in the wind & rain just to have a smoke.
The room was in a convenient location. Right above the casino and near the elevators. Our window view was overlooking the casino which was pretty cool. The furniture was a little dated and the cleaning was ehh but thatâ€™s pretty much the case with all smoking rooms in any hotel/resort.

Casino: clean. I saw several employees doing detailed cleaning while playing the slots.

Parking: If staying in the North tower, I recommend using the valet. It was very convenient and the charge for it wasnâ€™t much.

Staff: no complaints about the Tropicana staff. All very friendly and helpful.

Location: perfect location to the boardwalk and beach. I definitely recommend The Rain Forest Cafe located on the boardwalk.

My only 2 complaints (one was my fault).
1.  was our experience at Hooters there. From the moment we walked in the door, the waitress was very rude. Maybe she was having a bad day but it seemed like she took one look at us and assumed we wouldnâ€™t tip well (we tip a standard 20-30% (depending on service which I think is very fair). We were nothing but kind to her but she was still extremely rude. The other waitress walking around seemed delightful, I wish she was our waitress instead.
Complaint 2: we went during the week days in the fall so the pools werenâ€™t open. Thatâ€™s my bad for not seeing that in their website. So if you want to use a pool, double check the pools are open.
I think all the bad reviews were from people expecting it to be a five star hotel. Most said there wasnâ€™t much signage for locations but if you look up, there are signs with arrows pointing where to go.

Over all, we had a great time and definitely plan to be back soon! Thank you for helping making our vacay a good one!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: They place is ok. I would have rated 5 stars if the rooms were up to part. We found hair in the bathroom floor and the shower curtain had stains. Other than that is was ok, except for smokers all over the place. They have plenty of good restaurants.

text: Second time staying at this hotel casino. Great corner room , clean , well appointed. Great selection of tables and machines at the casino. Also good selection of retail stores and restaurants . ( Walk the Walk, Starbucks, Wet Willy's,Carmines, The Palm  to name a few.)  FYI the early check in charge is $ 25.00 but worth it in my book.

text: My boyfriend and I came to Tropicana Tuesday through Friday. We had a room in the Havana tower. The room was clean and spacious. At the Tropicana there are multiple towers there is so much to explore. There are restaurants and shops in the hotel. No need to leave the hotel. There are a few shops open 24/7. Tacos at 2am was perfect. We ate at PF Changs and it was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was great too. We also ate at Casa taco, Hash house a go go, and many other places as there are so many to pick from. The boardwalk is right outside the marketplace (where most the food shops are). We walked all the way to the end which took about 40 minutes one way. There were many shops closed but also many open and ready for customers. Going on a week day is our preference as there are so many less people. By Thursday alot more  people started coming.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Tropicana is terrible. First lets start with check in. The line was soooo long. No where to sit . I was very dizzy and was told i had to stand in line. My room was full of mold. I was coughing and sneezing alot. My eyes were itching. So as i started to investigate the room my sheets were dirty. The walls had black drippings rolling down the entire room walls. Maybe water stains but it was yucky! I had a double bed room . The water burned my skin and is difficult to get it to the right temperture. My phone fell and upon pulling the beds  out i saw so much yuck which explains why my allergies were all over the place. The tv was dusty. Towels had burn marks and more. Not to mention I had a groupon that states the promotional value never expires. But everyone acted like they had no idea what i was presenting in front of them so I never got to use it. One supervisor said "hang tight we are starting another groupon soon". Just sad! Im very annoyed with the service. I stayed two nights tuesday and thursday and both rooms were distguisting!

text:

Great selection of restaurants and easy access to the boardwalk.

text: It was okay. I was only there for a night as I attended the R.O.C. event. The safe in the room was closed shut, and I didn't feel like dealing with it, so...meh. The bathroom was clean, The shower itself made squeaky noises at times when using, again...meh.

text:
First time to Atlantic City, great experience!

Tropicana is a great location on the Boardwalk with lots of restaurant options inside, also a  short walk to Caesars, Hard Rock, Ballys...

text: We had a great time at Tropicana!  The casino was very clean.  I booked the Havana room in the Havana Tower.  Views from the room were incredible! Great price just after Christmas.   Check in was easy and fast.  Just make sure you have your driver's license ready for the check in kiosk.  We had drinks at the Saloon and the tequila bar downstairs.  The nachos at the tequila bar were incredible!  Get it with the chicken.  You won't be disappointed!  We went here for my birthday and ate at Carmines.  Ordered the meatballs, chicken wings and a slice of lasagna.  Delicious!
