text: So after a bad experience at another Atlantic City Casino we decided to go to the one that doesn't disappoint...well this time it was just ok.  All Restaurants open and food great, Palm, Broadway Burger and Casa Taco and Tequilla Bar, A++ Room was ok for a Junior Suite.  Regular Staff friendly.  One of the pitboss in the BlackJack area was rude and nasty, my wife never played so we wanted to play...literally got our chips, didn't play a hand and cashed in..story to long to tell.  Table games really horrible, with online gaming and Casinos just 10mins from people's houses, AC better losing the strings cause traveling to AC to lose money in 20mins ain't worth the trip anymore!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Our trip was booked several weeks prior to our arrival. The self check in booths were declining many booked hotel guests, stating our rooms werenâ€™t ready and theyâ€™d emhoyelus when it was. It was alr 6pm, and the kiosks werenâ€™t accurate! The lines after the mass confusion and frustration began and lasted beyond an hour and some for others, with less than minimal staff at the desk to accommodate the error. This is unacceptable.
Mind you, we are here with my step daughter for a cheer competition, so there are many parents and elementary aged and younger children filling this lobby waiting for resolution.
After weâ€™re able to get checked in, we come up to our room in the west wingâ€¦ seriously the most ghetto room Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. I would never have anticipated a casino hotel room to be in such dated/dirty/and sloppy conditions. Bathroom is filthy, tub/shower walls stained and smells like cigarette. Cigarette burn hole in bed linen, and the paint job looks like it was done by my grandchildren. The coffee maker is broken and filthy with thick calcium buildup. There isnâ€™t a dresser to put our clothes away. Mold in the shower molding.
The pictures on your website do NOT portray an image of the trash hole we walked into last night! Weâ€™re beyond disappointed, and have never had an experience as poor as this at any casino weâ€™ve gone to before. I plan on calling the front desk this morning for some kind of resolution.
Addendumâ€¦ step daughter just showed us a used band aid in her bed ðŸ˜£
Spoke with management yesterday, they returned our phone call after 9 hours, offered us a different room today, however, itâ€™s after 2pm and the room just now is ready. The replacement coffee maker and clean linen by the folded lump sum came up after several phone calls after 10:30 pm last night.
Manager stated this casino sleeps whatever sum of people and itâ€™s difficult to keep up and please everyone. Change of room without a guaranteed time and a $50 food and beverage voucher for one of their places within the casino doesnâ€™t make this stay worth the money Iâ€™ve spent at this casino!
I plan on calling management again tonight or tomorrow, I will update. Hopefully itâ€™s better than the less than interested game theyâ€™ve shown so far.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Probably one of the best casinoâ€™s on the AC boardwalk. Tons to do at this casino including restaurants, bars, nightclubs, shopping malls, movies. Decent slots too! ðŸ¤‘
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Everything was nice.   Hotel was nice and clean..  No need to venture out onto the Broadwalk because anything you desired was within the hotel.  Will be going back again
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
This was my first time at Tropicana Atlantic City. I stayed in the Havana Tower with 1  King size bed.
My first impression--the place is a sprawling monster of a Hotel and Casino resort. From the hotels lobby and check-in located on the lowest level (below the main casino floor accessible by escalators) to my room was a good 10 minute walk. If you have a lot of luggage it's going to be a workout for you. If you can't walk long distances or have any issues getting around, I suggest getting a room closer to the lobby and casino floor. The walk to my room involved many long inclined hallways, a pass through the shops and restaurants in the Quarter  and finally to the Havana Tower.
My room was big and looked very inviting and clean. But upon further inspection, it had it's share of problems. Smudges and  crud and on multiple door jams, and the bathroom vent and the room In-take A/C vent were disgustingly dirty. It looked unhealthy. (See pics)  Not sure if it is mold or just thick black dust but it should be cleaned REGULARLY. Besides that, I wanted to simply relax and take a shower but there was no body wash or hand soap for the sink. I called house keeping and was told they would be sending some up to the room immediately. I waited for over an hour and nothing showed up from housekeeping. Had to call again.  Someone showed up 30 minutes after that. (My stay was on a Wednesday and it took that long to get something that they forgot to put in the room. I can't imagine how long I request, like body wash or simply extra towels, would take on a weekend.
The hotel immenities are a pool and a very impressive  entertainment, shopping and restaurant area called the Quarter. It boasts over 24 restaurants, 25 shops of various goods and 22 bars and clubs and other entertainment like an Escape room.
Overall, despite the bad cleaning and service delays   from the housekeeping department,   I would recommend this hotel.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Rooms are a decent size for an AC casino. They aren't very modern, but that wasn't an issue.  Bathroom was spacious with incredibly strong water pressure. Location isn't too bad,  not far away from most places in AC. I'd definitely stay here again, has a nice atmosphere. Very well themed.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Enjoyed being back at the Tropicana (I spent time there in the 90's) It was good to see that some of the former Ballys Casino staff, had migrated down beach. . . My room proximity to the Casino was great. Very pleased with the North Tower. Once I figured out, how to get to the 5ðŸŒŸGilchrist for breakfast. It was during that walk, in the early mornings. I had the chance to observe the Cleaning Crews, and their attention to detail. Hand rails, escalators, elevators, corners of window sills, spotless. . . And the pool I passed at the Chelsea Tower looked so inviting and clean. . . I was Loving once again, my "New" Favorite AC Casino. . . Since merging with Caesars Rewards & Loyalty Program. . . *Update*. . . I want to Thank the Casino Staff for all they do. . . Fran the Floor Manager, is such a gentleman and professional. Big Ed V. Floor Supervisor also a gentlemen and professional, has the ability to make everyone feel welcome and appreciated. . . Sharp dresser and great sense of humor. . . It takes a special talent, to deal with some of these players, when they have been drinking all night. . . I want to recognize some of my favorite Table Games Dealers. Michael, who has been at the Tropicana since it was built. Paul also has been here almost as long. And George another long time employee who is fun, helpful, and hilarious. . . I'm looking forward to seeing them all, on my next trip. . .
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I would love to give this place 5 stars except check out and getting out of the parking lot took almost 2 hours. It's ridiculous, they need to take a better look at ways to resolve these issues. The only way to catch an elevator to get you downstairs was to ride up to the top floor and come back down to get to the lobby. Long lines to get out and was very discouraging. The rooms were beautiful spacious and clean. However, if I state there will be 4 people checking in there should be a minimum of 4 towels in the room.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
So far, not so good. Self check-in kiosk put us in a double when we reserved a king. Currently waiting in line in the South Tower Lobby, a long walk from the Havana Tower where we were, for assistance in rectifying the situation.  We have already had to change our dinner reservation at Ossu. I will update once we are settled. Not getting better: only 1 person working the counter. People behind us have been waiting for an email that their room is ready for an hour. Wow.
8:30 and Gary is now helping us. "The Kiosk wouldn't make a mistake. Whatever room you booked is the one you got."
Except it's not the one we booked and, oh look, we have the confirmation.
"Well, if a king bed is important to you,I can put you in the North Tower. "
Yes, since it is what we booked, we'd like the king.
So, we're in the king on the 17th of the North Tower. It's fine. Smells vaguely of cigarettes and marijuana, but it's  AC so... We may make our new reservation at 9.
I'll update tomorrow,  but at this point, my advice is avoid this property.

Good morning. Final update: The bed is pretty soft, but would be fine if there was any substance to the pillows, or if there were more pillows (4 small "feather" pillows on a king bed with no extras in the closet).
The temperature was impossible to regulate to any satisfaction. See the picture of the 70's technology thermostat.
The shower looked beautiful, however the design is awkward and it functions poorly.

We come to AC plenty and took a chance on the "New" Tropicana on this visit. This was a mistake.  Stay somewhere else. Hard Rock was fine, Ocean was lovely, Golden Nugget was really good, and Borgata and The Water Club are wonderful.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: The hotel staff is terribly bad, bad tempered and bad service.  The facilities are nice and comfortable.  The beach is very good to visit with children.  The businesses that are outside the hotel and in the market are very professional and provide good service.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: My husband booked a room for my birthday and we luved everything about it ...checked in on a kiosk, casino was right down stairs (spent $20 and won $183 on my first 5minðŸ™†ðŸ½â€â™€ï¸ happy bday to me!) so many locations to eat and drink at...right on the boardwalk near the beach..a night to remember
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Wow! Youâ€™re customer service here is TERRIBLE! Iâ€™ve never seen so much attitude. Maybe donâ€™t work in customer service if you donâ€™t like people.

So this is was the charter flight room (fyi I am the second highest tier for their slot club) that they put me inâ€¦ AWFUL- didnâ€™t even stay here. Booked the Borgata instead. Unreal that you would put me in this terrible room. Pictures attached. I wouldnâ€™t even take my shoes off at this place.

The only thing good here is Tony Lukeâ€™s and Chickie and Peteâ€™s
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Some rooms are just ok...and some rooms and suites are very good. No room service but some of the restaurants in the building deliver. Hotel convenience store carries no booze but there's a decent liquor store 7 min walk in the Trop mall area. Staff is ok...but not great. Could use a few more gambling tables available. Only one for Let It Ride and its usually full. Recommend Boogie Nights nightclub for club fun. A few dance floors and some great older music with a great sound system.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: The Trop is usually my go to in AC because there are tons of food options and multiple bars with happy hour deals. After this visit I may be looking for a new destination. Service was absolutely terrible throughout the entire casino. Every drink ordered AR a slot machine came out wrong, then the waitresses argued with me that they brought what I ordered. Some weren't even close. I ordered a rum and coke and they brought me a beer instead. Food was delicious every place we ate, but again terrible service and only had 2 meals in 4 days that came out correct the first time.  Housekeeping was another nightmare. We called at 9am Sunday to request service. We were out all day and no one came to clean, bring fresh towels etc. We called again and the desk told us someone would be there in an hour. We came back after dinner and the garbage was not taken, towels not taken, bed not made, and a pile of new towels and soap left on the bed. The next morning Housekeeping walked in without knocking. We told her it has ok and she could clean the room but she left and never came back. Had to call the desk for toiletries and again no one came. Day three we put the do not disturb sign on and Housekeeping knocked on the door for 10 minutes until I got up and answered. They asked if we wanted service. We had also asked for extra pillows when we checked in...I just checked out on day five and still no pillows. This was my only vacation this year, and stupid little things like this add up and make it hard to enjoy. While Caesars and Harrahs have less options for food and are smaller, my experiences there have been much better.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: It is a great place to come for the Garden State tree conference and do a little gambling while we're there.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
The Tropicana has its decent high points, but there are issues as well:

Issues:

For blackjack fans: dealer hits on soft 17s.

Service is less than good. Front desk was manned by one person for a 40 person queue. It looked like a line at an airport. Employees can be pretty bossy too.

Listed amenities are more like "services you can purchase" or "sometimes available". To the extent that you have to pay $35 or buy a $200 massage to get access to the hot tub for a day. So don't think you can go relax at it with $$$. And it's only available on certain days. I also think you have to rent a chair at the outdoor pool if you want to sit at it? The indoor pool is only available on certain days, and is by reservation.

Some games have seriously reduced payouts. Example, a side bet at blackjack has payouts nearly cut in half compared to what other casinos run the same bet at.

As others have mentioned, the hotel and casino are dated and show it. It gives the impression that things are just being kept as is. No serious upkeep since what seems like a long time ago.

Strengths:
The resturaunt selections are pretty nice, but on the pricey side. I'd recommend the Petitie Creperie in the quarter for an affordable, pleasant meal. They have a wide selection of interesting crepes and other breakfast foods.

My room in the south tower was pretty nicely kept and seemed modernish. The shower was modern and high quality.

Will continue to update this as things progress.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
HOTEL: Stayed here recently Saturday night in the Havana Towerâ€”room was fairly spacious and clean.  Decor was a bit outdated but the bathroom was nice.  Even got a partial ocean view!  The walls are thin, so you can hear the traffic outside at night and the guests in the hallway if they are loud.  Check-out was Sunday and it was a nightmare getting back to the parking garageâ€”there was a line of 40+ people just waiting for the elevator to get to their cars.

CASINO: The casino area looks remodeled and I really like the ambiance hereâ€”has an energetic vibe.  But itâ€™s crowded so I had trouble finding a blackjack table with open seats.  Thereâ€™s a lot of food and bar options in Tropicana which is great!  And on Saturday nights, they have fireworks outside in the boardwalk around 10pm thatâ€™s worth checking out!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Front desk is a mess...no one can even answer...don't even try to ask for anything...rooms at the west tower are DEPLORABLE....light outlets are in dangerous condition... NO ONE CAME TO FIX IT....I stayed x 2 days and they mistake my room...no one came to give me a solution....the guest is required to do everything.... not like it used to be..
Elevators were a nightmare...waited 40 min to catch one ...NO ONE CAME TO INSPECT...never again..
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: They say location is everything.But the homeless population on the boardwalk in that area  is insane . The casinos make so much money but does nothing to clean it up .
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
First off I've stayed at the Tropicana before but in the Chelsea tower. I had a great experience the last time I was here. This time I stayed in the west tower and I felt like I was sleeping in a motel. First off,it took three tries to get into the room. Then I noticed the security lock on the door was the old fashioned slide lock. Then there was mold and rust on the ceiling and wall of the bathroom. The room needed a serious facelift. There was torn wallpaper, holes in the dresser where the previous tv was and the climate control was ancient.
Granted I could have asked for a new room but I was tired and didn't want to move. I did complain and they gave me a $50 food voucher and extended checkout.
Next time I stay in the Tropicana, I'll make sure my room isn't in the west tower.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: We checked out a whole day early because we saw cockroaches in our room. That was after the fact we couldnâ€™t sleep because of a party next door that kept us up all night.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
First time staying in this casino and it will be the last time, we had to wait hours in line to check in because the self check in Kiosk wasnâ€™t working properly.
The Casino had only two agents helping people check in even tho their self check in system wasnâ€™t working correctly, the line kept growing but management never decided to add more agents to help people check in quicker.
Poor management skills
Wast of peopleâ€™s time
Donâ€™t waste your money or time in this Casino
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
EDIT
9/6 - Responded to owners request to email hotel about experience. I have emailed and hope the hotel will rectify this horrible experience. Will update when they have responded.

9/6 Where do I begin, first do not stay here!!!!!! There is no service and it ruined a birthday weekend trip.

When we arrived in AC we were going to check-in early. Mind you getting to the lobby hotel is a maze in itself with no signage anywhere to tell you where to go. We get to the lobby and there's 20 people and two receptionists along with self check-in machines on the side. I decided to wait. We waited to find out that there was a $25 fee to do so. We thought okay whatever let's do it and we asked if the room we reserved was ready and she said no housekeeping didn't get to it and you'll have to wait until 3pm. So we decided to wait for our room and came back at 3pm. We got our room  and it was not ready. Stains on the pillow cases and sheets and the bathroom with visible hairs everywhere. We called housekeeping 4x and each time they emphasized that requests take up to an hour to be completed. I said weird huh because I've been calling since 3pm and it's 7pm and nothing has been done. So I decided to call expedia for a refund. Expedia gets a manager called Jamal to help us and he says there is the same room ready and clean. So we trusts him and make the change just to find out the room is in the back of the hotel and even dirtier than the first. I had to go back downstairs and request our original room with the view and I would go to the store and buy cleaning supplies myself. The front desk manager was extremely helpful and so nice and helped fixed the situation. I have the emphasized SHE WAS THE ONLY ONE HELPFUL!. And when we moved back to the room it was finally being serviced and cleaned. However, it did take them until 8:30pm to have this completed. They did service the room the next day but at this point the trip was ruined and we checked out.

Save yourself the hassle and go elsewhere.  There's no entertainment, the casino here was dead, and the atmosphere just scummy. We ended up spending most of the following day at the ocean hotel and wished we would have just booked there.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Overall, for Atlantic City standards, this hotel is pretty good. Clean, soft beds, and nice views (If youâ€™re in the west tower and on floor 38 or higher)! The shower in our room didnâ€™t have hot water. The hottest the water got was lukewarm, and to get the faucet in the bathroom to run, we had to pull very hard on it to flow. Besides the rooms (which smelled nice), most of the hotel, and casino on the bottom floor, smelled overwhelmingly like cigarettes and tobacco. Even in the hallway on our floor (floor 43), it smelled like it. The gym in the hotel is great along with the selection of restaurants in the â€œquarterâ€. Most of the restaurants, however, are mostly full most nights so make sure to make a reservation at them before hand! Other then that, this is a great hotel!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I was disgraced to reserve a room at the Tropicana. We booked a nonsmoking executive room suite and the room was not up to the standard because the room was not properly cleaned and smelt like cigarettes. My husband complained that he was itching.  We called the concerige and went to the front desk for assistance. We were told that they can send someone to spray the room and we can probably move to another room the next day.  The manager did not come out of the office to address our concern, so we checked out and went to the Sheraton Hotel.  We were trying to check out the view, but the windows were filthy.  First time and last time at the Tropicana Hotel. We would love to speak to the owner regarding our concerns.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: One of our most fav casinos in Atlantic City . Love the interiors in Tropicana . Itâ€™s kinda a lucky casino for us . We love playing roulette here . Nice parking space and I think itâ€™s 5$ for parking . We also get offers sometimes. N very close to boardwalk and very nicely located . Walkable distance to banks and other restaurants nearby . Service could be better in casino area. They give ultra light beers in the casino area. Apart from this , itâ€™s an amazing place to spend time inâ€¦ ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

text: Iâ€™ll let my photos speak for themselves. Stayed here for the long weekend and was absolutely disgusted when I walked into the room. The floor was sticky, the bedding was stained, the walls were stained with some kind of â€œdripsâ€. Iâ€™ve stayed here in the past and it wasnâ€™t bad but this trip was just bad. text: We stayed on the north side, the pictures and the actual room where different. Then they had to move us to another room because there was mold around the vent. They moved us to a bigger room, somewhat but this was our first time staying. Overall it's was busy through out the whole casino, I'm guessing because people are getting back out. All an all not outside of the mold, we couldn't complain too much, we only paid $65 for the whole weekend. 5/7/2022 We stayed in the Havana Tower, rooms are decent, closer to all the action. The buffet is still closed but the food selections are on point, again for $74 for the weekend can't complain. 10/24/22 Did another weekend stay new restaurants are on point, something different BBQ, sushi, remodel PF Changs and breakfast brunch spot. The buffet is completely gone.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Disclaimer: This review is for the Casino Hotel only not the rooms. We visited on a weekday during the last week of July. We really liked the Havana inspired decor of Tropicana AC- it is clean and the casino does not have a strong smell of cigarette which is a plus for me. It has many different shops and restaurants to choose from. Also, close to the boardwalk but this one is close to the far end side not the one near Steel Pier (if youâ€™re planning to go with kids). Tropicana AC does have an indoor arcade (Family Fun Station located in the North Tower) as per their website but we didnâ€™t get to visit.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Didn't stay there this time but the Trop is a once-proud property on the Boardwalk. Now, it's in major need of a refresh.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
My policy is to only post positive reviews. So Atlantic City is a tough one for me. I decided to post because even though the streets around the Casino area are rough around the edges it's a place you should probably visit at least once and decide for yourself. The city has a "once was glamorous" feel, but now seems neglected and in need of a Facelift (see pics).
The Tropicana itself seems well managed and trying to bounce back from the pandemic.  The building is older, but my room was fine. Only a few of the restaurants are open and one inside pool.
The ventilation system allowed a hint of cigarette smell you find at casinos.  It seems if you stayed inside the building you could forget the neglected vibe outside.  Come see for yourself!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: We have been staying at the Tropicana In Atlantic City for over 20 years.  This will be our last stay at the property.  From check in to check out we have never been treated so poorly. The resort is in bad shape. It isnâ€™t ADA compliant as handrails are missing in the elevators and everything was dirty, as seen in the photos we posted.  At check in we were assigned a room that wasnâ€™t clean.  There were potato chips all over the floor and the sheets were stained and gross with shoe prints all over the sheets.  We were assigned a new room, but it wasnâ€™t much better.  There were boogers and blood wiped on the walls, the curtains had holes and the paint was peeling off the walls and headboards.  We had three guests and two towels.  When we requested more towels, housekeeping said we were only allowed two per room.  Two towels for three guests?  Housekeeping never came to our room to empty the trash or make the beds or collect old towels.  The next day we had to call housekeeping to get towels. I called back two hours later, and the gentlemen told me â€œYeah, I have your slip right hereâ€ and then hung up on me.  The towels never came.  The only time housekeeping came to our room was to rush us to checkout.  By the third day the toilet stopped flushing properly and we had to use the casino restrooms. The hallway during our stay was disgusting and dirty.  The manager on duty couldnâ€™t be reached.  Ceasarâ€™s claims theyâ€™ve invested 400 million dollars in upgrades, but you will not see any of it in the Trop.  We will be taking our business to another property.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: It's like a city inside they have the casino, clothing shops, ice cream shops, clubs etc uts big even a 24hrs convenient store inside. It's big as soon as you step out your hit with the boardwalk and beach with restaurants, stores, and at the end there's a amusement park !! $40 band pp kids had to much fun.

22nd floor suite south tower pic looking north.

text: Was a really nice experience just walking around in the hotel there's so much to see and do it's literally like a mall inside the hotel
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Pros: The hotel itself is great. Kioskâ€™s located throughout the hotel allow the guests to check out really easily. Great food and entertainment options. Valet is $35 and you get your car back in under 10 minutes. Fireworks at night. Great casino.

Cons: Check in desk had 2 staff members for a line of 15+ groups needing to check in. Kiosks would redirect you to the check in desk. From waiting in line to finally getting my room keys was about 45 minutes. Not all the rooms have a nice view but itâ€™s give in take: view of a parking garage but located next to a lot of dining/shopping options. The room was fairly dirty. During COVID it would be nice to have a little extra cleaning. Especially with the $35 a night â€œresort feeâ€ that is charged. Trash left from the prior guest, stains on the sheets, hair in the drain, oily hair dryer, stains on the wall, and dusty room should not be an acceptable condition. Water or drain from bathroom sink had a funny smell. Umbrella rental is $20 for the beach-you can buy an umbrella for that much at one of the souvenir stands off the boardwalk.

Overall, hotel is great. Rooms could use more work. Staff is friendly.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: This casino and hotel has a lot to offer from entertainment to delicious restaurants! Everything is convenient and now itâ€™s the season to be festive!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Casino by the Atlantic Ocean. Great views of the ocean and plenty of casino games and food to eat from. Accessibility of easy to the boardwalk
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: The room was exactly like the pictures on the website so very impressed. Also loved that there's many restaurants to choose from and loved the karaoke bar, planet rose. However since it was my first time staying in any casino hotel, it was very difficult to find where to check in and get our room keys. There's no signs or anything but thank God I found a security guard on the casino floor who told me where to find the kiosk to check in. Also my ceaser's card wasn't working so I couldn't drink while I was gambling and it seemed like there was never anyone by the desk to help. Maybe if there was more staff that might help.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
None of the kiosks in The Quarter by the Havana tower were working for me and they had the front desk there closed.. so I had to search and walk all the way to the casino and through there down an escalator to finally find the main front desk. Very inconvenient especially when your lugging a bunch of bags around.
Then I get to my room and it seemed like they didn't finish cleaning it.. none of the counters had been wiped as there was rice somehow on all of them and chips were smushed in the carpet. Luckily there was a maid in the hall who I had to call in to wipe down the counters and vacuum. Also the carpets on this floor by the elevators look like they haven't been cleaned in a year..
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: This is for the South Tower at Tropicana. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The bathrooms are newly renovated. The linens were all clean and fresh. The carpeting was clean and vacuumed. No dust at all. My wife and I have been coming to Tropicana for years and we rarely stay in the South tower but I will be recommending the South tower for our future stays.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Tropicana Atlantic City is a Great casino resort, lots of renovations and
Upgrades to the location. Big casino floor and plenty of food can't go wrong Only Complaint is now they charge $25 for self parking

text: Loving coming here! They installed these Roulette tables that are my favorite. I enjoy playing roulette but donâ€™t like how rowdy the table can get sometimes. Sitting here youâ€™re in your own little space and itâ€™s great. The only downside is the comps are not the same as when youâ€™re out an actual table.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: The Tropicana shares a reputation for being the ultimate affordable getaway. Instead what it provided was a terrible first experience. It was not what I expected at all. It took us almost an hour and a half to figure out where my room was, then when I finally got there it was outdated and sub-par.There was no one to offer anyone a guide to navigating the huge property. The kiosks are supposed to provide a map emailed at Check in and one was never received. When we finally got a hold of someone, they did change the room and for that I am thankful. However what was supposed to be a relaxing mid week getaway was a poor experience.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Casino is fun, hotel is a little outdated. The rooms are adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. I didnâ€™t sleep great lots of commotion in other rooms and hallways the walls are not insulated from noise that well. It was cheap for a hotel so thereâ€™s that. WiFi speeds were around 6 mbps, better to use your data.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: No pictures to busy planning Penny  machine very nice casino alot of places to shop and eat
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Went to Tropicana to do the Escape Room with friends and showed up fifteen minutes early only to find it closed.  Made some calls and got a recording.  Five minutes before show time, we got a call telling us the employee was sick and if weâ€™ll stick around for and hour and a half for someone else to come in.  We declined and was told weâ€™d get our $299 refunded.  The casino itself was nice, clean and not as noisy as the Hard Rock Casino (playing loud music 24/7).  I got buttered popcorn at the IMAX theatre without seeing a movie (a bonus for me).
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I just want to make sure, that my review will be about the hotel, not casino. Casino is actually nice and big, so you will have a lot of fun there. Let me start with the reason why we stood in Trop. It was our anniversary and we wanted to go to see our favorite DJ in Harrahâ€™s. We are reward members, so we get comp rooms in both of these hotels plus Caesars, unfortunate all the rooms were sold out a months before our stay, so we decided to stay in Tropicana for our first time. We didnâ€™t know, that the tower, that we picked was not renovated. We paid almost $400 for one night stay and we got old room with dirty chairs, broken safe and alarm clock, broken light in the bathroom and dirt all over. You can see it on the pictures. We called to the reward center and lady just forgot about us on the phone, so we went downstairs to see what was our options. We were ready to pay extra just to move to the nicer room. Lady in the reception helped us, she moved us to a suite in the same tower with no additional charge, but despite everything a new room wasnâ€™t better than the previous one. Suite also was old, couches with stains, broken things all over, but we were happy about working safe and comfy beds. So my biggest advice, check the towers before stay, if you are not sure, call them and ask. Or better stay in Harrahs or Caesars for chipper and with renovated rooms.  2 stars for trying to resolve our issue and a good custom service.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Nice room with partial view of the ocean!  The casino is huge and very confusing getting around.  There's a strong smoke. I was there for a conference and I'm not a gambler but there were lots of available sests for each type of game. Plenty of places to eat and a variety of food choices. It seemed like there was lots of security too.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Very nice casino..... very nice location only thing I didn't like was that I had 100 celebration credit for my diamond status so I got dinner on Saturday evening and thinking I could get  something and heat it up in microwave like any other casino I've stayed at has microwaves but no had no microwave so had to use hair dryer to heat up food both times and wasn't great.  Plus room where stayed in at room above and next door was very loud kept up all night long... Machines was tighter than Fort Knox for the weekend when they had a promotional weekend flight come in. If wanted to waste 2500 on tight machines could've stayed in cherokee and not had just a ok time. You would think they would have gave some promo cash away to guest also. Took card out n started winning Lil but as usual put back in what won.

text:

text: Went last year for a weekend for a friends birthday. We had a great time. The room was nice, good selection of restaurants and shops. We went to the night club one night and has a blast! Pools are also great.

text: We enjoyed our trip to Tropicana Atlantic City for the weekend. Rooms were nice, the service was great! The casino hotel has plenty of stores and restaurants, so you don't have to leave the whole time you're there.

text: The room was very clean. We did however,  have 2 power outages in our tower. The store Talk Of The Walk is to die for unique and well made clothing and shoes for adults. I would return to this hotel there is so much inside of it.

text: Bomb food court with plenty of options to eat. Another of things to keep you busy large sportsbook as well. Very busy with people but entertaining. Would come back again. Waitresses are very friendly.

text: Plenty to check out other then gambling. Wet Willies is great to stop at. Rooms are always clean and up-to-date.

text: I love the ambiance here and the decor makes you feel like you're in Havana, but the casino is very crowded, has very old poker machines and God forbid you need an agent to assist you with an issue with the machines....you'll be there for a while. The room was nice, but my stay was ruined by 2 women fighting in the room next door and slamming their door at 1 am, and then the people in the next room had the same song on repeat for 3 hours. Thank God the room was free. I will say this much. Tropicana has the best choices for restaurants.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Itâ€™s OK but weâ€™re on cleanliness and functionality of bathroom fixtures could be improved. Didnâ€™t win at the casino either.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
My family and I came here for the 1st time expecting to go to the movie theater (it was closed because of technical issues).

But if you like to Have Fun & Enjoy Being around friends, I strongly recommend a place located at the lower floor called Wet Willies!They had 20 daiquiri machines and they let you sample any flavor before buying.

Overall, we had a great time just walking around the rest of the building. From seeing lots of Restaurants to couples and lots of people dressed up. This place has lots to see and do.

I attached a few pics of my family and some of the beautiful things to see inside & outside of this building (people showing up in limos)...
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Tropicana is a beautiful scenery. I didnâ€™t stay in the hotel but I went to Wet Willies, Hooters , Mrs.Fieldâ€™s Bakery and Lick the candy store. My friends and I also attempted to go to the night clubs inside of Tropicana but they were to over capacity.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I never came to Atlantic City. This is a great stay, the inside is like a indoor town. It is unbelievable I had soooo much fun. The staff are GREAT. The rooms are great.  I stayed for an overnight stay, and woke up in the morning & went to the beach. It's really good. My only problem was that, I forgot my charger in the room. I asked the cleaning lady to open the door or go in & get it for me nicely & she tried to tell me that wasn't my room even though I had been standing there. She was the only flaw. *P.s. my room pics were taken right before checkout*
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Check out is at 11am and check in is at 4pm. Theres enough time to clean the rooms. The one I'm in right now is not. We found 2 stubs of cigarettes on the ground, it's like they sweeped and put it behind the drawer between the beds, there was someone elses hair in the shower (cause it was red and no one in my family has red hair) it reeks of cigarettes, probably because of the stubs. I've been here before in the north tower and it wasnt like this. The west tower needs more care. Only reason why I'm not leaving until my check out day is cause I already paid a lot of money for this, but I'm quite disgusted and disappointed.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Tropicana is like a city within the city. Almost everything you need in one place. The rooms are in serious need of repairs and upgrades!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Rooms are nice, pretty dated though. There was no water pressure in bathroom for showers. Nice assortment of restaurants, make sure you make reservations. Two of the restaurants closed the kitchen early due to lack of help. When leaving our room at 8 pm there was a man sleeping outside our door leaning against the wall. It seemed like a lot of underage teens in the casino after 11. All and all we had a good time.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Didnâ€™t stay at the hotel, but visited the casino to gamble. Feels very outdated, but service was still great. Loved the fireworks at 10pm that they have every Saturday! âœ¨
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
I feel the biggest pro for Trop is that it is one of the best casinos for food options. Lots of different types of places like Chickie & Pete's, Palm, Carmine's, etc. The casino is decent and clean although my wife was disappointed with no Monopoly or goldfish slots (that we saw).

The room we had was pretty outdated but spacious. You can hear people next door, at least from the room we had.

We waited probably 25 mins in line Friday early evening (6:30pm) to check in. The self check-in didn't work for us so we then had to wait for a person which was another line. Expect to wait, especially on the weekend. The only major con was leaving Sunday. The parking garage was backed up all the way to the top. It was crazy. Probably close to an hour to get out.

All said, I still feel it is one of the best options in Atlantic City. It's an option for us now that it is Caesar's Rewards. We will probably stay again in the future but I know the wife will probably prefer Caesars if it's available and reasonably priced.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Although their slot selection has been lacking over the last few years, this place is still a top attraction on the boardwalk. Above decent payouts and nice food choices. Cool clubs and bars and a wonderful gym to use.
I juat wish they would change around some of machine on a regular basis.

text: Beautiful hotel. Getting to our room was a bit of a labyrinth. Although our room was marked as a non-smoking room, you could smell residual smoke.  The room was of a generous size and quite comfortable. However, the pillows were a little flat. Either thicker pillows or extra pillows would be better.

text: Took a 1 night stay here. The rooms were very clean despite the fact that it was a smoking room it smelled really fresh and clean. text:
I paid 400 dollars for a room in the west tower on a Friday night.  The room was clean but in need of fixing and updating.  My room, the floor, the elevators all smelled like pot in a nonsmoking room and floor.
I had to change my room at 1 am because the noise from the room next door was so loud and they were blasting music.
We spent the day at the cabana five pool deck bar.  It was beautiful. Food was good and service was ok.  Too many guests, not enough waitresses.  I bought reserved loungers for 25 each which was worth it. The cabana was not worth it based on what I could see.  I would stay again just because of the pool bar but I would stay in the cabana towers. It's new and removed from the other areas of the hotel.

text:
It was comparable in price to other hotel casinos in the area like Ballyâ€™s and we booked as a group for a trip for a conference so it was busy. However when we arrived for check in at our 5+ reserved rooms they claimed they only had one room, over an hour later we were in the west tower (not on the boardwalk and very cheaply made).
The casino and hotel offer a lot, thereâ€™s even a little Havana theme with palm trees in the hallways and cobblestone streets. The rooms were very noisy (I could hear everyone around me) cheap small tv old curtains one thin blanket and two sheets on the bed only. No air or temp control and the shower took over 30 minutes to get hot.
Iâ€™m addition the room was a bit worn; peeling wallpaper paint stains, no metal fittings on sprinklers, dirty shower curtain. We made it work, but I wouldnâ€™t go back.

title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
For entertainment and dining this place is great, but do NOT stay in the West tower unless you're trying to save a few bucks.

Entertainment: Casino is vast, table games are plenty (enough) and the sportsbook is big.

Check in: they have many electronic kiosks, but they seemed clunky. Many people were having issues that required help, including us. They'll help did come quickly.

Rooms: We suggest not staying in West. Beds were okay. Bathroom is big. But the walls were scuffed/marked like a children's playroom. There is no carpeting, just vinyl floor which makes it a bit cold, (and more importantly louder above you.) If you do get a West tower room, request as far from the elevators as possible (you want the last two digits of your room number to be as high as possible, definitely above 25).

If you love 80s bathroom fixtures, and showers that whistle like tea kettles, then you'll love West. Haha.

Do not even think of trying to get an elevator near checkout time. After waiting five minutes, we took the stairs from the 45th floor and there were so many taking the stairs you'd think it was an evacuation.

Not a horrible room, and it was a few bucks cheaper, but had we'd known, we definitely would've paid more to be anywhere except West.

Parking: Extremely reasonable at only $10 for Saturday and Sunday night, and our check-in gave us a $5 voucher. So $5 total for 2 days of parking? Fabulous. There is no need to pay for valet.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: It was a amazing stay the hotel was amazing I stayed at the Tropicana hotel and that was the best hotel to stay at

text:

text:
The appearance of this hotel is great but I hope you donâ€™t have to call the front desk. You have to call for any towels, to have your room clean, etcâ€¦.. the wait times to call are greater than 5 minutes. The room with the lights and suites above was very good for the conference, thermostat just right, screens beside the stage large but speakers hang in front of them. Conference food was absolutely lacking any taste or creativity. Vegetarian option was pasta with a can of warmed tomato sauce dumped on top.
Hotel staff was very nice. The bathrooms were staffed with people for the conference area and were kept exceptionally cleanâ€¦ I mean SPOTLESS! Overall, itâ€™s an OK hotel but needed more staff. We were there for 6 days and wasnâ€™t able to get a cart for the luggage when we arrived or left.
The location of the hotel seems good considering the proximity to BWI airport. You have to walk through the Casino to get to more food and the choices are slim. Vegetarian options were a negative. Some of the casino staff wouldnâ€™t let you bring outside food back through the casino. You go up 3 floors, through the garage, and back down on the other side. text:
The newly open LIVE! Casino & Hotel. I booked this for a one night staycation and wanted to give it a shot.

We knew construction was still ongoing, so finding the entrance from the garage was a bit confusing but the best level to park on was P1 on the far side away from the Casino itself because this took you to the backside of the Casino which is where they have the new entrance for the Hotel. The moment you walk in to the hallway, you see the Gelato place and the gift shop all next to David's (the hotel restaurant). You honestly forget you were in the Live! Casino itself just a few seconds ago. The check-in staff was very attentive and helpful in finding our reservations and getting us on our way; the only bad part was I expected a $20 free play but because I had already gotten this credit a few years ago, they didn't give it to me.

We had our unit on the 8th floor for a King Suite with a bathtub and shower. It was a very spacious master suite, with a huge bathroom. The toilet and shower each had a separate glass door unit with a double vanity. The room had huge fantastic glass windows with a view to the Costco, still cool overall. The downside was the sound-proof of the room; we heard the planes outside since we were on the BWI runway side and also housekeeping having large conversations in the hallway sounded like they were inside our own room. I also was disappointed that they did not give hand soap (at least the little bars) for you to use. Also, the pillows were not what I expected in a luxury suite, not that comfortable.

The Keurig coffee machine was a nice plus to have in the room, along with an iron and ironing board. The attention to detail in having robes was also nice; the large screen TV was great (w/ plenty of channels and ability to link with your streaming apps). The nice touch of having a touch pad with your name was cool; it also has a built-in app for white noise which was helpful. Finally, having a couch (not that comfy), coffee table and office desk were nice pluses.

In regard to the Spa and Fitness center, we went down to see the Fitness center and overall were impressed with the equipment (mainly aerobics, but nice smith machines, kettle and dumbbells). We didn't see inside the Spa area but it looked very spacious. Otherwise, we went down to the Casino itself and played.

For the price we paid for a King suite, we expected a bit more (ie. some extras included). But definitely worth a shot!
title: Live! Casino & Hotel Maryland

title: Live! Casino & Hotel Maryland

text:
We were visiting from out of town and we wanted to try out a new restaurant and check out a casino for the first time so we went here (we also ended up checking out Horseshoe Casino on another night and I would prefer Live! over Horseshoe if I gambled since it was more crowded and more tables going on at Live!). The main reason we visited was I have seen Bobby Flay on the cooking channel so wanted to try out his burger palace.
We did not gamble but we walked around the casino before and after dinner at BBP. This casino is also a hotel. A 4-star hotel. It is located in Hanover which really worked out for us since it is right next to the largest mall in Maryland - Arundel Mills. Quick walk from the mall to the casino.
We saw hundreds of slot machines and some table games going on like blackjack, poker, roulette, craps, etc. and playing the slots and table games range from 1 cent to a couple hundred dollars as far as what you can bet per slot or table. They did have a high betting area as well. I think it was at least $50 each bet but not 100% sure; we did not walk in there. In the main casino area, I saw video themed slots from dragons, anime, Simpsons, etc. Musicians and bands come here to perform such as Gladys Knight and Dwight Yoakam so check it out if you are in the area and want to go to a special event.
The bathrooms in the casino were clean. Everything was stocked with toilet paper, soap, paper towels, etc.
There are other restaurants/places to eat at that have American, Asian, seafood, and Italian dishes. There are a lot of casual places and a fine dining option. Go to the casino website to check out those options. There are TVs in this casino to watch sports on such as Sportscenter, baseball games, football games, etc. They had a Live! Casino gift shop as well. We didn't walk in there but it was big enough to get a souvenir with their logo on it, cigarettes, snacks, or whatever you wanted from there.
There was plenty of free parking. They also offer valet parking.
It was cool to go to a casino and have that experience but I am not sure we will be back again unless we were with a group of people who wanted to go or we chose to try out one of the other restaurants.
title: Live! Casino & Hotel Maryland

text: Well Me & My Husband wanted to try something a little bit different. So we decided to go here. We weren't here that long, but the environment and the weather was 34 degree's. It was pretty cold outside. Another great casino. Giving this place a 5 Star â­ because it's right next to The Great Wolf Lodge Stay Safe God Bless ðŸ˜ŠðŸ¤—ðŸ˜˜ðŸ¥°

text: The resort is beautiful and clean. The spa is wonderful. I would give 5 stars if there was a hot tub. The pool water is still too cold for me for a heated indoor pool. text: The rooms are very modern and clean. There is a very nice hiking trail across the road sponsored by the hotel. A few things annoyed me. The casino allows smoking on the casino floor. The smell permeates into the restaurants, the gym and the hotel lobby.  In the room the heating/ventilation system sounds like a car ending. The bathroom fan is loud and does not have an off switch. The pool closes at 8 pm. There is nothing to do in the evening except gambling or drinking at the tiny quiet bar or the very loud casino floor bar.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text: This Hotel/Resort is beautiful. I stayed in the Hotel. The room itself was large enough, clean and did not smell of smoke. The lobby and other areas do smell badly of cigarettes. That is the only reason they lost a star for me. Even the restaurant areas reek of cigarette smoke, even though they are smoke free. With the Casino being in the middle of everything and obviously allowing smoking, the other areas suffer. Guy Fieri's Restaurant is the place to go! Don't waste your time or money on the other mediocre Restaurants.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text: The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because there's no fridge in the room. Other than that, it's a fabulous place to enjoy with your loved one. The room was spotless when I got there. The staff is friendly. If there's any issue, they show up right away to fix it. This is a hidden gem ðŸ’Ž in the Poconos. We will be back. It's worth what they charge for the stay.

text: If you enjoy the intoxicating smell of cigarettes and the company of elderly citizens then this little casino in the Poconos is right up your alley. In this case it was not nearly as much fun as it use to be.  The slots are 100% video games and everyone in our group felt like we were just spectators watching the games play themselves with our money.  Give me a handle to pull or something that makes me feel like I'm more involved otherwise I might as well just stay home and watch TV.

text: A lady recommended us this casino during our stay at the Poconos & it was okay, thereâ€™s a lot of second hand smoking. Machines weâ€™re jammed or out of service. Take cash because the fees at the ATM are bizarre !

text:
Got an awesome deal from Groupon for 1 night. We arrived at 6pm, free valet, were quickly checked in, and down enjoying the pool by 7pm where we wound down with a drink and a swim. Afterwards we showered, had some delicious appetizers at Guy Fieriâ€™s then hit the casino floor  for a few hours before calling it a night. The beds are so comfy I didnâ€™t feel my partner move all night. We just woke up and had an amazing breakfast at GFâ€™s and are packing up before heading back down to enjoy the pool for a couple more hours before we hit the road for our next destination.
Few complaints: the parking. Your options are valet and waiting or self-parking outside the casino and making the trek up to your room. It is a bit slow moving process if you choose valet. Also, the mini fridges are packed with items that will get charged to your room if removed. They donâ€™t leave you any space for you own items that need to be refrigerated.
Overall and for the deal we got, we are very pleased.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text: Absolutely recommend this resort! Beautiful decor and VERY friendly staff. Our room, a suite, was appropriately sized and fun to be in, also was able to check in 1.5 hours early so that was also very sweet to the price deal. The pool i recommend going early if enjoying adults only type of time, by 2-3pm lots of kiddos around. Bistecca was SUPER delicious and wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The live band playing last night 8/12 was jamming pretty well, i didnt stick around to give a full listen though. The cabanas were amazing to utilize, you also get to use the pool before/after checkout so thats a plus. Only gripes would be: unless you valet, theres no separate parking for the hotel, so you either walk thru the casino(which is probably designed on purpose) or walk around the outside, about a 5 min walk. Also, be prepared if going/leaving during peak times as your mixed in with regular casino goers so you may end up in the back of the lot. Secondly, theres not a lot of communication; in terms of staff to staff and promoting. Know before you go, the ONLY place to ACTUALLY get breakfast is Fieri's kitchen (other pption is a starbucks) unless you pay attention to the changing directory sign, you have no indication thats it for breakfast. Thirdly, the buffet opens an hour AFTER checkout, again, breakfast is the cheapest meal to execute so dropping the ball there too.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text:
Small casino compared to other ones Iâ€™ve been to (Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods). We stayed for a night in the Center Suite as a mini getaway from home.

They allowed us to check-in early, which was nice, especially since my husband wanted to take my toddler to the pool. Toddler had fun in the pool, but besides that there wasnâ€™t much to do for the little one.
Ate dinner at one of the restaurants on the casino floor and then spent rest of the evening in the room watching tv (not much option). Ordered room service for breakfast the next day before we went home. There was nothing special about it and coffee had a horrible cleaning supply taste to it. Pretty expensive especially since 18% gratuity was included in the room service bill

For those planning to visit with underaged kids, you will need to be escorted at all times in the casino area even if you are just heading to the restaurant inside.

I would probably come again once more just so my toddler could use the pool and I also heard good things about the spa

text: Peaceful place to stay, rooms are a little stuffy no matter how much you adjust the thermostat, it does not work. Gorgeous scenery. The rooms are nice and clean, and the staff is friendly however, for the amount of money charged for the stay the in room amenities could be much better. There's a wet bar as well as snacks such as nuts, pretzels, etc. DO NOT TOUCH them because you will be charged significantly! Don't even accidentally knock over a can of pretzels or you will be charged as it is weight sensitive. There is no microwave or refrigerator for personal use. You can rent a refrigerator for $26.50 per day. I believe that there is an option to rent the microwave as well. When checking out there are several additional charges such as a $12 food charge, $27.75 beverage charge, a $75 service charge, and another charge for $75 that says other. None of these charges were discussed prior to or during check in. It's evident that this place is about getting their money but, my husband and I enjoyed ourselves. However, I will never stay at this resort again.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text:

You can go there for a weekend, youâ€™ll have great time waking up to get Starbucks there and spending your evening in the casino!! Thereâ€™s a trail across the street and youâ€™ll love it!!

Make sure to get good pictures in the nature. You canâ€™t miss the sight seeing and beautiful lakes nearby.

text: Fast and easy check in. Everything in one place! Beautiful spa and I truly enjoyed my massage from Hubert!  I also appreciated that I got a discount for being in uniform "nurse"! Its nice to be appreciated during this pandemic! Plus, it was a discount for ANYONE that wears a uniform, not just health care workers! Pool area was...  not strict with covid compliance and slow service although it appeared to be fully staffed. Water was warm and I loved that I could swim through to go outside! Watch your head! ðŸ™ƒ Ask for a high floor so you can enjoy the view! My room was a lake view and well... see pictures! Overall it was great to get away and I got some good sleep!

text:
Valet free. Shout out to Lisa. Super friendly and helpful upon arrival and departure.
Stayed at hotel. Room was very nice and clean. Bed and pillows comfortable.
Small casino, but it has all the games- slot and table.
Guy Fieri was good for lunch and breakfast. No reservations. Servers friendly. Food was good.
Bisteka restaurant was nice. Need reservations. People dressed nice.. Make sure to tell server 1/2 or full plate. The half was enough. The calamari was excellent! Lightly breaded. Two free small glasses of champagne for my daughter's birthday!
Noodle place was awesome as well. No reservations. See bento box photo. Server was very nice.
Indoor and outdoor pools. Full bar service at pool. Great place to relax.  Lots of seating. Provide towels.
It has a spa as well, but we didn't use it.
Great place for a short getaway!

text:
Place is very nice. Rooms are all updated and very clean. Would have given it 5 stars but....

Took forever to get our rooms.

Food selections are very limited. Food staff seems very disorganized and it takes a long time to get served even when it is empty. But food was very good once it arrived, a half hour later.

No live music or bar/entertainment venues. Not like the Hard Rock Casinos.  It is basically just a Casino.

Pool is very crowded and open to outside guests, non-hotel guests, therefore they take all the seats and nothing is left for hotel guests. Very strange policy, and they yell at you if you sit in the coach area. What are you to do when there are no other seats available. Very odd.

Hotel itself is very nice and helpful.
